CaptainCasa Demos - Documentation

This documentation contains all demos that are part of the CaptainCasa demo workplace.

The demos show how to implement dialogs using the CaptainCasa Enterprise Client framework.

A dialog is implemented by defining a layout (layout definition) as XML using a set of tags that is provided by the CaptainCasa framework. And it consists ouf of a Java class that reflectes the server side processing of this dialog.

Components

Straight Controls

Basic Controls

This page is a summary of basic controls that are provided.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoBasicControls}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="e_11" coldistance="10" >
<t:label id="g_2" text="Field" width="180" />
<t:field id="g_3" labeltext="Vorname" text="#{d.demoBasicControls.fieldvalue}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" coldistance="10" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Checkbox / Radio button" width="180" />
<t:checkbox id="g_6" labeltext="Archived" selected="#{d.demoBasicControls.checkboxvalue}" text="Document archived" width="100%" />
<t:labelcontainer id="g_7" enabled="false" text="Direction" width="100%" >
<t:pane id="g_8" >
<t:row id="g_9" coldistance="5" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_10" group="leftright" refvalue="left" text="Left" value="#{d.demoBasicControls.radiobuttonvalue}" />
<t:radiobutton id="e_4" group="leftright" refvalue="right" text="Right" value="#{d.demoBasicControls.radiobuttonvalue}" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:labelcontainer>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" coldistance="10" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="Text area" width="180" />
<t:textarea id="g_13" bgpaint="mandatory()" height="100" labeltext="Description" text="#{d.demoBasicControls.textareavalue}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" coldistance="10" >
<t:label id="g_15" text="Combo box" width="180" />
<t:combobox id="g_16" labeltext="Sequence" value="#{d.demoBasicControls.comboboxvalue}" width="100%" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_17" text="First" value="1" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_18" text="Second" value="2" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_19" text="Third" value="3" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_20" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_21" coldistance="10" >
<t:coldistance id="g_22" width="180" />
<t:button id="g_23" actionListener="#{d.demoBasicControls.onOutputAll}" text="Summarize" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_24" height="10" />
<t:rowdistance id="g_25" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_26" coldistance="10" >
<t:label id="g_27" text="Summary" width="180" />
<t:textpane id="g_28" text="#{d.demoBasicControls.all}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;

public class DemoBasicControls extends PageBean
{
    boolean m_checkboxvalue;
    String m_fieldvalue = "Peter";
    String m_textareavalue = "This is a nice description.\nPlease carefully read it.";
    String m_radiobuttonvalue = "left";
    String m_comboboxvalue = "1";

    String m_all;
    
    public DemoBasicControls(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    public void onOutputAll(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        m_all = "";
        m_all += "Field: " + m_fieldvalue + "\r\n";
        m_all += "Checkbox: " + m_checkboxvalue + "\r\n";
        m_all += "Radiobutton: " + m_radiobuttonvalue + "\r\n";
        m_all += "Combobox: " + m_comboboxvalue + "\r\n";
        m_all += "Textarea: " + m_textareavalue + "\r\n";
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public String getAll()
    {
        return m_all;
    }
    public void setAll(String all)
    {
        m_all = all;
    }
    public boolean getCheckboxvalue()
    {
        return m_checkboxvalue;
    }
    public void setCheckboxvalue(boolean checkboxvalue)
    {
        m_checkboxvalue = checkboxvalue;
    }
    public String getFieldvalue()
    {
        return m_fieldvalue;
    }
    public void setFieldvalue(String fieldvalue)
    {
        m_fieldvalue = fieldvalue;
    }
    public String getTextareavalue()
    {
        return m_textareavalue;
    }
    public void setTextareavalue(String textareavalue)
    {
        m_textareavalue = textareavalue;
    }
    public String getRadiobuttonvalue()
    {
        return m_radiobuttonvalue;
    }
    public void setRadiobuttonvalue(String radiobuttonvalue)
    {
        m_radiobuttonvalue = radiobuttonvalue;
    }
    public String getComboboxvalue()
    {
        return m_comboboxvalue;
    }
    public void setComboboxvalue(String comboboxvalue)
    {
        m_comboboxvalue = comboboxvalue;
    }    
}

Label Control

Label

This demo shows the usage of the LABEL component.

When it comes to rendering images with more features (e.g. explicit sizing of height/width): please take a look onto the IMAGE component as well.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoLabel}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_3" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="Straight" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Straight" width="150" />
<t:label id="g_6" text="Hello World!" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="Font" width="150" />
<t:label id="g_9" font="size:16;family:Courier new" text="Hello World!" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="Foreground &amp; Font" width="150" />
<t:label id="g_12" font="size:16;family:Courier new;weight:bold" foreground="#800000" text="Hello World!" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:label id="g_14" text="Background" width="150" />
<t:label id="g_15" background="#FFC0C0" text="Hello World!" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="Bgpaint" width="150" />
<t:label id="g_18" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,50%,#00000010);rectangle(0,50%,100%,50%,#00000030)" text="Hello World!" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_19" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:label id="g_21" text="Right aligned" width="150" />
<t:label id="g_22" align="right" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,50%,#00000010);rectangle(0,50%,100%,50%,#00000030)" text="Hello World!" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_23" >
<t:label id="g_24" text="Centered" width="150" />
<t:label id="g_25" align="center" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,50%,#00000010);rectangle(0,50%,100%,50%,#00000030)" text="Hello World!" width="150" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_26" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_27" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="Data Format" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:label id="g_29" text="Int" width="150" />
<t:label id="g_30" format="int" text="99999" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_31" >
<t:label id="g_32" text="Decimal" width="150" />
<t:label id="g_33" format="bigdecimal" formatmask="dec2" text="1000008.99211" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_34" >
<t:label id="g_35" text="Date &amp; Time" width="150" />
<t:label id="g_36" format="datetime" formatmask="medium" text="345763464455" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_37" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_38" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="Image" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_39" >
<t:label id="g_40" text="Image + Text" width="150" />
<t:label id="g_41" image="/images/icons/magnifier.png" text="Hello World!" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_42" >
<t:label id="g_43" text="Only Image" width="150" />
<t:label id="g_44" image="/images/icons/magnifier.png" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoLabel extends PageBean
{
    public DemoLabel(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("label"); 
    }
}

Vertical Label

The component LABELVERTICAL is a normal label - the text is output in vertical direction instead of horizontal direction. You can set font, foreground, background, etc. just as with the normal LABEL component.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoLabelVertical}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" rowalignmenty="top" text="CaptainCasa" />
<t:coldistance id="g_4" width="10" />
<t:label id="g_5" font="size:20;weight:bold" foreground="#800000" text="Bob the Builder" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:labelvertical id="g_7" rowalignmenty="top" text="CaptainCasa" />
<t:coldistance id="g_8" width="10" />
<t:labelvertical id="g_9" font="size:20;weight:bold" foreground="#800000" text="Bob the Builder" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoLabelVertical extends PageBean
{

    public DemoLabelVertical(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("labelvertical"); 
    }

}

Font Definition

All components rendering text provide a FONT attribute. This demo shows examples how to use the FONT attribute.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFont}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="default (no font settings)" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" font="weight:bold" text="weight:bold" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" font="weight:bold;size:16" text="weight:bold;size:16" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" font="strikethrough:true" text="strikethrough:true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" font="strikethrough:true;size:18" text="strikethrough:true;size:18" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" font="posture:italic" text="posture:italic" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" font="posture:italic;size:10;weight:bold" text="posture:italic;size:10;weight:bold" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFont}")

public class DemoFont
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoFont(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);  
        initRefComponent("label"); 
    }
}

Info Label

There are three pre-configured style variants for the LABEL, which add some border and background to the label text in order to raise more attraction to the user.

The names are "ccinfored", "ccinfoyellow" and "ccinfogreen".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoInfoLabel}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Label" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" stylevariant="ccinfored" text="Error" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" stylevariant="ccinfoyellow" text="Warning" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" stylevariant="ccinfogreen" text="Info" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:label id="g_25" stylevariant="ccinfoblue" text="Info" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" stylevariant="ccinfogreen" text="Info with some longer text" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_13" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Textpane" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" coldistance="10" >
<t:textpane id="g_17" stylevariant="ccinfored" text="The text pane renders text that contains several lines." />
<t:textpane id="g_18" stylevariant="ccinfoyellow" text="The text pane renders text that contains several lines." />
<t:textpane id="g_19" stylevariant="ccinfogreen" text="The text pane renders text that contains several lines." />
<t:textpane id="g_27" stylevariant="ccinfoblue" text="The text pane renders text that contains several lines." />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_20" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_21" coldistance="10" >
<t:textpane id="g_22" stylevariant="ccinfogreen" text="The text pane renders text that contains several lines. The text pane renders text that contains several lines." width="100%;100" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoInfoLabel}")

public class DemoInfoLabel
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoInfoLabel(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoinfolabel.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoInfoLabel}"; }
}

Smart Label

The SMARTLABEL component is a ...smart label!

You can pass text definitions in which characters are formatted individually to a certain extent. (The normal LABEL component is only able to render all text in one and the same font.)

The format of passing is either an XML format or a comma/seimcolon separated format:

The XML tags are:
<b></b>
<u></u>
<sub></sub>
<sup></sup>
<highlighted></highlighted>

The CSV definition is done in the following way:
<text>[;beginOffset;endOffset;format]

The valid formats are:
10 => bold
20 => underlined
30 => subscript
40 => superscript
50 => highlighted


Please note: it is not possible to nest format definitions! E.g. <b><u>text</u></b> is NOT allowed. If you need to do such definitions you should use the more general TEXTPANE component.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSmartLabel}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="CSV (Semicolon separated) definition" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:smartlabel id="g_5" smarttext="Sehr wichtig;0;4;20" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:smartlabel id="g_7" smarttext="Sehr wichtig;5;12;10" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:smartlabel id="g_9" smarttext="Etwas hochgestellt;0;5;40" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:smartlabel id="g_11" smarttext="Etwas tiefgestellt;0;5;30" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:smartlabel id="g_13" smarttext="Etwas markiert;2;5;50" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_14" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_16" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Simple XML definition" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:smartlabel id="g_18" smarttext="&lt;u&gt;Sehr&lt;/u&gt; wichtig" smarttexttype="xml" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:smartlabel id="g_20" smarttext="Sehr &lt;b&gt;wichtig&lt;/b&gt;" smarttexttype="xml" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:smartlabel id="g_22" smarttext="&lt;sup&gt;Etwas&lt;/sup&gt; hochgestellt" smarttexttype="xml" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_23" >
<t:smartlabel id="g_24" smarttext="&lt;sub&gt;Etwas&lt;/sub&gt; tiefgestellt" smarttexttype="xml" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_25" >
<t:smartlabel id="g_26" smarttext="Et&lt;highlighted&gt;was&lt;/highlighted&gt; markiert." smarttexttype="xml" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoSmartLabel}")

public class DemoSmartLabel
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoSmartLabel(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        initRefComponent("smartlabel"); 
   }
}

Data Type Formatting

You can pass data format information into the LABEL - using attributes FORMAT, FORMATMASK and TIMEZONE. The attributes are the same ones that you also use within the FORMATTEDFIELD definition.

Please note: the TIMEZONE is inevitably important when working with FORMAT values "time", "date", "datetime"!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoLabelFormat}">
<t:row id="g_1" >
<t:label id="g_2" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Number formatting" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="No format" width="120" />
<t:label id="g_6" text="1100.12345" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="dec2" width="120" />
<t:label id="g_10" format="bigdecimal" formatmask="dec2" text="1100.12345" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="dec4" width="120" />
<t:label id="g_14" format="bigdecimal" formatmask="dec4" text="1100.12345" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Date formatting" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_26" >
<t:label id="g_27" text="No format" width="120" />
<t:label id="g_28" text="0" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" text="date" width="120" />
<t:label id="g_20" format="date" text="0" width="120" />
<t:label id="g_32" text="UTC" width="40" />
<t:label id="g_30" format="date" text="0" timezone="UTC" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:label id="g_23" text="time" width="120" />
<t:label id="g_24" format="time" text="0" width="120" />
<t:label id="g_34" text="UTC" width="40" />
<t:label id="g_35" format="time" text="0" timezone="UTC" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_37" >
<t:label id="g_38" text="datetime" width="120" />
<t:label id="g_39" format="datetime" text="0" width="120" />
<t:label id="g_40" text="UTC" width="40" />
<t:label id="g_41" format="datetime" text="0" timezone="UTC" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoLabelFormat}")

public class DemoLabelFormat
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoLabelFormat(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demolabelformat.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoLabelFormat}"; }

}

Blinking Text

By assigning style variant "ccblink" (internally pointing to style class "risclabel_blink") the component is changing its opacity.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoLabelBlinking}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoLabelBlinking}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:label id="g_4" stylevariant="ccblink" text="This text is blinking." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" font="size:20;weight:bold" foreground="#800000" stylevariant="ccblink" text="This text is blinking." />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoLabelBlinking}")

public class DemoLabelBlinking
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoLabelBlinking(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demolabelblinking.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoLabelBlinking}"; }
}

Label Text

The attribute LABELTEXT arranges a small, descriptive text on top of the component. It is consistently available for all components that are typically representing attribute data.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoExtLabelText}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoExtLabelText}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:label id="g_4" text="Label" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_5" labeltext="Test label text" text="Test content" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" text="Field/..." width="100" />
<t:field id="g_8" labeltext="Test label text" text="Test content" width="150" />
<t:coldistance id="g_9" />
<t:combofield id="g_10" labeltext="Test label text" text="Test content" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="Combobox" width="100" />
<t:combobox id="g_13" labeltext="Test label text" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoExtLabelText.departmentsVVS}" value="#{d.DemoExtLabelText.department}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" text="Text area" width="100" />
<t:textarea id="g_16" height="100" labeltext="Test label text" text="Test content" width="310" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:label id="g_18" text="Checkbox" width="100" />
<t:checkbox id="g_19" labeltext="Test label text" text="Test text" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:label id="g_21" text="Radiobutton" width="100" />
<t:radiobuttongroup id="g_22" labeltext="Test label text" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoExtLabelText.departmentVVS}" value="#{d.DemoExtLabelText.department}" />
<t:checkbox id="g_23" labeltext="Test label text" text="Test text" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:label id="g_25" text="Textpane" width="100" />
<t:textpane id="g_26" labeltext="Test label text" rowalignmenty="top" text="Test content" width="150" />
<t:coldistance id="g_27" />
<t:textpane id="g_28" labeltext="Test label text" text="sdg sahg dsah dgfsa hdgf sahd gfsadh gasf hgasfd hasdf ashgdf ashgd fashgdfashgdfsahgd fashgdf " width="200" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoExtLabelText}")

public class DemoExtLabelText
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_department = "0002";
    ValidValuesBinding m_departmentVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoExtLabelText(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        m_departmentVVS.addValidValue("0001","Sales");
        m_departmentVVS.addValidValue("0002","Marketing");
        m_departmentVVS.addValidValue("0003","Production");
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoextlabeltext.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoExtLabelText}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getDepartment() { return m_department; }
    public void setDepartment(String value) { this.m_department = value; }

    public ValidValuesBinding getDepartmentVVS() { return m_departmentVVS; }

}

Posture italic and right alignment

When using fonts with posture "italic" and when same time using "right"-alignment, then browsers will probably cut some pixels from the last character.

To avoid this you can set style parameter "_contentOverflow" to "visible". This is already done within the default style classes "risclabel_contentoverflow" and "risctextpane_overflow".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoLabelPostureItalic}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoLabelPostureItalic}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:label id="g_2" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Label" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_31" text="Problem:" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_7" align="right" font="posture:italic" text="label()" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_33" text="Solution:" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_10" align="right" font="posture:italic" styleseq="risclabel_contentoverflowvisible" text="label()" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_26" >
<t:label id="g_27" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Multi line label" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_35" text="Problem:" width="100" />
<t:labelmultiline id="g_13" align="right" font="posture:italic" text="label()" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_36" text="Solution:" width="100" />
<t:labelmultiline id="g_16" align="right" font="posture:italic" styleseq="risctextpane_contentoverflowvisible" text="label()" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:label id="g_29" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Text pane" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_37" text="Problem:" width="100" />
<t:textpane id="g_19" align="right" font="posture:italic" text="test()" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:label id="g_38" text="Solution:" width="100" />
<t:textpane id="g_22" align="right" font="posture:italic" styleseq="risctextpane_contentoverflowvisible" text="test()" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoLabelPostureItalic}")

public class DemoLabelPostureItalic
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoLabelPostureItalic(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demolabelpostureitalic.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoLabelPostureItalic}"; }
}

Field Control

Field Background

The field controls (FIELD, COMBOFIELD, FORMATTEDFIELD) allow to define a BGPAINT attribute - either statically or dynamically. This is very useful for painting information into the field that guides the user.

In the example screen some variants are shown for rendering a field as mandatory field and as field containing an error.

Have a look onto the definition of the BGPAINT attributes: there are two special painting methods (in addition to the "normal" ones like "rectangle", "image", etc.) which are:

(1) error()
(2) mandatory()

"error()" marks the control as control holding an error value. "mandatory()" shows the user that he/she needs to input the field. The rendering behind "mandatory()" is only done, if the corresponding element does not contain a value. When the user inputs a value then the painting for "mandatory()" is no longer done.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoFieldBgpaint}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_3" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" text="Predefined BGPAINT values" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:textpane id="g_9" text="The following bgpaint information is directly defined  with the component:" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Field with error" width="150" />
<t:field id="g_6" bgpaint="error()" labeltext="Value" text="#{d.demoFieldBgpaint.value}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_50" >
<t:label id="g_51" text="Field with warning" width="150" />
<t:field id="g_52" bgpaint="warning()" labeltext="Value" text="#{d.demoFieldBgpaint.value}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_54" >
<t:label id="g_55" text="Mandatory field" width="150" />
<t:field id="g_56" bgpaint="mandatory()" labeltext="Value" text="#{d.demoFieldBgpaint.value}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_7" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_44" >
<t:textpane id="g_45" text="Now the error background is not hard-defined anymore - but bound to a property. Input &#34;OK&#34; into the following field and press &#34;Check Input&#34;:" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="Field with error" width="150" />
<t:field id="g_12" bgpaint="#{d.demoFieldBgpaint.valueBgpaint}" labeltext="Value" text="#{d.demoFieldBgpaint.value}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:coldistance id="g_14" width="150" />
<t:button id="g_15" actionListener="#{d.demoFieldBgpaint.onCheckInput}" text="Check Input" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_23" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" text="COMBOFIELD and FORMATTEDFIELD" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_47" >
<t:textpane id="g_48" text="Background painting &#34;error()&#34;, &#34;warning()&#34; and &#34;mandatory()&#34; is available for all input components. The following list shows how controls look like when being set to error/mandatory:" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:label id="g_25" text="COMBOBOX" width="150" />
<t:combobox id="g_26" bgpaint="error()" flush="true" labeltext="Value" value="#{d.demoFieldBgpaint.value}" width="200" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_27" text="All OK!" value="OK" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_28" text="Nothing OK!" value="NOTHING" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_29" >
<t:label id="g_30" text="COMBOBOX" width="150" />
<t:combobox id="g_31" bgpaint="mandatory()" editable="false" flush="true" labeltext="Value" value="#{d.demoFieldBgpaint.value}" width="200" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_32" text="All OK!" value="OK" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_33" text="Nothing OK!" value="NOTHING" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_34" >
<t:label id="g_35" text="COMBOFIELD" width="150" />
<t:combofield id="g_36" actionListener="#{d.demoFieldBgpaint.onComboFieldAction}" bgpaint="error()" labeltext="Value" text="#{d.demoFieldBgpaint.value}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_37" >
<t:label id="g_38" text="FORMATTEDFIELD" width="150" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_39" bgpaint="error()" labeltext="Value" value="#{d.demoFieldBgpaint.value}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_40" >
<t:label id="g_41" text="PASSWORD" width="150" />
<t:password id="g_42" bgpaint="mandatory()" labeltext="Value" width="200" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ISetId;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdTextSelection;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;


public class DemoFieldBgpaint extends PageBean
{
    static String BGPAINT_ERROR = "error()";
    
    String m_value;
    String m_valueBgpaint;
    
    public DemoFieldBgpaint(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("field"); 
        m_valueBgpaint = BGPAINT_ERROR;
    }
    
    public void setValue(String value) { m_value = value; }
    public String getValue() { return m_value; }
    
    public void setValueBgpaint(String value) { m_valueBgpaint = value; }
    public String getValueBgpaint() { return m_valueBgpaint; }
    
    public void onCheckInput(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        if (m_value != null && m_value.equals("OK"))
            m_valueBgpaint = null;
        else
            m_valueBgpaint = BGPAINT_ERROR;
    }
    
    public void onComboFieldAction(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createInstance();
        idts.addLine("Option1","Explanation for Option1");
        idts.addLine("Option2","Explanation for Option2");
        idts.addLine("Option3","Explanation for Option3");
        ISetId callBack = new ISetId() 
        {
            public void setId(String id)
            {
                m_value = id;
            }
        };
        idts.setCallBack(callBack);
    }
    
}

Field with floating label

By setting attribute LABELTEXT within all FIELD-components (FIELD, CALENDARFIELD, COMBOFIELD, CALENDARFIELD, SPINNER, ...) the label text will be shown as so called floating text: if first is shown as background text. Once the user defines some value, then the text moves up into the left top corner of the field.

When setting LABELTEXTALWAYSHOWN to "true" then there is no floating text, but the label text is always shown on the left top.

In order to harmonize the field's look and feel with checkboxes and radio buttons there is the component LABELCONTAINER: it arranges the content component into a container, that is in sync with the field's look and feel.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoLabelContainer}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoLabelContainer}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:label id="g_4" stylevariant="ccbig" text="For field components" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" font="weight:bold" text="Default: floating text" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" coldistance="10" >
<t:field id="g_8" clientname="firstName" flush="true" labeltext="First name" text="#{d.DemoLabelContainer.firstName}" width="100%;150" />
<t:field id="g_9" clientname="lastName" flush="true" labeltext="Last name" text="#{d.DemoLabelContainer.lastName}" width="100%;150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" coldistance="10" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_11" clientname="weight" flush="true" format="int" labeltext="Weight" unittext="kg" value="#{d.DemoLabelContainer.weight}" width="100%;150" />
<t:combofield id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoLabelContainer.onDepartmentAction}" clientname="department" flush="true" labeltext="Department" text="#{d.DemoLabelContainer.department}" unittext="#{d.DemoLabelContainer.departmentText}" width="100%;150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" coldistance="10" >
<t:calendarfield id="g_14" flush="true" labeltext="Birth date" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoLabelContainer.birthDate}" width="50%;120" />
<t:coldistance id="g_15" width="50%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" coldistance="10" >
<t:combobox id="g_17" flush="true" labeltext="Country" value="#{d.DemoLabelContainer.country}" width="100%;150" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_18" text="Germany" value="DE" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_19" text="France" value="FR" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_20" text="United States" value="US" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_21" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:label id="g_23" font="weight:bold" text="Label text always shown" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" coldistance="10" >
<t:field id="g_25" flush="true" labeltext="First name" labeltextalwaysshown="true" text="#{d.DemoLabelContainer.firstName}" width="100%;150" />
<t:field id="g_26" flush="true" labeltext="Last name" labeltextalwaysshown="true" text="#{d.DemoLabelContainer.lastName}" width="100%;150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_27" coldistance="10" >
<t:calendarfield id="g_28" flush="true" labeltext="Birth date" labeltextalwaysshown="true" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoLabelContainer.birthDate}" width="50%;120" />
<t:coldistance id="g_29" width="50%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_30" coldistance="10" >
<t:combobox id="g_31" flush="true" labeltext="Country" labeltextalwaysshown="true" value="#{d.DemoLabelContainer.country}" width="100%;150" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_32" text="Germany" value="DE" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_33" text="France" value="FR" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_34" text="United States" value="US" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_35" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_36" >
<t:label id="g_37" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Label container" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_38" >
<t:label id="g_39" font="weight:bold" text="...for check boxes, radio buttons, labels..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_40" coldistance="5" >
<t:labelcontainer id="g_41" rowalignmenty="top" text="Archived" width="50%" >
<t:checkbox id="g_42" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoLabelContainer.archived}" text="Archived before 2020" />
</t:labelcontainer>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_43" >
<t:labelcontainer id="g_44" rowalignmenty="top" text="Gender" width="100%" >
<t:pane id="g_45" >
<t:row id="g_46" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_47" flush="true" group="GENDER" refvalue="F" text="Female" value="#{d.DemoLabelContainer.gender}" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_48" flush="true" group="GENDER" refvalue="M" text="Male" value="#{d.DemoLabelContainer.gender}" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_49" flush="true" group="GENDER" refvalue="D" text="Diverse" value="#{d.DemoLabelContainer.gender}" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:labelcontainer>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_50" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_51" >
<t:label id="g_52" font="weight:bold" text="...rendered with ENABLED set to &#34;false&#34;:" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_53" coldistance="5" >
<t:labelcontainer id="g_54" enabled="false" rowalignmenty="top" text="Archived" width="50%" >
<t:checkbox id="g_55" enabled="false" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoLabelContainer.archived}" text="Archived before 2020" />
</t:labelcontainer>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_56" >
<t:labelcontainer id="g_57" enabled="false" rowalignmenty="top" text="Gender" width="100%" >
<t:pane id="g_58" >
<t:row id="g_59" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_60" enabled="false" flush="true" group="GENDER" refvalue="F" text="Female" value="#{d.DemoLabelContainer.gender}" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_61" enabled="false" flush="true" group="GENDER" refvalue="M" text="Male" value="#{d.DemoLabelContainer.gender}" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_62" enabled="false" flush="true" group="GENDER" refvalue="D" text="Diverse" value="#{d.DemoLabelContainer.gender}" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:labelcontainer>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.time.LocalDate;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ISetId;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdTextSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventValueHelp;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoLabelContainer}")

public class DemoLabelContainer
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    static Map<String,String> DEPARTMENTS = new HashMap<String, String>();
    
    static
    {
        DEPARTMENTS.put("0001","Production");
        DEPARTMENTS.put("0002","Sales");
        DEPARTMENTS.put("0003","Research");
        DEPARTMENTS.put("0004","Human Resources");
    }
    
    public String getDepartmentText() 
    { 
        if (m_department == null)
            return null;
        String result = DEPARTMENTS.get(m_department);
        if (result == null)
            result = "(unknown)";
        return result;
    }

    public void onDepartmentAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventValueHelp)
        {
            IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createInstance();
            for (String key: DEPARTMENTS.keySet())
            {
                idts.addLine(key,DEPARTMENTS.get(key));
            }
            idts.sortItemsById();
            idts.setCallBack(new ISetId()
            {
                @Override
                public void setId(String id)
                {
                    m_department = id;
                }
            });
        }
    }

    String m_department;
    public String getDepartment() { return m_department; }
    public void setDepartment(String value) { this.m_department = value; }

    Integer m_weight = null;
    public int getWeight() { return m_weight; }
    public void setWeight(int value) { this.m_weight = value; }

    String m_lastName;
    String m_firstName;
    String m_gender;
    boolean m_archived;
    String m_country;
    LocalDate m_birthDate;
    
    public DemoLabelContainer(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demolabelcontainer.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoLabelContainer}"; }

    public String getGender() { return m_gender; }
    public void setGender(String value) { this.m_gender = value; }

    public boolean getArchived() { return m_archived; }
    public void setArchived(boolean value) { this.m_archived = value; }

    public String getCountry() { return m_country; }
    public void setCountry(String value) { this.m_country = value; }

    public LocalDate getBirthDate() { return m_birthDate; }
    public void setBirthDate(LocalDate value) { this.m_birthDate = value; }

    public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
    public void setLastName(String value) { this.m_lastName = value; }

    public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
    public void setFirstName(String value) { this.m_firstName = value; }

}

Field Value Help

The COMBOFIELD component adds a valid value help to the normal FIELD component. This means: the component talks back to the server side actionListener when the user either presses the F4 key or clicks onto the corresponding icon within the component.

On server side you are in principal open "to do what you want". Typically you will use a popup in order to provide a selection of values.

For simple value lists, consisting out of either a list of ids or a list of ids with their associated text, there is a default handling, using class "IdTextSelection". Please have a look into the code.

In the "department example" just the selected id is passed back into the server processing. In the "cost center example" both the id and text are passed back.

As shown in the example with "Name": by combining the properties "FLUSH" and "FLUSHTIMER" you can easily build up complex scenarios, in which a value proposal is done based on the user's current input - and without the user explicitly requesting the value help, but controlled by a timer that is activated when the user does not do any input into the field.

There is an additional interesting attribute: KEEPFOCUS. In this case the focus is not moved into the value help popup but is kept within the COMBOFIELD component. Ther user can continue typing. By pressing cursor-down the user can navigate into the popup. Of course this mode only is working correctly if the server side processing opens up a modeless window.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoCombofield}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:combofield id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoCombofield.onDepartmentAction}" helpid="firstName" labeltext="Department" text="#{d.DemoCombofield.department}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:combofield id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoCombofield.onWarehouseAction}" labeltext="Warehouse" text="#{d.DemoCombofield.warehouse}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:combofield id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoCombofield.onCostCenterAction}" flush="true" labeltext="Cost center" text="#{d.DemoCombofield.costCenter}" unittext="#{d.DemoCombofield.costCenterText}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="15" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" font="weight:bold" text="The same components as above, but now: no direct editing allowed." />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_11" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:combofield id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoCombofield.onDepartmentAction}" editable="false" labeltext="Department" text="#{d.DemoCombofield.department}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:combofield id="g_15" actionListener="#{d.DemoCombofield.onCostCenterAction}" editable="false" flush="true" labeltext="Cost center" text="#{d.DemoCombofield.costCenter}" unittext="#{d.DemoCombofield.costCenterText}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_16" height="15" />
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:label id="g_18" font="weight:bold" text="Some more intelligence on server side, regognizing the user&#39;s input." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:coldistance id="g_20" width="50" />
<t:combofield id="g_21" actionListener="#{d.DemoCombofield.onNameAction}" labeltext="Name" text="#{d.DemoCombofield.name}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:coldistance id="g_23" width="50" />
<t:label id="g_24" text="Input &#34;M&#34;, then &lt;ctrl-space&gt;/&lt;F4&gt;. Then repeat with &#34;Mo&#34;." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_25" >
<t:label id="g_26" text="...the same again, but now with keeping the focus in the field:" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_27" >
<t:coldistance id="g_28" width="50" />
<t:combofield id="g_29" actionListener="#{d.DemoCombofield.onNameAction}" keepfocus="true" labeltext="Name" text="#{d.DemoCombofield.name}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_30" >
<t:label id="g_31" text="...the same again, but now with auto-flushing of user input. Type &#34;M&#34;, then &#34;Mo&#34;" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_32" >
<t:coldistance id="g_33" width="50" />
<t:combofield id="g_34" actionListener="#{d.DemoCombofield.onNameAction}" flush="true" flushtimer="1000" keepfocus="true" labeltext="Name" text="#{d.DemoCombofield.name}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_35" height="15" />
<t:row id="g_36" >
<t:label id="g_37" font="weight:bold" text="Popup Rendering Variants" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_38" >
<t:label id="g_39" text="Default" width="120" />
<t:combofield id="g_40" actionListener="#{d.DemoCombofield.onDepartmentAction}" text="#{d.DemoCombofield.department}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_41" >
<t:label id="g_42" text="Small Size" width="120" />
<t:combofield id="g_43" actionListener="#{d.DemoCombofield.onDepartmentActionSmall}" text="#{d.DemoCombofield.department}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_44" >
<t:label id="g_45" text="Small Size" width="120" />
<t:combofield id="g_46" actionListener="#{d.DemoCombofield.onDepartmentActionSmallNoHeader}" text="#{d.DemoCombofield.department}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_47" height="15" />
<t:row id="g_48" >
<t:label id="g_49" font="weight:bold" text="Definition of own popups" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_50" >
<t:label id="g_51" text="Person" width="120" />
<t:combofield id="g_52" actionListener="#{d.DemoCombofield.onPersonAction}" text="#{d.DemoCombofield.person}" width="200" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.lang.reflect.Field;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ISetId;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ISetIdText;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdAttributesSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdTextSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModelessPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventFlush;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventValueHelp;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.DefaultModelessPopupListener;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ClientTestLog;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.DemoManyFields.FieldInfo;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.demoCombofield}")

public class DemoCombofield extends PageBean
{
    final static Map<String,String> MAP_COSTCENTER = new HashMap<String,String>();

    static
    {
        MAP_COSTCENTER.put("0001","Production Chassis");
        MAP_COSTCENTER.put("0002","Production Engine");
        MAP_COSTCENTER.put("0003","Production Gear System");
        MAP_COSTCENTER.put("0004","Quality Control");
    }
    
    public DemoCombofield(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("combofield"); 
    }
    
    // department -------------------------------------------------------------
    
    String m_department;
    
    public void setDepartment(String value) { m_department = value; }
    public String getDepartment() { return m_department; }
    
    public void onDepartmentAction(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        if (ae instanceof BaseActionEventValueHelp)
        {
            IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createInstance();
            idts.addLine("SALES1","Sales and Distribution North");
            idts.addLine("SALES2","Sales and Distribution East");
            idts.addLine("SALES3","Sales and Distribution South");
            idts.addLine("SALESW","Sales and Distribution West");
            idts.addLine("PROD","Production");
            idts.addLine("MGMT","Management");
            idts.addLine("HR","Human Resources");
            idts.addLine("SUP","Service and Support");
            idts.setCallBack(new ISetId()
                             {
                                 public void setId(String id)
                                 {
                                     m_department = id;
                                 }
                             });
            idts.setWithHeader(false);
            idts.setRenderFilterText(true);
            idts.preselect(m_department);
        }
    }
    
    public void onDepartmentActionSmall(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        if (ae instanceof BaseActionEventValueHelp)
        {
            IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createInstance();
            idts.addLine("SALES1","Sales and Distribution North");
            idts.addLine("SALES2","Sales and Distribution East");
            idts.addLine("SALES3","Sales and Distribution South");
            idts.addLine("SALESW","Sales and Distribution West");
            idts.addLine("PROD","Production");
            idts.addLine("MGMT","Management");
            idts.addLine("HR","Human Resources");
            idts.addLine("SUP","Service and Support");
            idts.setCallBack(new ISetId()
                             {
                                 public void setId(String id)
                                 {
                                     m_department = id;
                                 }
                             });
            idts.setWithHeader(true);
            idts.setPopupWidth(200);
            idts.setPopupHeight(100);
            idts.preselect(m_department);
        }
    }
    
    public void onDepartmentActionSmallNoHeader(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        if (ae instanceof BaseActionEventValueHelp)
        {
            IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createInstance();
            idts.addLine("SALES1","Sales and Distribution North");
            idts.addLine("SALES2","Sales and Distribution East");
            idts.addLine("SALES3","Sales and Distribution South");
            idts.addLine("SALESW","Sales and Distribution West");
            idts.addLine("PROD","Production");
            idts.addLine("MGMT","Management");
            idts.addLine("HR","Human Resources");
            idts.addLine("SUP","Service and Support");
            idts.setCallBack(new ISetId()
                             {
                                 public void setId(String id)
                                 {
                                     m_department = id;
                                 }
                             });
            idts.setWithHeader(false);
            idts.setSuppressHeadline(true);
            idts.setRenderIdColumn(false);
            idts.setPopupWidth(200);
            idts.setPopupHeight(100);
        }
    }
    
     // department -------------------------------------------------------------
    
    String m_warehouse;
    
    public void setWarehouse(String value) { m_warehouse = value; }
    public String getWarehouse() { return m_warehouse; }
    
    public void onWarehouseAction(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        if (ae instanceof BaseActionEventValueHelp)
        {
            String[] titles = new String[] {"Location","Size","Employees","Occupancy"};
            String[] widths = new String[] {"100%","80","50","50"};
            IdAttributesSelection idas = IdAttributesSelection.createInstance(titles, widths);
            idas.addLine("LONDON",new String[] {"London","10000 qm","45","76%"});
            idas.addLine("PARIS",new String[] {"Paris","6000 qm","25","56%"});
            idas.addLine("BAMMENTAL",new String[] {"Bammental","20000 qm","55","87%"});
            idas.setCallBack(new ISetId()
                             {
                                 public void setId(String id)
                                 {
                                     m_warehouse = id;
                                 }
                             });
            idas.preselect(m_warehouse);
//            idas.setPopupWidth(700);
//            idas.setPopupHeight(250);
        }
    }
    
    // cost center ------------------------------------------------------------
    
    String m_costCenter;
    
    public void setCostCenter(String value) { m_costCenter = value; }
    public String getCostCenter() { return m_costCenter; }

    public String getCostCenterText()
    {
        if (m_costCenter == null || m_costCenter.trim().length() == 0) return null;
        String result = MAP_COSTCENTER.get(m_costCenter);
        if (result == null) result = "(undefined)";
        return result;
    }
    
    public void onCostCenterAction(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        if (ae instanceof BaseActionEventValueHelp)
        {
            IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createInstanceWithExplanation("A cost center is an organizational unit that is used for allocating cost.");
            for (String key: MAP_COSTCENTER.keySet())
                idts.addLine(key,MAP_COSTCENTER.get(key));
            idts.sortItemsById();
            idts.setCallBack(new ISetIdText()
                             {
                                 public void setIdText(String id, String text)
                                 {
                                     m_costCenter = id;
                                 }
                             });
            idts.setWithHeader(true);
            idts.preselect(m_costCenter);
        }
    }
    
    // name -------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    static String[] NAMES = new String[]
                                       {
        "Clark",
        "Maas",
        "Mannesmann",
        "Maier",
        "Mayer",
        "Meyer",
        "Meier",
        "Monday",
        "Molotow",
        "Moretimer",
        "Mortadella",
        "Mill",
        "Miller",
        "Mitermayer",
        "Mittermeier",
        "Mittenwald",
        "Mller",
        "Mnch",
        "Meyer",
        "Smith",
        "Zappa"
                                       };
    
    protected String m_name = "";
    public String getName() { return m_name; }
    public void setName(String value) { m_name = value; }

    public void onNameAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventFlush && ((BaseActionEventFlush)event).getFlushWasTriggeredByTimer() ||
            event instanceof BaseActionEventValueHelp)
        {
            IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createInstance();
            for (String name: NAMES) idts.addLine(name,name);
            idts.filterByInputId(m_name);
            idts.setRenderIdColumn(false);
            idts.setCallBack(new ISetIdText()
            {
                public void setIdText(String id, String text)
                {
                    m_name = id;
                }
            });
        }
    }
    
    // person -----------------------------------------------------------------
    
    protected ModelessPopup m_modelessPopup;
    protected String m_person;
    
    public void setPerson(String value) { m_person = value; }
    public String getPerson() { return m_person; }
    
    public void onPersonAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        // call an own popup
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventValueHelp)
        {
            DemoComboFieldPopup cfp = (DemoComboFieldPopup)getOwningDispatcher().getDispatchedBean(DemoComboFieldPopup.class);
            cfp.prepare(new Runnable() 
            {
                public void run()
                {
                    // take over result
                    DemoComboFieldPopup cfp = (DemoComboFieldPopup)getOwningDispatcher().getDispatchedBean(DemoComboFieldPopup.class);
                    String result = cfp.getSelectionResult();
                    m_person = result;
                    // close popup
                    m_modelessPopup.close();
                    m_modelessPopup = null;
                }
            });
            m_modelessPopup = getOwningDispatcher().createModelessPopup();
            m_modelessPopup.open("/workplace/democombofieldpopup.jsp","Person Selection",350,400,new DefaultModelessPopupListener(m_modelessPopup));
            m_modelessPopup.setUndecorated(true);
            m_modelessPopup.setCloseonclickoutside(true);
            m_modelessPopup.setStartfromrootwindow(false);
        }
    }

    public boolean onCreateClientTestLogMessage()
    {
        ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage(m_costCenter + "//" + 
                                              m_warehouse + "//" + 
                                              m_department + "//" + 
                                              m_name + "//" + 
                                              m_person);
        return false;
    }
    
}

Field Value Help - Details
Changing the Icon

Use the attributes IMAGE, IMAGEROLLOVER, IMAGEPRESSED in order to update the image "on the right" of the combo field.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoComboFieldImage}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Default" width="100" />
<t:combofield id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoComboFieldImage.onCostCenterAction}" flush="true" text="#{d.DemoComboFieldImage.costCenter}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Other Image (I)" width="100" />
<t:combofield id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoComboFieldImage.onCostCenterAction}" flush="true" image="/eclntjsfserver/images/control_play.png" imagepressed="/eclntjsfserver/images/control_play.png" imagerollover="/eclntjsfserver/images/control_play.png" text="#{d.DemoComboFieldImage.costCenter}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Other Image (II)" width="100" />
<t:combofield id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoComboFieldImage.onCostCenterAction}" flush="true" image="/eclntjsfserver/images/magnifier.png" imagepressed="/eclntjsfserver/images/magnifier.png" imagerollover="/eclntjsfserver/images/magnifier.png" text="#{d.DemoComboFieldImage.costCenter}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="Other Image (III)" width="100" />
<t:combofield id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoComboFieldImage.onCostCenterAction}" flush="true" image="/images/icons/magnifier_small.png" imagepressed="/images/icons/magnifier_small.png" imagerollover="/images/icons/magnifier_small.png" text="#{d.DemoComboFieldImage.costCenter}" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ISetId;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdTextSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventValueHelp;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoComboFieldImage}")

public class DemoComboFieldImage
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    protected String m_costCenter;

    public DemoComboFieldImage(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("combofield"); 
    }
    
    public String getCostCenter() { return m_costCenter; }
    public void setCostCenter(String value) { m_costCenter = value; }

    public void onCostCenterAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventValueHelp)
        {
            IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createInstance();
            idts.addLine("BOARD","Executive Board");
            idts.addLine("DEV","Development");
            idts.addLine("PROD","Production");
            idts.addLine("SALES","Sales");
            idts.setCallBack(new ISetId() 
            {
                public void setId(String id)
                {
                    m_costCenter = id;
                }
            });
        }
    }

}

Image Selection

Together with the COMBOFIELD you can provide value help, combining an image, a description and the id/value to be selected.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoComboFieldImageSelection}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:combofield id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoComboFieldImageSelection.onCostCenterAction}" labeltext="Cost center" text="#{d.DemoComboFieldImageSelection.costCenter}" width="200" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ISetId;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdTextSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventValueHelp;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoComboFieldImageSelection}")

public class DemoComboFieldImageSelection
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    protected String m_costCenter;

    public DemoComboFieldImageSelection(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("combofield"); 
    }
    
    public String getCostCenter() { return m_costCenter; }
    public void setCostCenter(String value) { m_costCenter = value; }

    public void onCostCenterAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventValueHelp)
        {
            IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createInstanceWithImageLine();
            idts.addLine("BOARD","Executive Board","/images/pictures/ph0.jpg");
            idts.addLine("DEV","Development","/images/pictures/ph1.jpg");
            idts.addLine("PROD","Production","/images/pictures/ph2.jpg");
            idts.addLine("SALES","Sales","/images/pictures/ph3.jpg");
            idts.addLine("HR","Human Resources","/images/pictures/ph4.jpg");
            idts.addLine("QA1","Quality Assurance 1","/images/pictures/ph5.jpg");
            idts.addLine("QA2","Quality Assurance 2","/images/pictures/ph6.jpg");
            idts.setCallBack(new ISetId() 
            {
                public void setId(String id)
                {
                    m_costCenter = id;
                }
            });
        }
    }
    
}

Item background, item select-ability

This demo shows some extended functions of the IdTextSelection class, that may be used to implement the dialog that is shown by a COMBOFIELD:

1. on item level you may pass an individual BGPAINT
2. on item level you may pass the information if the item is select-able (default) or not.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoComboFieldExt}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:combofield id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoComboFieldExt.onCostCenterAction}" labeltext="Cost center" text="#{d.DemoComboFieldExt.costCenter}" width="200" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ISetId;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdTextSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdTextSelection.IdTextLine;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventValueHelp;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.PageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoComboFieldExt}")

public class DemoComboFieldExt
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoComboFieldExt(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_costCenter;
    public String getCostCenter() { return m_costCenter; }
    public void setCostCenter(String value) { this.m_costCenter = value; }

    public void onCostCenterAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventValueHelp)
        {
            IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createInstance();
            IdTextLine idtl;
            idtl = idts.addLine(null,"Production"); idtl.setBgpaint("background(#CCFFCC)"); idtl.setSelectable(false);
            idts.addLine("0001","Gear Systems");
            idts.addLine("0002","Engines");
            idts.addLine("0003","Chassis");
            idtl = idts.addLine(null,"Administration"); idtl.setBgpaint("background(#CCFFCC)"); idtl.setSelectable(false);
            idts.addLine("1001","Board");
            idts.addLine("1002","HR");
            idtl = idts.addLine(null,"Sales"); idtl.setBgpaint("background(#CCFFCC)"); idtl.setSelectable(false);
            idts.addLine("2001","Sales North");
            idts.addLine("2002","Sales South");
            idtl = idts.addLine(null,"Others"); idtl.setBgpaint("background(#CCFFCC)"); idtl.setSelectable(false);
            for (int i=3001; i<3050; i++)
            {
                idts.addLine(""+i,"Cost Center " + i);
            }
            idts.setCallBack(new ISetId()
            {
                public void setId(String id)
                {
                    m_costCenter = id;
                }
            });
            idts.preselect(m_costCenter);
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Tree Selection Popup

This demo shows how to bring together...

...COMBOFIELD-component
...PageBean Management
...Tree Management

...in order to support scenarios in which you want a tree to be opened for selecting items for a certain field.

(The code and the XML of the popup that is called is contained as comment inside the "Server side Java Code"-tab.)

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoComboFieldTree}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:combofield id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoComboFieldTree.onDepartmentAction}" labeltext="Department" text="#{d.DemoComboFieldTree.department}" width="200" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModelessPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventValueHelp;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoComboFieldTree}")

public class DemoComboFieldTree
    extends PageBean // ==> WorkpageDispatchedPageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    String m_department;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoComboFieldTree(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        initRefComponent("combofield"); 
    }
    
    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democombofieldtree.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoComboFieldTree}"; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public String getDepartment() { return m_department; }
    public void setDepartment(String value) { this.m_department = value; }

    public void onDepartmentAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventValueHelp)
        {
            final DemoComboFieldTreePopup dcfp = new DemoComboFieldTreePopup(getOwningDispatcher());
            dcfp.prepare(m_department,new DemoComboFieldTreePopup.IListener()
            {
                public void reactOnSelection(String selectedValue)
                {
                    m_department = selectedValue;
                    closePopup(dcfp);  
                }
            });
            ModelessPopup mp = openModelessPopup(dcfp,"",0,0,new ModelessPopup.IModelessPopupListener()
            {
                public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
                {
                    closePopup(dcfp);
                }
            });
            mp.setUndecorated(true);
            mp.setCloseonclickoutside(true);
        }
    }

}


// XML of the JSP page that is called:
// -----------------------------------

//  <t:row id="g_1" >
//    <t:fixgrid id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoComboFieldTreePopup.tree}" sbvisibleamount="15" suppressheadline="true" width="300" >
//      <t:gridcol id="g_3" text="Column" width="100%" >
//        <t:treenode id="g_4" />
//      </t:gridcol>
//    </t:fixgrid>
//  </t:row>


// Code of the popup class that is called:
// ---------------------------------------

//package workplace;
//
//import java.io.Serializable;
//
//import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
//import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeBinding;
//import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeItem;
//import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
//import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;
//
//@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoComboFieldTreePopup}")
//
//public class DemoComboFieldTreePopup
//    extends WorkpageDispatchedPageBean 
//    implements Serializable
//{
//    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
//    // inner classes
//    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
//    
//    public interface IListener
//    {
//        public void reactOnSelection(String selectedValue);
//    }
//    
//    public class TreeNode extends FIXGRIDTreeItem implements java.io.Serializable
//    {
//        public TreeNode(FIXGRIDTreeItem parentNode)
//        {
//            super(parentNode);
//        }
//        @Override
//        public void onRowExecute()
//        {
//            if (getStatusInt() == STATUS_ENDNODE)
//            {
//                if (m_listener != null)
//                    m_listener.reactOnSelection(getText());
//            }
//            else
//            {
//                toggleNode();
//            }
//        }
//    }
//
//    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
//    // members
//    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
//
//    IListener m_listener;
//    FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode> m_tree = new FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode>();
//    
//    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
//    // constructors & initialization
//    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
//
//    /**
//     * Only called during layout editor preview...
//     */
//    public DemoComboFieldTreePopup(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
//    {
//        super(workpageDispatcher);        
//        // fill tree
//        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
//        {
//            TreeNode top = new TreeNode(m_tree.getRootNode());
//            top.setText("Location " + i);
//            top.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_CLOSED);
//            for (int j=0; j<10; j++)
//            {
//                TreeNode sub = new TreeNode(top);
//                sub.setText("Department " + i + "/" + j);
//                sub.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_ENDNODE);
//            }
//        }
//    }
//
//    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democombofieldtreepopup.jsp"; }
//    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoComboFieldTreePopup}"; }
//    
//    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
//    // public usage
//    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
//    
//    public FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode> getTree() { return m_tree; }
//    
//    public void prepare(String selectedValue, IListener listener)
//    {
//        m_listener = listener;
//        // find item to be selected in tree
//        FIXGRIDTreeItem current = m_tree.getRootNode();
//        if (selectedValue != null)
//        {
//            FIXGRIDTreeItem selectedNode = findItemContainingText(selectedValue,m_tree.getRootNode());
//            if (selectedNode != null)
//            {
//                m_tree.selectItem(selectedNode);
//                m_tree.ensureItemToBeDisplayed((TreeNode)selectedNode);
//            }
//        }
//    }
//    
//    private FIXGRIDTreeItem findItemContainingText(String text,FIXGRIDTreeItem node)
//    {
//        if (node.getText() != null && node.getText().equals(text))
//            return node;
//        for (FIXGRIDTreeItem childNode: node.getChildNodes())
//        {
//            FIXGRIDTreeItem selNode = findItemContainingText(text,childNode);
//            if (selNode != null)
//                return selNode;
//        }
//        return null;
//    }
//}

Auto completion with COMBOFIELD (I)

This demo shows how to flexible use the COMBOFIELD in order to provide some auto complete function.

The value help for the COMBOFIELD shows up when either explicitly requesting it (pressing the icon, F4 or ctrl-space) or when keying in some characters and waiting a certain duration.

The following issues are the one, which are important:

1. COMBOFIELD-FLUSH and FLUSHTIMER is set in order to tell the server that values have changed
2. COMBOFIELD-KEEPFOCUS is switched to true, so that the focus is not moved into the value help dialog, but so that the focus stays with the COMBOFIELD

On server side the value help dialog is a just normal PageBean modeless popup.

Here it makes sense to...
1. use the lightway style for modeless popups: undecorated, with "clickoncloseoutside"
2. manage the popup in a way so that you check if the popup is already opened etc. - not to open the popup twice
3. tell the popup that it should not focus the calling component when being closed

Please pay attention: when using this demo with JavaFX 2.2 then there will be some problems within the focus management... These problems are fixed with JavaFX 3.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoCombofieldAutoComplete}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:textpane id="g_3" text="Key in some text in the Person-field. Either wait a short duration or press ctrl-space or F4 in order to open the auto completion value help." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_4" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_5" >
