<t:combofield id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoCombofieldAutoComplete.onPersonAction}" flush="true" flushtimer="1000" keepfocus="true" labeltext="Person" text="#{d.DemoCombofieldAutoComplete.person}" width="200" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModelessPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventFlush;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventValueHelp;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.PageBean;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.HttpSessionAccess;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoCombofieldAutoComplete}")

public class DemoCombofieldAutoComplete
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    /* Listener to the user of the page bean. */
    public interface IListener
    {
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private IListener m_listener;
    String m_person;
    DemoCombofieldAutoCompleteValueHelp m_personValueHelp = null;
    
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoCombofieldAutoComplete(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /* Initialization of the bean. Add any parameter that is required within your scenario. */
    public void prepare(IListener listener)
    {
        m_listener = listener;
    }

    public String getPerson() { return m_person; }
    public void setPerson(String value) { this.m_person = value; }

    public void onPersonAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        // the popup is triggered either if explicitly requested...
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventValueHelp)
        {
            showPersonValueHelp();
        }
        // ...or if a flush event was received that was caused by a flush timer
        // (and NOT by the user moving to the next field)
        else if (event instanceof BaseActionEventFlush)
        {
            BaseActionEventFlush e = (BaseActionEventFlush)event;
            if (e.getFlushWasTriggeredByTimer())
                showPersonValueHelp();
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void showPersonValueHelp()
    {
        // already shown? 
        if (m_personValueHelp == null)
        {
            m_personValueHelp = new DemoCombofieldAutoCompleteValueHelp();
            ModelessPopup mp = openModelessPopup(m_personValueHelp,"",0,0,new ModelessPopup.IModelessPopupListener()
            {
                public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
                {
                    closePersonValueHelp();
                }
            });
            mp.setUndecorated(true);
            // mp.setAvoidfocussingofopener(true);
            mp.setCloseonclickoutside(true);
            mp.setStyleseq("riscdialog_popup_transparent");
        }
        m_personValueHelp.prepare(new DemoCombofieldAutoCompleteValueHelp.IListener()
        {
            public void reactOnPersonSelected(String person)
            {
                m_person = person;
                closePersonValueHelp();
            }
        },m_person);
    }
    
    private void closePersonValueHelp()
    {
        if (m_personValueHelp == null)
            return;
        closePopup(m_personValueHelp);
        m_personValueHelp = null;
    }
}

Auto completion with COMBOFIELD (II)

This demo shows two issues:

1. the usage of the COMBOFIELD together with FLUSH, FLUSHTIMER, KEEPFOCUS in order to provide a comfortable lookup from some list
2. the usage of the COMBOFIELD so that some text is selected, but internally some id is managed

Please note: in the code there is a "m_country" which holds the id of the country - and there is a "m_countryText" which holds the corresponding text / input of the user.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoComboAutoComplete2}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Street" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_4" flush="true" text="#{d.DemoComboAutoComplete2.street}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Town" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_7" flush="true" text="#{d.DemoComboAutoComplete2.town}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Country" width="100" />
<t:combofield id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoComboAutoComplete2.onCountryAction}" flush="true" flushtimer="500" keepfocus="true" popupmenu="COMBOAUTOCOMPLETE" text="#{d.DemoComboAutoComplete2.countryText}" width="150" withvalidationevent="true" withremoveicon="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="Country Code" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_13" text="#{d.DemoComboAutoComplete2.country}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_14" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:coldistance id="g_16" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_17" actionListener="#{d.DemoComboAutoComplete2.onSaveAction}" text="Save" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:popupmenu id="COMBOAUTOCOMPLETE" >
<t:menuitem id="g_18" command="TAKEOVER" hotkey="10" text="Take over from value help" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Locale;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdTextSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModelessPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventFlush;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventHelp;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventValidate;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventValueHelp;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoComboAutoComplete2}")

public class DemoComboAutoComplete2
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public void onSaveAction(ActionEvent event) {}

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_country; // the country
    String m_countryText; // the current input of the user
    
    DemoComboAutoComplete2Popup m_countryPopup = null;
    
    String m_town;
    String m_street;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoComboAutoComplete2(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democombofieldautocompete2.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoComboAutoComplete2}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getTown() { return m_town; }
    public void setTown(String value) { this.m_town = value; }
    
    public String getStreet() { return m_street; }
    public void setStreet(String value) { this.m_street = value; }

    public String getCountryText() 
    {
        if (m_countryText == null) m_countryText = SomeLogic.getTextForCountryCode(m_country);
        return m_countryText;
    }
    public void setCountryText(String countryText) 
    {  
        m_countryText = countryText;
        if (m_countryText != null && m_countryText.length() == 0) m_countryText = null;
        if (m_countryText == null) m_country = null;
    }
    
    public void setCountryCode(String value) { m_country = value; }
    public String getCountry() { return m_country; }
//    public boolean getCountryValid() 
//    {
//        String t1 = SomeLogic.getTextForCountryCode(m_country);
//        if (t1 == null) t1 = "";
//        String t2 = m_countryText;
//        if (t2 == null) t2 ="";
//        if (ValueManager.checkIfStringsAreEqual(t1,t2))
//            return true;
//        else
//            return false;
//    }

    public void onCountryAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventValueHelp)
        {
            openCountryPopup();
        }
        else if (event instanceof BaseActionEventFlush)
        {
            BaseActionEventFlush e = (BaseActionEventFlush)event;
            if (e.getFlushWasTriggeredByTimer() == true)
            {
                openCountryPopup();
            }
        }
        else if (event instanceof BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem) // hot key 13
        {
            BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem e = (BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem)event;
            if ("TAKEOVER".equals(e.getCommand()))
            {
                takeOverPopupValue();
            }
        }
        else if (event instanceof BaseActionEventValidate)
        {
            Statusbar.outputMessage("Validate processed: " + m_countryText + "/" + System.currentTimeMillis());
            m_country = SomeLogic.findCountryCode(getCountryText());
            if (m_country == null && getCountryText() != null && getCountryText().length() != 0)
            {
                Statusbar.outputError("No country found for: " + getCountryText());
            }
            m_countryText = null;
            closeCountryPopup();
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private void takeOverPopupValue()
    {
        if (m_countryPopup == null) return;
        if (m_countryPopup.getSelectedId() == null) return;
        m_country = m_countryPopup.getSelectedId();
        m_countryText = null;
        closeCountryPopup();
    }
    
    private void openCountryPopup()
    {
        if (m_countryPopup == null)
        {
            m_countryPopup = new DemoComboAutoComplete2Popup();
            for (String countryCode: SomeLogic.getCountryCodes())
                m_countryPopup.addItem(countryCode,SomeLogic.getTextForCountryCode(countryCode));
            m_countryPopup.sortItems();
            m_countryPopup.prepare(new DemoComboAutoComplete2Popup.IListener()
            {
                public void reactOnSelection(String country)
                {
                    m_country = country;
                    m_countryText = null; // reset in get!
                    closeCountryPopup();
                }
            });
            ModelessPopup popup = openModelessPopup(m_countryPopup,"",0,0,new ModelessPopup.IModelessPopupListener()
            {
                public void reactOnPopupClosedByUser()
                {
                    closeCountryPopup();
                }
            });
            popup.setUndecorated(true);
            popup.setCloseonclickoutside(true);
            // popup.setAvoidfocussingofopener(true);
        }
        m_countryPopup.position(m_countryText);
    }
    
    private void closeCountryPopup()
    {
        if (m_countryPopup != null)
        {
            closePopup(m_countryPopup);
            m_countryPopup = null;
        }
    }
    
}

Simplified COMBOFIELD for id/text scenarios (PBC)

The page bean component CCComboFieldIdText simplifies the usage of the COMBOFIELD when dealing with objects, consisting out of an id and a text representation.

Internally the id is transferred in and out - whereas the user sees the text and uses the text for searching values.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCComboFieldIdText}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="The list of objects is directly provided by the logic:" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:pagebeancomponent id="g_5" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCComboFieldIdText.cfDepartment}" pagebeanclass="org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCComboFieldIdText" pagebeaninitdata="labeltext:Department;width:200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_6" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="The list of objects is taken from a resource file:" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:pagebeancomponent id="g_10" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCComboFieldIdText.cfLiteral}" pagebeanclass="org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCComboFieldIdText" pagebeaninitdata="labeltext:Literal;width:200" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCComboFieldIdText;
import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.util.combofieldidtext.LogicByLoadedList;
import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.util.combofieldidtext.LogicByResource;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPBCCCComboFieldIdText}")

public class DemoPBCCCComboFieldIdText
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    class DepartmentLogic extends LogicByLoadedList
    {
        public DepartmentLogic()
        {
            addObject("0001","Production");
            addObject("0002","Sales");
            addObject("0003","Maintenance");
            addObject("0004","Finance and Controlling");
            sortObjectsByText();
        }
        public String getId() { return m_departmentId; }
        public void setId(String id) { m_departmentId = id; }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_departmentId = "0001";
    String m_literalId;
    
    CCComboFieldIdText m_cfDepartment = new CCComboFieldIdText(new DepartmentLogic());
    CCComboFieldIdText m_cfLiteral = new CCComboFieldIdText(new LogicByResource("org.eclnt.jsfserver.i18n.resources.Literals")
    {
        public String getId() { return m_literalId; }
        public void setId(String id) { m_literalId = id; }
    });
    
    public CCComboFieldIdText getCfLiteral() { return m_cfLiteral; }
    public CCComboFieldIdText getCfDepartment() { return m_cfDepartment; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPBCCCComboFieldIdText(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopbccccombofieldidtext.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPBCCCComboFieldIdText}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------


    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Opening the value help dialog "from outside"

When you select the department by radio button, then immediately the selection of employees is opened.

Check the code for the following issues:

(.) The RADIOBUTTONGROUP flushes selections to the server by setting FLUSH to "true"
(.) On server side the method to open the selection is both called from the COMBOFIELD and from the RADIOBUTTONGROUP processing
(.) For correct positioning the popup dialog is always opened at the COMBOFIELD - which is done by explicitly assigning an id ("EMPLOYEE") to the component and by referencing this id when opening the dialog

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition
    xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t">
    <t:beanprocessing id="g_1"
        beanbinding="#{d.DemoComboFieldOpenValueHelpFromOutside}" />
    <t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4"
        objectbinding="#{d.DemoComboFieldOpenValueHelpFromOutside}">
        <t:row id="g_6">
            <t:radiobuttongroup id="g_2"
                actionListener="#{d.DemoComboFieldOpenValueHelpFromOutside.onDepartmentAction}"
                flush="true" labeltext="Department"
                validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoComboFieldOpenValueHelpFromOutside.departmentVVS}"
                value="#{d.DemoComboFieldOpenValueHelpFromOutside.department}" />
        </t:row>
        <t:row id="g_3">
            <t:combofield id="EMPLOYEE"
                actionListener="#{d.DemoComboFieldOpenValueHelpFromOutside.onEmployeeAction}"
                labeltext="Employee"
                text="#{d.DemoComboFieldOpenValueHelpFromOutside.employee}"
                width="250" />
        </t:row>
    </t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ISetId;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdTextSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventFlush;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventValueHelp;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoComboFieldOpenValueHelpFromOutside}")

public class DemoComboFieldOpenValueHelpFromOutside
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_employee;
    String m_department = "SALES";
    ValidValuesBinding m_departmentVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoComboFieldOpenValueHelpFromOutside(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);    
        m_departmentVVS.addValidValue("SALES","Sales");
        m_departmentVVS.addValidValue("PROD","Production");
        m_departmentVVS.addValidValue("ADMIN","Administration");
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democombofieldopenvaluehelpfromoutside.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoComboFieldOpenValueHelpFromOutside}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------


    public String getEmployee() { return m_employee; }
    public void setEmployee(String value) { this.m_employee = value; }

    public ValidValuesBinding getDepartmentVVS() { return m_departmentVVS; }

    public String getDepartment() { return m_department; }
    public void setDepartment(String value) { this.m_department = value; }

    public void onEmployeeAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventValueHelp)
        {
            selectEmployeeByPopup();
        }
    }

    public void onDepartmentAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventFlush)
        {
            selectEmployeeByPopup();
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void selectEmployeeByPopup()
    {
        IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createInstance();
        if ("SALES".equals(m_department))
        {
            idts.addLine("4711","Jo Mastersellor");
            idts.addLine("4712","Marianne Greatsales");
            idts.addLine("4713","Andy Alwaysgreat");
        }
        else if ("PROD".equals(m_department))
        {
            idts.addLine("4721","Lisa Hardwork");
            idts.addLine("4722","Hans Superdriller");
            idts.addLine("4723","Betty Alwaysworking");
            idts.addLine("4724","John Thechainsaw");
        }
        else if ("ADMIN".equals(m_department))
        {
            idts.addLine("4731","Hugo Superboss");
        }
        idts.setCallBack(new ISetId()
        {
            @Override
            public void setId(String id)
            {
                m_employee = id;
            }
        });
        // force the popup to always be opened at the EMPLOYEE combofield
        idts.getPopup().setLefTopReferenceComponentId("EMPLOYEE");
    }

    
}

Auto Completion
Example

The AUTOCOMPLETE component allows the user to input some text. After a certain time of inactivity a URL request is executed in order to pick value-proposals from the server. In the case of AUTOCOMPLETE this request is sent completely decoupled from the normal request/response processing of the Enterprise Client.

The AUTCOMPLETE component expects a certain URL, which you should normally provide by creating a corresponding "AutoCompleteProvider" implementation on backend side.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoAutoComplete}" rowdistance="0" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:autocomplete id="g_3" drawoddevenrows="true" flush="true" labeltext="Name" popupwidth="250" requestfocus="creation" value="#{d.DemoAutoComplete.name}" valuesurl="#{d.DemoAutoComplete.nameACURL}" width="250" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_4" height="30" />
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="(1) Input &#34;CaptainCasa&#34; or " />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="(2) input &#34;JSF&#34;..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="...and a corresponding list of value proposals will show up." />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_11" height="80" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="Variants" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" text="Faster Request" width="100" />
<t:autocomplete id="g_16" autocompletetimer="500" flush="true" labeltext="Name" value="#{d.DemoAutoComplete.name}" valuesurl="#{d.DemoAutoComplete.nameACURL}" width="250" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_17" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" text="Popup Size" width="100" />
<t:autocomplete id="g_20" flush="true" labeltext="Name" popupheight="100" popupwidth="400" value="#{d.DemoAutoComplete.name}" valuesurl="#{d.DemoAutoComplete.nameACURL}" width="250" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.AutoCompleteMgr;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.DefaultAutoCompleteProvider;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.HttpSessionAccess;
import org.eclnt.util.log.CLog;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageLifecycleListener;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoAutoComplete}")

public class DemoAutoComplete extends PageBean
{
    public class NameAutoCompleteProvider extends DefaultAutoCompleteProvider
    {
        public List<String> getProposals(String currentText)
        {
            CLog.L.log(CLog.LL_INF,"Auto Complete - getProposals called with " + currentText);
//            // simulate some waiting time...
//            try
//            {
//                Thread.currentThread().sleep(3000);
//            }
//            catch (Throwable t)
//            {
//            }
            List<String> result = new ArrayList<String>();
            if ("CaptainCasa".equalsIgnoreCase(currentText))
            {
                result.add("CaptainCasa");
                result.add("CaptainCasa Enterprise Client");
                result.add("CaptainCasa Corporate Community");
                result.add("CaptainCasa GmbH");
            }
            else if ("JSF".equalsIgnoreCase(currentText))
            {
                result.add("JSF - Java Server Faces");
                result.add("JSF - CaptainCasa Utilization");
                result.add("JSF - Server Side UI Standard");
                result.add("JSF - Some German Umlaute: ");
                result.add("JSF - This is a Euro: ");
            }
            else if ("Mller".equalsIgnoreCase(currentText))
            {
                result.add("Mller, Bjrn");
                result.add("Mller, Karl");
            }
            return result;
        }
    }
    
    protected NameAutoCompleteProvider m_nameAC;
    protected String m_name;
    
    public DemoAutoComplete(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("autocomplete"); 
        m_nameAC = new NameAutoCompleteProvider();
        AutoCompleteMgr.add(m_nameAC);
        // register clearing of "m_nameAC"
        getWorkpage().addLifecycleListener(new WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener() 
        {
            public void reactOnDestroyed()
            {
                super.reactOnDestroyed();
                AutoCompleteMgr.remove(m_nameAC);
            }
        });
    }

    public String getNameACURL() { return m_nameAC.getURL(); }

    public String getName() { return m_name; }
    public void setName(String value) 
    {
        CLog.L.log(CLog.LL_INF,"XXXXXXXXXX: Setting value: " + m_name);
        m_name = value; 
    }

}

Passing Text with Id

The AUTOCOMPLETE component is also able to manage text information that is associated with a certain id. In this case the component is to be used in the following way:

(.) By binding the VALUE-attribute you just as normal receive the text content of the component. By in addition binding the VALUEID-attribute you receive the id that is associated with the text.

(.) The AutoCompleteProvider on server side needs to extend class DefaultAutoCompleteProviderTextId - and pass both text and id information.

The behaviour of the components is:
When a proposed value is picked from the auto-complete-list then an id is passed back to the processing, because then the text is associated with a certain id. - If the user just inputs some text without picking a value from the list then only the text is passed (VALUE attribute), no id is passed (VALUEID attribute).

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoAutoCompleteIdText}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_4" font="size:10" text="Input &#34;ABC&#34; and the wait a short while." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Department" width="100" />
<t:autocomplete id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoAutoCompleteIdText.onValueFlush}" autocompletetimer="500" flush="true" value="#{d.DemoAutoCompleteIdText.value}" valueid="#{d.DemoAutoCompleteIdText.valueId}" valuesurl="#{d.DemoAutoCompleteIdText.valueURL}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="Text" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_11" font="weight:bold" text="#{d.DemoAutoCompleteIdText.value}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="Id" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_14" font="ABC Text " text="#{d.DemoAutoCompleteIdText.valueId}" width="50" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.AutoCompleteMgr;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.DefaultAutoComplete2Provider;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IAutoCompleteProvider2.AutoCompleteItem;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoAutoCompleteIdText}")

public class DemoAutoCompleteIdText
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
      // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    class MyAutoCompleteProvider extends DefaultAutoComplete2Provider
    {
        public List<AutoCompleteItem> getProposals(String value)
        {
            List<AutoCompleteItem> result = new ArrayList<AutoCompleteItem>();
            if ("ABC".equals(value))
            {
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("ABC Text 1","1"));
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("ABC Text 2","2"));
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("ABC Text 3","3"));
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("ABC Text 4","4"));
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("ABC Text 5","5"));
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("ABC Text 6","6"));
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("ABC Text 7","7"));
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("ABC Text 8","8"));
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("ABC Text 9","9-1"));
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("ABC Text 9","9-2"));
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("ABC Text 9","9-3"));
            }
            else if ("ABC Text 9".equals(value))
            {
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("ABC Text 9","9-1"));
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("ABC Text 9","9-2"));
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("ABC Text 9","9-3"));
            }
            else
            {
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("No information found",""));
            }
            return result;
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    MyAutoCompleteProvider m_acp;
    protected String m_value;
    protected String m_valueId;
    
  // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoAutoCompleteIdText(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("autocomplete"); 
        m_acp = new MyAutoCompleteProvider();
        AutoCompleteMgr.add(m_acp);
        getWorkpage().addLifecycleListener(new WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener() 
        {
            public void reactOnDestroyed()
            {
                super.reactOnDestroyed();
                AutoCompleteMgr.remove(m_acp);
            }
        });
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public String getValueURL() { return m_acp.getURL(); }

    public String getValue() 
    {
        if (m_value != null && m_value.startsWith("a"))
            return null;
        else
            return m_value; 
    }
    public void setValue(String value) { m_value = value; }

    public String getValueId() { return m_valueId; }
    public void setValueId(String value) { m_valueId = value; }

    public void onValueFlush(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("Passed value: " + m_value + " / Id: " + m_valueId);
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Double Line Items

This demo shows how to provide double line information within the item popup, presenting the auto-complete proposals to the user.

You need to...
(.) include the comment information on server side and
(.) set AUTOCOMPLETE-WITHVALUECOMMENT to "true"

In this example the AUTOCOMPLETE component is used by passing id-information also. You can also use the double line information without passing explicit ids, too.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoAutoCompleteComment}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_4" font="size:10" text="Input &#34;ABC&#34; and the wait a short while." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Department" width="100" />
<t:autocomplete id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoAutoCompleteComment.onValueFlush}" flush="true" value="#{d.DemoAutoCompleteComment.value}" valueid="#{d.DemoAutoCompleteComment.valueId}" valuesurl="#{d.DemoAutoCompleteComment.valueURL}" width="200" withvaluecomment="true" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="Text" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_11" font="weight:bold" text="#{d.DemoAutoCompleteComment.value}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="Id" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_14" font="ABC Text " text="#{d.DemoAutoCompleteComment.valueId}" width="50" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.AutoCompleteMgr;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.DefaultAutoComplete2Provider;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IAutoCompleteProvider2.AutoCompleteItem;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoAutoCompleteComment}")

public class DemoAutoCompleteComment
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
      // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    class MyAutoCompleteProvider extends DefaultAutoComplete2Provider
    {
        public List<AutoCompleteItem> getProposals(String value)
        {
            List<AutoCompleteItem> result = new ArrayList<AutoCompleteItem>();
            if ("ABC".equals(value))
            {
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("ABC Text 1","1","This is comment 1"));
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("ABC Text 2","2","This is comment 2"));
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("ABC Text 3","3","This is comment 3"));
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("ABC Text 4","4","This is comment 4"));
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("ABC Text 5","5","This is comment 5"));
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("ABC Text 6","6","This is comment 6"));
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("ABC Text 7","7","This is comment 7"));
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("ABC Text 8","8","This is comment 8"));
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("ABC Text 9","9","This is comment 9"));
            }
            else
            {
                result.add(new AutoCompleteItem("No information found","",""));
            }
            return result;
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    MyAutoCompleteProvider m_acp;
    protected String m_value;
    protected String m_valueId;
    
  // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoAutoCompleteComment(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("autocomplete"); 
        m_acp = new MyAutoCompleteProvider();
        AutoCompleteMgr.add(m_acp);
        getWorkpage().addLifecycleListener(new WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener() 
        {
            public void reactOnDestroyed()
            {
                super.reactOnDestroyed();
                AutoCompleteMgr.remove(m_acp);
            }
        });
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public String getValueURL() { return m_acp.getURL(); }

    public String getValue() { return m_value; }
    public void setValue(String value) { m_value = value; }

    public String getValueId() { return m_valueId; }
    public void setValueId(String value) { m_valueId = value; }

    public void onValueFlush(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("Passed value: " + m_value + " / Id: " + m_valueId);
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Formatted Field
Formatting by data type

By using the component FORMATTEDFIELD you can assign a data type that is checked as part of the client processing. The following data types are currently supported by passing the information via the attribute FORMAT:

int
long
float
double
date
time
datetime
bigdecimal

By using the attribute FORMATMASK you can pass certain additional type information in order to influence the rendering of values. In the case of using format date / time / datetime you can e.g. pass information if you want to output date values in short / medium / long format.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoFormattedfield}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Integer Value" width="120" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_4" flush="true" format="int" value="#{d.demoFormattedfield.intValue}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" text="Float Value" width="120" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_8" format="float" value="#{d.demoFormattedfield.floatValue}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_9" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="Big Decimal (3 always)" width="150" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_12" flush="true" format="bigdecimal" formatmask="dec3" value="#{d.demoFormattedfield.bidDecimalValue}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:label id="g_14" text="Big Decimal (3 as max.)" width="150" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_15" flush="true" format="bigdecimal" formatmask="decmax3" value="#{d.demoFormattedfield.bidDecimalValue}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_16" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:label id="g_18" text="Default date/time format: &#34;medium&#34;" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_19" />
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:label id="g_21" text="Date Value" width="120" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_22" format="date" value="#{d.demoFormattedfield.dateValue}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_23" >
<t:label id="g_24" text="Time Value" width="120" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_25" format="time" value="#{d.demoFormattedfield.timeValue}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_26" >
<t:label id="g_27" text="Date and Time Value" width="120" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_28" format="datetime" timezone="CET" value="#{d.demoFormattedfield.timeValue}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_29" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_30" >
<t:label id="g_31" text="Date/time format: &#34;short&#34;" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_32" />
<t:row id="g_33" >
<t:label id="g_34" text="Date Value" width="120" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_35" format="date" formatmask="short" value="#{d.demoFormattedfield.dateValue}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_36" >
<t:label id="g_37" text="Time Value" width="120" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_38" format="time" formatmask="short" value="#{d.demoFormattedfield.timeValue}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_39" >
<t:label id="g_40" text="Date and Time Value" width="120" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_41" format="datetime" formatmask="short" timezone="CET" value="#{d.demoFormattedfield.timeValue}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_42" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_43" >
<t:label id="g_44" text="Date/time format: &#34;long&#34;" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_45" />
<t:row id="g_46" >
<t:label id="g_47" text="Date Value" width="120" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_48" format="date" formatmask="long" value="#{d.demoFormattedfield.dateValue}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_49" >
<t:label id="g_50" text="Time Value" width="120" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_51" format="time" formatmask="long" value="#{d.demoFormattedfield.timeValue}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_52" >
<t:label id="g_53" text="Date and Time Value" width="120" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_54" format="datetime" formatmask="long" timezone="CET" value="#{d.demoFormattedfield.timeValue}" width="150" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.math.BigDecimal;
import java.util.Date;

import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoFormattedfield extends PageBean
{
    int m_intValue = 100;
    float m_floatValue = 99.99f;
    BigDecimal m_bidDecimalValue = new BigDecimal("99.99");
    Date m_dateValue = new Date();
    Date m_timeValue = new Date();
    
    public DemoFormattedfield(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("formattedfield"); 
    }
    
    public int getIntValue()
    {
        return m_intValue;
    }
    public void setIntValue(int intValue)
    {
        m_intValue = intValue;
    }
    public float getFloatValue()
    {
        return m_floatValue;
    }
    public void setFloatValue(float floatValue)
    {
        m_floatValue = floatValue;
    }
    public BigDecimal getBidDecimalValue()
    {
        return m_bidDecimalValue;
    }
    public void setBidDecimalValue(BigDecimal bidDecimalValue)
    {
        m_bidDecimalValue = bidDecimalValue;
    }
    public Date getDateValue()
    {
        return m_dateValue;
    }
    public void setDateValue(Date dateValue)
    {
        m_dateValue = dateValue;
    }
    public Date getTimeValue()
    {
        return m_timeValue;
    }
    public void setTimeValue(Date timeValue)
    {
        m_timeValue = timeValue;
    }
    
}

Adjust values during input

While performing the input of figures, the first field will automatically arrange the separators according to the FORMAT and the FORMATMASK definition. In addtion the user is not able to define more decimal digits than defined by the FORMATMASK definition.

The second field will format the user's input after leaving the field. (Default behavior.)

Use attribute FORMATTEDFIELD-WITHUPDATEDURINGINPUT to switch on the automatic arrangement of separators.

Please pay attention: this attribute currently is only supported with number formats. Which area: FORMATTEDFIELD-FORMAT "bigdecimal", "double", "float", "biginteger", "long", "int", "short".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoFormattedFieldAdjust}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFormattedFieldAdjust}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:label id="g_4" stylevariant="ccbig" text="bigdecimal / float / double" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_6" flush="true" format="bigdecimal" formatmask="dec2" labeltext="Formatting during input" value="#{d.DemoFormattedFieldAdjust.someValue}" width="200" withupdateduringinput="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_8" flush="true" format="bigdecimal" formatmask="dec2" labeltext="Formatting when leaving field" value="#{d.DemoFormattedFieldAdjust.someValue2}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_9" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" stylevariant="ccbig" text="int / long / biginteger / short" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_13" flush="true" format="int" labeltext="Formatting during input" value="#{d.DemoFormattedFieldAdjust.someValue3}" width="200" withupdateduringinput="true" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

    package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.math.BigDecimal;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.PageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFormattedFieldAdjust}")

public class DemoFormattedFieldAdjust
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    int m_someValue3;
    public int getSomeValue3() { return m_someValue3; }
    public void setSomeValue3(int value) { this.m_someValue3 = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    BigDecimal m_someValue = new BigDecimal(0);
    BigDecimal m_someValue2 = new BigDecimal(0);
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoFormattedFieldAdjust(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
    
    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoformattedfieldadjust.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoFormattedFieldAdjust}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public BigDecimal getSomeValue2() { return m_someValue2; }
    public void setSomeValue2(BigDecimal value) { this.m_someValue2 = value; }

    public BigDecimal getSomeValue() { return m_someValue; }
    public void setSomeValue(BigDecimal value) { this.m_someValue = value; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

High precision number input

By default there is a FORMATMASK attribute which is used both for input and for displaying the value.

But you can separate by defining a value in attribute FORMATMASKDURINGINPUT. In this case the format mask is switched automatically when the component is focused - and switches back automatically when the focus is lost.

The definition of FORMATMASKDURINGINPUT only makes sense for FORMAT "float", "double", "bigdecimal". And it only makes sense a format mask in FORMATMASKDURINGINPUT which is more detailed than the one defined in FORMATMASK.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoFloatFormatUpdate}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_11" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFloatFormatUpdate}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:label id="g_21" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Client side number value input" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_7" flush="true" format="bigdecimal" formatmask="dec2" formatmaskduringinput="dec8" labeltext="Some value" value="#{d.DemoFloatFormatUpdate.value}" width="250" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:textpane id="g_5" text="During input the precision of the value is opened to &#34;dec8&#34;(8 decimal digits) - and is switched back to &#34;dec2&#34; for display. As result the &#34;dec8&#34;-precision of the input is kept." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_3" height="40" />
<t:row id="g_23" >
<t:label id="g_24" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Server side value" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" coldistance="#{d.DemoFloatFormatUpdate.valueFormatMask}" >
<t:label id="g_18" format="bigdecimal" formatmask="dec8" text="#{d.DemoFloatFormatUpdate.value}" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.math.BigDecimal;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.BaseActionEvent;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFloatFormatUpdate}")

public class DemoFloatFormatUpdate
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    BigDecimal m_value = new BigDecimal("100.999999");

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoFloatFormatUpdate(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demofloatformatupdate.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoFloatFormatUpdate}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public BigDecimal getValue() { return m_value; }
    public void setValue(BigDecimal value) { this.m_value = value; }
}

Date Input
Date Input

There are three components that are available for providing date input:

(a) The CALENDAR component directly shows a calendar control within the page. The currently selected date is marked in the calendar.

(b) With the FORMATTEDFIELD component you can define the attribute FORMAT to be "date".

(c) The CALENDARFIELD component in addtion to (b) provides the function to open up a calendar popup for date input.

For all three components the display stlye of the date is dependent from the Locale that is associated with the client. You can set the locale via a start parameter of the client.

When maintaining a date, then the "long"-format of a date is sent from the client to ther server and back. This corresponds to the internal long value of the java.util.Date class. For this reason you always need to define the TIMEZONE attribute when working with dates. The TIMEZONE is definded by the server. Do not pass "null" to the client as time zone, because then it may happen that the client's time zone does not match the server's time zone!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoCalendar}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Date as Calendar" width="150" />
<t:calendar id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.demoCalendar.onDateAction}" exacttime="true" flush="true" timezone="CET" value="#{d.demoCalendar.date}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Date as Field" width="150" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.demoCalendar.onDateAction}" exacttime="true" flush="true" format="date" labeltext="Date" timezone="CET" value="#{d.demoCalendar.date}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Date as Calendar Field" width="150" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_10" exacttime="true" flush="true" labeltext="Date" timezone="CET" value="#{d.demoCalendar.date}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="Time as Calendar Field" width="150" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_13" exacttime="true" flush="true" format="datetime" formatmask="short" labeltext="Date &amp; time" timezone="CET" value="#{d.demoCalendar.date}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" text="Time as Calendar Field" width="150" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_16" exacttime="true" flush="true" format="datetime" formatmask="medium" labeltext="Date &amp; time" timezone="CET" value="#{d.demoCalendar.date}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:label id="g_18" text="Time as Calendar Field" width="150" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_19" exacttime="true" flush="true" format="time" formatmask="medium" labeltext="Time" timezone="CET" value="#{d.demoCalendar.date}" width="80" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:label id="g_22" text="Time as Calendar Field" width="150" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_27" flush="true" format="datetime" formatmask="yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss:SSS" labeltext="Date &amp; time with milliseconds" timezone="CET" value="#{d.demoCalendar.date}" width="200" />
<t:coldistance id="g_29" width="7" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_25" flush="true" format="time" formatmask="HH:mm:ss:SSS" labeltext="Time with milliseconds" timezone="CET" value="#{d.demoCalendar.date}" width="170" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.text.DateFormat;
import java.util.Calendar;
import java.util.Date;
import java.util.TimeZone;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventFlush;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ClientTestLog;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IClientLogAware;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoCalendar 
    extends PageBean
    implements IClientLogAware
{
    Date m_date;

    public DemoCalendar(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("calendarfield"); 
    }
    
    public Date getDate() { return m_date; }
    public void setDate(Date date) { m_date = date; }
    
    public void onDateAction(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        if (ae instanceof BaseActionEventFlush)
        {
            if (m_date != null)
            {
                Calendar cal = Calendar.getInstance(TimeZone.getTimeZone("CET"));
                DateFormat sdf = DateFormat.getDateTimeInstance();
                sdf.setCalendar(cal);
                Statusbar.outputSuccess("New date was selected: " + sdf.format(m_date) + " ("+m_date.getTime()+")");
            }
            else
                Statusbar.outputSuccess("Date was set to null");
        }
    }
    
    public boolean onCreateClientTestLogMessage()
    {
        if (m_date != null)
        {
            ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage("" + m_date.getTime());
        }
        else
        {
            ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage("null");
        }
        return false;
    }
}

Date formatting (1)

When using "date" as format you either can select various variants for formatting the date:

(.) as with all other time-related formats you can use "short", "medium", "long" - these rules are interpreted within the Java date formatting rules corresponding to standards defined by the current Locale.
(.) you can use any "free style" formatting rules corresponding to what is possible with "SimpleDateFormat". Details are available via http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html

When using "free style" formatting rules, then internationalization issues are on your side. I.e. you typically do not assign these rules directly but through a resource file - so that the formatting depends from language and/or country of the user.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoCalendarFormat}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" font="size:14" text="Date format (in CALENDAR)" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:calendarfield id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoCalendarFormat.onDateAction}" flush="true" formatmask="short" labeltext="Short" timezone="UTC" value="#{d.DemoCalendarFormat.date}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:calendarfield id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoCalendarFormat.onDateAction}" flush="true" formatmask="medium" labeltext="Medium" timezone="UTC" value="#{d.DemoCalendarFormat.date}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:calendarfield id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoCalendarFormat.onDateAction}" flush="true" formatmask="long" labeltext="Long" timezone="UTC" value="#{d.DemoCalendarFormat.date}" width="120" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:calendarfield id="g_15" actionListener="#{d.DemoCalendarFormat.onDateAction}" exacttime="true" flush="true" formatmask="yy-MM-dd H:mm" labeltext="yy-MM-dd H:mm" timezone="UTC" value="#{d.DemoCalendarFormat.date}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:calendarfield id="g_18" actionListener="#{d.DemoCalendarFormat.onDateAction}" flush="true" formatmask="yyyy:d_M" labeltext="yyyy:d_M" timezone="UTC" value="#{d.DemoCalendarFormat.date}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_19" height="100" />
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:label id="g_21" font="size:14" text="Date &amp; Time (in FORMATTEDFIELD)" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_24" actionListener="#{d.DemoCalendarFormat.onDateAction}" flush="true" format="datetime" formatmask="short" labeltext="Short" timezone="UTC" value="#{d.DemoCalendarFormat.date}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_25" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_27" actionListener="#{d.DemoCalendarFormat.onDateAction}" flush="true" format="datetime" formatmask="medium" labeltext="Medium" timezone="UTC" value="#{d.DemoCalendarFormat.date}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_30" actionListener="#{d.DemoCalendarFormat.onDateAction}" exacttime="true" flush="true" format="datetime" formatmask="dd.MM.yyyy HH:mm:ss/SSS" labeltext="dd.MM.yyyy HH:mm:ss/SSS" timezone="UTC" value="#{d.DemoCalendarFormat.date}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Date;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ClientTestLog;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IClientLogAware;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoCalendarFormat}")

public class DemoCalendarFormat
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable, IClientLogAware
{
    public DemoCalendarFormat(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("calendarfield"); 
    }
    
    protected Date m_date = new Date();
    public Date getDate() { return m_date; }
    public void setDate(Date value) { m_date = value; }
    
    public void onDateAction(ActionEvent event)
    {
        ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogComment("Date was changed");
    }
    
    public boolean onCreateClientTestLogMessage()
    {
        ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage("Date: " + m_date.getTime());
        return false;
    }
    
}

Date formatting (2)

When defining the FORMATMASK for date and time values (FORMAT date/ time/ datetime) then you...

...either can select the pre-configured format masks "short", "medium" and "long" (well, actually "long" is the same as "medium"...). These pre-configured format masks ensure that the sequence of year/ month/ date and the delimiters between follow the defaults of the client's country definition.

...or you can configure the format on your own by defining a pattern in which special characters indicate the placing of the date/time-values. In the pattern the following characters can be used:

yyyy - year (4 digits)
yy - year (2 digits)
M or MM - month
d or dd - day of month
E or EE or EEE or EEEE - abbreviated name of week day
H or HH - the hour of the day (0-23)
h or hh - the hour of the day (0-12)
a or aa - am/pm indicator

For all special characters you may either choose the one-character or t he twp-characters representation ("d" or "dd") - the result will always be the same, values will be shown as two digits always (e.g. "01", not "1").

You may see some analogies when comparing the format to the Java-SimpleDateFormat - but keep in mind: the conversion is taking place on client side (i.e. in the JavaScript part), so not all features of the Java SimpleDateFormat are available!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:label id="g_20" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Date" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:calendarfield id="g_2" flush="true" format="date" formatmask="short" labeltext="short" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_60" format="date" formatmask="short" labeltext="short" text="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" timezone="LOCAL" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:calendarfield id="g_9" flush="true" format="date" formatmask="medium" labeltext="medium" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_61" format="date" formatmask="medium" labeltext="medium" text="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" timezone="LOCAL" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:calendarfield id="g_12" flush="true" format="date" formatmask="long" labeltext="long" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_62" format="date" formatmask="long" labeltext="long" text="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" timezone="LOCAL" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_63" >
<t:calendarfield id="g_15" flush="true" format="date" formatmask="yyyy-MM-dd" labeltext="yyyy-MM-dd" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_64" format="date" formatmask="yyyy-MM-dd" labeltext="yyyy-MM-dd" text="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" timezone="LOCAL" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:calendarfield id="g_18" flush="true" format="date" formatmask="E yyyy-MM-dd" labeltext="E yyyy-MM-dd" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_65" format="date" formatmask="E yyyy-MM-dd" labeltext="E yyyy-MM-dd" text="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" timezone="LOCAL" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:label id="g_23" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Date time" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_25" >
<t:calendarfield id="g_26" flush="true" format="datetime" formatmask="short" labeltext="short" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_58" format="datetime" formatmask="short" labeltext="short" text="Label" timezone="LOCAL" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:calendarfield id="g_29" flush="true" format="datetime" formatmask="medium" labeltext="medium" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_56" format="datetime" formatmask="medium" labeltext="medium" text="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" timezone="LOCAL" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_31" >
<t:calendarfield id="g_32" flush="true" format="datetime" formatmask="long" labeltext="long" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_54" format="datetime" formatmask="long" labeltext="long" text="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" timezone="LOCAL" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_34" >
<t:calendarfield id="g_35" flush="true" format="datetime" formatmask="yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss" labeltext="yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_52" format="datetime" formatmask="yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss" labeltext="yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss" text="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" timezone="LOCAL" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_37" >
<t:calendarfield id="g_38" flush="true" format="datetime" formatmask="yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss a" labeltext="yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss a" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_50" format="datetime" formatmask="yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss a" labeltext="yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss a" text="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" timezone="LOCAL" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_40" >
<t:calendarfield id="g_41" flush="true" format="datetime" formatmask="E yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss a" labeltext="E yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss a" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_48" format="datetime" formatmask="E yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss a" labeltext="E yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss a" text="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" timezone="LOCAL" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_43" >
<t:calendarfield id="g_44" flush="true" format="datetime" formatmask="E yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss a z" labeltext="E yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss a z" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_46" format="datetime" formatmask="E yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss a z" labeltext="E yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss a z" text="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" timezone="LOCAL" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_67" >
<t:coldistance id="g_68" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_69" format="datetime" formatmask="E yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss a z Z" labeltext="E yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss a z Z" text="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" timezone="LOCAL" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_71" >
<t:label id="g_72" align="center" text="in CET" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_73" format="datetime" formatmask="E yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss a z Z" labeltext="E yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss a z Z" text="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat.someTime}" timezone="CET" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.time.LocalDateTime;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat}")

public class DemoSimpleDateFormat
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    LocalDateTime m_someTime = LocalDateTime.now();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoSimpleDateFormat(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demosimpledateformat.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoSimpleDateFormat}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public LocalDateTime getSomeTime() { return m_someTime; }
    public void setSomeTime(LocalDateTime value) { this.m_someTime = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Local Date/Time

As counter part of any date component you may use

(1.) a java.util.Date value
(2.) a Long/long value (same as java.util.Date, but representing the milliseconds time

or

(3.) a LocalDate or LocalTime value

LocalDate and LocalTime were introduced with Java 1.8 and are a representation of a date/time without reference to a time zone.

Define time zone "LOCAL" if using LocalDate/LocalTime!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoLocalDate}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" coldistance="5" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="LocalDate" width="100" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_4" flush="true" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoLocalDate.datum}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" coldistance="5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="LocalTime" width="100" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_7" flush="true" format="time" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoLocalDate.time}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" coldistance="5" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="LocalDateTime" width="100" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_10" flush="true" format="datetime" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoLocalDate.dateTime}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_11" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_12" coldistance="5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_13" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoLocalDate.onShowContentAction}" text="Show content" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" coldistance="5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_16" width="100" />
<t:textarea id="g_17" height="200" text="#{d.DemoLocalDate.protocol}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.time.LocalDate;
import java.time.LocalDateTime;
import java.time.LocalTime;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoLocalDate}")

public class DemoLocalDate
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    LocalDate m_datum = LocalDate.now();
    LocalTime m_time = LocalTime.now();
    LocalDateTime m_dateTime = LocalDateTime.now();
    String m_protocol;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoLocalDate(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demolocaldate.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoLocalDate}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void setTime(LocalTime time) { m_time = time; }
    public LocalTime getTime() { return m_time; }

    public LocalDate getDatum() { return m_datum; }
    public void setDatum(LocalDate datum) { m_datum = datum; }

    public LocalDateTime getDateTime() { return m_dateTime; }
    public void setDateTime(LocalDateTime value) { m_dateTime = value; }
    
    public String getProtocol() { return m_protocol; }
    public void setProtocol(String value) { this.m_protocol = value; }

    public void onShowContentAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
        sb.append("LocalDate: " + m_datum.toString());
        sb.append("\nLocalTime: " + m_time.toString());
        sb.append("\nLocalDateTime: " + m_dateTime.toString());
        m_protocol = sb.toString();
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Exact Time of Day

When entering a date/time - either via keyboard or via calendar dialog - then you can define, that the time is exactly set to a certain point of time of the corresponding day.

When setting the attribute EXACTTIME to "true" then the date, selected by the user, is interpreted as "00:00:00 (hh:mm:ss)" of the day.

By in addition defining EXACTTIMEHHMMSSMMM you can define the exact point of time to be used, e.h. "120000000" is defined for the noon of the day.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoCalendarFieldExactTime}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Exact Time (default)" width="150" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoCalendarFieldExactTime.onOutResult}" exacttime="true" flush="true" timezone="UTC" value="#{d.DemoCalendarFieldExactTime.date1}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Exact Time - Noon" width="150" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoCalendarFieldExactTime.onOutResult}" exacttime="true" exacttimehhmmssmmm="120000000" flush="true" timezone="UTC" value="#{d.DemoCalendarFieldExactTime.date2}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Exact Time - Last milli of day" width="150" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoCalendarFieldExactTime.onOutResult}" exacttime="true" exacttimehhmmssmmm="235959999" flush="true" timezone="UTC" value="#{d.DemoCalendarFieldExactTime.date3}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:coldistance id="g_12" width="150" />
<t:textarea id="g_13" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoCalendarFieldExactTime.outResult}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Calendar;
import java.util.Date;
import java.util.TimeZone;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoCalendarFieldExactTime}")

public class DemoCalendarFieldExactTime
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    String m_outResult;
    public String getOutResult() { return m_outResult; }
    public void setOutResult(String value) { this.m_outResult = value; }

    Date m_date3;
    public Date getDate3() { return m_date3; }
    public void setDate3(Date value) { this.m_date3 = value; }

    Date m_date2;
    public Date getDate2() { return m_date2; }
    public void setDate2(Date value) { this.m_date2 = value; }

    Date m_date1;
    public Date getDate1() { return m_date1; }
    public void setDate1(Date value) { this.m_date1 = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoCalendarFieldExactTime(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        initRefComponent("calendarfield"); 
    }

    public void onOutResult(ActionEvent event)
    {
        StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
        append(sb,"Date1: ",m_date1);
        append(sb,"Date2: ",m_date2);
        append(sb,"Date3: ",m_date3);
        m_outResult = sb.toString();
    }
    
    private void append(StringBuffer sb, String prefix, Date d)
    {
        try
        {
            sb.append(prefix);
            if (d == null)
            {
                sb.append("(null)\n");
                return;
            }
            Calendar cal = Calendar.getInstance(TimeZone.getTimeZone("UTC"));
            cal.setTime(d);
            sb.append(cal.get(Calendar.YEAR)); sb.append("/");
            sb.append(cal.get(Calendar.MONTH)+1); sb.append("/");
            sb.append(cal.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH)); sb.append(" ");
            sb.append(cal.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY)); sb.append(":");
            sb.append(cal.get(Calendar.MINUTE)); sb.append(":");
            sb.append(cal.get(Calendar.SECOND)); sb.append(":");
            sb.append(cal.get(Calendar.MILLISECOND)); 
            sb.append("\n");
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            sb.append(t.toString() + "\n");
        }
    }
    
}

Add info - direct way
