Both CALENDARFIELD and CALENDAR component provide an attribute EXTCALENDARINFOS by which you can pass information on certain days.

The information includes:

. a comment (tooltip)
. a background color
. a definition if the day is select-able
. a definition if a warning is shown to the user when selecting a date

As consequence you make the calendar more colorful - and add your information!

Please note: when using EXTCALENDARINFOS then all the day configuration is loaded to the client in one step. Do not use this attribute when e.g. setting up a general calendar definition - which might span years of information. Here we provide the possibility of defining a so called "extended calendar id" (EXTCALENDARID). The information about days will then be picked month by month, following the navigation of the user.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoExtCalendarInfos}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Next 7 days marked" width="150" />
<t:calendar id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoExtCalendarInfos.onDateValueAction}" extcalendarinfos="#{d.DemoExtCalendarInfos.extCalendarInfosNext7}" flush="true" value="#{d.DemoExtCalendarInfos.dateValue}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_6" width="150" />
<t:textarea id="g_7" enabled="false" height="150" linewrap="false" text="#{d.DemoExtCalendarInfos.extCalendarInfosNext7}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="From - to highlighting" width="150" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoExtCalendarInfos.onDateFromAction}" extcalendarinfos="#{d.DemoExtCalendarInfos.extCalendarInfosFromTo}" flush="true" value="#{d.DemoExtCalendarInfos.dateFrom}" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_12" />
<t:label id="g_13" text="to" />
<t:coldistance id="g_14" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_15" actionListener="#{d.DemoExtCalendarInfos.onDateToAction}" extcalendarinfos="#{d.DemoExtCalendarInfos.extCalendarInfosFromTo}" flush="true" value="#{d.DemoExtCalendarInfos.dateTo}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:coldistance id="g_17" width="150" />
<t:textarea id="g_18" enabled="false" height="150" linewrap="false" text="#{d.DemoExtCalendarInfos.extCalendarInfosFromTo}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Calendar;
import java.util.Date;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.calendar.ExtCalendarInfos;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.calendar.IExtCalendarMgr.ExtCalendarInfo;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventFlush;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.CALENDARComponent;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoExtCalendarInfos}")

public class DemoExtCalendarInfos
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    Date m_dateValue = new Date();
    String m_extCalendarInfosNext7;
    
    Date m_dateTo;
    Date m_dateFrom;
    String m_extCalendarInfosFromTo;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoExtCalendarInfos(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        buildNext7();
        buildFromTo();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoextcalendarinfos.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoExtCalendarInfos}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getExtCalendarInfosNext7() { return m_extCalendarInfosNext7; }

    public Date getDateValue() { return m_dateValue; }
    public void setDateValue(Date value) { this.m_dateValue = value; }
    public void onDateValueAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventFlush)
        {
            buildNext7();
        }
    }

    public Date getDateTo() { return m_dateTo; }
    public void setDateTo(Date value) { this.m_dateTo = value; }

    public Date getDateFrom() { return m_dateFrom; }
    public void setDateFrom(Date value) { this.m_dateFrom = value; }

    public String getExtCalendarInfosFromTo() { return m_extCalendarInfosFromTo; }

    public void onDateToAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventFlush)
        {
            if (m_dateTo != null)
            {
                if (m_dateFrom == null || m_dateFrom.getTime() > m_dateTo.getTime())
                {
                    m_dateFrom = m_dateTo;
                }
            }
        }
        buildFromTo();
    }

    public void onDateFromAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventFlush)
        {
            if (m_dateFrom != null)
            {
                if (m_dateTo == null || m_dateTo.getTime() < m_dateFrom.getTime())
                {
                    m_dateTo = m_dateFrom;
                }
            }
        }
        buildFromTo();
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void buildFromTo()
    {
        m_extCalendarInfosFromTo = null;
        if (m_dateFrom == null) return;
        if (m_dateTo == null) return;
        ExtCalendarInfos ecis = new ExtCalendarInfos();
        Calendar cal = Calendar.getInstance();
        cal.setTime(m_dateFrom);
        cal.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY,0);
        cal.set(Calendar.MINUTE,0);
        cal.set(Calendar.SECOND,0);
        cal.set(Calendar.MILLISECOND,0);
        while (true)
        {
            long l = cal.getTimeInMillis();
            if (l <= m_dateTo.getTime())
            {
                Date iDate = new Date(l);
                ExtCalendarInfo eci = new ExtCalendarInfo(iDate);
                if (l == m_dateFrom.getTime() || l == m_dateTo.getTime())
                    eci.setBackground("#00800060");
                else
                    eci.setBackground("#00800030");
                eci.setComment("From - to");
                ecis.addExtCalendarInfo(eci);
                cal.add(Calendar.DAY_OF_YEAR,1);
            }
            else
            {
                break;
            }
        }
        m_extCalendarInfosFromTo = ecis.toXML();
    }
    
    private void buildNext7()
    {
        Date now = m_dateValue;
        m_extCalendarInfosNext7 = null;
        String[] backgrounds = new String[] 
        {
            "#FF000070","#FF000060","#FF000050","#FF000040","#FF000030","#FF000020","#FF000010"
        };
        if (now == null) return;
        Calendar cal = Calendar.getInstance();
        cal.setTime(now);
        cal.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY,0);
        cal.set(Calendar.MINUTE,0);
        cal.set(Calendar.SECOND,0);
        cal.set(Calendar.MILLISECOND,0);
        ExtCalendarInfos ecis = new ExtCalendarInfos();
        for (int i=0; i<7; i++)
        {
            Date iDate = new Date(cal.getTimeInMillis());
            ExtCalendarInfo eci = new ExtCalendarInfo(iDate);
            eci.setBackground(backgrounds[i]);
            eci.setComment("Next 7");
            ecis.addExtCalendarInfo(eci);
            cal.add(Calendar.DAY_OF_YEAR,1);
        }
        m_extCalendarInfosNext7 = ecis.toXML();
    }
}

Add info - factory calendar

The CALENDARFIELD provides the attribute EXTCALENDARID. By defining this attribute you automatically link the date input to a server side definition of a calendar.

The definition of the server side calendar includes the following information per day:

1. comment - the comment is shown as tooltip
2. selectable - if selectable is set to false then the day cannot be selected
3. background - a backgroundcolor
4. warningonselection - the user can select the field but a warning showing the comment will be shown after selection

The server side interface is "IExtCalendarMgr", there is a default implementation available - which is typically overridden by your own implementation.
The CALENDARFIELD component communicates to the server side when the user selects a certain date, or when the user navigates through the calendar.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoExtCalendar}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Select a calendar" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Ext. Calendar" width="100" />
<t:combobox id="g_6" flush="true" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoExtCalendar.calendarIdVVS}" value="#{d.DemoExtCalendar.calendarId}" width="200" withnullitem="true" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_7" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" stylevariant="ccbig" text="View the calendars..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="Calendar field" width="100" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_12" exacttime="true" flush="true" timezone="UTC" value="#{d.DemoExtCalendar.testDay}" width="100" extcalendarid="#{d.DemoExtCalendar.calendarId}" extcalendarmode="1" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:label id="g_14" text="Calendar" width="100" />
<t:calendar id="g_15" exacttime="true" flush="true" timezone="UTC" value="#{d.DemoExtCalendar.testDay}" extcalendarid="#{d.DemoExtCalendar.calendarId}" extcalendarmode="1" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_16" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:label id="g_18" stylevariant="ccbig" text="View calendar &#34;raw info&#34;" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:coldistance id="g_20" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_21" actionListener="#{d.DemoExtCalendar.onTest}" text="View" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:coldistance id="g_23" width="100" />
<t:textarea id="g_24" height="100%;100" text="#{d.DemoExtCalendar.testMonthInfo}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Date;
import java.util.List;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.calendar.ExtCalendarMgr;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.calendar.IExtCalendarMgr;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoExtCalendar}")

public class DemoExtCalendar
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    protected ValidValuesBinding m_calendarIdVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();
    public ValidValuesBinding getCalendarIdVVS() { return m_calendarIdVVS; }
    public void setCalendarIdVVS(ValidValuesBinding value) { m_calendarIdVVS = value; }

    protected String m_calendarId;
    public String getCalendarId() { return m_calendarId; }
    public void setCalendarId(String value) { m_calendarId = value; }

    protected String m_testMonthInfo;
    public String getTestMonthInfo() { return m_testMonthInfo; }
    public void setTestMonthInfo(String value) { m_testMonthInfo = value; }

    protected Date m_testDay = new Date();
    public Date getTestDay() { return m_testDay; }
    public void setTestDay(Date value) { m_testDay = value; }

 
    public DemoExtCalendar(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        List<String> ids = ExtCalendarMgr.getInstance().getAvailableCalendarIds();
        for (String id: ids)
            m_calendarIdVVS.addValidValue(id,id);
    }
    
    public void onTest(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (m_calendarId == null)
        {
            Statusbar.outputError("No calendar id defined.");
            return;
        }
        IExtCalendarMgr ecm = ExtCalendarMgr.getInstance();
        IExtCalendarMgr.ExtCalendarInfo ri = ecm.getCalendarInfoForDay(m_calendarId,m_testDay,"UTC");
        if (ri == null)
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("This is a normal working day.");
        else
            Statusbar.outputAlert("This is NOT a working day: " + ri.getComment());
        m_testMonthInfo = "Month Info:\n";
        List<IExtCalendarMgr.ExtCalendarInfo> ecis = ecm.getCalendarInfoForMonth(m_calendarId,m_testDay,"UTC");
        for (IExtCalendarMgr.ExtCalendarInfo eci: ecis)
        {
            m_testMonthInfo += "" + eci.getDate().toString() + " // " + eci.getComment() + "\n";
        }
    }

}

Date/Time Touch Input (PBC)

This demo shows the usage of page beans components CCTouchDate and CCTouchTime.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoDateTimeSelection}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Date" width="100" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_4" enabled="false" value="#{d.DemoDateTimeSelection.date}" width="120" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Time" width="100" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_7" enabled="false" format="time" value="#{d.DemoDateTimeSelection.time}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_8" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="Date" width="100" />
<t:pagebeancomponent id="g_11" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoDateTimeSelection.dateSelection}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="Time" width="100" />
<t:pagebeancomponent id="g_14" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoDateTimeSelection.timeSelection}" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Date;

import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCTouchDate;
import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCTouchTime;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.PageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoDateTimeSelection}")

public class DemoDateTimeSelection
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    CCTouchTime m_timeSelection = new CCTouchTime();
    public CCTouchTime getTimeSelection() { return m_timeSelection; }

    CCTouchDate m_dateSelection = new CCTouchDate();
    public CCTouchDate getDateSelection() { return m_dateSelection; }

    Date m_time = new Date();
    public Date getTime() { return m_time; }
    public void setTime(Date value) { this.m_time = value; }

    Date m_date = new Date();
    public Date getDate() { return m_date; }
    public void setDate(Date value) { this.m_date = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    /* Listener to the user of the page bean. */
    public interface IListener
    {
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private IListener m_listener;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoDateTimeSelection(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        m_timeSelection.prepare(new CCTouchTime.IListener()
        {
            public void reactOnUpdate()
            {
                m_time = m_timeSelection.updateDate(m_time,null);
            }
        },true);
        m_dateSelection.prepare(new CCTouchDate.IListener()
        {
            public void reactOnUpdate()
            {
                m_date = m_dateSelection.updateDate(m_date,null);
            }
        });
        m_timeSelection.setTime(m_time,null);
        m_dateSelection.setDate(m_date,null);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/testdatetimeselection.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.TestDateTimeSelection}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /* Initialization of the bean. Add any parameter that is required within your scenario. */
    public void prepare(IListener listener)
    {
        m_listener = listener;
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

From - to validity check

With the CALENDARFIELD component you can define a FROMDATE and TODATE attribute - restricting the date input to a certain time range.

Please note: it's extremely important to pay attention to the milliseconds of a date representation - because that's the actual level the comparison is executed on.
In case of using java.util.Date you may set the milliseconds to 0 (or some other defined value) by using the Calendar-object, as shown in the example.
In case of using java.time.LocalDateTime you may set the milliseconds to 0 by using method ".withNano(0)".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoCalendarFromTo}" rowdistance="4" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="40" />
<t:label id="g_4" text="...from" width="60" />
<t:label id="g_5" format="datetime" text="#{d.DemoCalendarFromTo.fromDate}" timezone="#{d.DemoCalendarFromTo.timezone}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:coldistance id="g_7" width="40" />
<t:label id="g_8" text="...to" width="60" />
<t:label id="g_9" format="datetime" text="#{d.DemoCalendarFromTo.toDate}" timezone="#{d.DemoCalendarFromTo.timezone}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="Date from/to" width="100" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_13" fromdate="#{d.DemoCalendarFromTo.fromDate}" timezone="#{d.DemoCalendarFromTo.timezone}" todate="#{d.DemoCalendarFromTo.toDate}" value="#{d.DemoCalendarFromTo.date}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_14" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:coldistance id="g_16" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_17" text="#{d.DemoCalendarFromTo.timezone}" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.util.Calendar;
import java.util.Date;
import java.util.TimeZone;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoCalendarFromTo}")

public class DemoCalendarFromTo extends PageBean
{
    public DemoCalendarFromTo(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        m_date = new Date();
        TimeZone tz = TimeZone.getDefault();
        m_timezone = tz.getID();
        Calendar cal = Calendar.getInstance(tz);
        // right size from date
        m_fromDate = new Date();
        cal.setTime(m_fromDate);
        cal.add(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH,-5);
        cal.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY,0);
        cal.set(Calendar.MINUTE,0);
        cal.set(Calendar.SECOND,0);
        cal.set(Calendar.MILLISECOND,0);
        m_fromDate = cal.getTime();
        // right size to date
        m_toDate = new Date();
        cal.setTime(m_toDate);
        cal.add(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH,5);
        cal.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY,23);
        cal.set(Calendar.MINUTE,59);
        cal.set(Calendar.SECOND,59);
        cal.set(Calendar.MILLISECOND,999);
        m_toDate = cal.getTime();
    }

    protected String m_timezone;
    public String getTimezone() { return m_timezone; }
    public void setTimezone(String value) { m_timezone = value; }

    protected Date m_toDate;
    public Date getToDate() { return m_toDate; }
    public void setToDate(Date value) { m_toDate = value; }

    protected Date m_fromDate;
    public Date getFromDate() { return m_fromDate; }
    public void setFromDate(Date value) { m_fromDate = value; }

    protected Date m_date;
    public Date getDate() { return m_date; }
    public void setDate(Date value) { m_date = value; }

}

Time picker

The time picker component allows the user to comfortably select a time.

As with all date/time-components, the server side can be...

1. a property of type "LocalTime", then select "LOCAL" as TIMEZONE inside the component
2. a property of type "java.util.Date", then select the TIMEZONE of the application (see Developers' Guide for details on how to manage java.util.Date)
3. a property of type "Long" or "long" which is handled in the same way as 2 (the long-value being the long-value that is kept within a Date-instance)

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoTimePicker}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTimePicker}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:timepicker id="g_7" flush="true" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoTimePicker.time}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_5" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:label id="g_9" format="time" labeltext="Time of time picker" text="#{d.DemoTimePicker.time}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" coldistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultcoldistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:button id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoTimePicker.onSet0855Action}" text="Set to 08:55h" width="150+" />
<t:button id="g_16" actionListener="#{d.DemoTimePicker.onSet1430Action}" text="Set to 14:30h" width="150+" />
<t:button id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoTimePicker.onSetNowAction}" text="Set to now" width="150+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.time.LocalTime;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTimePicker}")

public class DemoTimePicker
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    LocalTime m_time = LocalTime.now();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoTimePicker(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotimepicker.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoTimePicker}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public LocalTime getTime() { return m_time; }
    public void setTime(LocalTime value) { this.m_time = value; }

    public void onSet1430Action(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_time = LocalTime.of(14,30);
    }

    public void onSet0855Action(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_time = LocalTime.of(8,55);
    }

    public void onSetNowAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_time = LocalTime.now();
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Masked input
Masked input

With the following attributes you can define an input mask that is automtically guiding the user through the input of complex values.

1. FIELD-INPUTMASK - this is a definition of a mask. In the mask a placeholder (default "_") is used for any character that the user may input. Other characters are fix characters of the mask.

2. FIELD-INPUTMASKPLACEHOLDER - if you do not want to use "_" as placehodler then you can define your own one here.

The value that is transferred to the application is exactly the value that you see in the field - the mask characters are part of the data.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoFieldMaskedInput}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFieldMaskedInput}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_4" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" text="Fields with INPUTMASK definition" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:field id="g_6" flush="true" flushtimer="1000" inputmask="____ ____ ____ ____ ____" labeltext="IBAN" placeholder="____ ____ ____ ____ ____" restricttokeys="ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ1234567890" text="#{d.DemoFieldMaskedInput.iban}" width="300" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:field id="g_8" flush="true" flushtimer="1000" inputmask="##:##:##:##:##:##" inputmaskplaceholder="#" labeltext="MAC address" placeholder="##:##:##:##:##:##" restricttokeys="ABCDEFabcdef1234567890" text="#{d.DemoFieldMaskedInput.mac}" uppercase="true" width="300" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:field id="g_10" flush="true" flushtimer="1000" inputmask="__/__/___" labeltext="Storage Location" placeholder="Warehouse/Aisle/Location" restricttokeys="1234567890" text="#{d.DemoFieldMaskedInput.storageLocation}" uppercase="true" width="300" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_11" height="50" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_13" height="#{d.DemoFieldMaskedInput.iban}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" text="Server side values" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" text="Server value of IBAN" width="150+" />
<t:label id="g_16" text="#{d.DemoFieldMaskedInput.iban}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:label id="g_18" text="MAC address" width="150+" />
<t:label id="g_19" text="#{d.DemoFieldMaskedInput.mac}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:label id="g_21" text="Storage Location" width="150+" />
<t:label id="g_22" text="#{d.DemoFieldMaskedInput.storageLocation}" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFieldMaskedInput}")

public class DemoFieldMaskedInput
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_iban;
    String m_mac;
    String m_storageLocation;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoFieldMaskedInput(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demofieldmaskedinput.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoFieldMaskedInput}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getStorageLocation() { return m_storageLocation; }
    public void setStorageLocation(String value) { this.m_storageLocation = value; }

    public String getMac() { return m_mac; }
    public void setMac(String value) { this.m_mac = value; }

    public String getIban() { return m_iban; }
    public void setIban(String value) { this.m_iban = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Masked input - value mode

If using the attribute INPUTMASK then by default the value that is passed into the server side processing is exactly the value that the user sees in the field - containing the mask character.

By using attribute INPUTMASKVALUEMODE and setting it to "withoutMask" you only receive the "net value" - without any mask character. The value is trimmed at its right side.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoFieldInputMaskValueMode}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFieldInputMaskValueMode}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:label id="g_5" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Default - Value is passed together with mask" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:field id="g_7" flush="true" inputmask="____ ____ ____ ____ ____" inputmaskvaluemode="withMask" labeltext="IBAN" restricttokeys="1234567890ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ" text="#{d.DemoFieldInputMaskValueMode.iban1}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="Sever side data is: " />
<t:field id="g_10" flush="true" text="#{d.DemoFieldInputMaskValueMode.iban1}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_22" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_23" >
<t:label id="g_24" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Alternative - Value is passed without mask" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:field id="g_15" flush="true" inputmask="____ ____ ____ ____ ____" inputmaskvaluemode="withoutMask" labeltext="IBAN" restricttokeys="1234567890ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ" text="#{d.DemoFieldInputMaskValueMode.iban2}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="Sever side data is: " />
<t:field id="g_18" flush="true" inputmaskvaluemode="withMask" text="#{d.DemoFieldInputMaskValueMode.iban2}" width="200" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFieldInputMaskValueMode}")

public class DemoFieldInputMaskValueMode
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_iban1;
    String m_iban2;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoFieldInputMaskValueMode(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demofieldinputmaskvaluemode.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoFieldInputMaskValueMode}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getIban2() { return m_iban2; }
    public void setIban2(String value) { this.m_iban2 = value; }

    public String getIban1() { return m_iban1; }
    public void setIban1(String value) { this.m_iban1 = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Masks with included numbers

Characters that you are using to define an input mask cannot be used by the user.

In certain use cases you want to define number-characters as fix content of the input mask - but at same point of time want the user to be allowed to key in numbers.

A solution is to use characters from the unicode character set which represent numbers, but which are not the default number-characters. There are a couple of parallel number representations, the ones listed below are not the only ones.

Use this characters inside your mask definition - and the mask characters will not conflict with the input of the user anymore.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoMaskedInputNumbers}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoMaskedInputNumbers}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:field id="g_2" flush="true" flushtimer="1000" inputmask="+-_____________" inputmaskvaluemode="withoutMask" labeltext="German phone number" placeholder="+-_____________" text="#{d.DemoMaskedInputNumbers.phoneNumber}" width="100%;100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:coldistance id="g_7" width="50" />
<t:label id="g_5" text="==&gt;" />
<t:label id="g_8" text="#{d.DemoMaskedInputNumbers.phoneNumber}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" height="50" />
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Unicode characeters representing numbers" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="&amp;#120782; ++" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_9" text="" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:label id="g_23" text="&amp;#65296; ++" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_14" text="" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_25" text="&amp;#120802; ++" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_17" text="" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoMaskedInputNumbers}")

public class DemoMaskedInputNumbers
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_phoneNumber;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoMaskedInputNumbers(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demomaskedinputnumbers.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoMaskedInputNumbers}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getPhoneNumber() { return m_phoneNumber; }
    public void setPhoneNumber(String value) { this.m_phoneNumber = value; }
}

Server Roundtrips
By individual component

Flushing... - this is the selection of the point of time when changes on the client side are communicated to the server processing.

User input controls (fields, checkbox, radio button, multi line fields) do not flush data to the client when being changed. The data is kept on client side and waits for the next flush, coming from another component. Typical example: a long list of fields with a button - the user inputs the fields and explicitly presses a button when finished.

But you can override this behaviour. The FLUSH attribute of a component needs to be set to "true". In this case check boxes, radio buttons ("clickable" components) directly cause a server flushing when being changed. Fields also flush, but they wait for the user leaving the field (focusLost event).

With field components there is a special attribute: FLUSHTIMER. With this attribute you can define a duration in milliseconds. When the user changes the content of a field and stays waiting in the field, then after this duration a flush to the server is done.

On server side the flush is passed into a corresponding action listener of the component. The event object is of type BaseActionEventFlush.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoFlush}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="No flush (default)" width="150" />
<t:field id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.demoFlush.onSearchNameAction}" clientname="noflush" text="#{d.demoFlush.searchName}" width="100%" />
<t:coldistance id="g_5" width="5" />
<t:button id="g_6" text="Synch!" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="Flush when leaving field" width="150" />
<t:field id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.demoFlush.onSearchNameAction}" clientname="flush" flush="true" text="#{d.demoFlush.searchName}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="Autoflush after 1000 ms" width="150" />
<t:field id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.demoFlush.onSearchNameAction}" clientname="flushtimer" flush="true" flushtimer="1000" text="#{d.demoFlush.searchName}" width="200" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.util.Date;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoFlush extends PageBean
{
    String m_searchName;
    
    public DemoFlush(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("field"); 
    }
    
    public void setSearchName(String value) { m_searchName = value; }
    public String getSearchName() { return m_searchName; }
    
    public void onSearchNameAction(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Flush on searchName: content now is " + m_searchName);
    }
}

By area

The logon button is only visible if all three fields are defined.

There is an attribute FLUSHAREA available on all container components. This triggers a server round trip in case of value changes inside the area.

The ENABLED status of the button is controlled by the server side - and only is enabled if all properties behind the fields are specified.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFlushArea}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:rowdistance id="g_2" height="50%" />
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:coldistance id="g_4" width="50%" />
<t:foldablepane id="g_5" flusharea="true" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="Demo - Definition of Logon Data" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" text="User name" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_8" requestfocus="creation" text="#{d.DemoFlushArea.userName}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="Password" width="100" />
<t:password id="g_11" text="#{d.DemoFlushArea.password}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="System Id" width="100" />
<t:combobox id="g_14" value="#{d.DemoFlushArea.systemId}" width="150" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_15" text="System A" value="A" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_16" text="System B" value="B" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_17" text="System C" value="C" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_18" text="System D" value="D" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:coldistance id="g_20" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_21" enabled="#{d.DemoFlushArea.logonEnabled}" text="Logon" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
<t:coldistance id="g_22" width="50%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_23" height="50%" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFlushArea}")

public class DemoFlushArea
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoFlushArea(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
    
    public boolean getLogonEnabled() 
    { 
        if (m_systemId == null || m_systemId.length() == 0) return false;
        if (m_password == null || m_password.length() == 0) return false;
        if (m_userName == null || m_userName.length() == 0) return false;
        return true;
    }

    String m_systemId;
    public String getSystemId() { return m_systemId; }
    public void setSystemId(String value) { this.m_systemId = value; }

    String m_password;
    public String getPassword() { return m_password; }
    public void setPassword(String value) { this.m_password = value; }

    String m_userName;
    public String getUserName() { return m_userName; }
    public void setUserName(String value) { this.m_userName = value; }

}

Non blocking flush round trips

For both fields (user name and password) the attribute ACTIONEVENTSNOBLOCKING is set to "flush".

This means you may enter a text which is flushed to the server - just as normal. But: the user interface is NOT blocked by this activity, the user can still continue to edit the field(s). So the communication roundtrip is done in some asynchronous way "behind the scenes".

When pressing the logon button, then the corresponding invoke-request is synchronously processed just as normal - so you can be sure that all data is correctly processed at server side.

When using the ACTIONEVENTSNOBLOCKING then your server side application has to deal with the obvious side effects. Example: the logon-button may be pressed ny the user though the button logically should not enabled! The button may be enabled because if the user interface still having shown the button as enabled becaus the round trip to the server side logic was still on its way.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFlushWithoutBlocking}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="User name" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoFlushWithoutBlocking.onVerifyInputAction}" actioneventsnoblocking="flush" bgpaint="#{d.DemoFlushWithoutBlocking.nameStatus}" flush="true" flushtimer="1000" text="#{d.DemoFlushWithoutBlocking.name}" width="100%;100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Password" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoFlushWithoutBlocking.onVerifyInputAction}" actioneventsnoblocking="flush" bgpaint="#{d.DemoFlushWithoutBlocking.passwordStatus}" flush="true" flushtimer="1000" text="#{d.DemoFlushWithoutBlocking.password}" width="100%;100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:coldistance id="g_9" width="100" />
<t:textpane id="g_10" text="Both user name and password must have at least 8 characters! - This is checked by the server side in this example..." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_11" height="50" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:coldistance id="g_13" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoFlushWithoutBlocking.onLogonAction}" enabled="#{d.DemoFlushWithoutBlocking.enabledLogon}" text="Logon" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:rowstatusbar id="g_15" />
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFlushWithoutBlocking}")

public class DemoFlushWithoutBlocking
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{

    String m_result = "Not yet set.";
    String m_name = "CaptainCasa";
    String m_nameStatus;
    String m_password;
    String m_passwordStatus;
    
    public DemoFlushWithoutBlocking(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }
    
    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoflushwithoutblocking.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoFlushWithoutBlocking}"; }


    public String getPassword() { return m_password; }
    public void setPassword(String value) { this.m_password = value; }

    public String getName() { return m_name; }
    public void setName(String value) { this.m_name = value; }
    
    public String getNameStatus() { return m_nameStatus; }
    public String getPasswordStatus() { return m_passwordStatus; }

    public void onVerifyInputAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        verifyInput();
    }

    public boolean getEnabledLogon() 
    { 
        return verifyInput();
    }

    public void onLogonAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        try
        {
            boolean succ = verifyInput();
            if (succ == false)
                Statusbar.outputError("Problem when logging on.");
            else
                Statusbar.outputSuccess("You are logged on");
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
        }
    }
    
    
    private boolean verifyInput()
    {
        m_nameStatus = null;
        m_passwordStatus = null;
        boolean result = true;
        if (m_name == null || m_name.length() < 8)
        {
            m_nameStatus = "error()";
            result = false;
        }
        if (m_password == null || m_password.length() < 8) 
        {
            m_passwordStatus = "error()";
            result = false;
        }
        return result;
    }
}

Regular Expressions
Regular Expressions

You can assign a regular expression to a FIELD using the REGEX attribute. As consequence the field's content is checked against the regular expression.

If the check determines an error, then the field is highlighted with red background colors.

There is an attribute REGEXMODE which defines the exact behavior:

0 (default): the user gets notified about invalid input of data - that's it. The value is accepted and passed to the logic.
1: the user is not allowed to input invalid data. Whenever invalid data is input and the user leaves the field, a popup dialog is shown notifying the suer that the input was reset to the last value.
2: same as 0, invalid values are accepted, the user in addition receives a popup dialog when leaving the field

By default the field only is drawn as invalid during input of data. By adding 10 to the existing REGEXMODE-values you define that invalid values are always shown.

There is the possibility to show the user a certain comment (attribute REGEXHINT) in case he/she is entering a value, that does not match the regular expression.

Regular expression can be - as with all other attributes - either assigned statically (as in the example) or can be assigned by expression binding to a server side property ("#{...}").

You find a nice description about the syntax of regular expressions at:
http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/essential/regex/intro.html

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoFieldregex}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:rowflexlinecontainer id="g_160" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_3" enabled="false" text="REGEXMODE = 0 (default - invalid values are accepted)" width="100%;500" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:field id="g_6" flush="true" labeltext="Mail Address" regex="[&#92;w.]+[@]{1}[&#92;w]+[.]{1}[&#92;w.]+" regexhint="Format: xxx@yyy.zz" text="#{d.demoFieldregex.mailAddress}" userhint="Please input a valid e-Mail address." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:coldistance id="g_140" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_9" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="[&#92;w.]+[@]{1}[&#92;w]+[.]{1}[&#92;w.]+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:field id="g_13" flush="true" labeltext="Phone number" regex="[0-9/+() ]+" regexhint="Example: +49 8223 484147" text="#{d.demoFieldregex.phoneNumer}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:coldistance id="g_142" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_16" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="[0-9/+() ]+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_17" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:field id="g_20" flush="true" labeltext="Zip code" regex="[0-9]{0,5}" regexhint="Is it so difficult to input a correct zip Code??? Grrr." text="#{d.demoFieldregex.zipCode}" userhint="A zip code is know as &#34;Postleitzahl&#34; in Germany." width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:coldistance id="g_143" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_23" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="[0-9]{0,5}" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
<t:foldablepane id="g_96" enabled="false" text="REGEXMODE = 10 (0 + always showing)" width="100%;500" >
<t:row id="g_97" >
<t:field id="g_99" flush="true" labeltext="Mail Address" regex="[&#92;w.]+[@]{1}[&#92;w]+[.]{1}[&#92;w.]+" regexhint="Format: xxx@yyy.zz" regexmode="10" text="#{d.demoFieldregex.mailAddress}" userhint="Please input a valid e-Mail address." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_100" >
<t:coldistance id="g_144" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_102" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="[&#92;w.]+[@]{1}[&#92;w]+[.]{1}[&#92;w.]+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_103" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_104" >
<t:field id="g_106" flush="true" labeltext="Phone number" regex="[0-9/+() ]+" regexhint="Example: +49 8223 484147" regexmode="10" text="#{d.demoFieldregex.phoneNumer}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_107" >
<t:coldistance id="g_145" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_109" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="[0-9/+() ]+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_110" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_111" >
<t:field id="g_113" flush="true" labeltext="Zip code" regex="[0-9]{0,5}" regexhint="Is it so difficult to input a correct zip Code??? Grrr." regexmode="10" text="#{d.demoFieldregex.zipCode}" userhint="A zip code is know as &#34;Postleitzahl&#34; in Germany." width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_114" >
<t:coldistance id="g_146" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_116" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="[0-9]{0,5}" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
<t:foldablepane id="g_25" enabled="false" text="REGEXMODE = 1 (invalid values are NOT accepted)" width="100%;500" >
<t:row id="g_26" >
<t:field id="g_28" flush="true" labeltext="Mail Address" regex="[&#92;w.]+[@]{1}[&#92;w]+[.]{1}[&#92;w.]+" regexhint="Format: xxx@yyy.zz" regexmode="1" text="#{d.demoFieldregex.mailAddress}" userhint="Please input a valid e-Mail address." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_29" >
<t:coldistance id="g_147" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_31" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="[&#92;w.]+[@]{1}[&#92;w]+[.]{1}[&#92;w.]+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_32" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_33" >
<t:field id="g_35" flush="true" labeltext="Phone number" regex="[0-9/+() ]+" regexhint="Example: +49 8223 484147" regexmode="1" text="#{d.demoFieldregex.phoneNumer}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_36" >
<t:coldistance id="g_148" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_38" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="[0-9/+() ]+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_39" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_40" >
<t:field id="g_42" flush="true" labeltext="Zip code" regex="[0-9]{0,5}" regexhint="Is is so difficult to input a correct zip Code??? Grrr." regexmode="1" text="#{d.demoFieldregex.zipCode}" userhint="A zip code is know as &#34;Postleitzahl&#34; in Germany." width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_43" >
<t:coldistance id="g_149" width="100%" />

</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
<t:foldablepane id="g_74" enabled="false" text="REGEXMODE = 11 (1 + always showing)" width="100%;500" >
<t:row id="g_75" >
<t:field id="g_77" flush="true" labeltext="Mail Address" regex="[&#92;w.]+[@]{1}[&#92;w]+[.]{1}[&#92;w.]+" regexhint="Format: xxx@yyy.zz" regexmode="11" text="#{d.demoFieldregex.mailAddress}" userhint="Please input a valid e-Mail address." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_78" >
<t:coldistance id="g_150" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_80" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="[&#92;w.]+[@]{1}[&#92;w]+[.]{1}[&#92;w.]+" />
</t:row>

<t:row id="g_82" >

</t:row>
<t:row id="g_122" >
<t:coldistance id="g_156" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_124" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="[&#92;w.]+[@]{1}[&#92;w]+[.]{1}[&#92;w.]+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_125" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_126" >
<t:field id="g_128" flush="true" labeltext="Phone number" regex="[0-9/+() ]+" regexhint="Example: +49 8223 484147" regexmode="12" text="#{d.demoFieldregex.phoneNumer}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_129" >
<t:coldistance id="g_157" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_131" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="[0-9/+() ]+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_132" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_133" >
<t:field id="g_135" flush="true" labeltext="Zip code" regex="[0-9]{0,5}" regexhint="Is is so difficult to input a correct zip Code??? Grrr." regexmode="12" text="#{d.demoFieldregex.zipCode}" userhint="A zip code is know as &#34;Postleitzahl&#34; in Germany." width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_136" >
<t:coldistance id="g_158" width="100%" />
<t:label id="g_138" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="[0-9]{0,5}" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:rowflexlinecontainer>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.demoFieldregex}")

public class DemoFieldregex extends PageBean
{
    public DemoFieldregex(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("field"); 
    }

    protected String m_mailAddress;
    public String getMailAddress() { return m_mailAddress; }
    public void setMailAddress(String value) { m_mailAddress = value; }

    protected String m_phoneNumer = "abcde";
    public String getPhoneNumer() { return m_phoneNumer; }
    public void setPhoneNumer(String value) { m_phoneNumer = value; }

    protected String m_zipCode;
    public String getZipCode() { return m_zipCode; }
    public void setZipCode(String value) { m_zipCode = value; }

    public void onSynchData(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccessWithPopup("Synchronization done.");
    }

}

Special words

Sometimes there is the necessity to build regular expressions, in which the locale/client-specific separators for decimal numbers are contained.

You can do this by using the reserved words "@@decimalSeparator@@" and "@@groupingSeparator@@". The words are replaced by their corresponding client-side representation at runtime.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoRegexSpecial}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" stylevariant="ccbig" text="@@decimalSeparator@@" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:textpane id="g_7" text="The reserved word &#34;@@decimalSeparator@@&#34; is replaced by the client- and locale-specific separator at runtime:" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_1" >
<t:field id="g_21" labeltext="Only decimal separators allowed" regex="[@@decimalSeparator@@]+" regexmode="1" width="100%;250" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Expression: [@@decimalSeparator@@]+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_14" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_16" stylevariant="ccbig" text="@@thousandsSeparator@@" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:textpane id="g_18" text="The reserved word &#34;@@thousandsSeparator@@&#34; is replaced by the client- and locale-specific grouping separator at runtime:" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:field id="g_24" labeltext="Only grouping separators allowed" regex="[@@thousandsSeparator@@]+" regexmode="1" width="100%;250" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_35" >
<t:label id="g_36" text="Expression: [@@thousandsSeparator@@]+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_33" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_26" >
<t:label id="g_27" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Example: only 3 decimal digits" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:textpane id="g_29" text="This example shows a regular expression allowing the input of numbers with only 3 decimals behind the decimal separator." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_30" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_31" format="bigdecimal" formatmask="dec3" labeltext="Only grouping separators allowed" regex="[0-9@@thousandsSeparator@@]*[@@decimalSeparator@@]{0,1}[0-9]{0,3}" regexhint="Only 3 decimal digits are used. Input will be rounded." regexmode="0" width="100%;250" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_38" >
<t:label id="g_39" text="Expression: [0-9@@thousandsSeparator@@]*[@@decimalSeparator@@]{0,1}[0-9]{0,3}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_41" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_42" >
<t:label id="g_43" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Example: max 5 digits in front, 3 digits behind" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_44" >
<t:textpane id="g_45" text="This example shows a regular expression allowing the input of numbers with only 3 decimals behind the decimal separator and maximal 5 digits in front of the decimal separator." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_46" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_47" format="bigdecimal" formatmask="dec3" labeltext="Only grouping separators allowed" regex="([-]{0,1}([0-9]{1}[@@thousandsSeparator@@]*){1,5}){1}([@@decimalSeparator@@]{1}[0-9]{0,3}){0,1}" regexhint="Only 3 decimal digits are used. Input will be rounded." regexmode="0" width="100%;250" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_48" >
<t:label id="g_49" text="Expression: [0-9@@thousandsSeparator@@]*[@@decimalSeparator@@]{0,1}[0-9]{0,3}" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.math.BigDecimal;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoRegexSpecial}")

public class DemoRegexSpecial
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoRegexSpecial(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoregexspecial.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoRegexSpecial}"; }

}

Spinner

The SPINNER component allows to input an integer value within a defined range. The user can scroll up and down the value either by using the keyboard or by using the corresponding icons.

By using the attribute EDITABLE you can decide if in addition keyboard input is possible.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSpinner}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Value between 0..10" width="120" />
<t:spinner id="g_4" align="center" bgpaint="mandatory()" dragsend="HHH:llll" dropreceive="HHH" maxvalue="10" minvalue="0" userhint="Only cursor up and down is allowed here." value="#{d.DemoSpinner.spinnerValue1}" width="50" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" dragsend="HHH:sjdhsd" text="Value between 0..50" width="120" />
<t:spinner id="g_7" align="center" dragsend="HHH:jjjjj" dropreceive="HHH" editable="true" maxvalue="50" minvalue="0" userhint="Now you can directly edit the value." value="#{d.DemoSpinner.spinnerValue2}" width="50" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" dragsend="HHH:sjdhsd" text="Value between 0..50" width="120" />
<t:spinner id="g_11" align="center" dragsend="HHH:jjjjj" dropreceive="HHH" editable="true" flush="true" increment="5" maxvalue="50" minvalue="0" userhint="Now you can directly edit the value." value="#{d.DemoSpinner.spinnerValue2}" width="50" />
<t:coldistance id="g_12" width="5" />
<t:label id="g_13" text="5 as increment" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:coldistance id="g_15" width="120" />
<t:textpane id="g_16" font="size:10" text="(The spinner is bound via flush to the spinner above.)" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_17" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" dragsend="HHH:sjdhsd" text="Value between 0..50" width="120" />
<t:spinner id="g_20" align="center" dragsend="HHH:jjjjj" dropreceive="HHH" editable="false" maxvalue="50" minvalue="0" userhint="Now you can directly edit the value." value="#{d.DemoSpinner.spinnerValue2}" width="50" />
<t:coldistance id="g_21" width="5" />
<t:label id="g_22" text="editable false" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoSpinner}")

public class DemoSpinner
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoSpinner(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("spinner"); 
    }
    
    protected int m_spinnerValue1 = 5;
    protected int m_spinnerValue2 = 20;

    public int getSpinnerValue1()
    {
        return m_spinnerValue1;
    }
    public void setSpinnerValue1(int spinnerValue1)
    {
        m_spinnerValue1 = spinnerValue1;
    }
    public int getSpinnerValue2()
    {
        return m_spinnerValue2;
    }
    public void setSpinnerValue2(int spinnerValue2)
    {
        m_spinnerValue2 = spinnerValue2;
    }

}

Additional info in field
Field with User Info

There are many ways of presenting additional information about what a user needs to input within a certain field.

The USERHINT is a text that shows up when the user steps into a field - and disappears when the user leaves the field.

The LABELTEXT is a text which is shown in the background if the field is empty and which then moves up into the top area during input.

The PLACEHOLDER is a background text which only appears on empty content.

The UNITTEXT is a text which is placed at the right of the field, typically showing a unit of measure. Of course it can be used for any other purpose as well.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFieldWriteIfEmpty}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_3" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" text="Label text" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:field id="g_6" labeltext="Weight" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:field id="g_9" labeltext="Height" width="200" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_31" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_32" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" text="Label text with user hint" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_33" >
<t:field id="g_34" labeltext="Weight" userhint="This is the weight in kilograms." width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_35" >
<t:field id="g_36" labeltext="Height" userhint="This is the height in cm. Please do carefully measure." width="200" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_11" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" text="Background text that disappears on User Input" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="Weight" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_14" placeholder="kg" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_16" text="Height" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_17" placeholder="cm" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" text="Distance" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_20" format="int" placeholder="km" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_23" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" text="&#34;Unit text&#34;, text at the right" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:field id="g_26" labeltext="Weight" unittext="kg" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_27" >
<t:field id="g_29" labeltext="Height" unittext="cm" width="200" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoFieldWriteIfEmpty extends PageBean
{
    public DemoFieldWriteIfEmpty(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("field"); 
    }
}

Unit text - setting max width

When defining a UNITTEXT, then the text is written at the right end of the field. This automatically reduces the size of the actual text input within the field.

By default the width of the UNITTEXT is automatically determined. All the are left of the text is available for editing. If the text exceeds more than 75% of the field's width then it is automatically cut, so that there is still some space left for input.

By using attribute UNITTEXTMAXWIDTH you can explicitly define the maximum size that the unit text should take before getting cut. You may either define a (scaled) pixel value or you may define a percentage size.

Please pay attention to pass "reasonable" values only - there is no checking if e.g. the maximum width of the unit text is bigger than the width of the field.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoFieldUnitTextMaxWidth}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFieldUnitTextMaxWidth}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:label id="g_23" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Default - following unit text, maximal 75%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:field id="g_2" flush="true" labeltext="Max unit width - default (following text)" text="#{d.DemoFieldUnitTextMaxWidth.someValue}" unittext="CM" width="250" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:field id="g_21" flush="true" labeltext="Max unit width - default (75%)" text="#{d.DemoFieldUnitTextMaxWidth.someValue}" unittext="ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ" width="250" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_5" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_25" >
<t:label id="g_26" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Explicitly set" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:field id="g_9" flush="true" labeltext="Max unit width - 50%" text="#{d.DemoFieldUnitTextMaxWidth.someValue}" unittext="ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ" unittextmaxwidth="50%" width="250" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:field id="g_12" flush="true" labeltext="Max unit width - 25%" text="#{d.DemoFieldUnitTextMaxWidth.someValue}" unittext="ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ" unittextmaxwidth="25%" width="250" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:field id="g_15" flush="true" labeltext="Max unit width - 150" text="#{d.DemoFieldUnitTextMaxWidth.someValue}" unittext="ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ" unittextmaxwidth="150" width="250" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:field id="g_18" flush="true" labeltext="Max unit width - 50" text="#{d.DemoFieldUnitTextMaxWidth.someValue}" unittext="ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ" unittextmaxwidth="50" width="250" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFieldUnitTextMaxWidth}")

public class DemoFieldUnitTextMaxWidth
    extends DemoPageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_someValue = "Some value";

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoFieldUnitTextMaxWidth(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demofieldunittextmaxwidth.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoFieldUnitTextMaxWidth}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getSomeValue() { return m_someValue; }
    public void setSomeValue(String value) { this.m_someValue = value; }
}

Color Chooser

The COLORFIELD allows the user to input a color value. The format of a color value is "#rrggbb" or "#rrggbbtt", with...:

(rr) representing the red value
(gg) representing the green value
(bb) representing the blue value
(tt) representing the transparency value

All values are to be defined as hexadecimal values.

Example: the color code for "red" is "#FF0000". The color code for "black" is "#000000". The color code for a black that lets the background shine through is e.g. "#00000030".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoColorField}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Color field" width="100" />
<t:colorfield id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoColorField.onColorAction}" flush="true" labeltext="Some color" value="#{d.DemoColorField.color}" width="120" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Color icon" width="100" />
<t:coloricon id="g_7" image="/eclntjsfserver/images/iconssvg/color_16x16.svg" value="#{d.DemoColorField.color}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="50" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="Some style variants" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="Foreground" width="100" />
<t:colorfield id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoColorField.onColorAction}" activationhotkey="40" flush="true" foreground="#{d.DemoColorField.color}" labeltext="Some color" value="#{d.DemoColorField.color}" width="120" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" text="Image" width="100" />
<t:colorfield id="g_16" actionListener="#{d.DemoColorField.onColorAction}" flush="true" image="/eclntjsfserver/images/magnifier.png" imagepressed="/eclntjsfserver/images/magnifier.png" imagerollover="/eclntjsfserver/images/magnifier.png" labeltext="Some color" value="#{d.DemoColorField.color}" width="120" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ClientTestLog;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IClientLogAware;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoColorField}")

public class DemoColorField
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable, IClientLogAware
{
    public DemoColorField(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("colorfield"); 
    }
    
    protected String m_color = null;
    public String getColor() { return m_color; }
    public void setColor(String value) { m_color = value; }
    
    public void onColorAction(ActionEvent event)
    {
    }
    
    public boolean onCreateClientTestLogMessage()
    {
        ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage("Color is: " + m_color);
        return true;
    }

    
}

Image in front of text

By using the attribute TEXTIMAGE you can arrange an image in front of the text.

The image can be used for explanation purpose and/or (esp. in case of COMBOFIED) for showing the image of the selected object.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFieldWithImage}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Field" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_4" textimage="#{d.DemoFieldWithImage.imageName}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Combo Field" width="100" />
<t:combofield id="g_7" textimage="#{d.DemoFieldWithImage.imageName}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Formatted Field" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_10" format="int" textimage="#{d.DemoFieldWithImage.imageName}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="Combo Box" width="100" />
<t:combobox id="g_13" textimage="#{d.DemoFieldWithImage.imageName}" width="150" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_14" text="Option1" value="1" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_15" text="Option2" value="2" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="Auto Complete" width="100" />
<t:autocomplete id="g_18" textimage="#{d.DemoFieldWithImage.imageName}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_20" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFieldWithImage.grid}" sbvisibleamount="5" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_21" text="Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_22" text=".{name}" textimage="#{d.DemoFieldWithImage.imageName}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_23" text="Name" width="50%" >
<t:combofield id="g_24" text=".{name}" textimage="#{d.DemoFieldWithImage.imageName}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_25" text="Name" width="70" >
<t:combobox id="g_26" textimage="#{d.DemoFieldWithImage.imageName}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_27" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:coldistance id="g_29" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_30" actionListener="#{d.DemoFieldWithImage.onSetAcceptImage}" image="/images/icons/accept.png" text="Set &#34;Accept&#34; Image" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_31" >
<t:coldistance id="g_32" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_33" actionListener="#{d.DemoFieldWithImage.onSetAddImage}" image="/images/icons/add.png" text="Set &#34;Add&#34; Image" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_34" >
<t:coldistance id="g_35" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_36" actionListener="#{d.DemoFieldWithImage.onClearImage}" text="Clear image" width="150" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFieldWithImage}")

public class DemoFieldWithImage
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected String m_name = "Hello";
        public String getName() { return m_name; }
        public void setName(String value) { m_name = value; }

    }

    public DemoFieldWithImage(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
            m_grid.getItems().add(new GridItem());
    }

    protected String m_imageName = "/images/icons/accept.png";
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    public String getImageName() { return m_imageName; }

    public void onSetAddImage(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_imageName = "/images/icons/add.png";
    }
    
    public void onSetAcceptImage(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_imageName = "/images/icons/accept.png";
    }
    
    public void onClearImage(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_imageName = null;
    }
    
}

Restricted keys only

By using attribute RESTRICTTOKEYS you can limit the keyboard input of the user to certain characters.

Please pay attention: the user still can copy paste other characters into the field!
Consequence: you still need to check values, either on server side by your backing bean logic, or by applying a regular expression in addition.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
