<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFieldRestrictToKeys}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="FIELD, 0..9 only" width="180" />
<t:field id="g_4" restricttokeys="0123456789" text="#{d.DemoFieldRestrictToKeys.fieldValue}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="FORMATTEDFIELD, 0..9 only" width="180" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_7" format="int" restricttokeys="0123456789" value="#{d.DemoFieldRestrictToKeys.formattedfieldValue}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="COMBOFIELD, aAbBcC only" width="180" />
<t:combofield id="g_10" restricttokeys="aAbBcC" text="#{d.DemoFieldRestrictToKeys.fieldValue}" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFieldRestrictToKeys}")

public class DemoFieldRestrictToKeys
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoFieldRestrictToKeys(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    protected int m_formattedfieldValue;
    public int getFormattedfieldValue() { return m_formattedfieldValue; }
    public void setFormattedfieldValue(int value) { m_formattedfieldValue = value; }

    protected String m_combofieldValue;
    public String getCombofieldValue() { return m_combofieldValue; }
    public void setCombofieldValue(String value) { m_combofieldValue = value; }

    protected String m_fieldValue;
    public String getFieldValue() { return m_fieldValue; }
    public void setFieldValue(String value) { m_fieldValue = value; }

}

Long Text Popup

The long text field is a text field that can hold multi line texts. The user can either directly input the text or can open a text dialog.

The usage of the LONGTEXTFIELD component is especially useful, when working with multi line texts within a grid environment.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoLongTextField}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Long Text" width="100" />
<t:longtextfield id="g_4" flush="true" text="#{d.DemoLongTextField.longText}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_6" width="100" />
<t:textpane id="g_7" font="size:10" text="User F4 or ctrl-space or click the icon in order to open the long text editor popup." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:coldistance id="g_9" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_10" text="OK" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_11" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:coldistance id="g_13" width="100" />
<t:textpane id="g_14" contenttype="text/plain" text="#{d.DemoLongTextField.longText}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_15" />
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Some Optical Variants" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" text="Ohter Icon" width="100" />
<t:longtextfield id="g_20" flush="true" image="/images/icons_16/save.png" text="#{d.DemoLongTextField.longText}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:label id="g_22" text="Border of Dialog" width="100" />
<t:longtextfield id="g_23" flush="true" text="#{d.DemoLongTextField.longText}" width="200" popupborder="left:5;right:5;top:5;bottom:5;color:#00000030" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:label id="g_25" text="Size of Dialog" width="100" />
<t:longtextfield id="g_26" flush="true" popupheight="100" popupwidth="600" text="#{d.DemoLongTextField.longText}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_27" />
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:label id="g_29" text="Editable = false" width="100" />
<t:longtextfield id="g_30" editable="false" flush="true" text="#{d.DemoLongTextField.longText}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_31" >
<t:label id="g_32" text="Enabled = false" width="100" />
<t:longtextfield id="g_33" enabled="false" text="#{d.DemoLongTextField.longText}" width="200" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoLongTextField}")

public class DemoLongTextField
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoLongTextField(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        initRefComponent("longtextfield"); 
    }
    
    protected String m_longText = "Hello world!\n\nThis is a long text. This is a long text. This is a long text. This is a long text. This is a long text. This is a long text.";
    public String getLongText() { return m_longText; }
    public void setLongText(String value) { m_longText = value; }
}

Long Text Popup - lazy loading

This demo shows the possibility to lazily load the text at the point of time when the user opens the long text popup dialog.

There are three issues that you have to do:

1. Set LONGTEXTFIELD-LAZYLAODING to "true".

2. The text value requires to end with "..." if it is not fully loaded.

3. Implement the BaseActionEventLazyLoading event

Lazy loading automatically will switch the field component to non-editable - the user can only edit the text via the popup dialog.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoLongTextFieldLazyLoading}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoLongTextFieldLazyLoading}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:longtextfield id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoLongTextFieldLazyLoading.onFieldAction}" flush="true" labeltext="Lazily loaded text" lazyloading="true" text="#{d.DemoLongTextFieldLazyLoading.text}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_5" height="50" />
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:textpane id="g_7" labeltext="Same text rendered in text pane" text="#{d.DemoLongTextFieldLazyLoading.text}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventLazyLoading;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoLongTextFieldLazyLoading}")

public class DemoLongTextFieldLazyLoading
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet,...";

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoLongTextFieldLazyLoading(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demolongtextfieldlazyloading.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoLongTextFieldLazyLoading}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getText() { return m_text; }
    public void setText(String value) { this.m_text = value; }

    public void onFieldAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventLazyLoading)
        {
            m_text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor "
                    + "invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. "
                    + "At vero eos et accusam et justo duo dolores et ea rebum. "
                    + "Stet clita kasd gubergren, no sea takimata sanctus est Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet. "
                    + "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor "
                    + "invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. "
                    + "At vero eos et accusam et justo duo dolores et ea rebum. "
                    + "Stet clita kasd gubergren, no sea takimata sanctus est Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet.";
        }
    }
}

Password
Encryption

The PASSWORD component allows to encrypt the user's input. The encryption transfers the password into a hashed string using diverse one-way encryption methods.

Pay attention: this type of encryption just makes sure that the user's password input (e.g. "aaaa") is immediatly encrypted as part of the componnt's processing (e.g. into "sb437fdbs7fsdf=="). The encrypted value is the one that is sent to server side. There is no way (of course...) to decrypt back into "aaaa", so on server side you from now on have to "live" with the encrypted password.

And, pay attention, too: this encryption does only hide the actual value that the user enters. I.e. no one can see (e.g. by listening to the http protocol) that the user enters "aaaa". But: esp. when using http, then the encryption of the PASSWORD component does not add any kind of security to your application! - Still someone can listen to what is transferred via http, and then use the encrypted password to the server side!

Using https is the only way to really make sure that password values are managed in a secure way!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPassword}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Unencrypted" width="120" />
<t:password id="BLOCKLOGGING_4" text="#{d.DemoPassword.password1}" width="200" withshowtexticon="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:coldistance id="g_5" width="120" />
<t:textpane id="g_6" text="#{d.DemoPassword.password1}" width="100%" wordwrap="true" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_7" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="SHA Encrypted" width="120" />
<t:password id="g_10" encryption="SHA" text="#{d.DemoPassword.password3}" width="200" withshowtexticon="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:coldistance id="g_12" width="120" />
<t:textpane id="g_13" text="#{d.DemoPassword.password3}" width="100%" wordwrap="true" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_14" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_16" text="SHA 256 Encrypted" width="120" />
<t:password id="g_17" encryption="SHA256" text="#{d.DemoPassword.password4}" width="200" withshowtexticon="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:coldistance id="g_19" width="120" />
<t:textpane id="g_20" text="#{d.DemoPassword.password4}" width="100%" wordwrap="true" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_21" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:label id="g_23" text="SHA 512 Encrypted" width="120" />
<t:password id="g_24" encryption="SHA512" text="#{d.DemoPassword.password5}" width="200" withshowtexticon="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_25" >
<t:coldistance id="g_26" width="120" />
<t:textpane id="g_27" text="#{d.DemoPassword.password5}" width="100%" wordwrap="true" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_28" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_29" >
<t:coldistance id="g_30" width="120" />
<t:button id="g_31" actionListener="#{d.DemoPassword.onShowContent}" text="Show Content" width="100+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPassword}")

public class DemoPassword
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    String m_password5;
    public String getPassword5() { return m_password5; }
    public void setPassword5(String value) { this.m_password5 = value; }

    String m_password4;
    public String getPassword4() { return m_password4; }
    public void setPassword4(String value) { this.m_password4 = value; }

    public DemoPassword(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("password"); 
    }
    
    public void onShowContent(ActionEvent event) {}

    protected String m_password3;
    public String getPassword3() { return m_password3; }
    public void setPassword3(String value) { m_password3 = value; }

    protected String m_password2;
    public String getPassword2() { return m_password2; }
    public void setPassword2(String value) { m_password2 = value; }

    protected String m_password1;
    public String getPassword1() { return m_password1; }
    public void setPassword1(String value) { m_password1 = value; }

}

Regular Expression

You can also define regular expressions behind the PASSWORD component.

Why is this important? You may use the PASSWORD-ENCRYPTION attribute in order to directly encrypt your password on client side. When doing so, then you cannot check on server side anymore if the password was entered following certain password rules (e.g. "must contain at least one digit", "must only consist out of digits", "must be 6 characters long as minimum", ...). So, you now can do these checks on client side against a regular expression.

This regular expression is typically not used in the logon dialog, but in an administration dialog, in which you let the user specifiy his/her password.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPasswordRegex}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Password" width="100" />
<t:password id="g_4" regex="[0123456789]{5}" text="#{d.DemoPasswordRegex.password}" userhint="Your password must consist out of 5 digits (e.g. &#34;37589&#34;). The regular expression that is checked is defined as &#34;[0123456789]{5}&#34;." width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPasswordRegex}")

public class DemoPasswordRegex
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoPasswordRegex(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("password"); 
    }
    
    protected String m_password;
    public String getPassword() { return m_password; }
    public void setPassword(String value) { m_password = value; }
}

Display length

The length of the real password is only shown during input and until the password value was sent to the serer side.

In all other situations the number of characters shown in the password field is set to a fix value (by default: 20) - totally independent from the actual size of the password. Reason: by this, guessing the password is much harder.

The number of characters can be explicitly set using PASSWORD-ANONYMIZEDLENGTH. Please note: values below 4 are not accepted.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPasswordLength}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPasswordLength}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:password id="g_2" flush="true" labeltext="Default length (20)" text="#{d.DemoPasswordLength.password}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:password id="g_9" anonymizedlength="40" flush="true" labeltext="Length set to 40" text="#{d.DemoPasswordLength.password}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:password id="g_18" anonymizedlength="10" flush="true" labeltext="Length set to 10" text="#{d.DemoPasswordLength.password}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:password id="g_12" anonymizedlength="4" flush="true" labeltext="Length set to 4" text="#{d.DemoPasswordLength.password}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:password id="g_15" anonymizedlength="3" flush="true" labeltext="Length set to &lt;= 3" text="#{d.DemoPasswordLength.password}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_5" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:label id="g_20" labeltext="Actual vlaue of password" text="#{d.DemoPasswordLength.password}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_22" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_23" >
<t:textpane id="g_24" text="In this example we did not use password encryption - in order to show that the length of the password that is shown is independent from the length of the content. - Please in general never show passwords... and in general encrypt the password. Check the attribute PASSWORD-ENCRYPTION if you want to encrypt on client side already." width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPasswordLength}")

public class DemoPasswordLength
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_password = "CaptainCasa";
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPasswordLength(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopasswordlength.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPasswordLength}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getPassword() { return m_password; }
    public void setPassword(String value) { this.m_password = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Pass text selection info

Both FIELD and TEXTAREA component are able to send the current text selection information to the server side.

You may use this information in order to e.g. insert/replace text at a certain position - or to start functions based on the currently selected text.

The information is passed as semicolon-separated string of three digits:
(.) the current caret position
(.) the current start of selection
(.) the current end of selection
You may use ValuManager.decodeStraightIntCSV(...) to transfer the string into int-values.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFieldTextSelectionInfo}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:textpane id="g_3" text="The selection start/end information of the following field will be transferred to the server. Select some text and press refresh:" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_4" />
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Multi line text" width="125" />
<t:textarea id="g_7" height="200" text="#{d.DemoFieldTextSelectionInfo.longText}" textselectioninfo="#{d.DemoFieldTextSelectionInfo.longTextSelectionInfo}" width="100%;200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" coldistance="5" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Text selection info" width="125" />
<t:label id="g_10" text="#{d.DemoFieldTextSelectionInfo.longTextSelectionInfo}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_11" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="Single line text" width="125" />
<t:field id="g_14" text="#{d.DemoFieldTextSelectionInfo.text}" textselectioninfo="#{d.DemoFieldTextSelectionInfo.textSelectionInfo}" width="100%;200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" coldistance="5" >
<t:label id="g_16" text="Text selection info" width="125" />
<t:label id="g_17" text="#{d.DemoFieldTextSelectionInfo.textSelectionInfo}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_18" />
<t:rowdistance id="g_19" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_20" coldistance="5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_21" width="125" />
<t:button id="g_22" actionListener="#{d.DemoFieldTextSelectionInfo.onRefreshAction}" text="Show text selection info" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_23" height="20" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFieldTextSelectionInfo}")

public class DemoFieldTextSelectionInfo
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_longText = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo dolores et ea rebum. Stet clita kasd gubergren, no sea takimata sanctus est Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo dolores et ea rebum. Stet clita kasd gubergren, no sea takimata sanctus est Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet.";
    String m_longTextSelectionInfo = "Not set yet";
    String m_textSelectionInfo = "Not set yet.";
    String m_text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua.";

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoFieldTextSelectionInfo(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demofieldtextselectioninfo.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoFieldTextSelectionInfo}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getLongTextSelectionInfo() { return m_longTextSelectionInfo; }
    public void setLongTextSelectionInfo(String value) { this.m_longTextSelectionInfo = value; }

    public String getLongText() { return m_longText; }
    public void setLongText(String value) { this.m_longText = value; }

    public String getText() { return m_text; }
    public void setText(String value) { this.m_text = value; }

    public String getTextSelectionInfo() { return m_textSelectionInfo; }
    public void setTextSelectionInfo(String value) { this.m_textSelectionInfo = value; }

    public void onRefreshAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        // no action here: refresh button just used to trigger a rountrip
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Spell checking

When clicking/tabbing into the field/text area then the spell checking of the browser will be activated.

Use attribute WITHSPELLCHECK to activate the spell checking.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFieldSpellCheck}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:field id="g_3" text="#{d.DemoFieldSpellCheck.text1}" width="100%" withspellcheck="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:textarea id="g_5" height="100" text="#{d.DemoFieldSpellCheck.text2}" width="100%" withspellcheck="true" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFieldSpellCheck}")

public class DemoFieldSpellCheck
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_text1 = "Tis text has manny erors.";
    String m_text2 = "Tis text has evn more erors. Tis text has evn more erors. Tis text has evn more erors. Tis text has evn more erors. ";

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoFieldSpellCheck(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demofieldspellcheck.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoFieldSpellCheck}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getText2() { return m_text2; }
    public void setText2(String value) { this.m_text2 = value; }

    public String getText1() { return m_text1; }
    public void setText1(String value) { this.m_text1 = value; }
}

Open popup at selected text

The FIELD and TEXTAREA component are able to transfer the current text selection information to the backend processing.

To do so, bing the attribute TEXTSELECTION to some property. The property is used in two directions:

1. The actual text selection of the component is filled into this property with every round trip from the client to the server.
2. You can actively set the text selection value on server side and then trigger the TRIGGERTEXTSELECTION, so that the corresponding selection will be executed on client side as part of the response processing.

The value of TEXTSELECTION is a comma separated string of integer values:

1. the caret position
2. the begin of selection
3. the end of selection
4. the left-pixel position within the component
5. the top-pixel position within the component
6. the height of the selected text

As consequence you can now open dialog popups directly below the selected text.

For finding the text position we use some external JS-library "caret.js". Please find details here: https://github.com/ichord/Caret.js

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTextEditor}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Text editor" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Presse ctrl-space within the editor:" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:textarea id="MYEDITOR" actionListener="#{d.DemoTextEditor.onOpenDialog}" height="100%" popupmenu="TEXTEDITORMENU" requestfocus="#{d.DemoTextEditor.textRequestFocus}" selectallwhenfocussed="false" text="#{d.DemoTextEditor.text}" textselectioninfo="#{d.DemoTextEditor.textSelectionInfo}" triggertextselection="#{d.DemoTextEditor.trigger}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:button id="g_8" text="Sync" width="100+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Server side data" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="Selection" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_13" text="#{d.DemoTextEditor.textSelectionInfo}" width="100%" />
<t:coldistance id="g_14" />
<t:button id="g_15" actionListener="#{d.DemoTextEditor.onSelectAction}" text="Select in text area" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" rendered="false" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="Text" width="100" />
<t:textpane id="g_18" text="#{d.DemoTextEditor.text}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:popupmenu id="TEXTEDITORMENU" >
<t:menuitem id="g_19" command="AAA" hotkey="ctrl-32" text="Insert &#34;aaa&#34;" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.OKPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.OKPopup.IOKListener;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.session.RequestFocusManager;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTextEditor}")

public class DemoTextEditor
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_text = "This is some to be edited.";
    Trigger m_trigger = new Trigger();
    
    // important to be set, so that the client knows that text selection should
    // be transferred! The value "-1;-1;-1" will be ignored on client side
    String m_textSelectionInfo = "-1;-1;-1"; 
    long m_textRequestFocus;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoTextEditor(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotexteditor.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoTextEditor}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public Trigger getTrigger() { return m_trigger; }

    public String getTextSelectionInfo() { return m_textSelectionInfo; }
    public void setTextSelectionInfo(String value) { this.m_textSelectionInfo = value; }

    public String getText() { return m_text; }
    public void setText(String value) { this.m_text = value; }

    public void onOpenDialog(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        // a popup is opened at the text position. In the example we use a
        // simple OK-popup, but you can take any other Modeless- or ModalPopup
        // instance, of course!
        try
        {
            int[] selectionInfos = ValueManager.decodeStraightIntCSV(m_textSelectionInfo);
            final int caretPos = selectionInfos[0];
            final int selBegin = selectionInfos[1];
            final int selEnd = selectionInfos[2];
            final int caretLeft = selectionInfos[3];
            final int caretTop = selectionInfos[4];
            final int caretHeight = selectionInfos[5];
            String selectedText = m_text.substring(selBegin,selEnd);
            OKPopup okp = OKPopup.createInstance
            (
                "A dialog",
                "This dialog should be opened close to the text caret position.\n\n"
                + "The text selected by the user is: " + selectedText + "\n\n"
                + "After pressing OK, \"aaa\" will be added at the caret position and some text selection will be executed.",
                new IOKListener()
                {
                    @Override
                    public void reactOnOK()
                    {
                        if (caretPos >= 0)
                        {
                            m_text = m_text.substring(0,selBegin) +
                                     "aaa" +
                                     m_text.substring(selEnd);
                            m_textSelectionInfo = caretPos + ";" + caretPos + ";" + (caretPos+3);
                            m_trigger.trigger();
                        }
                        else
                        {
                            m_text += "aaa";
                        }
                    }
                }
            );
            ModalPopup mp = okp.getModalPopup();
            // the x,y position is the same as the text are node's x,y position,
            // but shifted by the x,y position of the selection
            mp.setLeftTopReferenceComponentIdOver("MYEDITOR");
            mp.setLeft(caretLeft); 
            mp.setTop(caretTop+caretHeight);
            // optional: explicit sizing
            mp.setWidth(400); // optional: explicit sizing
            mp.setHeight(300); // optional: explicit sizing
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Opened popup at: " + caretLeft + "/" + (caretTop+caretHeight));
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            t.printStackTrace();
            Statusbar.outputAlert(t.toString());
        }
    }

    public long getTextRequestFocus() { return m_textRequestFocus; }

    public void onSelectAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_textRequestFocus = RequestFocusManager.getNewRequestFocusCounter();
        m_trigger.trigger();
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Field with remove icon

By setting attribute WITHREMOVEICON an explicit remove icons is a added to the field control.

The attribute is available for all field controls, including: FIELD, PASSWORD, COMBOFIELD, COMBOBOX, LONGTEXTFIELD.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoFieldWithRemoveIcon}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFieldWithRemoveIcon}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:label id="g_4" text="Field" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_5" clientname="test" text="#{d.DemoFieldWithRemoveIcon.someText}" width="150" withremoveicon="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" text="Long text" width="100" />
<t:longtextfield id="g_8" text="#{d.DemoFieldWithRemoveIcon.someLongText}" width="150" withremoveicon="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="Formatted field" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_11" align="right" format="int" value="#{d.DemoFieldWithRemoveIcon.someInt}" width="150" withremoveicon="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="Combo Field" width="100" />
<t:combofield id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoFieldWithRemoveIcon.onDepartmentAction}" flush="true" text="#{d.DemoFieldWithRemoveIcon.someDepartment}" width="150" withremoveicon="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_16" text="Combobox" width="100" />
<t:combobox id="g_17" actionListener="#{d.DemoFieldWithRemoveIcon.onDepartmentAction}" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoFieldWithRemoveIcon.costCenterVVS}" value="#{d.DemoFieldWithRemoveIcon.someCostCenter}" width="150" withremoveicon="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" text="Spinner" width="100" />
<t:spinner id="g_20" actionListener="#{d.DemoFieldWithRemoveIcon.onDepartmentAction}" flush="true" value="#{d.DemoFieldWithRemoveIcon.someSpinnerInt}" width="150" withremoveicon="true" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ISetId;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdTextSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventValueHelp;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFieldWithRemoveIcon}")

public class DemoFieldWithRemoveIcon
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    int m_someInt = 4711;
    String m_someText = "Test";
    String m_someDepartment = "SALES";
    ValidValuesBinding m_costCenterVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();
    String m_someCostCenter = "CC_1";
    String m_someLongText = "Some long text";
    int m_someSpinnerInt = 10;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoFieldWithRemoveIcon(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        for (int i=0; i<20; i++)
            m_costCenterVVS.addValidValue("CC_"+i,"Cost center " + i);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demofieldwithremoveicon.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoFieldWithRemoveIcon}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public ValidValuesBinding getCostCenterVVS() { return m_costCenterVVS; }

    public String getSomeCostCenter() { return m_someCostCenter; }
    public void setSomeCostCenter(String value) { this.m_someCostCenter = value; }

    public int getSomeInt() { return m_someInt; }
    public void setSomeInt(int value) { this.m_someInt = value; }

    public String getSomeText() { return m_someText; }
    public void setSomeText(String value) { this.m_someText = value; }

    public String getSomeDepartment() { return m_someDepartment; }
    public void setSomeDepartment(String value) { this.m_someDepartment = value; }

    public void onDepartmentAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventValueHelp)
        {
            IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createInstance();
            idts.addLine("SALES","Sales");
            idts.addLine("PROD","Production");
            idts.addLine("HR","Human Resources");
            idts.setCallBack(new ISetId()
            {
                @Override
                public void setId(String id)
                {
                    m_someDepartment = id;
                }
            });
        }
    }

    public String getSomeLongText() { return m_someLongText; }
    public void setSomeLongText(String value) { this.m_someLongText = value; }

    public int getSomeSpinnerInt() { return m_someSpinnerInt; }
    public void setSomeSpinnerInt(int value) { this.m_someSpinnerInt = value; }

}

Input of "strange" characters
Key variant selection

The key variant popup is activated by adding KEYVARIANTSSUPPORT to "true".

The definition of the key variants is kept in a server-side XML file, by default the file "/eclntjsfserver/keyvariants/ccdefault.xml" is used - but you can define an own definition and reference this one using attribute KEYVARIANTSLAYOUT.

The hot key (default: alt-k) can be defined using attribute CLIENTCONFIG-KEYVARIANTSHOTKEY.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoFieldKeyVariants}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFieldKeyVariants}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:textpane id="g_4" text="Press alt-K (&#34;K&#34; for key) after the input of a character in the following text field. A dialog will show up in which you can select character variants." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_5" height="30" />
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:field id="g_7" keyvariantssupport="true" labeltext="Field with key-variant-support, press &#34;alt-K&#34;" text="#{d.DemoFieldKeyVariants.text}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFieldKeyVariants}")

public class DemoFieldKeyVariants
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_text = "\u0054\u0068\u0069\u0073\u0020\u0074\u1EC5\u0078\u0074"
            + "\u0020\u0063\u006F\u006E\u0074\u00E6\u0069\u006E\u0073"
            + "\u0304\u0020\u0073\u0074\u0072\u0061\u006E\u01E5\u1EC7"
            + "\u0020\u0188\u0068\u0061\u0072\u0061\u0063\u021B\u0065\u0072\u0073\u0021";

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoFieldKeyVariants(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demofieldkeyvariants.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoFieldKeyVariants}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getText() { return m_text; }
    public void setText(String value) { this.m_text = value; }
}

Virtual keyboard on demand

You can explicitly open a touch dialog by defining a keyboard short cut. Use attribute TOUCHOPENSHOTKEY to do so.

Typical use case: you want to provide a selection of keys that are not reach-able via the user's keyboard.

The layout of the keyboard can be customized. Please check the demos in the area of "Touch Screen" to see details about the configuration.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoTouchOpenHotkey}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTouchOpenHotkey}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:field id="g_4" labeltext="A text - press ctrl-space for opening touch support" text="#{d.DemoTouchOpenHotkey.text1}" touchlayout="strangekeys1" touchopenhotkey="ctrl-32" width="100%;100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_6" format="int" labeltext="An integer number - press ctrl-space for opening touch support" touchopenhotkey="ctrl-32" value="#{d.DemoTouchOpenHotkey.number1}" width="100%;100" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTouchOpenHotkey}")

public class DemoTouchOpenHotkey
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    int m_number1;
    String m_text1 = "Some text";
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoTouchOpenHotkey(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotouchopenhotkey.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoTouchOpenHotkey}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public int getNumber1() { return m_number1; }
    public void setNumber1(int value) { this.m_number1 = value; }

    public String getText1() { return m_text1; }
    public void setText1(String value) { this.m_text1 = value; }

}

Invokers

Various Buttons

The button can be formatted in various way - as you can see.

Please pay attention: the normal button comes with a coloring that depends on the Java look and feel that you use. There is an attribute CONTENTAREAFILLED that you need to explicitly define to be "false" prior to using BACKGROUND, BGPAINT and FOREGROUND. - The same is true for borders: a button without borders requires CONTENTAREAFILLED to be set to "false".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoButton}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Normal Button" width="120" />
<t:button id="g_4" text="Normal Button" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Button with Image" width="120" />
<t:button id="g_7" image="/images/iconssvg/arrowright_green_16x16.svg" text="Button with Image" />
<t:coldistance id="g_8" width="5" />
<t:button id="g_9" horizontaltextposition="left" image="/images/iconssvg/arrowright_red_16x16.svg" text="Button with Image" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="Button with Image" width="120" />
<t:button id="g_12" background="#ffc0c0" image="/images/iconssvg/arrowright_green_16x16.svg" text="Button with Background" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:label id="g_14" text="Content area unfilled" width="120" />
<t:button id="g_15" contentareafilled="false" image="/images/iconssvg/arrowright_green_16x16.svg" text="Unfilled" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="Rounded" width="120" />
<t:button id="g_18" image="/images/iconssvg/arrowright_green_16x16.svg" rounding="8" text="Rounded" />
<t:coldistance id="g_19" width="5" />
<t:button id="g_20" image="/images/iconssvg/arrowright_green_16x16.svg" rounding="16" text="Rounded" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:label id="g_22" text="...explicitly sized" width="120" />
<t:button id="g_23" height="50" text="...explicitly sized" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_24" height="10" />
<t:rowline id="g_25" />
<t:rowdistance id="g_26" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_27" >
<t:label id="g_28" text="Icon" width="120" />
<t:icon id="g_29" image="/images/iconssvg/envelope_32x32.svg" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_30" >
<t:label id="g_31" text="Icon with text" width="120" />
<t:icon id="g_32" horizontaltextposition="center" image="/images/iconssvg/envelope_32x32.svg" text="Some Text" verticaltextposition="bottom" />
<t:coldistance id="g_33" width="20" />
<t:icon id="g_34" horizontaltextposition="center" image="/images/iconssvg/envelope_32x32.svg" text="Some Text" verticaltextposition="top" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_35" >
<t:label id="g_36" text="Hover/Pressed" width="120" />
<t:icon id="g_37" horizontaltextposition="center" image="/images/iconssvg/envelope_32x32.svg" imagepressed="/images/iconssvg/envelope_green_32x32.svg" imagerollover="/images/iconssvg/envelope_yellow_32x32.svg" text="Some Text" verticaltextposition="bottom" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_38" >
<t:label id="g_39" text="Border" width="120" />
<t:icon id="g_40" background="#ffd965" border="#808080" height="56" horizontaltextposition="center" image="/images/iconssvg/envelope_32x32.svg" verticaltextposition="bottom" width="56" />
<t:coldistance id="g_41" width="20" />
<t:icon id="g_42" background="#c5e0b3" border="#808080" height="56" horizontaltextposition="center" image="/images/iconssvg/envelope_32x32.svg" rounding="32" verticaltextposition="bottom" width="56" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_43" height="10" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoButton extends PageBean
{

    public DemoButton(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("button"); 
    }

}

Links

The LINK component is a nice, lightweight component for invoking server side functions.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoLink}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:link id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.demoLink.onLink}" text="Press this link!" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:link id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.demoLink.onLink}" font="size:20" text="Press this link!" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:link id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.demoLink.onLink}" font="size:9" text="Press this link!" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:link id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.demoLink.onLink}" font="size:20" foreground="#6c0000" text="Press this link!" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:link id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.demoLink.onLink}" font="size:20;weight:bold" foreground="#00006c" linkinvokedcolor="#FFFF00" text="Press this link!" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:link id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.demoLink.onLink}" image="/images/iconssvg/arrowright_green_16x16.svg" text="Press this link!" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.util.Date;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoLink extends PageBean
{
    public DemoLink(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("link"); 
    }

    public void onLink(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Link was pressed. " + (new Date()).toString());
    }
}

Vertical Links

The LINKVERTICAL component is a text that can be clicked by the user. It provides certain roll-over effect that are similar to what users know from browser-links.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoLinkVertical}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:linkvertical id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoLinkVertical.onLinkPressed}" rowalignmenty="bottom" text="Vertical Link" />
<t:linkvertical id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoLinkVertical.onLinkPressed}" font="size:16;weight:bold" rowalignmenty="bottom" text="Vertical Link" />
<t:linkvertical id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoLinkVertical.onLinkPressed}" font="size:26;weight:bold" foreground="#0000FF" linkinvokedcolor="#FFFF00" text="Vertical Link" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoLinkVertical}")

public class DemoLinkVertical
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoLinkVertical(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("linkvertical"); 
    }

    public void onLinkPressed(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        getOwningDispatcher().getStatusbar().outputSuccess("Link was pressed!");
    }
}

Button - Click/DoubleClick

By default the button reacts on single click events - using the left mouse button.
Double-clicks are by default not transferred to the server in order to not invoke a server side action twice by accident.

You can allow double- and multiple clicks by defining the attribute DOUBLECLICKENABLED as "true".

In addition you can fine-granularly control the "quality of mouse clicks" by using the INVOKEEVENT attribute.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoButtonClick}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="&#34;Straight&#34; Usage" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="No double clicking" width="150" />
<t:button id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoButtonClick.onPressMe}" doubleclickenabled="false" text="Click me!" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="Fast clicking supported" width="150" />
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoButtonClick.onPressMe}" doubleclickenabled="true" text="Click me!" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Explicit control via INVOKEEVENT" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:label id="g_14" text="Double click only" width="150" />
<t:button id="g_15" actionListener="#{d.DemoButtonClick.onPressMe}" doubleclickenabled="true" invokeevent="doubleclick" text="Double-click me!" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="Right Mouse Click" width="150" />
<t:button id="g_18" actionListener="#{d.DemoButtonClick.onPressMe}" invokeevent="rightclick" text="Right-click me!" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventInvoke;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ClientTestLog;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IClientLogAware;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoButtonClick}")

public class DemoButtonClick
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable, IClientLogAware
{
    int m_counter = 0;
    
    public DemoButtonClick(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        initRefComponent("button"); 
    }

    public void onPressMe(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventInvoke)
        {
            BaseActionEventInvoke e = (BaseActionEventInvoke)event;
            m_counter++;
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Button was pressed ("+m_counter+"). Click count: " + e.getClickCount());
        }
    }

    public boolean onCreateClientTestLogMessage()
    {
        ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage("Counter = " + m_counter);
        return true;
    }


}

Button - Image Sizing

When defining an image with a BUTTON / ICON / ICONSEPTEXT component then you can explicitly define an image sizing by using the attributes IMAGEHEIGHT and IMAGEWIDTH.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoButtonImageSizing}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="No explicit sizing" width="150" />
<t:button id="g_4" image="/images/iconssvg/arrowright_green_16x16.svg" text="Some text" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="50 x 50" width="150" />
<t:button id="g_7" image="/images/iconssvg/arrowright_green_16x16.svg" imageheight="50" imagewidth="50" text="Some text" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="100 x 50" width="150" />
<t:button id="g_10" image="/images/iconssvg/arrowright_green_16x16.svg" imageheight="50" imagewidth="100" text="Some text" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="100 x 50, fit mode &#34;cover&#34;" width="150" />
<t:button id="g_13" image="/images/iconssvg/arrowright_green_16x16.svg" imagefitmode="cover" imageheight="50" imagewidth="100" text="Some text" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_14" height="20" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoButtonImageSizing}")

public class DemoButtonImageSizing
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoButtonImageSizing(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        initRefComponent("password"); 
    }
}

Button image definition

BUTTON and ICON provide some attributes to explicitly define the image that may be shown. These attributes are:

(.) IMAGEHEIGHT/WIDTH for sizing the image (please always use both!)
(.) IMAGEBACKGROUND for coloring the background of the image area
(.) IMAGEBORDERWIDTH, IMAGEBORDERCOLOR for defining the border
(.) IMAGEROUNDING for defining the radius that is applied to background and border

As result you are able to customize the image part, e.g. to have a rounded background - and to not influence e.g. the background of the whole button - including the button text.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoButtonImage}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="No explicit configuration" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:button id="g_5" image="/images/icons/clock_dark.png" text="button" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Background and border configuration" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Image background, border, rounding" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_11" image="/images/icons/clock_dark.png" imagebackground="#E0E0FF" imagebordercolor="#808080" imageborderwidth="1" imagerounding="50%" text="button" />
<t:button id="g_12" image="/images/icons/clock_dark.png" imagebackground="#E0FFE0" imagebordercolor="#808080" imageborderwidth="1" imagerounding="50%" text="button" />
<t:button id="g_13" image="/images/icons/clock_light.png" imagebackground="#800000" imagebordercolor="#808080" imageborderwidth="1" imagerounding="50%" text="button" />
<t:button id="g_14" image="/images/icons/clock_light.png" imagebackground="#008000" imagebordercolor="#808080" imageborderwidth="1" imagerounding="50%" text="button" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_16" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Without button background" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_18" contentareafilled="false" image="/images/icons/clock_light.png" imagebackground="#800000" imagebordercolor="#808080" imageborderwidth="1" imagerounding="50%" text="button" />
<t:button id="g_19" contentareafilled="false" image="/images/icons/clock_light.png" imagebackground="#008000" imagebordercolor="#808080" imageborderwidth="1" imagerounding="50%" text="button" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:label id="g_21" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Image that is cut out, with text below" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:button id="g_23" contentareafilled="false" image="/images/pictures/photo0.gif" imagebordercolor="#000000" imageborderwidth="2" imageheight="50" imagerounding="50%" imagewidth="50" text="Image A" verticaltextposition="bottom" />
<t:button id="g_24" contentareafilled="false" image="/images/pictures/photo1.gif" imagebordercolor="#000000" imageborderwidth="2" imageheight="50" imagerounding="50%" imagewidth="50" text="Image B" verticaltextposition="bottom" />
<t:button id="g_25" contentareafilled="false" image="/images/pictures/photo2.gif" imagebordercolor="#000000" imageborderwidth="2" imageheight="50" imagerounding="50%" imagewidth="50" text="Image C" verticaltextposition="bottom" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoButtonImage}")

public class DemoButtonImage
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoButtonImage(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demobuttonimage.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoButtonImage}"; }

}

Rounded Icons

This demo shows how to style rounded icons. The core attributes to use are:

1. WIDTH/HEIGHT - to explicitly define the dimension of the icon
2. ROUNDING - to define the rounding of edges
3. BACKGROUND - to define the background behind the icon

ROUNDING is available with a lot of components. The defaut rounding comes from the CSS definitions - but can be overridden, as show in this example.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoIconRounding}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Some mall rounded icons" />
</t:row>
<t:rowheader id="g_4" coldistance="5" padding="10" >
<t:button id="g_5" background="#70ad47" contentareafilled="false" height="24" image="/images/icons_16/search_light.png" rounding="12" width="24" />
<t:button id="g_6" background="#4472c4" contentareafilled="false" height="24" image="/images/icons_16/refresh_light.png" rounding="12" width="24" />
<t:button id="g_7" background="#ed7d31" contentareafilled="false" height="24" image="/images/icons_16/alarm_light.png" rounding="12" width="24" />
</t:rowheader>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Some big rounded icons" />
</t:row>
<t:rowheader id="g_10" coldistance="10" padding="10" >
<t:button id="g_11" background="#70ad47" contentareafilled="false" height="50" image="/images/icons_32/search_light.png" rounding="25" width="50" />
<t:button id="g_12" background="#4472c4" contentareafilled="false" height="50" image="/images/icons_32/refresh_light.png" rounding="25" width="50" />
<t:button id="g_13" background="#ed7d31" contentareafilled="false" height="50" image="/images/icons_32/alarm_light.png" rounding="25" width="50" />
</t:rowheader>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Some big rounded icons" />
</t:row>
<t:rowheader id="g_16" coldistance="5" padding="10" >
<t:button id="g_17" background="#70ad47" contentareafilled="false" foreground="#FFFFFF" height="24" image="/images/icons_16/search_light.png" rounding="12" text="Search" />
<t:button id="g_18" background="#4472c4" contentareafilled="false" foreground="#FFFFFF" height="24" image="/images/icons_16/refresh_light.png" rounding="12" text="Refresh" />
<t:button id="g_19" background="#ed7d31" contentareafilled="false" foreground="#FFFFFF" height="24" image="/images/icons_16/alarm_light.png" rounding="12" text="Alarm" />
</t:rowheader>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoIconRounding}")

public class DemoIconRounding
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoIconRounding(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoiconrounding.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoIconRounding}"; }
}

Vertical button

The component BUTTONVERTICAL is just a normal button, but rotated.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoButtonVertical}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Sized by content" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" coldistance="5" >
<t:buttonvertical id="g_5" text="Test Button" />
<t:buttonvertical id="g_6" image="/images/iconssvg/welcomedb_32x32.svg" text="Test Button" />
<t:buttonvertical id="g_7" text="Short text" />
<t:buttonvertical id="g_8" text="Loooooooooooooooooong text" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Explicitly sized" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" coldistance="5" >
<t:buttonvertical id="g_12" height="200" image="/images/iconssvg/welcomedb_32x32.svg" text="Test Button" />
<t:buttonvertical id="g_13" height="200" image="/images/iconssvg/welcomedb_32x32.svg" text="Test Button" width="60" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.PageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoButtonVertical}")

public class DemoButtonVertical
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoButtonVertical(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demobuttonvertical.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoButtonVertical}"; }
}

Button with HTML text

By assigning a text in the format "<html>...</html>" the text is passed as HTML content into the component.

Internally the client does some HTML-sanitizing against the HTML 4.0 standard in order to avoid cross site scriping attacks. Example: the sanitizing e.g. also removes the "src" attribute of images, because you/someone may pass "javascript:" statements inside. As consequence images have to be passed by using e.g. SPAN or other HTML elements - together with some background styling.

Please note: the height-sizing of the button by default follows the font that is used within the button (FONT attribute, if not set: style). Only if the button text contains some "<br>" then the height will be calculated by analyzing the contained HTML text.

Please note: from performance point of view "<html>...</html>" buttons are slower than buttons with plain text. You should only use this feature when rendering HTML-content!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoButtonHtml}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Default: HTML is NOT parsed" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:button id="g_5" text="&lt;u&gt;P&lt;/u&gt;ress &lt;span style=&#34;color:#800000&#34;&gt;here&lt;/span&gt;" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_6" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Use &#34;&lt;html&gt;...&lt;/html&gt;&#34;!" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_10" text="&lt;html&gt;&lt;u&gt;P&lt;/u&gt;ress &lt;span style=&#34;color:#800000&#34;&gt;here&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/html&gt;" />
<t:button id="g_11" text="&lt;html&gt;&lt;u&gt;S&lt;/u&gt;ave file&lt;/html&gt;" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:button id="g_13" align="right" text="&lt;html&gt;This&lt;br&gt;is&lt;br&gt;a nice example for a&lt;br&gt;multiline&lt;br&gt;button&lt;/html&gt;" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:button id="g_15" text="&lt;html&gt;You may pass &lt;span style=&#39;display: inline-block;height:20px;width:20px;background:url(images/icons/car.png) no-repeat center&#39;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt; images.&lt;/html&gt;" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_16" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:label id="g_18" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Same with LINK, TABBEDLINE, ..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:label id="g_20" text="Link" width="100" />
<t:link id="g_21" text="&lt;html&gt;&lt;u&gt;P&lt;/u&gt;ress &lt;span style=&#34;color:#800000&#34;&gt;here&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/html&gt;" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:label id="g_23" text="Tabbed line" width="100" />
<t:tabbedline id="g_24" >
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_25" text="&lt;html&gt;&lt;u&gt;F&lt;/u&gt;ile&lt;/html&gt;" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_26" text="&lt;html&gt;&lt;u&gt;F&lt;/u&gt;ile&lt;/html&gt;" />
</t:tabbedline>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_27" >
<t:label id="g_28" text="Menu item" width="100" />
<t:menubar id="g_29" >
<t:menu id="g_30" text="&lt;html&gt;&lt;u&gt;F&lt;/u&gt;ile&lt;/html&gt;" >
<t:menuitem id="g_31" text="&lt;html&gt;&lt;u&gt;S&lt;/u&gt;ave file and exit&lt;/html&gt;" />
</t:menu>
</t:menubar>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoButtonHtml}")

public class DemoButtonHtml
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /* Listener to the user of the page bean. */
    public interface IListener
    {
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private IListener m_listener;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoButtonHtml(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demobuttonhtml.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoButtonHtml}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /* Initialization of the bean. Add any parameter that is required within your scenario. */
    public void prepare(IListener listener)
    {
        m_listener = listener;
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Button with long click

When setting attribute BUTTON-WITHLONGCLICK to "true" then the user may press the button for a while. Triggered by some internal timer an invoke-roundtrip will be started automatically.

In addition you my set BUTTON-WITHLONGCLICKENDEVENT to "true". Then you get some additional notification when the user actually finished the long clicking and releases the mouse button.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoButtonLongClick}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoButtonLongClick}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:button id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoButtonLongClick.onNormalButtonAction}" text="Normal button" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_5" />
<t:row id="g_6" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoButtonLongClick.onLongClickButtonAction}" text="Long click button" width="200" withlongclick="true" />
<t:label id="g_8" text="&#34;simple&#34;" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoButtonLongClick.onLongClickButtonAction}" text="Long click button" width="200" withlongclick="true" withlongclickendevent="true" />
<t:label id="g_11" text="with end of long click notification" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoButtonLongClick.onLongClickButtonAction}" dragsend="test:test" text="Long click button" width="200" withlongclick="true" withlongclickendevent="true" />
<t:label id="g_14" text="...and with drag/drop..." />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_15" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="Protocol" />
<t:coldistance id="g_18" width="100%" />
<t:link id="g_19" actionListener="#{d.DemoButtonLongClick.onClearProtocolAction}" text="Clear protocol" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:textarea id="g_21" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoButtonLongClick.protocol}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:rowstatusbar id="g_22" />
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventInvoke;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventLongClickEnd;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoButtonLongClick}")

public class DemoButtonLongClick
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_protocol = "";

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoButtonLongClick(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demobuttonlongclick.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoButtonLongClickUI}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getProtocol() { return m_protocol; }
    public void setProtocol(String value) { this.m_protocol = value; }

    public void onLongClickButtonAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventInvoke)
        {
            BaseActionEventInvoke e = (BaseActionEventInvoke)event;
            m_protocol += "Long Click Button Action: long click = " + e.isLongClick() + "\n";
        }
        else if (event instanceof BaseActionEventLongClickEnd)
        {
            m_protocol += "Long Click Button Action: long click ended\n";
        }
    }

    public void onNormalButtonAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        BaseActionEventInvoke e = (BaseActionEventInvoke)event;
        m_protocol += "Normal Button Action: long click = " + e.isLongClick() + "\n";
    }

    public void onClearProtocolAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_protocol = "";
    }
