    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Font icons

The FONTICON is a button/icon that uses an image font for rendering its image.

In the icon you need to reference the font-family and the character hex code of the character.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoFontIcon}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFontIcon}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:label id="g_4" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Awesome font" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" coldistance="5" >
<t:fonticon id="g_6" fontfamily="FontAwesome" foreground="#606060" iconhexcode="f007" iconsize="16" />
<t:fonticon id="g_7" fontfamily="FontAwesome" foreground="#606060" iconhexcode="f055" iconsize="16" />
<t:fonticon id="g_8" fontfamily="FontAwesome" foreground="#606060" iconhexcode="f087" iconsize="16" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" coldistance="5" >
<t:fonticon id="g_10" fontfamily="FontAwesome" foreground="#800000" iconhexcode="f007" iconsize="16" />
<t:fonticon id="g_11" fontfamily="FontAwesome" foreground="#008000" iconhexcode="f055" iconsize="16" />
<t:fonticon id="g_12" fontfamily="FontAwesome" foreground="#000080" iconhexcode="f087" iconsize="16" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" coldistance="5" >
<t:fonticon id="g_14" background="#70ad47" border="0" fontfamily="FontAwesome" foreground="#FFFFFF" height="48" iconhexcode="f007" iconsize="20" rounding="100%" width="48" />
<t:fonticon id="g_15" background="#ffd965" border="0" fontfamily="FontAwesome" foreground="#FFFFFF" height="48" iconhexcode="f055" iconsize="20" rounding="100%" width="48" />
<t:fonticon id="g_16" background="#2f5496" border="0" fontfamily="FontAwesome" foreground="#FFFFFF" height="48" iconhexcode="f087" iconsize="20" rounding="100%" width="48" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" coldistance="5" >
<t:fonticon id="g_18" contentareafilled="false" fontfamily="FontAwesome" foreground="#800000" iconhexcode="f007" iconsize="16" />
<t:fonticon id="g_19" contentareafilled="false" fontfamily="FontAwesome" foreground="#008000" iconhexcode="f055" iconsize="16" />
<t:fonticon id="g_20" contentareafilled="false" fontfamily="FontAwesome" foreground="#000080" iconhexcode="f087" iconsize="16" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_21" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:label id="g_23" stylevariant="ccbig" text="SAP icon font" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" coldistance="5" >
<t:fonticon id="g_25" fontfamily="SAPIcons" foreground="#606060" iconhexcode="e086" iconsize="16" />
<t:fonticon id="g_26" fontfamily="SAPIcons" foreground="#606060" iconhexcode="e087" iconsize="16" />
<t:fonticon id="g_27" fontfamily="SAPIcons" foreground="#606060" iconhexcode="e085" iconsize="16" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_28" coldistance="5" >
<t:fonticon id="g_29" fontfamily="SAPIcons" foreground="#800000" iconhexcode="e086" iconsize="16" />
<t:fonticon id="g_30" fontfamily="SAPIcons" foreground="#008000" iconhexcode="e087" iconsize="16" />
<t:fonticon id="g_31" fontfamily="SAPIcons" foreground="#000080" iconhexcode="e085" iconsize="16" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_32" coldistance="5" >
<t:fonticon id="g_33" contentareafilled="false" fontfamily="SAPIcons" foreground="#800000" iconhexcode="e086" iconsize="16" />
<t:fonticon id="g_34" contentareafilled="false" fontfamily="SAPIcons" foreground="#008000" iconhexcode="e087" iconsize="16" />
<t:fonticon id="g_35" contentareafilled="false" fontfamily="SAPIcons" foreground="#000080" iconhexcode="e085" iconsize="16" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFontIcon}")

public class DemoFontIcon
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoFontIcon(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        initRefComponent("fonticon"); 
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demofonticon.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoFontIcon}"; }
    
    public void onIconAction(ActionEvent event)
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccessWithPopup("Icon was pressed!");
    }

}

Avatar icon

The AVATORICON is a special icon that is used to render icons showing a person's image or - if not available - its initials. Of course it can be used for any similar purposes as well.

If no image is available and no explicit background color is defined then some background color is automatically chosen, which is derived from the TEXT that is passed.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoAvatarIcon}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoAvatarIcon}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:rowflexlinecontainer id="g_3" coldistance="5" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:avataricon id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoAvatarIcon.onIconAction}" iconsize="96" image="/images/pictures/avatar0.jpg" text="HUHU" />
<t:avataricon id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoAvatarIcon.onIconAction}" iconsize="96" image="/images/pictures/avatar0.jpg" rounding="30" text="HUHU" />
<t:avataricon id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoAvatarIcon.onIconAction}" image="/images/pictures/avatar0.jpg" />
<t:avataricon id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoAvatarIcon.onIconAction}" image="/images/pictures/avatar1.jpg" />
<t:avataricon id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.DemoAvatarIcon.onIconAction}" image="/images/pictures/avatar2.jpg" />
</t:rowflexlinecontainer>
<t:rowflexlinecontainer id="g_9" coldistance="5" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:avataricon id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoAvatarIcon.onIconAction}" iconsize="96" text="HH" />
<t:avataricon id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoAvatarIcon.onIconAction}" iconsize="96" rounding="30" text="BM" />
<t:avataricon id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoAvatarIcon.onIconAction}" text="HH" />
<t:avataricon id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoAvatarIcon.onIconAction}" text="BM" />
</t:rowflexlinecontainer>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoAvatarIcon}")

public class DemoAvatarIcon
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoAvatarIcon(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoavataricon.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoAvatarIcon}"; }

    public void onIconAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Icon was pressed. (" + System.currentTimeMillis() + ")");
    }
}

Button with number information (1)

You may place buttons inside an OVERLAYAREA and as result may add additional information on top.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoButtonWithNumber}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoButtonWithNumber}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_6" coldistance="10" >
<t:overlayarea id="g_3" >
<t:overlayareabaseitem id="g_8" >
<t:icon id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoButtonWithNumber.onRefreshAction}" font="size:10" image="/images.iconssvg.refresh.#538135.32x32.ccsvg" text="Refresh" verticaltextposition="bottom" width="50+" />
</t:overlayareabaseitem>
<t:overlayareaitem id="g_5" boundsanchor="righttop" x="100%" y="0" zindex="1" >
<t:label id="g_9" align="center" background="#FFFFFFB0" border="#800000" font="size:10;weight:bold" height="18" rounding="100" text="#{d.DemoButtonWithNumber.refreshItems}" width="18+" />
</t:overlayareaitem>
</t:overlayarea>
<t:overlayarea id="g_11" >
<t:overlayareabaseitem id="g_12" >
<t:icon id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoButtonWithNumber.onFilterAction}" font="size:10" image="/images.iconssvg.filter.#2f5496.32x32.ccsvg" text="Filter" verticaltextposition="bottom" width="50+" />
</t:overlayareabaseitem>
<t:overlayareaitem id="g_14" boundsanchor="righttop" x="100%" y="0" zindex="1" >
<t:label id="g_15" align="center" background="#FFFFFFB0" border="#800000" font="size:10;weight:bold" height="18" rounding="100" text="#{d.DemoButtonWithNumber.filterItems}" width="18+" />
</t:overlayareaitem>
</t:overlayarea>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:textpane id="g_10" text="Click onto the icons in order to change the numbers shown inside." width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoButtonWithNumber}")

public class DemoButtonWithNumber
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    int m_refreshItems = 1;
    int m_filterItems = 1;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoButtonWithNumber(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demobuttonwithnumber.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoButtonWithNumber}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public int getRefreshItems() { return m_refreshItems; }
    public void setRefreshItems(int value) { this.m_refreshItems = value; }

    public int getFilterItems() { return m_filterItems; }
    public void setFilterItems(int value) { this.m_filterItems = value; }

    public void onFilterAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_filterItems++;
    }

    public void onRefreshAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_refreshItems++;
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Button with number information (2)

This example shows the usage of OVERLAYAREA components to render label information on top of some icon component.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoOverlayButton}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoOverlayButton}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:label id="g_4" stylevariant="ccbig" text="ICON with overlayed PANE/LABEL" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" coldistance="10" >
<t:overlayarea id="g_6" >
<t:overlayareabaseitem id="g_7" >
<t:icon id="g_8" image="/images.iconssvg.refresh.#008000.48x48.ccsvg" />
</t:overlayareabaseitem>
<t:overlayareaitem id="g_9" x="2" y="2" >
<t:pane id="g_10" background="#FFFFFFD0" border="#008000" rounding="10" width="30" >
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" align="center" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="12" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:overlayareaitem>
</t:overlayarea>
<t:overlayarea id="g_13" >
<t:overlayareabaseitem id="g_14" >
<t:icon id="g_15" image="/images.iconssvg.refresh.#008000.48x48.ccsvg" />
</t:overlayareabaseitem>
<t:overlayareaitem id="g_16" boundsanchor="righttop" x="100%-2" y="2" >
<t:pane id="g_17" background="#FFFFFFD0" border="#008000" rounding="10" width="30" >
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" align="center" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="12" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:overlayareaitem>
</t:overlayarea>
<t:overlayarea id="g_20" >
<t:overlayareabaseitem id="g_21" >
<t:icon id="g_22" image="/images.iconssvg.refresh.#008000.48x48.ccsvg" />
</t:overlayareabaseitem>
<t:overlayareaitem id="g_23" boundsanchor="rightbottom" x="100%-2" y="100%-2" >
<t:pane id="g_24" background="#FFFFFFD0" border="#008000" rounding="10" width="30" >
<t:row id="g_25" >
<t:label id="g_26" align="center" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="12" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:overlayareaitem>
</t:overlayarea>
<t:overlayarea id="g_27" >
<t:overlayareabaseitem id="g_28" >
<t:icon id="g_29" image="/images.iconssvg.refresh.#008000.48x48.ccsvg" />
</t:overlayareabaseitem>
<t:overlayareaitem id="g_30" boundsanchor="leftbottom" x="2" y="100%-2" >
<t:pane id="g_31" background="#FFFFFFD0" border="#008000" rounding="10" width="30" >
<t:row id="g_32" >
<t:label id="g_33" align="center" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="12" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:overlayareaitem>
</t:overlayarea>
<t:overlayarea id="g_34" >
<t:overlayareabaseitem id="g_35" >
<t:icon id="g_36" image="/images.iconssvg.refresh.#008000.48x48.ccsvg" />
</t:overlayareabaseitem>
<t:overlayareaitem id="g_37" boundsanchor="centermiddle" x="50%" y="50%" >
<t:pane id="g_38" background="#FFFFFFD0" border="#008000" rounding="10" width="30" >
<t:row id="g_39" >
<t:label id="g_40" align="center" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="12" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:overlayareaitem>
</t:overlayarea>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_41" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_42" >
<t:label id="g_43" stylevariant="ccbig" text="...using SHOWONAREAMOUSEOVERONLY..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_44" coldistance="10" >
<t:overlayarea id="g_45" >
<t:overlayareabaseitem id="g_46" >
<t:icon id="g_47" image="/images.iconssvg.refresh.#008000.48x48.ccsvg" />
</t:overlayareabaseitem>
<t:overlayareaitem id="g_48" showonareamouseoveronly="true" x="2" y="2" >
<t:pane id="g_49" background="#FFFFFFD0" border="#008000" rounding="10" width="30" >
<t:row id="g_50" >
<t:label id="g_51" align="center" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="12" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:overlayareaitem>
</t:overlayarea>
<t:overlayarea id="g_52" >
<t:overlayareabaseitem id="g_53" >
<t:icon id="g_54" image="/images.iconssvg.refresh.#008000.48x48.ccsvg" />
</t:overlayareabaseitem>
<t:overlayareaitem id="g_55" boundsanchor="righttop" showonareamouseoveronly="true" x="100%-2" y="2" >
<t:pane id="g_56" background="#FFFFFFD0" border="#008000" rounding="10" width="30" >

<t:label id="g_58" align="center" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="12" width="100%" />

</t:overlayarea>
<t:overlayarea id="g_59" >

</t:overlayareabaseitem>

<t:pane id="g_63" background="#FFFFFFD0" border="#008000" rounding="10" width="30" >
<t:row id="g_64" >
<t:label id="g_65" align="center" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="12" width="100%" />
</t:row>

</t:overlayarea>
<t:overlayarea id="g_66" >

</t:overlayareabaseitem>

<t:pane id="g_70" background="#FFFFFFD0" border="#008000" rounding="10" width="30" >
<t:row id="g_71" >
<t:label id="g_72" align="center" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="12" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:overlayareaitem>
</t:overlayarea>
<t:overlayarea id="g_73" >
<t:overlayareabaseitem id="g_74" >
<t:icon id="g_75" image="/images.iconssvg.refresh.#008000.48x48.ccsvg" />
</t:overlayareabaseitem>
<t:overlayareaitem id="g_76" boundsanchor="centermiddle" showonareamouseoveronly="true" x="50%" y="50%" >
<t:pane id="g_77" background="#FFFFFFD0" border="#008000" rounding="10" width="30" >
<t:row id="g_78" >
<t:label id="g_79" align="center" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="12" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:overlayareaitem>
</t:overlayarea>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoOverlayButton}")

public class DemoOverlayButton
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoOverlayButton(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demooverlaybutton.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoOverlayButton}"; }

}

Hover resizing effects

The BUTTON and the PANE component provide a set of pre configured style variants that create a hover effect to resize the component. This hove effect is added into addition to coloring effects of the background.

The information about the hover effect is kept in the style. Example:

<class
n="riscbutton_withhoverresizemedium"
extends="riscbutton">
<risc
n="_hoverEffectResizeInsets"
v="5 5 5 5"/>
</class>

The CaptainCasa style definitions for the BUTTON and PANE component is made to server common use cases. You may set up the hover effects with all other components as well.

From the demo you see that the resizing effects automatically influence the sizing of the component, so that the space for resizing if automatically considered.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoButtonHoverEffect}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoButtonHoverEffect}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:label id="g_27" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Variant  &#34;default&#34; - no sizing effect" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_7" image="/images/iconssvg/demolayout_16x16.svg" text="Button 1" width="120+" />
<t:button id="g_9" image="/images/iconssvg/delete_16x16.svg" text="Button 2" width="120+" />
<t:button id="g_10" image="/images/iconssvg/edit_16x16.svg" text="Button 3" width="120+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_29" >
<t:label id="g_30" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Variant  &#34;cchoverresizesmall&#34;" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_13" image="/images/iconssvg/demolayout_16x16.svg" stylevariant="cchoverresizesmall" text="Button 1" width="120+" />
<t:button id="g_14" stylevariant="cchoverresizesmall" text="Button 2" width="120+" />
<t:button id="g_15" stylevariant="cchoverresizesmall" text="Button 3" width="120+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_32" >
<t:label id="g_33" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Variant  &#34;cchoverresizemedium&#34;" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_18" image="/images/iconssvg/demolayout_16x16.svg" stylevariant="cchoverresizemedium" text="Button 1" width="120+" />
<t:button id="g_19" stylevariant="cchoverresizemedium" text="Button 2" width="120+" />
<t:button id="g_20" stylevariant="cchoverresizemedium" text="Button 3" width="120+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_38" >
<t:pane id="g_2" border="#00000030" padding="10" shadow="hoffset:5;voffset:5;blur:3;color:#00000030" stylevariant="cchoverresizemedium" >
<t:rowdistance id="g_44" height="100%" />
<t:row id="g_39" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_41" image="/images/iconssvg/demolayout_16x16.svg" text="Button 1" width="100%;120" />
<t:button id="g_42" image="/images/iconssvg/delete_16x16.svg" text="Button 2" width="100%;120" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_45" height="100%" />
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_35" >
<t:label id="g_36" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Variant  &#34;cchoverresizetopmedium&#34;" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_23" image="/images/iconssvg/demolayout_16x16.svg" stylevariant="cchoverresizetopmedium" text="Button 1" width="120+" />
<t:button id="g_24" stylevariant="cchoverresizetopmedium" text="Button 2" width="120+" />
<t:button id="g_25" stylevariant="cchoverresizetopmedium" text="Button 3" width="120+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_47" >
<t:pane id="g_48" border="#00000030" padding="10" shadow="hoffset:5;voffset:5;blur:3;color:#00000030" stylevariant="cchoverresizetopmedium" >
<t:rowdistance id="g_49" height="100%" />
<t:row id="g_50" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_51" image="/images/iconssvg/demolayout_16x16.svg" text="Button 1" width="100%;120" />
<t:button id="g_52" image="/images/iconssvg/delete_16x16.svg" text="Button 2" width="100%;120" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_53" height="100%" />
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_55" >
<t:label id="g_56" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Variant  &#34;cchoverreflymedium&#34;" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_57" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_58" image="/images/iconssvg/demolayout_16x16.svg" stylevariant="cchoverflymedium" text="Button 1" width="120+" />
<t:button id="g_59" stylevariant="cchoverflymedium" text="Button 2" width="120+" />
<t:button id="g_60" stylevariant="cchoverflymedium" text="Button 3" width="120+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_61" >
<t:pane id="g_62" border="#00000030" padding="10" shadow="hoffset:5;voffset:5;blur:3;color:#00000030" stylevariant="cchoverflymedium" >
<t:rowdistance id="g_63" height="100%" />
<t:row id="g_64" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_65" image="/images/iconssvg/demolayout_16x16.svg" text="Button 1" width="100%;120" />
<t:button id="g_66" image="/images/iconssvg/delete_16x16.svg" text="Button 2" width="100%;120" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_67" height="100%" />
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoButtonHoverEffect}")

public class DemoButtonHoverEffect
    extends DemoPageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoButtonHoverEffect(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demobuttonhovereffect.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoButtonHoverEffect}"; }
}

Combobox and List

Fix definition of items

The COMBOBOX is bound to a VALUE-property on server-side.

By selecting a combobox item the corresponding ID of the item is passed into the VALUE-property.

In this demo the items are hard-coded as part of the layout. For each item there is a COMBOBOXITEM instance in the layout definition.

Please note: as any other input component a user selection is not immediately sent to the server-side but is queued within the client. You may switch attribute FLUSH to true if you want to immediately trigger a round-trip after user-selection.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoComboboxFix}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoComboboxFix}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:combobox id="g_7" labeltext="Department" value="#{d.DemoComboboxFix.department}" width="200" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_3" text="Sales" value="0001" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_9" text="Production" value="0002" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_10" text="Human Resources" value="0003" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_11" text="Development" value="0004" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoComboboxFix}")

public class DemoComboboxFix
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_department;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoComboboxFix(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democomboboxfix.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoComboboxFix}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getDepartment() { return m_department; }
    public void setDepartment(String value) { this.m_department = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Dynamic definition of items

In this demo the list of COMBOBOX-items is defined on server-side.

In addition to the COMBOBOX-VALUE (which points to the property which is shown/edited) you need to implement a property of class "ValidValuesBinding" and bind it by the COMBOBOX-VALIDVALUESBINDING attribute.

As you can see in the demo by pressing the "Show 10 items" button, the server-side logic may change the number of items any time.

Please note: as any other input component a user selection is not immediately sent to the server-side but is queued within the client. You may switch attribute FLUSH to true if you want to immediately trigger a round-trip after user-selection.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoComboboxDyn}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoComboboxDyn}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:combobox id="g_7" labeltext="Department" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoComboboxDyn.departmentVVB}" value="#{d.DemoComboboxDyn.department}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_11" height="50" />
<t:row id="g_3" />
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:textpane id="g_13" text="Press the following button - the number of available combo box items will be changed from 4 values to 10 values." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:button id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoComboboxDyn.onShow10Items}" text="Show 10 items" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoComboboxDyn}")

public class DemoComboboxDyn
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /* Listener to the user of the page bean. */
    public interface IListener extends Serializable
    {
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    ValidValuesBinding m_departmentVVB = new ValidValuesBinding();
    String m_department;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoComboboxDyn(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        fillComboboxValidValuesWith4Values();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democomboboxdyn.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoComboboxDyn}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public ValidValuesBinding getDepartmentVVB() { return m_departmentVVB; }

    public String getDepartment() { return m_department; }
    public void setDepartment(String value) { this.m_department = value; }
    
    public void onShow10Items(ActionEvent event)
    {
        fillComboboxValidValuesWith10Values();
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void fillComboboxValidValuesWith4Values()
    {
        m_departmentVVB.clear();
        m_departmentVVB.addValidValue("0001","Sales");
        m_departmentVVB.addValidValue("0002","Production");
        m_departmentVVB.addValidValue("0003","Human Resources");
        m_departmentVVB.addValidValue("0004","Development");
    }

    private void fillComboboxValidValuesWith10Values()
    {
        m_departmentVVB.clear();
        m_departmentVVB.addValidValue("0001","Sales");
        m_departmentVVB.addValidValue("0002","Production");
        m_departmentVVB.addValidValue("0003","Human Resources");
        m_departmentVVB.addValidValue("0004","Development");
        m_departmentVVB.addValidValue("0005","Department 5");
        m_departmentVVB.addValidValue("0006","Department 6");
        m_departmentVVB.addValidValue("0007","Department 7");
        m_departmentVVB.addValidValue("0008","Department 8");
        m_departmentVVB.addValidValue("0009","Department 9");
        m_departmentVVB.addValidValue("0010","Department 10");
    }

}

Combobox examples

A combo box manages a value that is selectable from a list of values. The value is internally represented as value + text, only the text is the one which is shown to the user - whereas the value is the one which is internally set and get into the corresponding property.

A combo box can be filled in three different ways:

(1) STATIC: You can define the items directly as part of the layout definition.

(2) DYNAMIC: You can define the items at backend side.

(3) DYNAMIC with ON DEMAND LOADING: in this case the complete list of values is only sent to the frontend when the user actually operates on the combo box, e.g. when the user clicks on the box to see the valid values.

Have a look into the coding of the adapter side: the valid values that are returned via getDepartmentVvb() method are null until an event from client side tells that the values are required. You also may observe what happens in the client: before the loading only the key of the value ("PROD") is shown - because no value-text information is sent to the client. After loading the full information is shown. If you want to avoid this effect then you can also send exactly one valid-values-item to the client, the one which represents the current value.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoCombo}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:pane id="g_3" padding="10" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Static definition of items within layout" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_6" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:coldistance id="g_8" width="50" />
<t:combobox id="g_9" flush="true" labeltext="Credit card" value="#{d.DemoCombo.creditcard}" width="200" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_10" text="Visa" value="V" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_11" text="Mastercard" value="M" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_12" text="American Express" value="A" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_13" text="Praktiker Baumarkt Kundenkarte" value="P" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_14" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_16" text="Flexible definition of output format for separating VALUE and TEXT:" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_17" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:coldistance id="g_19" width="50" />
<t:combobox id="g_20" flush="true" labeltext="Credit card" value="#{d.DemoCombo.creditcard}" valuetextmode="VALUE / TEXT" width="200" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_21" text="Visa" value="V" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_22" text="Mastercard" value="M" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_23" text="American Express" value="A" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_24" text="Praktiker Baumarkt Kundenkarte" value="P" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_25" >
<t:coldistance id="g_26" width="50" />
<t:combobox id="g_27" flush="true" labeltext="Credit card" value="#{d.DemoCombo.creditcard}" valuetextmode="TEXT (VALUE)" width="200" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_28" text="Visa" value="V" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_29" text="Mastercard" value="M" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_30" text="American Express" value="A" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_31" text="Praktiker Baumarkt Kundenkarte" value="P" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_32" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_33" >
<t:label id="g_34" text="Combo box that allows input" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_35" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_36" >
<t:coldistance id="g_37" width="50" />
<t:combobox id="g_38" editable="true" flush="true" labeltext="Credit card" value="#{d.DemoCombo.creditcard}" valuetextmode="TEXT" width="200" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_39" text="Visa" value="V" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_40" text="Mastercard" value="M" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_41" text="American Express" value="A" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_42" text="Praktiker Baumarkt Kundenkarte" value="P" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_43" >
<t:pane id="g_44" padding="10" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_45" >
<t:label id="g_46" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Dynamnic definition  + loading when starting the page" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_47" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_49" >
<t:coldistance id="g_50" width="50" />
<t:combobox id="g_51" editable="true" flush="true" labeltext="Title" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoCombo.titleVvb}" value="#{d.DemoCombo.title}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_53" >
<t:coldistance id="g_54" width="50" />
<t:combobox id="g_55" editable="true" flush="true" labeltext="Title" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoCombo.titleVvb}" value="#{d.DemoCombo.title}" valuetextmode="VALUE / TEXT" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_57" >
<t:coldistance id="g_58" width="50" />
<t:combobox id="g_59" drawoddevenrows="true" editable="false" flush="true" labeltext="100 values..." validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoCombo.numberVvb}" value="#{d.DemoCombo.number}" valuetextmode="VALUE / TEXT" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_60" height="5" />
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_61" height="50" />
<t:row id="g_62" >
<t:pane id="g_63" border="top:1;color:#C0C0C0" padding="10" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_64" >
<t:coldistance id="g_65" width="50" />
<t:button id="g_66" actionListener="#{d.DemoCombo.onOK}" hotkey="10" text="OK" width="100+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_67" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_68" >
<t:coldistance id="g_69" width="50" />
<t:textpane id="g_70" height="100" text="#{d.DemoCombo.result}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_71" >
<t:label id="g_72" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Font and list configuration" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_73" >
<t:label id="g_74" text="Font Size" width="150" />
<t:combobox id="g_75" flush="true" font="size:20" value="#{d.DemoCombo.creditcard}" width="200" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_76" text="Visa" value="V" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_77" text="Mastercard" value="M" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_78" text="American Express" value="A" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_79" text="Praktiker Baumarkt Kundenkarte" value="P" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_80" >
<t:label id="g_81" text="Item Font Size" width="150" />
<t:combobox id="g_82" flush="true" itemfont="size:20" value="#{d.DemoCombo.creditcard}" width="200" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_83" text="Visa" value="V" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_84" text="Mastercard" value="M" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_85" text="American Express" value="A" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_86" text="Praktiker Baumarkt Kundenkarte" value="P" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_87" >
<t:label id="g_88" text="Odd/Even coloring" width="150" />
<t:combobox id="g_89" drawoddevenrows="true" flush="true" value="#{d.DemoCombo.creditcard}" width="200" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_90" text="Visa" value="V" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_91" text="Mastercard" value="M" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_92" text="American Express" value="A" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_93" text="Praktiker Baumarkt Kundenkarte" value="P" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

//import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventLoadOnDemand;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.COMBOBOXComponent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ClientTestLog;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

/**
 * @author bmu
 *
 */
public class DemoCombo extends PageBean
{
    public class ValueText implements Serializable
    {
        String i_value;
        String i_text;
        public ValueText(String value, String text)
        {
            i_value = value;
            i_text = text;
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    ValueText[] DEPARTMENTS = new ValueText[]
                                            {
            new ValueText("SALES","Sales & Marketing"),
            new ValueText("FINANCE","Financials"),
            new ValueText("EXEC","Executive Board"),
            new ValueText("PROD","Production"),
            new ValueText("RND","Reserach & Development"),
            new ValueText("HR","Human Resources"),
                                            };    
    
    ValueText[] TITLES = new ValueText[]
                                            {
            new ValueText("1","Dr."),
            new ValueText("2","Prof."),
            new ValueText("3","Earl"),
            new ValueText("4","Prince of"),
                                            };    
    
    String m_creditcard;
    String m_title;
    String m_department;
    String m_number;
    
    ValidValuesBinding m_titleVvb;
    ValidValuesBinding m_departmentVvb;
    ValidValuesBinding m_numberVvb;
    
    COMBOBOXComponent m_titleCB;
    COMBOBOXComponent m_departmentCB;
    boolean m_loadDepartmentCB = false;
    
    String m_result = "Press OK to view result.";
    int m_idCounter = 0;    
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoCombo(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("combobox"); 
        m_department = DEPARTMENTS[3].i_value;
        m_creditcard = "V";
        // titles
        // m_title = TITLES[0].i_value;
        m_titleVvb = new ValidValuesBinding();
        for (int i=0; i<TITLES.length; i++)
            m_titleVvb.addValidValue(TITLES[i].i_value,TITLES[i].i_text);
        // departments
        m_departmentVvb = new ValidValuesBinding();
        for (int i=0; i<DEPARTMENTS.length; i++)
            m_departmentVvb.addValidValue(DEPARTMENTS[i].i_value,DEPARTMENTS[i].i_text);
        m_titleVvb.sortByName();
        m_departmentVvb.sortByValue();
        // numbers
        m_numberVvb = new ValidValuesBinding();
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
            m_numberVvb.addValidValue(""+i,"Number " + i);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void setCreditcard(String value) { m_creditcard = value; }
    public String getCreditcard() { return m_creditcard; }
    
    public void setTitle(String value) { m_title = value; }
    public String getTitle() { return m_title; }
    
    public void setDepartment(String value) { m_department = value; }
    public String getDepartment() { return m_department; }

    public void setNumber(String value) { m_number = value; }
    public String getNumber() { return m_number; }
    
    public ValidValuesBinding getTitleVvb() { return m_titleVvb; }
    
    public void setResult(String value) { m_result = value; }
    public String getResult() { return m_result; }
    
    public ValidValuesBinding getNumberVvb() 
    { 
        return m_numberVvb; 
    }
    
    public ValidValuesBinding getDepartmentVvb() 
    {
        if (m_loadDepartmentCB == true)
            return m_departmentVvb;
        else
            return null;
    }
    
//    public void onDepartmentAction(ActionEvent ae)
//    {
//        if (ae instanceof BaseActionEventLoadOnDemand)
//        {
//            m_loadDepartmentCB = true;
//        }
//    }
    
    public void onOK(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        m_result = "CreditCard: " + m_creditcard + 
                   "\nTitle: " + m_title +
                   "\nDepartment: " + m_department;
    }
    
    public boolean onCreateClientTestLogMessage()
    {
        ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage(m_creditcard + "//" + m_title + "//" + m_department);
        return false;
    }
    
}

Width of Popup

Open the different combo boxes and observe the width of the popup in which the list of values is shown.



The popup that is opened by the COMBOBOX can be sized using the attribute COMBOPOPUPWIDTH.

By default the width of the popup equals the width of the COMBOBOX component - with a minimum width of 150. This ensures that event with small COMBOBOX instances the text of the popup is readable for the user.

By setting the attribute COMBOPOPUPWIDTH you can define the minimum width of the popup on your own.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoComboPopupWidth}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Sizing the Popup of the Combobox:" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_4" height="50" />
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Default" width="150" />
<t:combobox id="g_7" labeltext="Option" width="100" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_8" text="Option 1" value="Option 1" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_9" text="Option 2" value="Option 2" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="Default" width="150" />
<t:combobox id="g_12" labeltext="Option" width="200" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_13" text="Option 1" value="Option 1" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_14" text="Option 2" value="Option 2" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_15" height="50" />
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="Width 100, Popup 100" width="150" />
<t:combobox id="g_18" combopopupwidth="100" labeltext="Option" width="100" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_19" text="Option 1" value="Option 1" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_20" text="Option 2" value="Option 2" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:label id="g_22" text="Width 100, Popup 300" width="150" />
<t:combobox id="g_23" combopopupwidth="300" labeltext="Option" width="100" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_24" text="Option 1" value="Option 1" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_25" text="Option 2" value="Option 2" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;

public class DemoComboPopupWidth extends PageBean
{

    public DemoComboPopupWidth(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("combobox"); 
    }

}

Default / Null Value

In the first combo box a default value is assigned using the attribute DEFAULTVALUE. In case the value that is assigned to the combobox is null, the default value is displayed.

In the second combo box no default value is assigned.

What you see in addition: you can define null as valid id of a combo box item. As a result you can offer the user to set the combo box to an empty (null) value.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoComboDefaultValue}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="With default Value" width="150" />
<t:combobox id="g_4" defaultvalue="1" flush="true" labeltext="Option" value="#{d.DemoComboDefaultValue.value}" width="150" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_5" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_6" text="Option 1" value="1" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_7" text="Option 2" value="2" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_8" text="Option 3" value="3" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="Without default Value" width="150" />
<t:combobox id="g_11" flush="true" labeltext="Option" value="#{d.DemoComboDefaultValue.value}" width="150" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_12" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_13" text="Option 1" value="1" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_14" text="Option 2" value="2" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_15" text="Option 3" value="3" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoComboDefaultValue}")

public class DemoComboDefaultValue
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoComboDefaultValue(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("combobox"); 
    }
    
    protected String m_value;
    public String getValue() { return m_value; }
    public void setValue(String value) 
    {
        m_value = value; 
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Value passed = " + m_value);
    }

}

Direct Select Mode

The attribute DIRECTSELECTMODE controls the behavior of the COMBOBOX during keyboard navigation.

Both COMBOBOX instances of the screen edit the same value ("department"). Both COMBOBOX flush their value immediately.

When opening the COMBOBOX-list in the first COMBOBOX and then navigating through the list of items by up/down keys, the value of the COMBOBOX is not updated. The user needs to explicitly press the return-key.

In the second COMBOBOX the value of the COMBOBOX is updated immediately when navigating up and down.

The advantage of the direct selection mode being switched on is:

1. The behavior is the traditional behavior of combo boxes.

The disadvantages are:

1. when flushing values directly to the server (FLUSH defined as "true") then there is a network roundtrip initiated with each keyboard navigation.

2. the default behavior of the default COMBOFIELD selection dialogs is different. With the COMBOFIELD component you typically open up a dialog and the value of the dialog is transferred explicitly. Because COMBOBOX and COMBOFIELD look the same the user may also expect the same selection behavior.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoComboBoxDirectSelectionMode}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Default keyboard selection mode" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:combobox id="g_6" flush="true" labeltext="Department" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoComboBoxDirectSelectionMode.departmentVVS}" value="#{d.DemoComboBoxDirectSelectionMode.department}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_7" height="15" />
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Direct keyboard selection mode" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:combobox id="g_12" directselectmode="true" flush="true" labeltext="Department" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoComboBoxDirectSelectionMode.departmentVVS}" value="#{d.DemoComboBoxDirectSelectionMode.department}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_13" height="100%" />
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" text="Department value" width="120" />
<t:label id="g_16" text="#{d.DemoComboBoxDirectSelectionMode.department}" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoComboBoxDirectSelectionMode}")

public class DemoComboBoxDirectSelectionMode
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    ValidValuesBinding m_departmentVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();
    public ValidValuesBinding getDepartmentVVS() { return m_departmentVVS; }

    String m_department = null;
    public String getDepartment() { return m_department; }
    public void setDepartment(String value) { this.m_department = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoComboBoxDirectSelectionMode(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        m_departmentVVS.addValidValue("0001","Sales");
        m_departmentVVS.addValidValue("0002","Production");
        m_departmentVVS.addValidValue("0003","Human Resources");
        m_departmentVVS.addValidValue("0004","Financials");
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democomboboxdirectselectionmode.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoComboBoxDirectSelectionMode}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Usage in Grid

This demo shows the usage of combo boxes in a grid environment.

Well, there is nothing "specific" to be aware about - just normal grid processing.

When selecting the left combo box (department) then the right combo box (employee) will be updated correspondingly. To do so the list of valid values on server side is updated. It's important to set the FLUSH attribute of the department-combo-box to "true" so that a selection is directly transferred to the server side and as result triggers the exchange of the items of the employee-combo-box.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoComboInGrid}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoComboInGrid.grid}" sbvisibleamount="5" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="Department" width="100" >
<t:combobox id="g_5" actionListener=".{onDeparmentAction}" flush="true" validvaluesbinding=".{departmentVVS}" value=".{department}" withvaluecomment="true" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Employee" width="100" >
<t:combobox id="g_7" validvaluesbinding=".{employeeVVS}" value=".{employee}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ClientTestLog;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IClientLogAware;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoComboInGrid}")

public class DemoComboInGrid
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable, IClientLogAware
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        public ValidValuesBinding getEmployeeVVS() 
        { 
            if ("D".equals(m_department))
                return s_devEmployeesVVS;
            else if ("S".equals(m_department))
                return s_salesEmployeesVVS;
            else
                return s_emptyVVS;
        }
        
        protected String m_employee;
        public String getEmployee() { return m_employee; }
        public void setEmployee(String value) { m_employee = value; }
        
        public ValidValuesBinding getDepartmentVVS() 
        { 
            return s_departmentVVS; 
        }
        
        protected String m_department;
        public String getDepartment() { return m_department; }
        public void setDepartment(String value) {  m_department = value; }
        
        public void onDeparmentAction(ActionEvent event) 
        {
            m_employee = null;
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    static ValidValuesBinding s_departmentVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();
    static ValidValuesBinding s_salesEmployeesVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();
    static ValidValuesBinding s_devEmployeesVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();
    static ValidValuesBinding s_emptyVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();
    
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    static
    {
        s_departmentVVS.addValidValue("S","Sales","Our fabulous sales department");
        s_departmentVVS.addValidValue("D","Development","Great developers work here");
        s_salesEmployeesVVS.addValidValue("1","John");
        s_salesEmployeesVVS.addValidValue("2","Peter");
        s_salesEmployeesVVS.addValidValue("3","Mary");
        s_devEmployeesVVS.addValidValue("10","Karl");
        s_devEmployeesVVS.addValidValue("11","Klaus");
        s_devEmployeesVVS.addValidValue("12","Harry");
        s_devEmployeesVVS.addValidValue("13","Stephanie");
    }
    
    public DemoComboInGrid(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
            m_grid.getItems().add(new GridItem());
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    public boolean onCreateClientTestLogMessage()
    {
        StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
        for (GridItem gi: m_grid.getItems())
            sb.append("/" + gi.getDepartment() + "/" + gi.getEmployee());
        ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage(sb.toString());
        return false;
    }

    
}

Double Line Item

Open the combo box item popup: you will see that the items are rendered as two lines - the first representing the text that is passed, the second reperesenting a so called value-comment.

In order two use the value-comment you need to:

(.) set COMBOBOX-WITHVALUECOMMENT to "true"
(.) passe the value comments as part of the item definition - in addition to the value and text that you normally pass

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoComboWithComment}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Item definition as part of layout:" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Company" width="100" />
<t:combobox id="g_6" value="#{d.DemoComboWithComment.company}" width="200" withvaluecomment="true" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_7" text="CaptainCasa" value="CC" valuecomment="The best company I ever worked for" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_8" text="Software AG" value="SAG" valuecomment="2 years of my life" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_9" text="CasabacTechnologies" value="CT" valuecomment="The time I believed in AJAX" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_10" text="SAP" value="SAP" valuecomment="A great company " />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_11" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="Items passed from server side processing:" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" text="Department" width="100" />
<t:combobox id="g_16" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoComboWithComment.departmentVVS}" value="#{d.DemoComboWithComment.department}" width="200" withnullitem="true" withvaluecomment="true" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoComboWithComment}")

public class DemoComboWithComment 
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    protected String m_company;
    protected String m_department;
    protected ValidValuesBinding m_departmentVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();
    
    public DemoComboWithComment(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("combobox"); 
        m_departmentVVS.addValidValue("S","Sales","Sales of our outstanding products","/images/pictures/photo0.gif");
        m_departmentVVS.addValidValue("D","Development","Fabulous development department","/images/pictures/photo1.gif");
        m_departmentVVS.addValidValue("Q","Quality Assurance","Yes, seems that we really need these guys","/images/pictures/photo2.gif");
        m_departmentVVS.addValidValue("HR","Human Resources",null,"/eclntjsfserver/images/delete.png");
        m_department = "S"; // preset to "Sales"
    }

    public ValidValuesBinding getDepartmentVVS() { return m_departmentVVS; }

    public String getDepartment() { return m_department; }
    public void setDepartment(String value) { m_department = value; }

    public String getCompany() { return m_company; }
    public void setCompany(String value) { m_company = value; }

}

Selection of objects
Simple way: using COMBOBOXWITHOBJECTS (PBC)
On your own: using COMBOBOX

The COMBOBOX is managing id-Strings and text-Strings (and maybe some comment and image in addition)

Do not hesitate to override the ValidValuesBinding class to add some more references to objects.

In this example the ValidValuesBinding implementation contains some cross reference to objects, so that within the managed bean the Department-object is managed. Of course you now see that in the example all Department objects are held in memory, which may have impacts for big scenarios.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoComboBoxWithObjects}">
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Department" width="100" />
<t:combobox id="g_4" flush="true" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoComboBoxWithObjects.departmentVVS}" value="#{d.DemoComboBoxWithObjects.departmentId}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_5" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" text="Selected id" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_8" text="#{d.DemoComboBoxWithObjects.department.id}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="Selected text" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_11" text="#{d.DemoComboBoxWithObjects.department.text}" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoComboBoxWithObjects}")

public class DemoComboBoxWithObjects
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class Department
    {
        String i_id;
        String i_text;
        public String getId() { return i_id; }
        public void setId(String id) { i_id = id; }
        public String getText() { return i_text; }
        public void setText(String text) { i_text = text; }
    }
    
    public class ValidValuesBindingWithObject<OBJCLASS extends Object> extends ValidValuesBinding
    {
        Map<String,OBJCLASS> i_objects = new HashMap<>();
        Map<OBJCLASS,String> i_objectIds = new HashMap<>();
        public void addObject(String id, String text, OBJCLASS object)
        {
            i_objects.put(id,object);
            i_objectIds.put(object,id);
            addValidValue(id,text);
        }
        public OBJCLASS lookupObject(String id)
        {
            if (id == null) return null;
            return i_objects.get(id);
        }
        public String lookupId(OBJCLASS object)
        {
            if (object == null) return null;
            return i_objectIds.get(object);
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    ValidValuesBindingWithObject<Department> m_departmentVVS = new ValidValuesBindingWithObject();
    Department m_department = null;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoComboBoxWithObjects(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        loadDepartments();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democomboboxwithobjects.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoComboBoxWithObjects}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public ValidValuesBinding getDepartmentVVS() { return m_departmentVVS; }

    public String getDepartmentId() { return m_departmentVVS.lookupId(m_department); }
    public void setDepartmentId(String value) { m_department = m_departmentVVS.lookupObject(value); }
    
    public Department getDepartment() { return m_department; }


    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void loadDepartments()
    {
        for (int i=0; i<20; i++)
        {
            Department d = new Department();
            d.setId(""+i);
            d.setText("Department " + i);
            m_departmentVVS.addObject(d.getId(),d.getText(),d);
        }
    }
}

List

The LIST component provides a selection of items, each one represented by an Id and by a value.

The items are passed as semicolon separated list, the sequence being "id1;text1;id2;text2;...". Please use the ValueManager class for assembling the list - it correctly handles situations in which e.g. the text contains a semicolon character itself.

The LIST can either select one or more than one items. You can configure by using attribute MULTISELECT. All the selected id-values are passed back to the server side as semicolon separated list.

Please not: the list is a component that does NOT send changes to its selection immediately to the server side. This is the same behavior as all typical components - but for the list it needs to be emphasized.
In case you want to directly react on list selections, you need to define FLUSH to be true. In this case the list selection will be transferred to the server when the user selects the item with the mouse, or if the user selectes the items with the return or space bar key. On server side two events will be thrown: (1) the Flush-Event and (2) an Invoke-Event, if the user clicked the mouse or selected the item with the keyboard.

The example shows how to use the list in the valid value processing of a COMBOFIELD as well.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoList}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" font="size:14" text="List embedded in page:" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Server binding as String with &#34;id;text&#34; - pairs" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:list id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoList.onListAction}" flush="true" height="100" listselection="#{d.DemoList.listSelection}" listvalues="#{d.DemoList.listValues}" multiselect="true" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Selection" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_10" text="#{d.DemoList.listSelection}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_11" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="Server binding as String with ValidValuesBinding" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:list id="g_15" actionListener="#{d.DemoList.onListAction}" flush="true" font="size:16" height="100" listselection="#{d.DemoList.list2Selection}" listvalues="#{d.DemoList.list2Values}" multiselect="true" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="Selection" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_18" text="#{d.DemoList.list2Selection}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_19" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:label id="g_21" font="size:14" text="List as value list for COMBOFIELD:" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:label id="g_23" text="Department" width="100" />
<t:combofield id="g_24" actionListener="#{d.DemoList.onDepartmentAction}" text="#{d.DemoList.department}" width="150" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ISetId;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdTextSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventValueHelp;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoList}")

public class DemoList
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    String m_department;
    String m_listValues;
    String m_listSelection;
    ValidValuesBinding m_list2Values = new ValidValuesBinding();
    String m_list2Selection;
    
    public DemoList(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        initRefComponent("list"); 
        // buildin id;text pair string
        List<String> ls = new ArrayList<String>();
        for (int i=0; i<30; i++)
        {
            ls.add("ID"+i);
            ls.add("Item "+i);
        }
        m_listValues = ValueManager.encodeCSV(ls);
        // building ValidValuesBinding
        for (int i=0; i<20; i++)
            m_list2Values.addValidValue("ID"+i,"Item " + i);
        m_listSelection = null;
    }

    public String getListSelection() { return m_listSelection; }
    public void setListSelection(String listSelection) { m_listSelection = listSelection; }

    public String getListValues() { return m_listValues; }
    
    public String getDepartment() { return m_department; }
    public void setDepartment(String value) { this.m_department = value; }

    public ValidValuesBinding getList2Values() { return m_list2Values; }

    public String getList2Selection() { return m_list2Selection; }
    public void setList2Selection(String value) { this.m_list2Selection = value; }

    public void onListAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("List selection was updated: " + m_listSelection + " // " + m_list2Selection);
    }
    
    public void onDepartmentAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventValueHelp)
        {
            IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createListInstance();
            for (int i=0; i<20; i++)
                idts.addLine("Department " + i,"Department " + i);
            idts.preselect(m_department);
            idts.setCallBack(new ISetId()
            {
                public void setId(String id)
                {
                    m_department = id;
                }
            });
        }
    }

}

Pick List
Filtered Pick List (PBC)

The "FilteredPickList" is a page bean component that allows to select multiple items out of a collection of items.

The selection is done by drag & drop from the one list into the other. - The user can double click an item, as well, in order to move it from the one side to the other.

The user can filter the object list on the right by defining a filter text.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoCCFilteredPickList}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:pagebeancomponent id="g_3" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoCCFilteredPickList.picklist}" pagebeanclass="org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCFilteredPickList" pagebeaninitdata="paneheight:300;panewidth:100%;lefttitle:Selected Objects;leftgridbackground:#FFFFFF;righttitle:Available Objects;rightgridbackground:#fafafa" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Current Selection" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:textarea id="g_7" height="100%;100" text="#{d.DemoCCFilteredPickList.text}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.HashSet;
import java.util.Set;

import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCFilteredPickList;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoCCFilteredPickList}")

public class DemoCCFilteredPickList
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    CCFilteredPickList m_picklist = new CCFilteredPickList();
    String m_text = "";
    
    public DemoCCFilteredPickList(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        Set<Object> sel = new HashSet<Object>();
        for (int i=0; i<25; i++)
        {
            Object ref = "Object " + i;
            String image;
            if (i % 2 == 0)
                image = "/eclntjsfserver/images/control_play.png";
            else
                image = "/eclntjsfserver/images/disk.png";
            if (i % 5 == 0)
                sel.add(ref);
            m_picklist.addItem(ref,"Text " + i,image);
        }
        m_picklist.setSelection(sel);
        m_picklist.setGridRowHeight("20");
        m_picklist.prepare(new CCFilteredPickList.IListener()
        {
            public void reactOnUpdate()
            {
                outputSelection();
            }
        });
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democcfilteredpicklist.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoCCFilteredPickList}"; }

    public CCFilteredPickList getPicklist() { return m_picklist; }
    public String getText() { return m_text; }

    private void outputSelection()
    {
        Set<Object> sel = m_picklist.getSelection();
        StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
        for (Object o: sel)
            sb.append(o.toString() + "\n");
        m_text = sb.toString();
    }
}

Filtered Pick List (PBC) as popup

This example shows how a COMBOFIELD is combined with a filtered pick list.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCFilteredPicklistCombo}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCFilteredPicklistCombo}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:label id="g_4" text="Persons" width="100" />
<t:combofield id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoPBCCCFilteredPicklistCombo.onPersonsAction}" editable="false" text="#{d.DemoPBCCCFilteredPicklistCombo.persons}" width="100%;200" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.HashSet;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Set;

import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCFilteredPickList;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ModalPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.DefaultModalPopupListener;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPBCCCFilteredPicklistComboUI}")

public class DemoPBCCCFilteredPicklistCombo
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public static class MyPerson
    {
        String m_name;
        public MyPerson(String name)
        {
            m_name = name;
        }
        public String getName() { return m_name; } 
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    List<MyPerson> m_allPersons = new ArrayList<DemoPBCCCFilteredPicklistCombo.MyPerson>();
    Set<Object> m_selectedPersons = new HashSet<Object>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPBCCCFilteredPicklistCombo(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
       super(workpageDispatcher);
       for (int i=0; i<20; i++)
           m_allPersons.add(new MyPerson("Person " + i));
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopbcccfilteredpicklistcombo.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPBCCCFilteredPicklistComboUI}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public String getPersons() 
    { 
        StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
        int counter = 0;
        for (Object p: m_selectedPersons)
        {
            if (counter != 0) sb.append(", ");
            sb.append(((MyPerson)p).getName());
            counter++;
        }
        return sb.toString();
    }
    
    public void onPersonsAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        final CCFilteredPickList ui = new CCFilteredPickList();
        for (MyPerson p: m_allPersons)
            ui.addItem(p,p.getName(),null);
        ui.prepare(new CCFilteredPickList.IListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnUpdate()
            {
                m_selectedPersons = ui.getSelection();
            }
        });
        ui.setSelection(m_selectedPersons);
        ui.setPanePadding("10");
        ModalPopup pop = openModalPopup(ui,"Filtered selection",450,0,new DefaultModalPopupListener(this,ui));
        pop.setCloseonclickoutside(true);
        pop.setUndecorated(true);
    }


}

Multi Value Selection (PBC)

The page bean component CCMultiValueSelection renders a grid of values, from which the user can select/deselect by using checkboxes.

There is a popup menu (right mouse button) providing functions to clear the selection or to select all items.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
