<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCMultiValueSelection}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="As popup dialog" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Buildings" width="100" />
<t:combofield id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoPBCCCMultiValueSelection.onBuildingsAction}" editable="false" text="#{d.DemoPBCCCMultiValueSelection.buildings}" width="100%;200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_7" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Directly embedded" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:pane id="g_11" >
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="Buildings" width="100" />
<tpbc:multivalueselection id="g_22" height="250" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCMultiValueSelection.mvs}" selectedValuesAtTop="#{d.DemoPBCCCMultiValueSelection.selecteValuesAtTop}" shownullcontent="true" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_20" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:coldistance id="g_17" width="100" />
<t:checkbox id="g_18" align="right" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoPBCCCMultiValueSelection.selecteValuesAtTop}" text="Selected values to top" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Collections;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.HashSet;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Map;
import java.util.Set;

import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCMultiValueSelection;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventValueHelp;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.session.RequestFocusManager;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPBCCCMultiValueSelection}")

public class DemoPBCCCMultiValueSelection
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    boolean m_selecteValuesAtTop;
    public boolean getSelecteValuesAtTop() { return m_selecteValuesAtTop; }
    public void setSelecteValuesAtTop(boolean value) { this.m_selecteValuesAtTop = value; }

    CCMultiValueSelection m_mvs = new CCMultiValueSelection();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructor
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPBCCCMultiValueSelection(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        m_buildingMap.put("0001","Bammental");
        m_buildingMap.put("0002","Bayrischzell");
        m_buildingMap.put("0003","Sofia");
        m_buildingMap.put("0004","Karlsruhe");
        m_buildingMap.put("0005","Mnchen");
        m_buildingMap.put("0006","Stuttgart");
        m_buildingMap.put("0007","Heidelberg");
        m_buildingMap.put("0008","Mannheim");
        m_buildingMap.put("0009","Lingental");
        m_buildingMap.put("0010","Peking");
        fillSelection(m_mvs);
        m_mvs.prepare(new CCMultiValueSelection.IListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnSelectionUpdate(Set<String> selectedIds)
            {
                m_selectedIds = selectedIds;
            }
        });
        m_mvs.setAvailableButtonBar(true);
        m_mvs.setAvailableFilterBar(true);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopbcccmultivalueselection.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPBCCCMultiValueSelection}"; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    Map<String,String> m_buildingMap = new HashMap();
    Set<String> m_selectedIds = new HashSet<String>();
    
    public String getBuildings() 
    { 
        List<String> values = new ArrayList<String>();
        for (String key: m_selectedIds)
        {
            String text = m_buildingMap.get(key);
            values.add(text);
        }
        return ValueManager.encodeCSV(values);
    }

    public void onBuildingsAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventValueHelp)
        {
            openValueSelection();
        }
    }

    public CCMultiValueSelection getMvs() { return m_mvs; }

    private void openValueSelection()
    {
        final CCMultiValueSelection mvs = CCMultiValueSelection.openAsPopup(this,250,300);
        fillSelection(mvs);
        mvs.setAvailableFilterBar(true);
        mvs.setFilterFieldRequestFocus(RequestFocusManager.REQFOCUS_CREATION_LONG);
        mvs.prepare(new CCMultiValueSelection.IListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnSelectionUpdate(Set<String> selectedIds)
            {
                m_selectedIds = selectedIds;
            }
        });
    }
    
    private void fillSelection(CCMultiValueSelection mvs)
    {
        List<String> keys = new ArrayList<>(m_buildingMap.keySet());
        Collections.sort(keys);
        for (String key: keys)
            mvs.addValue(key,m_buildingMap.get(key));
        mvs.setSelectedIds(m_selectedIds);
    }

}

Open combo dialog on focus

All components that open some detail dialog provide the attribute OPENONFOCUS.

If set to true then the detail dialog is directly opened when moving the focus into the component.

Moving the focus can be done by...

(.) clicking the component
(.) tab-ing into the component by keyboard
(.) programmatically requesting the focus

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoOpenOnFocus}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoOpenOnFocus}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:combobox id="g_2" labeltext="Department" openonfocus="true" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoOpenOnFocus.departmentVVS}" value="#{d.DemoOpenOnFocus.department}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:combofield id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoOpenOnFocus.onPersonAction}" labeltext="Person" openonfocus="true" text="#{d.DemoOpenOnFocus.personId}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:calendarfield id="g_12" labeltext="Some date" openonfocus="true" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoOpenOnFocus.someDate}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:longtextfield id="g_15" labeltext="Some text" openonfocus="true" text="#{d.DemoOpenOnFocus.someText}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:colorfield id="g_18" labeltext="Some color" openonfocus="true" value="#{d.DemoOpenOnFocus.someColor}" width="200" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.time.LocalDate;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ISetId;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdTextSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventValueHelp;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoOpenOnFocus}")

public class DemoOpenOnFocus
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    ValidValuesBinding m_departmentVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();
    String m_department;
    String m_personId;
    String m_someText = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt.";
    LocalDate m_someDate = LocalDate.now();
    String m_someColor = "#FF0000";
 
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoOpenOnFocus(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        m_departmentVVS.addValidValue("SALES","Sales");
        m_departmentVVS.addValidValue("PROD","Production");
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoopenonfocus.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoOpenOnFocus}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public ValidValuesBinding getDepartmentVVS() { return m_departmentVVS; }

    public String getDepartment() { return m_department; }
    public void setDepartment(String value) { this.m_department = value; }

    public String getPersonId() { return m_personId; }
    public void setPersonId(String value) { this.m_personId = value; }

    public String getSomeColor() { return m_someColor; }
    public void setSomeColor(String value) { this.m_someColor = value; }

    public void onPersonAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventValueHelp)
        {
            IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createInstance();
            idts.addLine("4711","Hirsch, Harry");
            idts.addLine("4712","Smith, Jonathan");
            idts.setCallBack(new ISetId()
            {
                @Override
                public void setId(String id)
                {
                    m_personId = id;
                }
            });
        }
    }

    public String getSomeText() { return m_someText; }
    public void setSomeText(String value) { this.m_someText = value; }

    public LocalDate getSomeDate() { return m_someDate; }
    public void setSomeDate(LocalDate value) { this.m_someDate = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Text Input/Output

Text Area

The TEXTAREA is a multi-line text input component. It represents a plain text editor - there are no sophisticated formatting functions.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTextArea2}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:textarea id="g_3" flush="true" height="50%" labeltext="Description text" text="#{d.DemoTextArea2.text}" width="100%" tabtonextcomponent="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoTextArea2.onCount}" text="Count characters of Text" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTextArae2}")

public class DemoTextArea2
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoTextArea2(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("textarea"); 
    }

    String m_text = "";
    public void setText(String value) { m_text = value; }
    public String getText() { return m_text; }
    
    public void onCount(ActionEvent event)
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Length of text = " + m_text.length());
    }
}

Text Pane

On the left you can define some text. The text is then "shifted" into the right TEXTPANE components when pressing the button "Update the right side".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowheader id="g_1" >
<t:coldistance id="g_2" width="75%" />
<t:button id="g_3" text="Update the right side" />
<t:coldistance id="g_4" width="25%" />
</t:rowheader>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_5" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTextarea}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_7" text="Plain Text" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:textarea id="g_9" flush="true" height="100" text="#{d.demoTextarea.plain}" width="50%" tabtonextcomponent="true" />
<t:coldistance id="g_10" width="20" />
<t:textpane id="g_11" contenttype="text/plain" height="100%" text="#{d.demoTextarea.plain}" width="50%" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_12" />
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_14" text="HTML Text" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:textarea id="g_16" flush="true" height="100" text="#{d.demoTextarea.html}" width="50%" tabtonextcomponent="true" />
<t:coldistance id="g_17" width="20" />
<t:scrollpane id="g_18" height="100%" width="50%" >
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:textpane id="g_20" contenttype="text/html" font="font-face:Courier" text="#{d.demoTextarea.html}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:scrollpane>
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_21" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoTextarea extends PageBean
{
    String m_plain = "Plain text, no formatting possible.";
    String m_html = "<span style=\"font-family:Arial;font-size:9px\">Some <b>HTML Text</b>.</span>";
    String m_rtf = "Hmmm. Is there some RTF expert...? ;-)";

    public DemoTextarea(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("textpane"); 
    }
    
    public void setPlain(String value) { m_plain = value; }
    public String getPlain() { return m_plain; }
    
    public void setHtml(String value) { m_html = value; }
    public String getHtml() { return m_html; }
    
    public void setRtf(String value) { m_rtf = value; }
    public String getRtf() { return m_rtf; }
}

Wiki Type Texts

This demo shows how a Wiki text that you enter in the top area is translated on servier side into an HTML text. The translation is done using the bliki.jar library - which is an open source library available through sourceforge.

The translation is done when pressing the button or when pressing ctrl-U on the keyboard.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoWiki}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:splitpane id="g_3" border="#00000030" dividerlocation="200" height="100%" orientation="vertical" width="100%" >
<t:splitpanesplit id="g_4" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:textarea id="g_6" border="top:0" font="family:Courier New" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoWiki.wikiText}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:splitpanesplit>
<t:splitpanesplit id="g_7" >
<t:rowheader id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="HTML Preview" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoWiki.onUpdate}" hotkey="ctrl-85" text="Update" />
</t:rowheader>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:scrollpane id="g_12" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:textpane id="g_14" contenttype="text/html" text="#{d.DemoWiki.htmlText}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:scrollpane>
</t:row>
</t:splitpanesplit>
</t:splitpane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import info.bliki.wiki.filter.WikiModel;

import java.io.ByteArrayInputStream;
import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.util.log.CLog;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoWiki}")

public class DemoWiki 
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoWiki(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("textarea");
        onUpdate(null);
    }

    protected String m_htmlText;
    public String getHtmlText() { return m_htmlText; }
    public void setHtmlText(String value) { m_htmlText = value; }

    protected String m_wikiText =
        "=A headline=\n" +
        "This is some straight text.\n" +
        "*first\n" +
        "*second\n" +
        "*third\n" +
        "Now a mini table\n" +
        "{| border=\"1\"\n" +
        "!Column1\n" +
        "!Columns2\n" +
        "|-\n" +
        "|Value1\n" +
        "|Value2\n" +
        "|}";
    public String getWikiText() { return m_wikiText; }
    public void setWikiText(String value) { m_wikiText = value; }

    public void onUpdate(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        try
        {
            WikiModel wikiModel = new WikiModel("${image}", "${title}");
            m_htmlText = wikiModel.render(m_wikiText);
        }
        catch (Exception e)
        {
            CLog.L.log(CLog.LL_ERR,"",e);
        }
    }

}

Text with Links

The TEXTWITHLINKS component renders an HTML text containing links.

When the user clicks onto a link then a server side action is triggered (ActionEvent of type BaseActionEventLink). The event contains the information about the href-attribute that you define with the link definition. The href-attribute may not be a valid URL as consequence, but just some "link-id" that you then process on server side.

Example: when clicking onto a link with <a href='AAA'>Hallo</a>, then on server side the action listener is invoked, the event of type BaseActionEventLink can be checked with "getLinkId()", returning "AAA".

In the demo there are two ways shown how to open http-links:
(.) The first one is the "through the server" one. The link's href-definition is sent to the server side - just as any other link. The server side then triggers a JSHOWURL component.
(.) The seconds one is the "through the client" one: by adding prefix "url:" to the href-definition, the client immediately knows what to do - and opens up the URL in a new window. By default target "_blank" is used, you may set your own target by append ";target:..." to the href-definition.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:jshowurl id="g_2" trigger="#{d.DemoTextWithLinks.browserTrigger}" url="#{d.DemoTextWithLinks.browserURL}" useappletcontext="false" usedesktop="true" usejavascript="false" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTextWithLinks}" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:textwithlinks id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoTextWithLinks.onLinkAction}" border="top:1;bottom:1;left:1;right:1;color:#00000030;top2:5;bottom2:5;left2:5;right2:5;color2:#00000000" font="family:Tahoma" htmlstylesheetrule="A {color:#000000}" text="#{d.DemoTextWithLinks.html}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventLink;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTextWithLinks}")

public class DemoTextWithLinks
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    protected String m_browserURL;
    public String getBrowserURL() { return m_browserURL; }
    public void setBrowserURL(String value) { this.m_browserURL = value; }

    protected Trigger m_browserTrigger = new Trigger();
    public Trigger getBrowserTrigger() { return m_browserTrigger; }
    public void setBrowserTrigger(Trigger value) { this.m_browserTrigger = value; }

    public DemoTextWithLinks(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("textwithlinks");
    }
    

    protected String m_html = 
        "<html>" +
        "<body>" +
        "This text contains some links: <a href='AAA'>First link (AAA)</a> and <a href='BBB'> Second link (BBB)</a>. When clicking a corresponding information will be sent to the server side - so that your application can react correspondingly. " +
        "<br><br>" +
        "This text contains some links: <a href=\"AAA\">First link (AAA)</a> and <a href=\"BBB\"> Second link (BBB)</a>. When clicking a corresponding information will be sent to the server side - so that your application can react correspondingly. " +
        "<br><br>" +
        "This text contains some hyper links: <a href='http://www.google.de' target='_blank'>Google</a> and <a href='http://www.captaincasa.com'>CaptainCasa</a>. When clicking a corresponding information will be sent to the server side - so that your application can react correspondingly. " +
        "<br><br>" +
        "You also may directly open links by using prefix &quot;url:&quot;: <a href='url:http://www.google.de'>Google</a> "
        + "and <a href='url:http://www.captaincasa.com;target:CC'>CaptainCasa</a>. "
        + "In this case the navigation is completely managed on client side - without going through the server. "
        + "You may also append a target by adding &quot;;target:...&quot; to the URL." +
        "</body>" +
        "</html>";
    public String getHtml() { return m_html; }
    
    public void onLinkAction(ActionEvent event)
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventLink)
        {
            BaseActionEventLink bael = (BaseActionEventLink)event;
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Link with id '"+bael.getLinkId()+"' was pressed!");
            if (bael.getLinkId().startsWith("http://"))
            {
                m_browserURL = bael.getLinkId();
                m_browserTrigger.trigger();
            }
        }
    }
}

Text with Hyperlinks

The TEXTWITHLINKS component feeds back the link information when it contains hyperlink definitions. In this example the server side logic opens up a corresponding browser, showing the link's content.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:jshowurl id="g_2" trigger="#{d.DemoTextWithHyperLinks.urlTrigger}" url="#{d.DemoTextWithHyperLinks.url}" usedesktop="true" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTextWithHyperLinks}" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:textwithlinks id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoTextWithHyperLinks.onLinkAction}" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoTextWithHyperLinks.text}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventLink;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTextWithHyperLinks}")

public class DemoTextWithHyperLinks
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    protected String m_url;
    public String getUrl() { return m_url; }
    public void setUrl(String value) { m_url = value; }

    protected Trigger m_urlTrigger = new Trigger();
    public Trigger getUrlTrigger() { return m_urlTrigger; }
    public void setUrlTrigger(Trigger value) { m_urlTrigger = value; }

    protected String m_text = 
        "<html>" +
        "<body>" +
        "This is a link to CaptainCasa: <a href='http://www.captaincasa.com'>CaptainCasa</a><br>" +
        "This is a link to Google: <a href='http://www.google.com'>Google</a>" +
        "</body>" +
        "</html>";

    public DemoTextWithHyperLinks(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        initRefComponent("textwithlinks");
    }

    public String getText() { return m_text; }

    public void onLinkAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventLink)
        {
            BaseActionEventLink le = (BaseActionEventLink)event;
            m_url = le.getLinkId();
            m_urlTrigger.trigger();
        }
    }

}

HTML Editor
CKEditor

The component SIMPLEHTMLEDITOR is a really simple HTML editor that can be used to input HTML text that does require the typical "Wordpad-like" formatting.

In the RISC Client we internally use the CKEditor-component. Please check details about this embedded component via the URL https://ckeditor.com/ckeditor-4/. - We like this component because it is lightweight and configure-able, maybe you like it for any other purpose on your side!

Please carefully check license conditions of CKEditor prior to using this component within your projects!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditor}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:tabbedpane id="g_3" height="100%" innerpadding="0" width="100%" >
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_4" padding="0" text="Editor" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:simplehtmleditor id="g_6" avoidsanitizing="true" enabled="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditor.enabled}" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditor.htmlText}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:tabbedpanetab>
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_7" text="Saved HTML Text (display only)" >
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:textarea id="g_9" enabled="false" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditor.htmlText}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:tabbedpanetab>
</t:tabbedpane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditor.onLoadText}" text="Load Text" width="100+" />
<t:checkbox id="g_16" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditor.enabled}" text="Editing enabled" />
<t:coldistance id="g_13" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditor.onSaveText}" text="Save Text" width="100+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditor}")

public class DemoSimpleHtmlEditor 
    extends PageBean
{
    protected String m_htmlText = "<html><body style='font-family:Trebuchet MS'><p>This is some initial text!</p></body></html>";
    protected boolean m_enabled = false;

    public DemoSimpleHtmlEditor(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("simplehtmleditor");
    }
    
    public String getHtmlText() { return m_htmlText; }
    public void setHtmlText(String value) { m_htmlText = value; }

    public boolean getEnabled() { return m_enabled; } 
    public void setEnabled(boolean enabled) { m_enabled = enabled; } 

    public void onLoadText(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_htmlText = "<html><body style='font-family:Trebuchet MS'><p>Hello world!</p></body></html>";
    }
    
    public void onSaveText(ActionEvent event)
    {
        System.out.println("==========");
        System.out.println(m_htmlText);
        System.out.println("==========");
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Text was processed on server side.");
    }

}

CKEditor Version 5

The attribute SIMPLEHTMLEDITOR-BRIDGEPAGE points to an HTML page that binds the processing of the HTML editor to the CaptainCasa client processing.

By using the bridge page of the example, the version 5 of the CKEditor is embedded as HTML editor.

CaptainCasa currently provides bridges to the CKEditor (version 4,5) and to the Quill editor. Writing a bridge page is simple - so there is an open integration of other editor frameworks, too. The bridge pages are part of the eclntjsfsrver.jar file.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditorCK5}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditorCK5}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:tabbedpane id="g_3" height="100%" innerpadding="0" width="100%" >
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_16" padding="0" text="Editor" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:simplehtmleditor id="g_6" avoidsanitizing="true" bridgepage="/eclnt/risc/ext_ckeditorV5/ext_ckeditor.html" enabled="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditorCK5.enabled}" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditorCK5.htmlText}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:tabbedpanetab>
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_7" text="Saved HTML Text (display only)" >
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:textarea id="g_9" enabled="false" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditorCK5.htmlText}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:tabbedpanetab>
</t:tabbedpane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditorCK5.onLoadText}" text="Load Text" width="100+" />
<t:checkbox id="g_18" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditorCK5.enabled}" text="Editing enabled" />
<t:coldistance id="g_13" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditorCK5.onSaveText}" text="Save Text" width="100+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditor}")

public class DemoSimpleHtmlEditorCK5 
    extends PageBean
{
    protected String m_htmlText;
    protected boolean m_enabled = true;

    public DemoSimpleHtmlEditorCK5(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("simplehtmleditor");
    }
    
    public String getHtmlText() { return m_htmlText; }
    public void setHtmlText(String value) { m_htmlText = value; }
    
    public boolean getEnabled() { return m_enabled; }
    public void setEnabled(boolean enabled) { m_enabled = enabled; }

    public void onLoadText(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_htmlText = "<html><body style='font-family:Trebuchet MS'><p>Hello world!</p></body></html>";
    }
    
    public void onSaveText(ActionEvent event)
    {
        System.out.println("==========");
        System.out.println(m_htmlText);
        System.out.println("==========");
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Text was processed on server side.");
    }

}

Quill Editor

Quill is a JavaScript based text editor which is free and open source based. Please check https://quilljs.com/

To use the Quill-editor you need to define the attribute SIMPLEHTMLEDITOR-BRIDGEPAGE with value "eclnt/risc/ext_quill/quillbridge.html".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditorQuill}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:tabbedpane id="g_3" height="100%" innerpadding="0" width="100%" >
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_4" padding="0" text="Editor" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:simplehtmleditor id="g_6" avoidsanitizing="true" bridgepage="eclnt/risc/ext_quill/quillbridge.html" enabled="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditorQuill.enabled}" focusable="true" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditorQuill.htmlText}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:tabbedpanetab>
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_7" text="Saved HTML Text (display only)" >
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:textarea id="g_9" enabled="false" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditorQuill.htmlText}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:tabbedpanetab>
</t:tabbedpane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditorQuill.onLoadText}" text="Load Text" width="100+" />
<t:checkbox id="g_16" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditorQuill.enabled}" text="Editing enabled" />
<t:coldistance id="g_13" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditorQuill.onSaveText}" text="Save Text" width="100+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoSimpleHtmlEditorQuill extends DemoSimpleHtmlEditor
{
    public DemoSimpleHtmlEditorQuill(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
}

HTML Editor - with flushing

Key in some text into the HTML-editor - after some time of inactivity the text will automatically be flushed to the server side processing.

The SIMPLEHTMLEDITOR component also provides some - limited - functions to flush its content on change.

By defining FLUSH to "true" and by assigning a number value to FLUSHTIMER the component will flush back changes within the text content after some duration of user inactivity. The duration is defined by the FLUSHTIMER value.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditorFlush}" padding="0" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:splitpane id="g_3" dividerlocation="70%" height="100%" orientation="vertical" width="100%" >
<t:splitpanesplit id="g_4" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:simplehtmleditor id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditorFlush.onEditorAction}" bridgepage="eclnt/risc/ext_quill/quillbridge.html" flush="true" flushtimer="1000" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditorFlush.htmlText}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:splitpanesplit>
<t:splitpanesplit id="g_7" >
<t:rowheader id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Plain text" />
</t:rowheader>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:textarea id="g_11" flush="true" flushtimer="2000" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditorFlush.htmlText}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:splitpanesplit>
</t:splitpane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditorFlush}")

public class DemoSimpleHtmlEditorFlush
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_htmlText = "Some <b>HTML Text</b>.";

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoSimpleHtmlEditorFlush(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demosimplehtmleditorflush.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoSimpleHtmlEditorFlush}"; }

    public void onEditorAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("Editor content was updated. ("+System.currentTimeMillis()+")");
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getHtmlText() { return m_htmlText; }
    public void setHtmlText(String value) { this.m_htmlText = value; }

}

Code / XML Editor
Code editor

The CODEEDITOR component internally wraps the ACE editor - please check the page https://ace.c9.io for detailed information.

The editor can be configured with more than 100 different code formats, that it correctly colors and observes while keying in the text.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoCodeEditor}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoCodeEditor}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_3" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoCodeEditor.onLoadText}" reference="xml" text=".xml" width="100+" />
<t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoCodeEditor.onLoadText}" reference="java" text=".java" width="100+" />
<t:button id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoCodeEditor.onLoadText}" reference="javascript" text=".js" width="100+" />
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoCodeEditor.onLoadText}" reference="xmas" text=".xmas" width="100+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:codeeditor id="g_9" codetype="#{d.DemoCodeEditor.codeType}" enabled="true" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoCodeEditor.text}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.BaseActionEvent;
import org.eclnt.util.file.ClassloaderReader;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoCodeEditor}")

public class DemoCodeEditor
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_codeType = "xml";
    Map<String,String> m_texts = new HashMap<String, String>(); // codeType, text
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoCodeEditor(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);   
        readText();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democodeeditor.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoCodeEditor}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public String getText() { return m_texts.get(m_codeType); } 
    public void setText(String text) { m_texts.put(m_codeType,text); }
    
    public String getCodeType() 
    { 
        if ("xmas".equals(m_codeType)) return "java"; // ;-)
        return m_codeType; 
    }
    public void setCodeType(String codeType) { m_codeType = codeType; }

    public void onLoadText(ActionEvent event)
    {
        m_codeType = ((BaseActionEvent)event).getSourceReference();
        readText();
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void readText()
    {
        if (m_texts.containsKey(m_codeType) == false)
        {
            String text = new ClassloaderReader(true).readUTF8File("workplace/DemoCodeEditor_"+m_codeType+".txt",true);
            m_texts.put(m_codeType,text);
        }
    }
}

Passing ACE-property-parameters

By using attribute CODEEDITORPARAMS you can pass any specific properties to the internally used ACE editor

The format of the value is: name:value;name:value;name:value

The name is pointing to a set-ter method of or a setOption method of the ACE-editor object.

(.) "xxx:value" ==> editor.setXxx(value)
(.) "session/xxx:value ==> editor.getSession().setXxx(value)
(.) "renderer/xxx:value ==> editor.renderer.setXxx(value)
(.) "renderer.option/xxx:value ==> editor.renderer.setOption(xxx,value)
(.) "editor.option/xxx:value ==> editor.setOption(xxx,value)

Please check the ACE editor documentation for the concrete values you might pass. - Some of the values can be set one time, and can not be set back to their previous value. Please check the ACE documentation.

If you want to configure the ACE editor in a more sophisticated please also consider to implement an own bridge page, which then can be set by using the BRIDGEPAGE attribute. The default is: "/eclnt/risc/ext_ace/ace_brige.html".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoCodeEditorParams}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoCodeEditorParams}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_3" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoCodeEditorParams.onLoadText}" reference="xml" text=".xml" width="100+" />
<t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoCodeEditorParams.onLoadText}" reference="java" text=".java" width="100+" />
<t:button id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoCodeEditorParams.onLoadText}" reference="javascript" text=".js" width="100+" />
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoCodeEditorParams.onLoadText}" reference="xmas" text=".xmas" width="100+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" labeltext="Current paramater" text="#{d.DemoCodeEditorParams.editorParameterString}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:codeeditor id="g_11" codeeditorparams="#{d.DemoCodeEditorParams.editorParameterString}" codetype="#{d.DemoCodeEditorParams.codeType}" enabled="true" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoCodeEditorParams.text}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoCodeEditorParams.onApplyAction}" coldistance="5" >
<t:combobox id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoCodeEditorParams.onApplyAction}" flush="true" labeltext="New parameter string" value="#{d.DemoCodeEditorParams.newEditorParamString}" width="100%" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_14" text="theme:ace/theme/clouds" value="theme:ace/theme/clouds" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_15" text="theme:ace/theme/dracula" value="theme:ace/theme/dracula" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_16" text="theme:ace/theme/monokai" value="theme:ace/theme/monokai" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_17" text="theme:ace/theme/twilight" value="theme:ace/theme/twilight" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_19" text="theme:ace/theme/twilight;renderer/showGutter:false" value="theme:ace/theme/twilight;renderer/showGutter:false" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_21" text="theme:ace/theme/twilight;renderer/showGutter:false;renderer.option/printMarginColumn:30" value="theme:ace/theme/twilight;renderer/showGutter:false;renderer.option/printMarginColumn:30" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_23" text="editor.option/showLineNumbers:false" value="editor.option/showLineNumbers:false" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_25" text="readOnly:true" value="readOnly:true" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_27" text="theme:ace/theme/clouds;editor.option/cursorStyle:wide" value="theme:ace/theme/clouds;editor.option/cursorStyle:wide" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.BaseActionEvent;
import org.eclnt.util.file.ClassloaderReader;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoCodeEditorParams}")

public class DemoCodeEditorParams
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_codeType = "xml";
    Map<String,String> m_texts = new HashMap<String, String>(); // codeType, text
    String m_editorParameterString = "theme:ace/theme/monokai";
    String m_newEditorParamString  = m_editorParameterString;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoCodeEditorParams(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);   
        readText();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democodeeditorparams.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoCodeEditorParams}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public String getText() { return m_texts.get(m_codeType); } 
    public void setText(String text) { m_texts.put(m_codeType,text); }
    
    public String getCodeType() 
    { 
        if ("xmas".equals(m_codeType)) return "java"; // ;-)
        return m_codeType; 
    }
    public void setCodeType(String codeType) { m_codeType = codeType; }

    public void onLoadText(ActionEvent event)
    {
        m_codeType = ((BaseActionEvent)event).getSourceReference();
        readText();
    }

    public String getEditorParameterString() { return m_editorParameterString; }
    public void setEditorParameterString(String value) { this.m_editorParameterString = value; }

    public String getNewEditorParamString() { return m_newEditorParamString; }
    public void setNewEditorParamString(String value) { this.m_newEditorParamString = value; }

    public void onApplyAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_editorParameterString = m_newEditorParamString;
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void readText()
    {
        if (m_texts.containsKey(m_codeType) == false)
        {
            String text = new ClassloaderReader(true).readUTF8File("workplace/DemoCodeEditor_"+m_codeType+".txt",true);
            m_texts.put(m_codeType,text);
        }
    }
}

Code editor with flushing

The FLUSH of the code editor is automatically associated with a FLUSHTIMER function: if the user updates the editor content then the editor is observed for subsequent user changes within the duration defined by FLUSHTIMER.

If there are no changes then the value is automatically transferred to the server side - together with some flush event.

The default flush duration is 2000ms.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoCodeEditorFlush}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoCodeEditorFlush}" rowdistance="20" >
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:button id="g_9" text="Button" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:codeeditor id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoCodeEditorFlush.onCodeEditorAction}" codetype="xml" flush="true" flushtimer="10000" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoCodeEditorFlush.text}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:textarea id="g_6" enabled="false" height="200" text="#{d.DemoCodeEditorFlush.text}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoCodeEditorFlush}")

public class DemoCodeEditorFlush
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_text = 
            "<test>\n"
            + "    <companyName>CaptainCasa</companyName>\n" 
            + "</test>";

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoCodeEditorFlush(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democodeeditorflush.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoCodeEditorFlush}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getText() { return m_text; }
    public void setText(String value) { this.m_text = value; }

    public void onCodeEditorAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Editor action: " + m_text.length() + ", " + System.currentTimeMillis());
    }

}

Text from different Contributors ("Chat", PBC)

The page bean component CCComposedText manages a text that is composed out of text items coming from different contributors.

You may use it for simple chat scenarios.

The component is initialized by...

1. telling the name of the current contributor (so that new text items are assigned to this person)
2. passing the history of text items
3. (optional) by passing a listener that tells about text items being added by the current contributor

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPBCComposedText}">
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:pagebeancomponent id="g_3" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCComposedText.composedText}" pagebeanclass="org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCComposedText" pagebeaninitdata="paneheight:100%;panewidth:400" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Date;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCComposedText;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPBCComposedText}")

public class DemoPBCComposedText
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    CCComposedText m_composedText = new CCComposedText();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPBCComposedText(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initializeComposedText();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopbccomposedtext.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPBCComposedText}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public CCComposedText getComposedText() { return m_composedText; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void initializeComposedText()
    {
        List<CCComposedText.TextItem> textItems = new ArrayList<CCComposedText.TextItem>();
        textItems.add(new CCComposedText.TextItem
        (
            "Guest user",
            "Hi, I have a question on using the chat component. Where can I find it?",
            new Date())
        );
        textItems.add(new CCComposedText.TextItem
        (
            "CaptainCasa",
            "Hi, the chat component\'s technical name is CCComposedText. It is part of the addon package coming with the CaptainCasa installation.",
            new Date())
        );
        textItems.add(new CCComposedText.TextItem
        (
            "Guest user",
            "Oh, I see, it's the eclnt_pbc.jar package.",
            new Date())
        );
        textItems.add(new CCComposedText.TextItem
        (
            "CaptainCasa",
            "Yessss. Just add to your WEB-INF/lib. Nothing else to do. Then use control PAGEBEANCOMPONENT and create an instance of CCComposedText as counter part.",
            new Date())
        );
        m_composedText.prepare("CaptainCasa",textItems,null);
    }
}

Text Diff Viewer

The page bean CCTextDiff compares two texts with one another and renders the comparison result.

Change the text on the left side - or change the text on the right side. Shortly after finishing your input the comparison will be updated.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPBCTextDiff}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" coldistance="5" >
<t:pane id="g_3" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Left text" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:textarea id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoPBCTextDiff.onLeftTextAction}" flush="true" flushtimer="2000" height="100" requestfocus="creation" text="#{d.DemoPBCTextDiff.leftText}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
<t:pane id="g_8" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="Right text" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:textarea id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoPBCTextDiff.onRIghtTextActioi}" flush="true" flushtimer="2000" height="100" text="#{d.DemoPBCTextDiff.rightText}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_13" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:textpane id="g_15" text="The comparison will be updated 2 seconds after changing one of the texts:" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_21" height="50" />
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_17" enabled="false" height="100%" innerpadding="0" text="Comparison" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:pagebeancomponent id="g_19" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCTextDiff.textDiffBean}" pagebeanclass="org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCTextDiff" pagebeaninitdata="padding:5" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCTextDiff;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPBCTextDiff}")

public class DemoPBCTextDiff
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_rightText = "Right text. The weather outside is not nice at all. Please remind me.";
    String m_leftText = "Left Text. The weather outside is nice. Please remind me.";
    CCTextDiff m_textDiffBean = new CCTextDiff();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPBCTextDiff(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);  
        m_textDiffBean.prepareTexts(m_leftText,m_rightText);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopbctextdiff.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPBCTextDiff}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getRightText() { return m_rightText; }
    public void setRightText(String value) { this.m_rightText = value; }

    public String getLeftText() { return m_leftText; }
    public void setLeftText(String value) { this.m_leftText = value; }

    public CCTextDiff getTextDiffBean() { return m_textDiffBean; }
    public void setTextDiffBean(CCTextDiff value) { this.m_textDiffBean = value; }

    public void onLeftTextAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_textDiffBean.prepareTexts(m_leftText,m_rightText);
    }

    public void onRIghtTextActioi(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event)
    {
        m_textDiffBean.prepareTexts(m_leftText,m_rightText);
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Text Area with Line Numbers

The component TEXTAREAWITHCOMMENT shows a normal text area on the right.

On the left there is a parallel text area which renders a comment. The comment typically is some numbering, but may also be something different.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTextAreaWithComment}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:textareawithcomment id="g_3" commenttext="#{d.DemoTextAreaWithComment.comment}" flush="true" flushtimer="1000" font="family:Courier New" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoTextAreaWithComment.text}" userhint="Hello User Hint" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoTextAreaWithComment.onDefaultCommentAction}" text="Default numbering" />
<t:button id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoTextAreaWithComment.onSpecialCommentAction}" text="Own numbering" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.PageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTextAreaWithComment}")

public class DemoTextAreaWithComment
    extends DemoPageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    String m_text = "a\nb\nc\na\nb\nc\na\nb\nc\na\nb\nc\na\nb\nc\n";
    String m_comment = null;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoTextAreaWithComment(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotextareawithcomment.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoTextAreaWithComment}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getText() { return m_text; }
    public void setText(String value) { this.m_text = value; }
    
    public String getComment() { return m_comment; }

    public void onDefaultCommentAction(ActionEvent event)
    {
        m_comment = null;
    }
    
    public void onSpecialCommentAction(ActionEvent event)
    {
        StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
        for (int i=1; i<200; i++)
        {
            sb.append("\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n"+(i*10)+"\n");
        }
        m_comment = sb.toString();
    }
    

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Vertical Text Pane

The TEXTPANEVERTICAL renders multi line text content vertically. It's the vertical version of the normal TEXTPANE component.

The sizing is managed in the following way:

1. you may define both a HEIGHT and a WIDTH. In this case the component takes over exactly the size that you pass.

2. you may define only some HEIGHT. In this case the component calculates the desired width automatically.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTextPaneVertical}" >
<t:row id="g_2" coldistance="10" >
<t:textpanevertical id="g_3" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoTextPaneVertical.text}" />
<t:pane id="g_4" height="100%" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:textarea id="g_6" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoTextPaneVertical.text}" width="100%;200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:button id="g_8" text="Sync" width="100+" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTextPaneVertical}")

public class DemoTextPaneVertical
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo dolores et ea rebum. Stet clita kasd gubergren, no sea takimata sanctus est Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. At vero eos et accusam et justo duo dolores et ea rebum. Stet clita kasd gubergren, no sea takimata sanctus est Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet.";

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoTextPaneVertical(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotextpanevertical.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoTextPaneVertical}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getText() { return m_text; }
    public void setText(String value) { this.m_text = value; }
}

Text Pane - word wrapping

The same text is output to a TEXTPANE, one time without word-wrapping, the other time with word-wrapping.

By setting attribute TEXTPANE-WORDWRAP to "true", long words are wrapped if required. By default long words are cut.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTextPaneBreak}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Default" width="120" />
<t:textpane id="g_4" text="averyveryveryveryveryveryveryveryveryveryveryveryveryveryveryveryveryveryveryverylongwordwithoutinterruptionastest. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua." width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="WORDWRAP=true" width="120" />
<t:textpane id="g_7" text="averyveryveryveryveryveryveryveryveryveryveryveryveryveryveryveryveryveryveryverylongwordwithoutinterruptionastest. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua." width="200" wordwrap="true" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.DefaultDispatchedPageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTextPaneBreak}")

public class DemoTextPaneBreak
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
     public DemoTextPaneBreak(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotextpanebreak.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoTextPaneBreak}"; }

 }

Info Text Pane

There are three pre-configured style variants for the LABEL, which add some border and background to the label text in order to raise more attraction to the user.

The names are "ccinfored", "ccinfoyellow" and "ccinfogreen".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoInfoLabel}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Label" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" stylevariant="ccinfored" text="Error" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" stylevariant="ccinfoyellow" text="Warning" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" stylevariant="ccinfogreen" text="Info" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:label id="g_25" stylevariant="ccinfoblue" text="Info" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" stylevariant="ccinfogreen" text="Info with some longer text" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_13" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Textpane" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" coldistance="10" >
<t:textpane id="g_17" stylevariant="ccinfored" text="The text pane renders text that contains several lines." />
<t:textpane id="g_18" stylevariant="ccinfoyellow" text="The text pane renders text that contains several lines." />
<t:textpane id="g_19" stylevariant="ccinfogreen" text="The text pane renders text that contains several lines." />
<t:textpane id="g_27" stylevariant="ccinfoblue" text="The text pane renders text that contains several lines." />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_20" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_21" coldistance="10" >
<t:textpane id="g_22" stylevariant="ccinfogreen" text="The text pane renders text that contains several lines. The text pane renders text that contains several lines." width="100%;100" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoInfoLabel}")

public class DemoInfoLabel
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoInfoLabel(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoinfolabel.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoInfoLabel}"; }
}

Text transform to upper/lower case

Most of the components rendering some text content provide an attribute TEXTTRANSFORM which either can be set to "uppercase" or "lowercase". The text that is output is updated inside the client accordingly.

This is extremely useful when e.g. defining text in resource files for multi-language usage: you do not want to define literals in upper case within the resource files, but only want the output in the control to be upper case.

Please also note:

1. for FIELD-components there is an equivalent UPPERCASE / LOWERCASE property. Here the user input is transferred correspondingly.

2. LABELTEXT values (the little labels shown on top left of a e.g. field) can be transformed using the LABELTEXTTRANSFORM attribute

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoTextTransform}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTextTransform}" rowdistance="50" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:pane id="g_7" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" width="100%" >
<t:rowtitlebar id="g_93" text="Upper case" texttransform="uppercase" />
<t:row id="g_25" coldistance="10" >
<t:label id="g_26" text="Label" texttransform="uppercase" width="100+" />
<t:labelvertical id="g_31" text="Vertical" texttransform="uppercase" />
<t:textpane id="g_36" text="TextPane TextPane TextPane TextPane" texttransform="uppercase" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:field id="g_20" labeltext="Field input/output in upper case" labeltexttransform="uppercase" uppercase="true" width="300" />
<t:labelcontainer id="g_84" text="A label container" texttransform="uppercase" >
<t:label id="g_85" text="Some content" texttransform="uppercase" />
</t:labelcontainer>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" coldistance="10" >
<t:button id="g_10" text="Button" texttransform="uppercase" width="100+" />
<t:icon id="g_5" align="left" image="/images/iconssvg/delete_16x16.svg" text="Icon" texttransform="uppercase" width="100+" />
<t:link id="g_89" align="left" image="/images/iconssvg/delete_16x16.svg" text="Link" texttransform="uppercase" width="100+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_41" >
<t:checkbox id="g_68" text="Check box" texttransform="uppercase" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_78" text="Radio button" texttransform="uppercase" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_69" >
<t:menubar id="g_70" >
<t:menu id="g_71" text="File" texttransform="uppercase" >
<t:menuitem id="g_72" text="Open..." texttransform="uppercase" />
<t:menuitem id="g_73" text="Save" texttransform="uppercase" />
</t:menu>
<t:menu id="g_74" text="Edit" texttransform="uppercase" >
<t:menuitem id="g_75" text="Undo" texttransform="uppercase" />
</t:menu>
</t:menubar>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_57" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_58" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTextTransform.grid}" sbvisibleamount="2" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_59" text="Last name" texttransform="uppercase" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_61" text=".{lastName}" texttransform="uppercase" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_97" coldistance="10" >
<t:tabbedpane id="g_2" width="100%" >
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_98" text="Left tab" texttransform="uppercase" />
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_3" text="Right tab" texttransform="uppercase" />
</t:tabbedpane>
<t:tabbedlinecontainer id="g_100" width="100%" >
<t:tabbedlinecontainertab id="g_101" text="Left tab" texttransform="uppercase" />
<t:tabbedlinecontainertab id="g_102" text="Right tab" texttransform="uppercase" />
</t:tabbedlinecontainer>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:pane id="g_13" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" width="100%" >
<t:rowtitlebar id="g_95" text="Lower case" texttransform="lowercase" />
<t:row id="g_28" coldistance="10" >
<t:label id="g_29" text="Label" texttransform="lowercase" width="100+" />
<t:labelvertical id="g_33" text="Vertical" texttransform="lowercase" />
<t:textpane id="g_39" text="TextPane TextPane TextPane TextPane" texttransform="lowercase" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:field id="g_23" labeltext="Field input/output in upper case" labeltexttransform="lowercase" lowercase="true" width="300" />
<t:labelcontainer id="g_86" text="A label container" texttransform="lowercase" >
<t:label id="g_87" text="Some content" texttransform="uppercase" />
</t:labelcontainer>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" coldistance="10" >
<t:button id="g_15" text="Button" texttransform="lowercase" width="100+" />
<t:icon id="g_17" align="left" image="/images/iconssvg/delete_16x16.svg" text="Icon" texttransform="lowercase" width="100+" />
<t:link id="g_91" align="left" image="/images/iconssvg/delete_16x16.svg" text="Link" texttransform="lowercase" width="100+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_80" >
<t:checkbox id="g_81" text="Check box" texttransform="lowercase" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_82" text="Radio button" texttransform="lowercase" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_49" >
<t:menubar id="g_50" >
<t:menu id="g_51" text="File" texttransform="lowercase" >
<t:menuitem id="g_52" text="Open..." texttransform="lowercase" />
<t:menuitem id="g_53" text="Save" texttransform="lowercase" />
</t:menu>
<t:menu id="g_54" text="Edit" texttransform="lowercase" >
<t:menuitem id="g_55" text="Undo" texttransform="lowercase" />
</t:menu>
</t:menubar>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_63" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_64" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTextTransform.grid}" sbvisibleamount="2" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_65" text="Last name" texttransform="lowercase" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_66" text=".{lastName}" texttransform="lowercase" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_104" coldistance="10" >
<t:tabbedpane id="g_105" width="100%" >
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_106" text="Left tab" texttransform="lowercase" />
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_107" text="Right tab" texttransform="lowercase" />
</t:tabbedpane>
<t:tabbedlinecontainer id="g_108" width="100%" >
<t:tabbedlinecontainertab id="g_109" text="Left tab" texttransform="lowercase" />
<t:tabbedlinecontainertab id="g_110" text="Right tab" texttransform="lowercase" />
</t:tabbedlinecontainer>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import workplace.logic.RandomLogic;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTextTransform}")

public class DemoTextTransform
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { this.i_lastName = value; }

        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoTextTransform(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);    
        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setLastName(RandomLogic.getLastName());
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotexttransform.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoTextTransform}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Simple text editor

Edit the text in one of the editor instances of the demo. When tabbing out of the instance the value is populated to the other ones.

The component TEXTEDITOR is a simple editor that is internally based on an edit-able DIV element.

For this reason it overcomes some of the weaknesses of the TEXTAREA component:
