(.) You can embed HTML elements into the text of the editor (e.g. images or span-elements) and use this editor to edit "text around".
(.) The sizing of the editor is more flexible - you may define the editor to have a flexible height so that it adapts its size to the contained text.

Please pay attention: by default the HTML text that is editred is sanitized by quite strong rule on client side in order to prevent client side JavaScript injection. This injection e.g. avoids images to be part of the HTML. - You may avoide this sanitizing by setting attribute AVOIDSANITIZING to "false". But, of course: in this case you are responsible on your own for checking the text for client side injection!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoSimpleTextEditor}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSimpleTextEditor}" rowdistance="20" >
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_5" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" text="Fix size, with scrolling" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_6" coldistance="20" >
<t:texteditor id="g_9" avoidsanitizing="true" flush="true" height="80" labeltext="Some text" selectallwhenfocussed="false" text="#{d.DemoSimpleTextEditor.editorText}" width="300" withspellcheck="false" />
<t:texteditor id="g_12" avoidsanitizing="true" flush="true" height="80" labeltext="Some text" selectallwhenfocussed="false" text="#{d.DemoSimpleTextEditor.editorText}" width="100%" withspellcheck="false" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_15" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" text="Variable height, no scrolling" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:splitpane id="g_19" width="100%" >
<t:splitpanesplit id="g_10" >
<t:row id="g_23" coldistance="20" >
<t:texteditor id="g_24" avoidsanitizing="true" flush="true" labeltext="Some text" rowalignmenty="top" selectallwhenfocussed="false" text="#{d.DemoSimpleTextEditor.editorText}" width="100%" withspellcheck="false" />
</t:row>
</t:splitpanesplit>
<t:splitpanesplit id="g_11" >
<t:row id="g_20" coldistance="20" >
<t:texteditor id="g_21" avoidsanitizing="true" flush="true" labeltext="Some text" rowalignmenty="top" selectallwhenfocussed="false" text="#{d.DemoSimpleTextEditor.editorText}" width="100%" withspellcheck="false" />
</t:row>
</t:splitpanesplit>
</t:splitpane>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_28" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_26" >
<t:textpane id="g_13" stylevariant="ccsmall" text="Change the size of the left/right area of the split pane - and see how the editor adapts its size according to the content." width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoSimpleTextEditor}")

public class DemoSimpleTextEditor
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_editorText = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod "
        + "tempor invidunt ut labore <img src=\"images/icons/car.png\"> et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. "
        + "At vero eos et accusam et justo <span contenteditable=\"false\"><b>duo dolores</b></span> et ea rebum. Stet clita kasd gubergren, "
        + "no sea takimata sanctus est Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet.";

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoSimpleTextEditor(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demosimpletexteditor.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoSimpleTextEditor}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getEditorText() { return m_editorText; }
    public void setEditorText(String value) { this.m_editorText = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Simple text editor - caret info

This example shows how to insert text (here: HTML statements) into a document during editing.

The editor component informs about the current caret location by the attribute TEXTSELECTIONINFO - which provides a semicolon separated integer sequence. Index 0 holds holds the carte position. In case of a selection in client side index 1 holds the start of the selection and index 2 the end of the selection.

When actively setting the caret on server side then you need to trigger the client explicitly using attribute TRIGGERTEXTSELECTION.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoSimpleTextEditorCaretMgmt}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSimpleTextEditorCaretMgmt}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:textpane id="g_13" stylevariant="ccbig" text="User ctrl-i to insert an image and ctrl-j to insert a span while editing." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:scrollpane id="g_7" border="#00000030" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:texteditor id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoSimpleTextEditorCaretMgmt.onTextAction}" avoidsanitizing="true" background="#00000000" border="0" flush="true" flushtimer="2000" height="100%" selectallwhenfocussed="false" text="#{d.DemoSimpleTextEditorCaretMgmt.text}" textselectioninfo="#{d.DemoSimpleTextEditorCaretMgmt.textSelectionInfo}" triggertextselection="#{d.DemoSimpleTextEditorCaretMgmt.textSelectionInfoTrigger}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:scrollpane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_20" coldistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultcoldistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:button id="g_21" actionListener="#{d.DemoSimpleTextEditorCaretMgmt.onAddImageAction}" hotkey="ctrl-73" text="Add image" width="100+" />
<t:button id="g_18" actionListener="#{d.DemoSimpleTextEditorCaretMgmt.onAddSpanAction}" hotkey="ctrl-74" text="Add fix text" width="100+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import workplace.logic.RandomLogic;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoSimpleTextEditorCaretMgmt}")

public class DemoSimpleTextEditorCaretMgmt
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    static String NBSP = "\u202F";
    
    String m_textSelectionInfo;
    String m_text = RandomLogic.getLoremIpsumShort();
    Trigger m_textSelectionInfoTrigger = new Trigger();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoSimpleTextEditorCaretMgmt(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demosimpletexteditorcaretmgmt.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoSimpleTextEditorCaretMgmt}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getTextSelectionInfo() { return m_textSelectionInfo; }
    public void setTextSelectionInfo(String value) { m_textSelectionInfo = value; }
    public Trigger getTextSelectionInfoTrigger() { return m_textSelectionInfoTrigger; }

    public String getText() { return m_text; }
    public void setText(String value) 
    { 
        m_text = value;
        // &nbsp; is treated as one character in browser! but would be treated as
        // 5 characters in java processing
        m_text = m_text.replace("&nbsp;",NBSP);
    }
    

    public void onAddImageAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        updateText("<img src=\"images/iconssvg/add_16x16.svg\">");
    }

    public void onAddSpanAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        updateText("<span contenteditable=\"false\" style=\"text-weight:bold;color:blue\">SOME FIX TEXT</span>");
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void updateText(String sForInsert)
    {
        int insertPosition = findInsertPosition();
        m_text = m_text.substring(0,insertPosition) + sForInsert + m_text.substring(insertPosition);
        int newCaretPosition = insertPosition + sForInsert.length();
        m_textSelectionInfo = newCaretPosition + ";" + newCaretPosition + ";" + newCaretPosition;
        m_textSelectionInfoTrigger.trigger();
    }

    private int findInsertPosition()
    {
        int insertPosition = m_text.length();
        try
        {
            int[] tsiValues = ValueManager.decodeStraightIntCSV(m_textSelectionInfo);
            if (tsiValues[0] >= 0)
                insertPosition = tsiValues[0];
        }
        catch (Throwable t) { }
        return insertPosition;
    }

}

Check Box & Radio Button

Check Box

The CHECKBOX component maintains a boolean value. On server side it either can be implemented as "boolean" type property or as "Boolean" object property.

When implementing as object you can take use of the TRIPLESTATE attribute. In this case the check box is able to render three states: selected (true), de-selected (false) and "partially selected" (null).

When do you need a triple state checkbox? Typically when you position the checkbox into a tree. "Partially selected" then tells the user that some tree nodes below one tree node are selected, but not all.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoCheckbox}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Checkbox" width="150" />
<t:checkbox id="g_4" selected="#{d.demoCheckbox.value}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Checkbox with Text" width="150" />
<t:checkbox id="g_7" selected="#{d.demoCheckbox.value2}" text="Some text" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="Triple State Checkbox" width="150" />
<t:checkbox id="g_11" flush="true" selected="#{d.demoCheckbox.tripleValue}" text="Some text" triplestate="true" />
<t:coldistance id="g_23" width="20" />
<t:label id="g_24" text="default: true/false input" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_26" >
<t:coldistance id="g_27" width="150" />
<t:checkbox id="g_28" flush="true" selected="#{d.demoCheckbox.tripleValue}" text="Some text" triplestate="true" triplestateinput="true" />
<t:coldistance id="g_29" width="20" />
<t:label id="g_30" text="now: true/false/null input" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="(disabled)" width="150" />
<t:checkbox id="g_14" enabled="false" selected="#{d.demoCheckbox.tripleValue}" text="Some text" triplestate="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:coldistance id="g_16" width="150" />
<t:button id="g_17" actionListener="#{d.demoCheckbox.onSetTrue}" text="Set TRUE" />
<t:coldistance id="g_18" width="5" />
<t:button id="g_19" actionListener="#{d.demoCheckbox.onSetBetween}" text="Set NULL" />
<t:coldistance id="g_20" width="5" />
<t:button id="g_21" actionListener="#{d.demoCheckbox.onSetFalse}" text="Set FALSE" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoCheckbox extends PageBean
{
    boolean m_value;
    boolean m_value2;
    Boolean m_tripleValue;

    public DemoCheckbox(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("checkbox");
    }
    
    public boolean isValue()
    {
        return m_value;
    }
    public void setValue(boolean value)
    {
        m_value = value;
    }
    
    
    public boolean isValue2()
    {
        return m_value2;
    }
    public void setValue2(boolean value2)
    {
        m_value2 = value2;
    }
    
    public Boolean getTripleValue()
    {
        return m_tripleValue;
    }
    public void setTripleValue(Boolean value)
    {
        m_tripleValue = value;
    }
    
    public void onSetTrue(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        m_tripleValue = new Boolean(true);
    }
    
    public void onSetFalse(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        m_tripleValue = new Boolean(false);
    }
    public void onSetBetween(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        m_tripleValue = null;
    }
}

Image Toggle

The TOGGLE component is very similar to a CHECKBOX - you can maintain a boolean value. For each state (true/false) you can define a specific image to be rendered. Use attributes IMAGETRUE and IMAGEFALSE. There is a default image representing a switch, that is shown if no images are specified - but we strongly recommend to use own images!

On server side the TOGGLE is represented by a boolean/Boolean value. In case of using "B"oolean, a null value is represented by a corresponding image defined by attribute IMAGENULL.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoToggle}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Switch" width="100" />
<t:toggle id="g_4" animationtype="fogdark" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoToggle.married}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:label id="g_14" text="...with text" width="100" />
<t:toggle id="g_15" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoToggle.married}" text="married" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_24" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:textpane id="g_22" text="All three status of the toggle component (true/false/null) reference some own image definition. By using &#34;.ccsvg&#34; for loading flat SVG images you can directly update the color." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:label id="g_18" text="Switch" width="100" />
<t:toggle id="g_19" flush="true" imagefalse="/eclntjsfserver.images.iconssvg.toggleoff.#800000.36x24.ccsvg" imagenull="/eclntjsfserver.images.iconssvg.toggleoff.#c0c0c0.36x24.ccsvg" imagetrue="/eclntjsfserver.images.iconssvg.toggleon.#008000.36x24.ccsvg" selected="#{d.DemoToggle.married}" text="married" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Day/Night" width="100" />
<t:toggle id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoToggle.onDayAction}" flush="true" imagefalse="/images/pictures/night.png" imagenull="/images/pictures/daynight.png" imagetrue="/images/pictures/day.png" selected="#{d.DemoToggle.day}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="20" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoToggle}")

public class DemoToggle extends PageBean
{
    public void onDayAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("DAY changed: " + m_day);
    }

    public DemoToggle(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("toggle");
    }

    protected Boolean m_day = null;
    public Boolean getDay() { return m_day; }
    public void setDay(Boolean value) { m_day = value; }

    protected boolean m_married = false;
    public boolean getMarried() { return m_married; }
    public void setMarried(boolean value) { m_married = value; }
}

Radio Button

Radio buttons are logically structured in groups. A group name is defined by the attribute GROUP - it must be unique within one page. Each group maintains one shared value, that is referenced using the VALUE attribute of each RADIOBUTTON. The REFVALUE attribute defined in the RADIOBUTTON defines the value that is represented by the corresponding button.

There is one optional feature used in the demo: the ISDEFAULT attribute. It can be set with exactly one item of the group. This item is switched on if the referenced VALUE is null, as well.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoRadioButton}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Color" width="100" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_4" flush="true" foreground="#C00000" group="COLOR" isdefault="true" refvalue="#FF0000" text="Red" value="#{d.DemoRadioButton.color}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_6" width="100" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_7" flush="true" foreground="#00C000" group="COLOR" refvalue="#00FF00" text="Green" value="#{d.DemoRadioButton.color}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:coldistance id="g_9" width="100" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_10" flush="true" foreground="#0000C0" group="COLOR" refvalue="#0000FF" text="Blue" value="#{d.DemoRadioButton.color}" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_11" width="20" />
<t:field id="g_12" enabled="false" text="#{d.DemoRadioButton.color}" width="80" />
<t:coldistance id="g_13" />
<t:button id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoRadioButton.onColorNull}" text="Set null" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoRadioButton}")

public class DemoRadioButton
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoRadioButton(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("radiobutton");
    }

    protected String m_color;
    public String getColor() { return m_color; }
    public void setColor(String value) { m_color = value; }

    public void onColorNull(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_color = null;
    }

}

Radio Button Group

The RADIOBUTTONGROUP binds to a ValidValuesBinding instance on server side - in the same way as a COMBOBOX.

Per value an individual RADIOBUTTON is rendered. You can select between a horizontal and a vertical arrangement.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoRadioButtonGroup}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoRadioButtonGroup}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:label id="g_4" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Selection of one value - with RADIOBUTTONGROUP" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:radiobuttongroup id="g_6" flush="true" labeltext="Department" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoRadioButtonGroup.departmentVVS}" value="#{d.DemoRadioButtonGroup.department}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:radiobuttongroup id="g_8" flush="true" labeltext="Department" orientation="vertical" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoRadioButtonGroup.departmentVVS}" value="#{d.DemoRadioButtonGroup.department}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_9" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Selection of one value - with COMBOBOX" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:combobox id="g_13" flush="true" labeltext="Department" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoRadioButtonGroup.departmentVVS}" value="#{d.DemoRadioButtonGroup.department}" width="150" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoRadioButtonGroup}")

public class DemoRadioButtonGroup
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    ValidValuesBinding m_departmentVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();
    String m_department = "0002";

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoRadioButtonGroup(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        m_departmentVVS.addValidValue("0001","Sales");
        m_departmentVVS.addValidValue("0002","Marketing");
        m_departmentVVS.addValidValue("0003","Production");
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoradiobuttongroup.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoRadioButtonGroup}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public ValidValuesBinding getDepartmentVVS() { return m_departmentVVS; }

    public String getDepartment() { return m_department; }
    public void setDepartment(String value) { this.m_department = value; }
}

Tabbed Line Style Variants

There are some pre-configured style variants that are part of the default style.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTabbedLineStyleVariants}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Default" width="80" />
<t:tabbedline id="g_4" >
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_5" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_6" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_7" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_8" text="tab" />
</t:tabbedline>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="cctl05" width="80" />
<t:tabbedline id="g_11" stylevariant="cctl05" width="100%" >
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_12" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_13" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_14" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_15" text="tab" />
</t:tabbedline>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="cctl01" width="80" />
<t:tabbedline id="g_18" stylevariant="cctl01" >
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_19" text="tab" width="70" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_20" text="tab" width="70" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_21" text="tab" width="70" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_22" text="tab" width="70" />
</t:tabbedline>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_23" >
<t:label id="g_24" text="cctl02" width="80" />
<t:tabbedline id="g_25" stylevariant="cctl02" >
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_26" text="tab" width="70" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_27" text="tab" width="70" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_28" text="tab" width="70" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_29" text="tab" width="70" />
</t:tabbedline>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_30" >
<t:label id="g_31" text="cctl03" width="80" />
<t:tabbedline id="g_32" stylevariant="cctl03" >
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_33" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_34" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_35" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_36" text="tab" />
</t:tabbedline>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_37" >
<t:label id="g_38" text="cctl04" width="80" />
<t:tabbedline id="g_39" stylevariant="cctl04" >
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_40" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_41" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_42" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_43" text="tab" />
</t:tabbedline>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_44" >
<t:label id="g_45" text="cctlbreadcrumb01" width="100" />
<t:tabbedline id="g_46" stylevariant="cctlbreadcrumb01" >
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_47" stylevariant="cctlbreadcrumb01" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_48" stylevariant="cctlbreadcrumb01" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_49" stylevariant="cctlbreadcrumb01" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_50" stylevariant="cctlbreadcrumb01" text="tab" />
</t:tabbedline>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_52" >
<t:label id="g_53" text="cctlbreadcrumb01" width="100" />
<t:tabbedline id="g_54" menuiconvisible="false" stylevariant="cctlbutton" width="100" withscrollicons="false" >
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_55" stylevariant="cctlbreadcrumb01" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_56" stylevariant="cctlbreadcrumb01" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_57" stylevariant="cctlbreadcrumb01" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_58" stylevariant="cctlbreadcrumb01" text="tab" />
</t:tabbedline>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoTabbedLineStyleVariants extends PageBean
{

    public DemoTabbedLineStyleVariants(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("tabbedline");
    }

}

Images

Image output

Image data can be output using the IMAGE or the HEXIMAGE component.

The IMAGE component receives an IMAGE attribute value that represents an access path to an image within your web application. The value either starts with "/" (being the root of your application) or is relative to the location of your page. The client will load the image via http(s) access and then cache it.

The HEXIMAGE component receives a hexadecimal string that is translated into an image on client side. The string may represent a .png , .gif or .jpg file. Use the ValueManager for transferring a byte[] array into a hexadecimal string representation.


Both type of components support the following features:

(.) explicit setting of width and height
(.) definition if the width/height ratio is kept when being resized
(.) reacting on click events (using INVOKEEVENT attribute)
(.) popup menus, hot keys, etc. as any other component

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoImage}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_3" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="IMAGE component: loading via &#34;URL&#34;" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="/images/icons/bigcalendar.png" width="180" />
<t:image id="g_6" image="/images/icons/bigcalendar.png" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="100% * 80, stretched" width="180" />
<t:image id="g_9" height="80" image="/images/icons/bigcalendar.png" keepratio="false" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="100% * 80, keep ratio" width="180" />
<t:image id="g_12" height="80" image="/images/icons/bigcalendar.png" keepratio="true" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:label id="g_14" text="100% * 80, keep ratio, aligned" width="180" />
<t:image id="g_15" align="center" background="#f0f0f0" height="80" image="/images/icons/bigcalendar.png" keepratio="true" valign="center" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_16" height="25" />
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:label id="g_18" text="Click enabled" width="180" />
<t:image id="g_19" actionListener="#{d.demoImage.onImageInvoke}" image="/images/icons/bigcalendar.png" invokeevent="click" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:label id="g_21" text="Double click enabled" width="180" />
<t:image id="g_22" actionListener="#{d.demoImage.onImageInvoke}" image="/images/icons/bigcalendar.png" invokeevent="doubleclick" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_23" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_24" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="HEXIMAGE component: passing the bytes..." width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_25" >
<t:coldistance id="g_26" width="180" />
<t:heximage id="g_27" hexdata="#{d.demoImage.hexi}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:coldistance id="g_29" width="180" />
<t:textarea id="g_30" height="100" text="#{d.demoImage.hexi}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_31" height="25" />
<t:row id="g_32" >
<t:label id="g_33" text="Stretched, double click" width="180" />
<t:heximage id="g_34" actionListener="#{d.demoImage.onImageInvoke}" height="80" hexdata="#{d.demoImage.hexi}" invokeevent="doubleclick" keepratio="false" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_35" >
<t:label id="g_36" text="Ratio kept, centered" width="180" />
<t:heximage id="g_37" actionListener="#{d.demoImage.onImageInvoke}" align="center" height="80" hexdata="#{d.demoImage.hexi}" invokeevent="doubleclick" keepratio="true" valign="center" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.WebResourceReader;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.demoImage}")

public class DemoImage extends PageBean
{
    public DemoImage(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("image");
    }

    public void onImageInvoke(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Invoke on image!");
    }

    public String getHexi() 
    { 
        byte[] bytes = WebResourceReader.readFileIntoByteArray("/images/icons/bigmails.png");
        String result = ValueManager.encodeHexString(bytes);
        return result;
    }

}

Image fill mode

When images are explicitly sized then you can define how images should fit into the available space.

The "cover" mode is especially useful for images that serve as background of a screen because it always guarantees the full area to be filled without breaking the image's ratio.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoImageFillMode}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoImageFillMode}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:textpane id="g_4" align="center" stylevariant="ccbig" text="All the following images are sized to 150 x 150" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_5" height="20" />
<t:rowflexlinecontainer id="g_6" coldistance="10" rowdistance="10" >
<t:pane id="g_7" border="#00000010" padding="5" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" shadow="hoffset:5;voffset:5;blur:5;color:#00000030" width="100%;250" >
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" align="center" text="Defaut: keep ratio, mode &#34;contain&#34;" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:coldistance id="g_11" width="100%" />
<t:image id="g_12" border="#00000010" height="150" image="/images/pictures/carpicture.jpg" width="150" />
<t:coldistance id="g_13" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
<t:pane id="g_14" border="#00000010" padding="5" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" shadow="hoffset:5;voffset:5;blur:5;color:#00000030" width="100%;250" >
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_16" align="center" text="Keep ratio, mode &#34;cover&#34;" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:coldistance id="g_18" width="100%" />
<t:image id="g_19" border="#00000010" height="150" image="/images/pictures/carpicture.jpg" keepratiofitmode="cover" width="150" />
<t:coldistance id="g_20" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
<t:pane id="g_21" border="#00000010" padding="5" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" shadow="hoffset:5;voffset:5;blur:5;color:#00000030" width="100%;250" >
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:label id="g_23" align="center" text="Not keeeping ratio" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:coldistance id="g_25" width="100%" />
<t:image id="g_26" border="#00000010" height="150" image="/images/pictures/carpicture.jpg" keepratio="false" width="150" />
<t:coldistance id="g_27" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:rowflexlinecontainer>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoImageFillMode}")

public class DemoImageFillMode
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoImageFillMode(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoimagefillmode.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoImageFillMode}"; }
}

SVG images

SVG images can be used just as normal images.

The default size of the SVG image is derived out of its SVG element:
"<svg ... width="..." height=".." ...>"

If no height is available then the size is set to 16x16.

Of course you can explicitly set the width and height. Unlike with e.g. PNG or JPG images, SVG images always keept their ratio.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSVGImages}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="100%" />
<t:image id="g_4" height="50" image="/images/iconssvg/svglogo.svg" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Image component with SVG content" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="No size inside SVG" width="150" />
<t:image id="g_9" image="/images/iconssvg/cake_withoutsize.svg" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="Size inside SVG" width="150" />
<t:image id="g_12" image="/images/iconssvg/cake_withsize.svg" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:label id="g_14" text="Explicitly sized 100x100" width="150" />
<t:image id="g_15" height="100" image="/images/iconssvg/cake_withsize.svg" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="Explicitly sized 100x50" width="150" />
<t:image id="g_18" height="50" image="/images/iconssvg/cake_withsize.svg" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_19" height="30" />
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:label id="g_21" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Image component with SVG content" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:label id="g_23" text="No size inside SVG" width="150" />
<t:button id="g_24" image="/images/iconssvg/cake_withoutsize.svg" text="Happy birthday!" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_25" >
<t:label id="g_26" text="No size inside SVG" width="150" />
<t:button id="g_27" image="/images/iconssvg/cake_withsize.svg" text="Happy birthday!" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:label id="g_29" text="Explicitly sized 100x100" width="150" />
<t:button id="g_30" image="/images/iconssvg/cake_withsize.svg" imageheight="100" imagewidth="100" text="button" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoSVGImages}")

public class DemoSVGImages
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoSVGImages(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demosvgimages.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoSVGImages}"; }
}

SVG images - coloring and sizing

Flat SVG icons can be accessed via some special URL, in which you can pass the color and the size of the icon. Is is possible as consequence to use one SVG definition for multiple colors and sizes.

The format is: /[DIR.]NAME.COLOR.WIDTHxHEIGHT.ccsvg

Example: if the SVG-file in the webcontent is "/images/svgicons/icon.svg" then a valid URL would be: "/images.svgicons.icon.#800000.32x32.ccsvg"

On server side the file either may be located in the webcontent directory, or it may be located within the classes that are loaded.

In addition within an image you may directly access variables from CaptainCasa style definitions - so that you can outsource color and style values into the style. This is a very strong feature because the color of flat icons typically depends on the background styling of the area that it is located on.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSVGImageColorSize}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Different colors &amp; sizes, explicitly defined:" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_5" image="/images.iconssvg.heartbeat.#800000.16x16.ccsvg" text="Red 16x16" verticaltextposition="bottom" />
<t:button id="g_6" image="/images.iconssvg.heartbeat.#000080.32x32.ccsvg" text="Blue 32x32" verticaltextposition="bottom" />
<t:button id="g_7" image="/images.iconssvg.heartbeat.#008000.48x48.ccsvg" text="Green 48x48" verticaltextposition="bottom" />
<t:button id="g_8" image="/images.iconssvg.heartbeat.#606060.64x64.ccsvg" text="Gray 64x64" verticaltextposition="bottom" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Different colors &amp; sizes, defined via style variables:" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_12" image="/images.iconssvg.heartbeat.@iconDark@.@iconSmall@.ccsvg" text="small, dark" verticaltextposition="bottom" />
<t:button id="g_13" image="/images.iconssvg.heartbeat.@iconDark@.@iconBig@.ccsvg" text="big, dark" verticaltextposition="bottom" />
<t:button id="g_14" background="#606060" foreground="#f0f0f0" image="/images.iconssvg.heartbeat.@iconLight@.@iconSmall@.ccsvg" text="small, light" verticaltextposition="bottom" />
<t:button id="g_15" background="#606060" foreground="#F0F0F0" image="/images.iconssvg.heartbeat.@iconLight@.@iconBig@.ccsvg" text="big, light" verticaltextposition="bottom" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoSVGImageColorSize}")

public class DemoSVGImageColorSize
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoSVGImageColorSize(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demosvgimagecolorsize.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoSVGImageColorSize}"; }
}

Image as background

This demo shows how to arrange a picture-image as background.

(.) Use OVERLAYAREA and OVERLAYREAITEM to arrange two z-layers
(.) paint the IMAGE on the background layer
(.) use IMAGE-KEEPRATIONFILLMODE to make the image cover the whole space with keeping its ratio

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoImageAsBackground}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoImageAsBackground}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:overlayarea id="g_4" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:overlayareaitem id="g_5" height="100%" width="100%" x="0" y="0" zindex="1" >
<t:image id="g_6" height="100%" image="/images/pictures/riscBackground0.jpg" keepratiofitmode="cover" width="100%" />
</t:overlayareaitem>
<t:overlayareaitem id="g_7" height="100%" width="100%" x="0" y="0" zindex="2" >
<t:pane id="g_8" padding="50" >
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:box id="g_10" background="#FFFFFFF0" height="100%" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:field id="g_12" labeltext="Some content 1" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:field id="g_14" labeltext="Some content 2" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:field id="g_16" labeltext="Some content 3" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_17" height="100%" />
<t:row id="g_18" coldistance="5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_19" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_20" text="Some button" />
<t:button id="g_21" text="Some button" />
</t:row>
</t:box>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:overlayareaitem>
</t:overlayarea>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoImageAsBackground}")

public class DemoImageAsBackground
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoImageAsBackground(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoimageasbackground.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoImageAsBackground}"; }
}

Dynamic image content
Dynamic SVG content

Just like other images (JPG, ...), SVG-images can also be dynamically loaded.

You may either use the component HEXIMAGE - or you may use any other component and pass a pseudo URL ("hex(...)") into the IMAGE-attribute.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSVGImagesDynamic}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="By using component HEXIMAGE" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoSVGImagesDynamic.onLoadSVGLogoAction}" text="Load SVG logo" />
<t:button id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoSVGImagesDynamic.onLoadBirthdayCakeAction}" text="Load birthday cake" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="Not sized" width="120" />
<t:heximage id="g_9" hexdata="#{d.DemoSVGImagesDynamic.hexData}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="Explicitly sized" width="120" />
<t:heximage id="g_12" height="50" hexdata="#{d.DemoSVGImagesDynamic.hexData}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_13" height="25" />
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" stylevariant="ccbig" text="By using pseudo-URL &#34;/hex(...)&#34;" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="Image" width="120" />
<t:image id="g_18" image="#{d.DemoSVGImagesDynamic.urlHexData}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:label id="g_20" text="Button" width="120" />
<t:button id="g_21" image="#{d.DemoSVGImagesDynamic.urlHexData}" text="Some button" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:textarea id="g_23" height="100" text="#{d.DemoSVGImagesDynamic.urlHexData}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.WebResourceReader;
import org.eclnt.util.file.FileManager;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoSVGImagesDynamic}")

public class DemoSVGImagesDynamic
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    String m_hexData;
    public DemoSVGImagesDynamic(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        load("/images/iconssvg/svglogo.svg");
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demosvgimagesdynamic.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoSVGImagesDynamic}"; }

    public String getHexData() { return m_hexData; }
    
    private void load(String resource)
    {
        byte[] bytes = new WebResourceReader().readFileIntoByteArray(resource);
        m_hexData = ValueManager.encodeHexString(bytes);
    }

    public void onLoadBirthdayCakeAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        load("/images/iconssvg/cake_withsize.svg");
    }

    public void onLoadSVGLogoAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        load("/images/iconssvg/svglogo.svg");
    }
    
    public String getUrlHexData() { return "/hex(" + getHexData() + ")"; }
    
}

data:image-URIs

You may use data:image-URIs as well. For proper multi-browser support and for proper sizing, we recommend to only use base64-encoded URIs.

In the example the images are read from the deployed web application using the WebResourceReader-API.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoImageDataURL}">
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="PNG Image" width="100" />
<t:image id="g_4" image="#{d.DemoImageDataURL.imagePNG}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="JPG Image" width="100" />
<t:image id="g_7" image="#{d.DemoImageDataURL.imageJPG}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="SVG Image" width="100" />
<t:image id="g_10" image="#{d.DemoImageDataURL.imageSVG}" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.WebResourceReader;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.Base64;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoImageDataURL}")

public class DemoImageDataURL
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_imageJPG;
    String m_imageSVG;
    String m_imagePNG;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoImageDataURL(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        byte[] jpg = WebResourceReader.readFileIntoByteArray("images/pictures/ph0.jpg");
        byte[] png = WebResourceReader.readFileIntoByteArray("images/pictures/adressbuch.png");
        byte[] svg = WebResourceReader.readFileIntoByteArray("images/iconssvg/add_16x16.svg");
        m_imageJPG = "data:image/jpg;base64," + Base64.encode(jpg);
        m_imagePNG = "data:image/png;base64," + Base64.encode(png);
        m_imageSVG = "data:image/svg+xml;base64," + Base64.encode(svg);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoimagedataurl.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoImageDataURL}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getImageJPG() { return m_imageJPG; }
    public String getImageSVG() { return m_imageSVG; }
    public String getImagePNG() { return m_imagePNG; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Animated images

You can pass animated images into the client side image processing as well.
But: animated images need to indicate the animation by having "_animated" within their file name.

Background: the user can scale the client sizing using the client configuration popup (icon on the bottom right). This scaling also has impact on the size of images. For scaling images a certain API is used on client side that allows to scale up the size of images with a very good quality. This takes time but is only done once per image.
The API for scaling up images does not support animated images - so the client uses a different way of scaling up images, which is from result point of view "rougher". In order to know when to apply which scaling-algorithm you need to set the filename accordingly.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoImageAnimated}">
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:image id="g_3" image="/images/pictures/image_animated.gif" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:image id="g_5" height="100" image="/images/pictures/image_animated.gif" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoImageAnimated extends PageBean
{

    public DemoImageAnimated(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("image");
    }

}

Image (double) click

Many components (such as the IMAGE component) provide a property INVOKEEVENT. When setting to "click" or "doubleclick" then the component will react correspondingly and will send invoke-events to the server side processing.

On server side you can evaluate the exact click-position. Please pay attention: images and texts may be scaled on client side. When evaluating the click position, then always take the width and height information as reference, that is available via the event's API as well.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoImageInvoke}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" font="size:20;weight:bold" text="Click" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="click" width="155" />
<t:label id="g_6" text="leftclick" width="155" />
<t:label id="g_7" text="rightclick" width="155" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:image id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoImageInvoke.onInvoke}" image="/images/pictures/ph1.jpg" invokeevent="click" width="150" />
<t:coldistance id="g_10" width="5" />
<t:coldistance id="g_11" />
<t:image id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoImageInvoke.onInvoke}" image="/images/pictures/ph1.jpg" invokeevent="leftclick" width="150" />
<t:coldistance id="g_13" width="5" />
<t:image id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoImageInvoke.onInvoke}" image="/images/pictures/ph1.jpg" invokeevent="rightclick" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_16" text="#{d.DemoImageInvoke.result}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:label id="g_18" font="size:20;weight:bold" text="Double Click" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:image id="g_20" actionListener="#{d.DemoImageInvoke.onInvoke2}" image="/images/pictures/ph2.jpg" invokeevent="doubleclick" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:label id="g_22" text="#{d.DemoImageInvoke.result2}" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventInvoke;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ClientTestLog;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IClientLogAware;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoImageInvoke}")

public class DemoImageInvoke
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    String m_result;
    String m_result2;
    
    public DemoImageInvoke(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("image");
    }

    public String getResult() { return m_result; }
    public String getResult2() { return m_result2; }
    
    public void onInvoke(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventInvoke)
        {
            ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage("click executed");
            BaseActionEventInvoke baei = (BaseActionEventInvoke)event;
            m_result = "Click executed, coordinates: " + baei.getX() + ", " + 
                                                         baei.getY() + ", " + 
                                                         baei.getWidth() + ", " + 
                                                         baei.getHeight() + ", " +
                                                         baei.getClickCount();
        }
    }

    public void onInvoke2(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventInvoke)
        {
            ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage("double click executed");
            BaseActionEventInvoke baei = (BaseActionEventInvoke)event;
            m_result2 = "Double click executed, coordinates: " + baei.getX() + ", " + 
                                                                 baei.getY() + ", " + 
                                                                 baei.getWidth() + ", " + 
                                                                 baei.getHeight() + ", " +
                                                                 baei.getClickCount();
        }
    }

}

Image with mapped areas

The IMAGEMAP is able to render an image together with mapped area information. This means you can define areas of the image, either by rectangle or polygon definition. Each area has a certain id and a text associated.

When the user moves the mouse over an area, then the mouse cursor indicates that there is something clickable + the tooltip shows the text of the area. When the user clicks onto the area then an event is communicated to the server side. Part of the event is the id of the area, that was clicked.

The definition of mapping areas is simple: either use "rect(ID,TEXT,X,Y,WIDTH,HEIGHT)" or use "poly(ID,TEXT,X1,Y2,X2,Y2,...)". You can concatenate definitions, by separating them with a semicolon. Best, use ValueManeger.encodeCSV(...) for concatenating.

Please note: the mapped areas are only a definition of "hot spots" - there is e.g. no additional coloring associated. All the coloring comes through the image that is loaded.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoImageMap}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:imagemap id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoImageMap.onMapAreaAction}" image="/images/pictures/germany.gif" imageareas="rect(BAMMENTAL,Bammental (Home of CaptainCasa),144,211,14,11);rect(BERLIN,Berlin (Capital of Germany),226,96,10,10);rect(HAMBURG,Hamburg (2nd biggest city of Germany),161,55,10,10);poly(GERMANALPS,German Alps - very beatiful,177,272,186,266,243,265,252,274,236,276,222,272,203,279,192,274,184,282)" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_4" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Selected Id" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_7" enabled="false" text="#{d.DemoImageMap.selectedId}" width="250" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventImageMapAreaSelected;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoImageMap}")

public class DemoImageMap
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    protected String m_selectedId = "<not yet selected>";
    public String getSelectedId() { return m_selectedId; }
    public void setSelectedId(String value) { m_selectedId = value; }

    public DemoImageMap(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("imagemap");
    }

    public void onMapAreaAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventImageMapAreaSelected)
        {
            BaseActionEventImageMapAreaSelected e = (BaseActionEventImageMapAreaSelected)event;
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Area was selected, area's Id: " + e.getMapAreaId() + ", click count: " + e.getClickCount());
            m_selectedId = e.getMapAreaId();
        }
    }

}

Chart with mapped areas

In this demo, charts are created on server side - using the JFreeChart library. The image of the chart is transferred to the client, but not as URL but as hex string of data.

The component that is used within the layout is the HEXIMAGE component, that is able to render an image out of an hexstring representation of data (e.g. "af6e4453").

Have a look into the server side Java program: the image is created using the JFreeChart library, and then the image is transferred into a hex representation using the ValueManager class that comes with the server side library of Enterprise Client.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoCharts}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#e0e0e0" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" objectbinding="#{d.demoCharts.rows}" rowheight="16" sbvisibleamount="5" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="Town" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_5" text=".{town}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Inhabitants" width="50%" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_7" align="right" format="double" value=".{inhabitants}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.demoCharts.onCreateNewTown}" text="Add new Town" />
<t:coldistance id="g_11" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.demoCharts.onUpdateChart}" text="Update Chart" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_13" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:pane id="g_15" background="#FFFFFF" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,10,100%,#00000040,#00000000,horizontal);rectangle(100%-10,0,10,100%,#00000000,#00000040,horizontal);" border="top:1;bottom:1;color:#00000020" padding="5" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:coldistance id="g_17" width="50%" />
<t:heximagemap id="g_18" actionListener="#{d.DemoCharts.onImageMapAction}" hexdata="#{d.demoCharts.image}" imageareas="#{d.demoCharts.imageAreas}" />
<t:coldistance id="g_19" width="50%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.awt.Font;
import java.io.BufferedOutputStream;
import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileOutputStream;
import java.io.OutputStream;
import java.io.PrintWriter;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventImageMapAreaSelected;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.util.file.FileManager;
import org.eclnt.util.log.CLog;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.jfree.chart.ChartFactory;
import org.jfree.chart.ChartRenderingInfo;
import org.jfree.chart.ChartUtilities;
import org.jfree.chart.JFreeChart;
import org.jfree.chart.entity.ChartEntity;
import org.jfree.chart.entity.EntityCollection;
import org.jfree.chart.entity.StandardEntityCollection;
import org.jfree.chart.imagemap.StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator;
import org.jfree.chart.imagemap.ToolTipTagFragmentGenerator;
import org.jfree.chart.plot.MultiplePiePlot;
import org.jfree.chart.plot.PiePlot;
import org.jfree.data.category.CategoryDataset;
import org.jfree.data.general.DatasetUtilities;
import org.jfree.data.general.DefaultPieDataset;
import org.jfree.util.TableOrder;

public class DemoCharts extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------    

    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem
    {
        String m_town;
        double m_inhabitants;
        public String getTown()
        {
            return m_town;
        }
        public void setTown(String town)
        {
            m_town = town;
        }
        public double getInhabitants()
        {
            return m_inhabitants;
        }
        public void setInhabitants(double inhabitants)
        {
            m_inhabitants = inhabitants;
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> m_rows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>();
    String m_image;
    String m_imageAreas;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoCharts(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("imagemap");
        MyRow row;
        row = new MyRow(); row.setTown("Bammental"); row.setInhabitants(6800); m_rows.getItems().add(row);
        row = new MyRow(); row.setTown("Mauer"); row.setInhabitants(4000); m_rows.getItems().add(row);
        row = new MyRow(); row.setTown("Meckesheim"); row.setInhabitants(5300); m_rows.getItems().add(row);
        generateChart();
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getRows() { return m_rows; }
    
    public void setImage(String value) { m_image = value; }
    public String getImage() { return m_image; }
    
    public void setImageAreas(String value) { m_imageAreas = value; }
    public String getImageAreas() { return m_imageAreas; }
    
    public void onUpdateChart(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        generateChart();
    }
    
    public void onCreateNewTown(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        MyRow row = new MyRow();
        row.setTown("new town");
        m_rows.getItems().add(row);
    }
    
    public void onImageMapAction(ActionEvent event)
    {
        try
        {
            if (event instanceof BaseActionEventImageMapAreaSelected)
            {
                BaseActionEventImageMapAreaSelected e = (BaseActionEventImageMapAreaSelected)event;
                String mapId = e.getMapAreaId();
                int index = (new Integer(mapId)).intValue();
                m_rows.deselectCurrentSelection();
                m_rows.selectItem(index);
            }
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputError(t.toString());
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private void generateChart()
    {
        try
        {
            DefaultPieDataset ds = new DefaultPieDataset();
            for (MyRow row: m_rows.getItems())
                ds.setValue(row.getTown(),row.getInhabitants());
            // create image
            JFreeChart chart = ChartFactory.createPieChart("Some important towns",ds,true,true,false);
            ChartRenderingInfo info = new ChartRenderingInfo(new StandardEntityCollection());
            ByteArrayOutputStream bos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
            ChartUtilities.writeChartAsPNG(bos,chart,400,300,info);
            m_image = ValueManager.encodeHexString(bos.toByteArray());
            // collect entity data
            EntityCollection ec = info.getEntityCollection();
            StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
            Map<String,String> shapeCoordsByName = new HashMap<String,String>();
            for (int i=0; i<ec.getEntityCount(); i++)
            {
                ChartEntity ce = ec.getEntity(i);
                if (ce.getToolTipText() == null)
                    continue;
                String key = ce.getToolTipText();
                System.out.println(ce.getToolTipText());
                System.out.println(ce.getToolTipText());
                System.out.println(ce.getToolTipText());
                System.out.println(ce.getToolTipText());
                System.out.println(ce.getToolTipText());
                int index = key.lastIndexOf(':');
                if (index < 0)
                    continue;
                key = key.substring(0,index);
                shapeCoordsByName.put(key,ce.getShapeCoords());
            }
            // build area string
            sb = new StringBuffer();
            int counter = 0;
            for (MyRow row: m_rows.getItems())
            {
                String fragment;
                fragment = shapeCoordsByName.get(row.getTown());
                if (sb.length() != 0)
                    sb.append(";");
                sb.append("poly("+counter+","+row.getTown()+","+fragment+")");
                counter++;
            }
            m_imageAreas = sb.toString();
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            CLog.L.log(CLog.LL_ERR,"",t);
        }
    }
    
    private void generateChartOLD()
    {
        try
        {
            DefaultPieDataset ds = new DefaultPieDataset();
            for (int i=0; i<m_rows.getItems().size(); i++)
            {
                MyRow row = m_rows.getItems().get(i);
                ds.setValue(row.getTown(),row.getInhabitants());
            }
            JFreeChart chart = ChartFactory.createPieChart("Some important towns",ds,true,true,false);
            ByteArrayOutputStream bos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
            ChartUtilities.writeChartAsPNG(bos, chart, 400, 200);
            bos.close();
            byte[] image = bos.toByteArray();
            m_image = ValueManager.encodeHexString(image);
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            CLog.L.log(CLog.LL_ERR,"",t);
        }
    }
    
}

Image Anonymizer

The component IMAGEANONYMIZERDIRECT allows the drawing on lines on top of an existing image.

The image is passed as hexadecimal information to the client side using attribute HEXDATA. If the user updates the image then the image is passed back as hexadecimal image into the HEXDATA attribute as well.

The control in general is a "mini image editor" but typically is used in the context of anonymizing images (e.g. to hide faces, number plates, ...).

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoImageAnonymizerDirect}" popupmenu="TTTTT" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:imageanonymizerdirect id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoImageAnonymizerDirect.onAnonymizerAction}" background="#00000010" colorpalette="#FFFFFF;#FF0000;#000000;#FFFF00;#FF8000" flush="true" height="100%" hexdata="#{d.DemoImageAnonymizerDirect.imageData}" pencolor="#{d.DemoImageAnonymizerDirect.penColor}" pensize="#{d.DemoImageAnonymizerDirect.pensize}" pensizemax="20" pensizemin="5" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_5" text="Sync Image to Server" />
<t:buttonmenu id="g_6" text="Load Start Image" >
<t:menuitem id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoImageAnonymizerDirect.onReload}" text="JPEG Image (the car...)" />
<t:menuitem id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.DemoImageAnonymizerDirect.onReload2}" text="PNG Image (boring...)" />
<t:menuitem id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoImageAnonymizerDirect.onReload3}" text="GIF Image (boring...)" />
</t:buttonmenu>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="Server Image" width="100" />
<t:heximage id="g_12" height="100" hexdata="#{d.DemoImageAnonymizerDirect.imageData}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:label id="g_14" text="Pen Size" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_15" text="#{d.DemoImageAnonymizerDirect.pensize}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="Pen Color" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_18" text="#{d.DemoImageAnonymizerDirect.penColor}" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:popupmenu id="TTTTT" >
<t:menuitem id="g_19" actionListener="#{d.DemoImageAnonymizerDirect.onReload}" hotkey="39" text="JPEG Image (the car...)" />
<t:menuitem id="g_20" actionListener="#{d.DemoImageAnonymizerDirect.onReload2}" hotkey="37" text="PNG Image (boring...)" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.WebResourceReader;
import org.eclnt.util.file.FileManager;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoImageAnonymizerDirect}")

public class DemoImageAnonymizerDirect
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    String m_penColor = "#FF0000";
    int m_pensize = 15;
    String m_imageData;
    
    public DemoImageAnonymizerDirect(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        byte[] bs = (new WebResourceReader()).readFileIntoByteArray("/images/pictures/carpicture.jpg");
        m_imageData = ValueManager.encodeHexString(bs);
    }

    public String getImageData() { return m_imageData; }
    public void setImageData(String value) { this.m_imageData = value; }

    public String getPenColor() { return m_penColor; }
    public void setPenColor(String value) { this.m_penColor = value; }

    public int getPensize() { return m_pensize; }
    public void setPensize(int value) { this.m_pensize = value; }

    public void onUndoChanges(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        byte[] bs = (new WebResourceReader()).readFileIntoByteArray("/images/pictures/carpicture.jpg");
        m_imageData = ValueManager.encodeHexString(bs);
    }
    
    public void onReload(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        byte[] bs = (new WebResourceReader()).readFileIntoByteArray("/images/pictures/carpicture.jpg");
        m_imageData = ValueManager.encodeHexString(bs);
    }
    
    public void onReload2(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        byte[] bs = (new WebResourceReader()).readFileIntoByteArray("/images/pictures/wpBubbles.png");
        m_imageData = ValueManager.encodeHexString(bs);
    }
    
    public void onReload3(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        byte[] bs = (new WebResourceReader()).readFileIntoByteArray("/images/pictures/germany.gif");
        m_imageData = ValueManager.encodeHexString(bs);
    }
    
    public void onAnonymizerAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
    }
}

Area selection (image cropping)

Drag and drop the red areas and see what happens...

The AREASELECTOR component is able to draw some selection that the user executes via dragging and dropping. The seleciton information is sent to the server side, so that you can perform any kind of activity there.

Typical scenario: you want to crop an image out of some existing image.

Important:

(.) The counter part of the component is some AREASELECTORBinding object which is references in the attribute OBJECTBINDING
(.) The AREASELECTORBinding provides the corresponding get-ter method to acces the selection data
(.) In principal you can select some area of any contained inner component. In the example an IMAGE component is positioned as content of the AREASELECTOR component.

The inner values of AREASELECTORBinding are transferred as just normal component content - and by default are queued on client side when being changed (like e.g. FIELD input, which is also queued). You may set the FLUSH attribute to "true" so that the values are causing some server side roundtrip directly after some update by the user.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoAreaSelector}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:checkbox id="g_2" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoAreaSelector.withSideSizer}" text="with sizers at side" />
<t:checkbox id="g_18" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoAreaSelector.withEdgeSizer}" text="with sizers at edges" />
<t:checkbox id="g_19" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoAreaSelector.withMover}" text="with mover" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" coldistance="5" >
<t:combobox id="g_22" flush="true" labeltext="Area ratio" value="#{d.DemoAreaSelector.areaRatio}" width="200" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_3" text="No ratio" value="0.0" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_4" text="4:3" value="1.3333334" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_5" text="16:9" value="1.7777778" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_27" text="3:4" value="0.75" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_28" text="9:16" value="0.5625" />
</t:combobox>
<t:coldistance id="g_37" width="20" />
<t:combobox id="g_30" labeltext="Selected area" value="#{d.DemoAreaSelector.selectedArea}" width="250" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_32" text="x1:100;y1:100;x2:200;y2:200" value="x1:100;y1:100;x2:200;y2:200" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_33" text="x1:100;y1:100;x2:400;y2:200" value="x1:100;y1:100;x2:400;y2:200" />
</t:combobox>
<t:button id="g_35" actionListener="#{d.DemoAreaSelector.onApplySelectedAreaAction}" text="Apply" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:areaselector id="g_23" arearatio="#{d.DemoAreaSelector.areaRatio}" flush="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoAreaSelector.areaInfo}" withedgeresizer="#{d.DemoAreaSelector.withEdgeSizer}" withmover="#{d.DemoAreaSelector.withMover}" withsideresizer="#{d.DemoAreaSelector.withSideSizer}" >
<t:image id="g_24" image="/images/pictures/carpicture.jpg" />
</t:areaselector>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_25" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Area selection" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_7" enabled="false" text="#{d.DemoAreaSelector.areaInfoString}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:coldistance id="g_9" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoAreaSelector.onCreateImageAction}" text="Create cropped image" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:coldistance id="g_12" width="100" />
<t:heximage id="g_13" hexdata="#{d.DemoAreaSelector.croppedImageHex}" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Map;

import org.eclnt.ccee.image.ImageCropper;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.AREASELECTORBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.WebResourceReader;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoAreaSelector}")

public class DemoAreaSelector
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    AREASELECTORBinding m_areaInfo = new AREASELECTORBinding();
    String m_croppedImageHex;
    boolean m_withMover = true;
    boolean m_withEdgeSizer = true;
    boolean m_withSideSizer = true;
    float m_areaRatio = 0;
    String m_selectedArea;
