    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoAreaSelector(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
    }

    @Override
    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoareaselector.jsp"; }
    @Override
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoAreaSelector}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public AREASELECTORBinding getAreaInfo() { return m_areaInfo; }

    public String getAreaInfoString()
    {
        return m_areaInfo.toString();
    }

    public String getCroppedImageHex() { return m_croppedImageHex; }

    public float getAreaRatio() { return m_areaRatio; }
    public void setAreaRatio(float value) { this.m_areaRatio = value; }
    
    public String getSelectedArea() { return m_selectedArea; }
    public void setSelectedArea(String value) { this.m_selectedArea = value; }

    public boolean getWithMover() { return m_withMover; }
    public void setWithMover(boolean value) { this.m_withMover = value; }

    public boolean getWithEdgeSizer() { return m_withEdgeSizer; }
    public void setWithEdgeSizer(boolean value) { this.m_withEdgeSizer = value; }

    public boolean getWithSideSizer() { return m_withSideSizer; }
    public void setWithSideSizer(boolean value) { this.m_withSideSizer = value; }

    public void onApplySelectedAreaAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (m_selectedArea == null)
        {
            Statusbar.outputError("Please define a selected area");
            return;
        }
        Map<String,String> m = ValueManager.decodeComplexValue(m_selectedArea);
        int x1 = ValueManager.decodeInt(m.get("x1"),-1);
        int y1 = ValueManager.decodeInt(m.get("y1"),-1);
        int x2 = ValueManager.decodeInt(m.get("x2"),-1);
        int y2 = ValueManager.decodeInt(m.get("y2"),-1);
        m_areaInfo.setPixelPosX1(x1);
        m_areaInfo.setPixelPosY1(y1);
        m_areaInfo.setPixelPosX2(x2);
        m_areaInfo.setPixelPosY2(y2);
    }

    public void onCreateImageAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event)
    {
        byte[] originalImage = new WebResourceReader().readFileIntoByteArray("/images/pictures/carpicture.jpg");
        byte[] newImage = originalImage;
        if (m_areaInfo.getPixelPosX1() >= 0)
        {
            // the class ImageCropper is part of the eclnt_ccee.jar library
            // eclnt_ccee is a collection of server side utilities which is
            // available in the "resources" area of your CaptainCasa
            // installation
            newImage = ImageCropper.cropImage(newImage,
                                              m_areaInfo.getPixelPosX1(),m_areaInfo.getPixelPosY1(),
                                              m_areaInfo.getPixelPosX2(),m_areaInfo.getPixelPosY2());
            m_croppedImageHex = ValueManager.encodeHexString(newImage);
        }
        else
        {
            Statusbar.outputError("No area selection was done so far.");
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Image shown on mouseover

By defining WITHHOVER=true, a shrinked image will automatically show its real image as dialog which is opened once the user moves the mousue over the image.

You may also define an explicit HOVERIMAGE that is shown.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoImageHover}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoImageHover}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:textpane id="g_4" text="Move the mouse over an image and it will be shown in full size." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_5" height="50" />
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" text="One image" width="150" />
<t:image id="g_8" height="32" image="/images/pictures/adressbuch.gif" width="32" withhover="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="Explicit hover image" width="150" />
<t:image id="g_11" height="32" hoverimage="/images/pictures/carpicture.jpg" image="/images/pictures/carpicture.jpg" width="32" withhover="true" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoImageHover}")

public class DemoImageHover
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoImageHover(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoimagehover.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoImageHover}"; }
}

Scale image by user

You can zoom the image by...

...on desktop: use ctrl-MouseWheel
...on tablet/phone: use two finger gesture

Take a look into the layout definition. The zooming is done by a general-purpose SCALEPANE into which the actual IMAGE is embedded.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoScaleImage}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoScaleImage}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:scrollpane id="g_4" border="#00000030" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:scalepane id="g_6" height="100%" maxscale="20" minscale="0.1" scale="#{d.DemoScaleImage.scale}" width="100%" withuserscaling="true" >
<t:pane id="g_7" >
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="100%" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:coldistance id="g_10" width="100%" />
<t:image id="g_11" image="/images/pictures/skelett.png" />
<t:coldistance id="g_12" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_13" height="100%" />
</t:pane>
</t:scalepane>
</t:row>
</t:scrollpane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoScaleImage}")

public class DemoScaleImage
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoScaleImage(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoscaleimage.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoScaleImage}"; }
    
    float m_scale = 1f;

    public float getScale() { return m_scale; } 
    public void setScale(float scale) { m_scale = scale; }
}

Lazy loading of PDF thumbnails

This example handles a quite complex case: each line of the grid represents some PDF document, which is internally available as resource.

For each line of the grid a thumb nail image is produced. The thumb nail image is loaded in a separate thread - assuming that the production of the image is an expensive activity which should not be executed when loading the grid - but which should in the backgrond.

The images are loaded by implementing a BufferedContent class and creating instances at runtime.

It is crucially important to add the file name to the buffered content - and in particular to specify the dimension of the image in this file name (here: "_100x100"). If not doing so then the first thing the client will do, is to calculate the size of the image - and for this reason it requires to access the image data! If not defining the size as part of the image name, then the result of the demo will be a very long duration that the client waits for the images to be loaded.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPDFThumbNails}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPDFThumbNails}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_2" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPDFThumbNails.grid}" rowheight="40" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_3" text="Name of document" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_8" text=".{name}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_15" align="center" text="Image" width="100" >
<t:image id="g_18" background="#00000008" hoverimage=".{hoverImage}" hoverimageheight="200" hoverimagewidth="200" image=".{image}" imageheight="32" imagewidth="32" rendered=".{imageRendered}" withhover="true" height="100%" width="100%" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Hashtable;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Map;

import org.eclnt.ccee.pdf.PDF2ImageConverter;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.bufferedcontent.BufferedContentMgr;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.bufferedcontent.DefaultBufferedContent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.ThreadData;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.polling.LongPollingMgr;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.polling.websocket.DefaultLongPollingWebSocket;
import org.eclnt.util.file.ClassloaderReader;
import org.eclnt.util.log.CLog;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPDFThumbNails}")

public class DemoPDFThumbNails
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class ThumbNailBufferedContent extends DefaultBufferedContent
    {
        String i_name;
        public ThumbNailBufferedContent(String name)
        { 
            i_name = name; 
        }
        @Override
        public byte[] getContent()
        {
            try
            {
                int counter = 0;
                while (counter < 25)
                {
                    counter++;
                    byte[] image = m_thumbNails.get(i_name);
                    if (image != null)
                        return image;
                    Thread.sleep(1000);
                    System.out.println("No image available yet: " + image);
                }
                throw new Exception("Counter exceeded 25 " + i_name);
            }
            catch (Throwable t)
            {
                CLog.L.log(CLog.LL_ERR,"Problem resolving thumbNail: " + i_name,t);
                throw new Error("Problem resolving thumbNail: " + i_name,t);
            }
        }
        @Override
        public String getContentType()
        {
            return null; 
        }
    }
    
    public class ThumbnailLoaderThread extends Thread
    {
        @Override
        public void run()
        {
            // create a "clone" so that looping through the list is done
            // in own instance which independent from oriignal list (which may
            // be manipulated in e.g. UI thread processing)
            ClassloaderReader clr = new ClassloaderReader(true);
            List<GridItem> l = new ArrayList<>(m_grid.getItems());
            for (GridItem gi: l)
            {
                try 
                { 
                    Thread.sleep(2500); // slow down to simulate heavy activity
                    byte[] pdf = clr.readFile(gi.getName(),false);
                    byte[] image = PDF2ImageConverter.convertPDFIntoThumbImagePNG(pdf,200,200);
                    m_thumbNails.put(gi.getName(),image);
                    System.out.println("PROCESSED IMAGE " + gi.getName());
                }
                catch (Throwable t) 
                {
                    CLog.L.log(CLog.LL_ERR,"Problem when loading thumbnail: " + gi.getName(),t);
                }
            }
        }
    }

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_name;
        String i_image;
        ThumbNailBufferedContent i_bufferedContent;
        public GridItem(String name)
        { 
            i_name = name;
            i_bufferedContent = new ThumbNailBufferedContent(i_name);
            i_bufferedContent.setFileName("thumbNail_200x200.png");
            BufferedContentMgr.add(i_bufferedContent);
        }
        public String getImage() { return i_bufferedContent.getURL(); }
        public String getName() { return i_name; }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    DefaultLongPollingWebSocket m_polling;
    Map<String,byte[]> m_thumbNails = new Hashtable<String,byte[]>(); // thread-safe map!
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPDFThumbNails(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        m_polling = new DefaultLongPollingWebSocket();
        LongPollingMgr.add(m_polling);
        loadGrid();
        startThumbnailLoader();
        // registrations to BufferedContentMgr are removed when closing a dialog session 
        // automatically. You may do this earlier: in this case it is assumed that the
        // page is started within a workpage - and all registrations are removed when
        // the workpage is removed from the workplace.
        getWorkpage().addLifecycleListener(new WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnDestroyed()
            {
                super.reactOnDestroyed();
                destroy();
            }
        });
    }

    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPDFThumbNails}"; }
    public String getLayoutPageName() { return "/worplace/demopdfthumbnails.xml"; }

    public String getPollingURL() { return m_polling.getURL(); }

    public void onPollingAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("HALLO " + System.currentTimeMillis());
    }
    
    public void destroy()
    {
        cleanBufferedContentRegistrations();
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    private void cleanBufferedContentRegistrations()
    {
        for (GridItem gi: m_grid.getItems())
        {
            BufferedContentMgr.remove(gi.i_bufferedContent);
        }
    }
    
    private void loadGrid()
    {
        m_grid.getItems().clear();
        for (int i=1; i<=5; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem("/workplace/resources/pdf0"+i+".pdf");
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    private void startThumbnailLoader()
    {
        ThumbnailLoaderThread tlt = new ThumbnailLoaderThread();
        ThreadData.injectExtThread(tlt);
        tlt.start();
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Value Representation

Slider

The slider allows to edit integer values.

By using the attributes MINVALUE and MAXVALUE you define the number range you can select from. If you do not specify any value, then the range from 0 to 100 is selected by default.

By defining the attributes MINORTICKSPACING and MAJORTICKSPACING you set up the scale of the slider. The ouput of textual scale information follows the definition of MAJORTICKSPACING.

By using the attribute SNAPTOPTICKS you define if the slider is bound to the values that are represented by the scale, or if also between-tick values can be selected by the user.

Finally "all the other typical attributes" are available: the VALUE that transfers the selected value to the server side, the FLUSH for indicating that value changes are sent to the server side immediately, the BGPAINT for defining the background etc. etc.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoSlider}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Default rendering" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:slider id="g_5" flush="true" majortickspacing="250" maxvalue="1000" minortickspacing="25" minvalue="0" value="#{d.demoSlider.sliderValue}" width="200" snaptoticks="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:slider id="g_7" flush="true" majortickspacing="500" maxvalue="1000" minortickspacing="100" minvalue="0" value="#{d.demoSlider.sliderValue}" width="200" snaptoticks="true" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Tick spacing shift" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:slider id="g_12" flush="true" majortickspacing="5" maxvalue="52" minortickspacing="1" minvalue="33" shifttickspacing="-3" value="#{d.demoSlider.shoeSize}" width="200" snaptoticks="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:slider id="g_14" flush="true" majortickspacing="5" maxvalue="52" minortickspacing="1" minvalue="33" value="#{d.demoSlider.shoeSize}" width="200" snaptoticks="true" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_15" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Vertical" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:coldistance id="g_19" width="15" />
<t:slider id="g_20" flush="true" height="125" majortickspacing="500" maxvalue="1000" minortickspacing="100" minvalue="0" orientation="vertical" value="#{d.demoSlider.sliderValue}" width="50" snaptoticks="true" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_21" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:label id="g_23" stylevariant="ccbig" text="No minor ticks" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:slider id="g_25" flush="true" majortickspacing="250" maxvalue="1000" minortickspacing="25" minvalue="0" paintminorticks="false" value="#{d.demoSlider.sliderValue}" width="200" snaptoticks="true" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_26" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_27" >
<t:label id="g_28" stylevariant="ccbig" text="No labels" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_29" >
<t:slider id="g_30" flush="true" majortickspacing="500" maxvalue="1000" minortickspacing="100" minvalue="0" paintlabels="false" value="#{d.demoSlider.sliderValue}" width="200" snaptoticks="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_31" >
<t:label id="g_32" stylevariant="ccbig" text="No labels, no ticks" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_33" >
<t:slider id="g_34" flush="true" majortickspacing="500" maxvalue="1000" minortickspacing="100" minvalue="0" paintlabels="false" paintmajorticks="false" paintminorticks="false" value="#{d.demoSlider.sliderValue}" width="200" snaptoticks="true" />
<t:coldistance id="g_35" width="15" />
<t:slider id="g_36" flush="true" height="125" majortickspacing="500" maxvalue="1000" minortickspacing="100" minvalue="0" orientation="vertical" paintlabels="false" paintmajorticks="false" paintminorticks="false" value="#{d.demoSlider.sliderValue}" snaptoticks="true" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_37" height="50" />
<t:row id="g_38" >
<t:coldistance id="g_39" width="50" />
<t:field id="g_40" align="center" flush="true" flushtimer="1000" regex="[0-9]+" text="#{d.demoSlider.sliderValue}" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.demoSlider}")

public class DemoSlider extends PageBean
{
    int m_shoeSize = 41;
    public int getShoeSize() { return m_shoeSize; }
    public void setShoeSize(int value) { this.m_shoeSize = value; }

    public DemoSlider(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("slider");
    }
    
    protected int m_sliderValue = 450;
    public int getSliderValue() { return m_sliderValue; }
    public void setSliderValue(int value) { m_sliderValue = value; }
}

Slider - Text items

This demos shows some extended attributes of the SLIDER component:

(.) the ORIENTATION defines if the slider is shown horiozntally or vertically

(.) the VALUESTRINGCONVERSION defines a translation between numbers and their label representation:

The definition is done in the following way:
number:text;number:text;number:text;...

Please pay attention: no blank spaces are allowed (if they are not part of the text definition)!
Valid example: "0:Black;1:White;2:Black and white"

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSliderExt}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Own labels" width="100" />
<t:slider id="g_4" flush="true" majortickspacing="1" maxvalue="3" minortickspacing="1" minvalue="1" snaptoticks="true" value="#{d.DemoSliderExt.colorInt}" valuestringconversion="1:red;2:green;3:blue" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Vertical" width="100" />
<t:slider id="g_7" flush="true" majortickspacing="1" maxvalue="3" minortickspacing="1" minvalue="1" orientation="vertical" snaptoticks="true" value="#{d.DemoSliderExt.colorInt}" valuestringconversion="1:red;2:green;3:blue" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoSliderExt}")

public class DemoSliderExt
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    int m_colorInt = 2;
    public int getColorInt() { return m_colorInt; }
    public void setColorInt(int value) { this.m_colorInt = value; }

    public DemoSliderExt(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        initRefComponent("slider");
    }

}

Slider - Flush timer

The SLIDER component provides a FLUSHTIMER attribute by which you can define when flush events (value change events) are sent to the server side.

Without defining a FLUSHTIMER, the flush event is sent when releasing the mouse button. With defining a FLUSHTIMER the flush event already is sent if the user stops moving the mouse for a certain duration.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSliderFlushTimer}" rowdistance="20" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:textpane id="g_3" text="When moving the slider and stopping the movement, then the flush event is sent to server side - wihout releasing the mouse button." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="With flush timer 500" width="120" />
<t:slider id="g_6" flush="true" flushtimer="500" majortickspacing="20" maxvalue="100" minortickspacing="5" minvalue="0" value="#{d.DemoSliderFlushTimer.sliderValue}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_7" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:textpane id="g_9" text="With the following slider there is no &#34;interim&#34; eventing. The flush is sent to server side when the user releases the mouse button." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="Without flush timer" width="120" />
<t:slider id="g_12" flush="true" majortickspacing="20" maxvalue="100" minortickspacing="5" minvalue="0" value="#{d.DemoSliderFlushTimer.sliderValue}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_13" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" text="Slider value" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_16" enabled="false" text="#{d.DemoSliderFlushTimer.sliderValue}" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoSliderFlushTimer}")

public class DemoSliderFlushTimer
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    int m_sliderValue = 50;
    public int getSliderValue() { return m_sliderValue; }
    public void setSliderValue(int value) { this.m_sliderValue = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /* Listener to the user of the page bean. */
    public interface IListener
    {
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private IListener m_listener;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoSliderFlushTimer(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demosliderflushtimer.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoSliderFlushTimer}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /* Initialization of the bean. Add any parameter that is required within your scenario. */
    public void prepare(IListener listener)
    {
        m_listener = listener;
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Slider - From/to range

The SLIDERRANGE manages two values: a FROMVALUE and a TOVALUE. Both are read and updated when using the component.

The values can be changed by the user in the following ways:

1. the user can move the from- and to-part individually
2. the user can move the range-part between the from- and the to-part
3. the user can click into the component - the most probable value will be changed as result

As with any other component, changes to the data by default do not immediately trigger a roundtrip to the server-side. For the default scenario you need some other activity - e.g. pressing the OK button.

When setting FLUSH to "true" then the component triggers the roundtrip (and an action-event) when releasing the mouse-button.

When setting FLUSHTIMER in addition then the component also sends events with the keeping the mouse button pressed - after the user not moving the mouse for a defined duration.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoSliderRange1}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSliderRange1}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:label id="g_18" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Default usage (no flushing)" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:sliderrange id="g_7" fromvalue="#{d.DemoSliderRange1.from}" majortickspacing="25" maxvalue="100" minortickspacing="5" minvalue="0" tovalue="#{d.DemoSliderRange1.to}" width="200" />
<t:sliderrange id="g_35" fromvalue="#{d.DemoSliderRange1.from}" height="150" majortickspacing="25" maxvalue="100" minortickspacing="5" minvalue="0" orientation="vertical" tovalue="#{d.DemoSliderRange1.to}" />
<t:coldistance id="g_37" width="50" />
<t:button id="g_5" text="OK" width="100+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_23" >
<t:label id="g_24" stylevariant="ccbig" text="With default flushing" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_25" >
<t:sliderrange id="g_26" actionListener="#{d.DemoSliderRange1.onSliderAction}" flush="true" flushtimer="1000" fromvalue="#{d.DemoSliderRange1.from}" majortickspacing="25" maxvalue="100" minortickspacing="5" minvalue="0" tovalue="#{d.DemoSliderRange1.to}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:label id="g_29" stylevariant="ccbig" text="With flushing during movement" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_30" >
<t:sliderrange id="g_31" actionListener="#{d.DemoSliderRange1.onSliderAction}" flush="true" flushtimer="500" fromvalue="#{d.DemoSliderRange1.from}" majortickspacing="25" maxvalue="100" minortickspacing="5" minvalue="0" tovalue="#{d.DemoSliderRange1.to}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_33" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:label id="g_21" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Slider values (server side)" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="From #{d.DemoSliderRange1.from}, to #{d.DemoSliderRange1.to}" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoSliderRange1}")

public class DemoSliderRange1
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    int m_to = 75;
    int m_from = 25;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoSliderRange1(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demosliderrange1.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoSliderRange1}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public int getTo() { return m_to; }
    public void setTo(int value) { this.m_to = value; }

    public int getFrom() { return m_from; }
    public void setFrom(int value) { this.m_from = value; }

    public void onSliderAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) {}
}

Slider - From to time range

As with the normal SLIDER, you can also assign any meaning to the integer values that are maintained by the SLIDERRANGE component.

In this demo the slider component is used to define some time range between 08:00h and 16:00h.

Take a look into the definition of the attribute VALUESTRINCONVERSION which binds the inner integer values to some semantic definition.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoSliderRange2}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSliderRange2}" rowdistance="20" >
<t:rowdistance id="g_6" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:sliderrange id="g_7" flush="true" flushtimer="800" fromvalue="#{d.DemoSliderRange2.fromAsInt}" majortickspacing="4" maxvalue="32" minortickspacing="1" minvalue="0" tovalue="#{d.DemoSliderRange2.toAsInt}" valuestringconversion="0:8:00h;4:9:00h;8:10:00h;12:11:00h;16:12:00h;20:13:00h;24:14:00h;28:15:00h;32:16:00h" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_3" coldistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultcoldistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:coldistance id="g_5" width="100%" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_9" align="center" enabled="false" format="time" labeltext="From" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoSliderRange2.fromTime}" width="120" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_11" align="center" enabled="false" format="time" labeltext="To" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoSliderRange2.toTime}" width="120" />
<t:coldistance id="g_13" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.time.LocalTime;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoSliderRange2}")

public class DemoSliderRange2
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    LocalTime m_toTime = LocalTime.of(12,0);
    LocalTime m_fromTime = LocalTime.of(10,0);

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoSliderRange2(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demosliderrange2.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoSliderRange2}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public int getToAsInt() { return convertLocalTimeToInt(m_toTime); }
    public void setToAsInt(int value) { m_toTime = convertIntToLocalTime(value); }

    public int getFromAsInt() { return convertLocalTimeToInt(m_fromTime); }
    public void setFromAsInt(int value) { m_fromTime = convertIntToLocalTime(value); }

    public LocalTime getToTime() { return m_toTime; }
    public void setToTime(LocalTime value) { this.m_toTime = value; }

    public LocalTime getFromTime() { return m_fromTime; }
    public void setFromTime(LocalTime value) { this.m_fromTime = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private int convertLocalTimeToInt(LocalTime lt)
    {
        int hour = (lt.getHour()-8) * 4;
        int quarter = Math.floorDiv(lt.getMinute(),15);
        return hour + quarter;
    }
    
    private LocalTime convertIntToLocalTime(int value)
    {
        int hour = 8 + value/4;
        int minute = value%4 * 15;
        return LocalTime.of(hour,minute);
    }
}

Progress Bar

The progress bar renders a percentage value - passed via the VALUE attribute. The percentage value on the one hand defines the size of the progress area, on the other hand it is by default as string on top of the bar.

If defining in addition a text via the TEXT attribute, then the text is rendered on top of the bar.

Parameters like foreground, background color, font, border, etc. are available. - You (unfortunately) cannot change the color of the text...

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoProgressbar}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Horizontal" width="120" />
<t:progressbar id="g_4" value="#{d.DemoProgressbar.progressValue}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_6" width="120" />
<t:progressbar id="g_7" font="weight:bold" text="Text inside" value="#{d.DemoProgressbar.progressValue}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:coldistance id="g_9" width="120" />
<t:progressbar id="g_10" background="#C0FFC0" border="#808080" font="size:9" foreground="#FFC0C0" text="Some Colors, other font" value="#{d.DemoProgressbar.progressValue}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_11" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="Vertical" width="120" />
<t:progressbar id="g_14" height="50" orientation="vertical" value="#{d.DemoProgressbar.progressValue}" width="20" />
<t:coldistance id="g_15" width="5" />
<t:progressbar id="g_16" barbackground="#800000" foreground="#C0C0C0" height="50" orientation="vertical" text="#{d.DemoProgressbar.progressValue}" value="#{d.DemoProgressbar.progressValue}" width="30" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_17" height="50" />
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" text="Set Progress" width="120" />
<t:slider id="g_20" flush="true" value="#{d.DemoProgressbar.progressValue}" width="150" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoProgressbar}")

public class DemoProgressbar
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoProgressbar(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("progressbar");
    }
    
    protected int m_progressValue = 25;
    public int getProgressValue() { return m_progressValue; }
    public void setProgressValue(int value) { m_progressValue = value; }
}

Radial

The component RADIAL renders a percentage value as circle (or ellipse).

You can define the line color and line size - and many other parameters...

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoRadial}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoRadial}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:label id="g_4" text="Only setting value" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:radial id="g_6" dragsend="TEST" value="66" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="Same width and height ==&gt; circle" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:radial id="g_10" dragsend="TEST" font="weight:bold;size:15" height="70" linecolor="#008000" linesize="10" value="66" width="70" />
<t:radial id="g_11" dragsend="TEST" font="weight:bold;size:15" height="70" linecolor="#FFFF20" linesize="7" value="50" width="70" />
<t:radial id="g_12" dragsend="TEST" font="weight:bold;size:15" height="70" linecolor="#800000" linesize="3" value="25" width="70" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:label id="g_14" text="Different width and height ==&gt; ellipse" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:radial id="g_16" dragsend="TEST" font="weight:bold;size:15" height="70" linecolor="#008000" linesize="10" value="66" width="130" />
<t:radial id="g_17" dragsend="TEST" font="weight:bold;size:15" height="130" linecolor="#008000" linesize="10" value="66" width="70" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" text="Value by expression, move the slider" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:coldistance id="g_21" width="50" />
<t:radial id="g_22" dragsend="TEST" font="weight:bold;size:15" height="100" linecolor="#{d.DemoRadial.lineColor}" linesize="10" value="#{d.DemoRadial.value}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_23" >
<t:slider id="g_24" flush="true" flushtimer="500" majortickspacing="10" maxvalue="100" minvalue="0" value="#{d.DemoRadial.value}" width="200" />
<t:label id="g_25" text="#{d.DemoRadial.value}" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoRadial}")

public class DemoRadial
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    int m_value = 50;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoRadial(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        initRefComponent("radial"); 
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoradial.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoRadial}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public int getValue() { return m_value; }
    public void setValue(int value) { this.m_value = value; }

    public String getLineColor() 
    { 
        if (m_value <= 25) return "#800000";
        if (m_value <= 60) return "#FFFF40";
        return "#008000";
    }

}

Independent scroll bar

The SCROLLBAR component is vertical scroll bar that represents/maintains an integer value. You can define the integer range (SBMINVALUE and SBMAXVALUE) and the size of the scroller (SBSIZE).

By defining the FLUSH attribute to be "true" any scroll bar changes of the user are communicated directly to the server side application processing.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoScrollBar}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_5" coldistance="10" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Scrollbar" />
<t:scrollbar id="g_7" flush="true" height="250" sbmaxvalue="100" sbminvalue="0" sbsize="20" value="#{d.DemoScrollBar.verticalValue}" />
<t:coldistance id="g_2" width="20" />
<t:label id="g_13" text="Value" />
<t:field id="g_14" enabled="false" text="#{d.DemoScrollBar.verticalValue}" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoScrollBar}")

public class DemoScrollBar
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoScrollBar(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    protected int m_verticalValue = 0;
    public int getVerticalValue() { return m_verticalValue; }
    public void setVerticalValue(int value) { m_verticalValue = value; }

}

Enabled/ Disabled

Use the attribute ENABLED in order to activate/deactivate a component.

Note: there is an attribute RENDERED as well, that decides if a component is drawn at all.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoEnabled}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:checkbox id="g_3" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoEnabled.enabled}" text="Components enabled" />
<t:coldistance id="g_4" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoEnabled.onChange}" hotkey="ctrl-70" text="Change!" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_6" height="50" />
<t:rowflexlinecontainer id="g_7" coldistance="20" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_8" height="100%" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" text="Field components" width="100%;400" >
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="Field" width="150" />
<t:field id="g_11" enabled="#{d.DemoEnabled.enabled}" labeltext="Some number" text="#{d.DemoEnabled.value}" tooltip="Tooltip for some number" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="Password" width="150" />
<t:password id="g_14" enabled="#{d.DemoEnabled.enabled}" labeltext="Some password" text="#{d.DemoEnabled.value}" tooltip="&lt;html&gt;Some HTML tooltip with better possibilities to &lt;b&gt;style&lt;/b&gt; the content...&lt;/html&gt;" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_16" text="Formatted Field" width="150" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_17" enabled="#{d.DemoEnabled.enabled}" format="int" labeltext="Some integer" value="#{d.DemoEnabled.value}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" width="150" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_20" background="#C0FFC0" enabled="#{d.DemoEnabled.enabled}" format="int" value="#{d.DemoEnabled.value}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:label id="g_22" width="150" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_23" enabled="#{d.DemoEnabled.enabled}" format="int" value="#{d.DemoEnabled.value}" width="200" withremoveicon="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:label id="g_25" text="Calendar Field" width="150" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_26" enabled="#{d.DemoEnabled.enabled}" labeltext="Some date" timezone="MET" value="9378" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_27" >
<t:label id="g_28" text="Combo Field" width="150" />
<t:combofield id="g_29" actionListener="#{d.DemoEnabled.onComboFieldAction}" editable="false" enabled="#{d.DemoEnabled.enabled}" labeltext="Some combo field" text="#{d.DemoEnabled.value}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_30" >
<t:label id="g_31" text="Combo Box" width="150" />
<t:combobox id="g_32" enabled="#{d.DemoEnabled.enabled}" labeltext="Come combo box" value="1" width="200" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_33" text="First" value="1" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_34" text="Second" value="2" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_35" >
<t:label id="g_36" text="Editable Combo Box" width="150" />
<t:combobox id="g_37" editable="true" enabled="#{d.DemoEnabled.enabled}" labeltext="Some combo" value="1" width="200" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_38" text="First" value="1" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_39" text="Second" value="2" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_40" >
<t:label id="g_41" text="Auto Complete" width="150" />
<t:autocomplete id="g_42" enabled="#{d.DemoEnabled.enabled}" labeltext="Some auto complete" value="aaaa" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_43" >
<t:label id="g_44" text="Spinner" width="150" />
<t:spinner id="g_45" enabled="#{d.DemoEnabled.enabled}" labeltext="Some integer" maxvalue="100" minvalue="0" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_46" >
<t:label id="g_47" text="Textarea" width="150" />
<t:textarea id="g_48" enabled="#{d.DemoEnabled.enabled}" height="150" labeltext="Description" text="Some text that spans multiple lines. Some text that spans multiple lines. Some text that spans multiple lines. " width="200" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
<t:foldablepane id="g_49" height="100%" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" text="Other components" width="100%;400" >
<t:row id="g_50" >
<t:label id="g_51" text="Button" width="150" />
<t:button id="g_52" actionListener="#{d.DemoEnabled.onAction}" enabled="#{d.DemoEnabled.enabled}" hotkey="ctrl-79" text="OK" tooltip="Tooltip for button" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_53" >
<t:label id="g_54" text="Icon" width="150" />
<t:icon id="g_55" actionListener="#{d.DemoEnabled.onAction}" enabled="#{d.DemoEnabled.enabled}" image="/images/icons/car.png" text="Some text" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_56" >
<t:label id="g_57" text="Link" width="150" />
<t:link id="g_58" actionListener="#{d.DemoEnabled.onAction}" enabled="#{d.DemoEnabled.enabled}" hotkey="ctrl-76" text="Text of Link" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_59" >
<t:label id="g_60" text="Button Popup" width="150" />
<t:buttonpopup id="g_61" enabled="#{d.DemoEnabled.enabled}" text="Button Popup" tooltip="Tooltip for button popup" >
<t:pane id="g_62" height="100" width="200" />
</t:buttonpopup>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_63" >
<t:label id="g_64" text="Radio Button" width="150" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_65" enabled="#{d.DemoEnabled.enabled}" flush="true" group="RB" refvalue="OK" text="OK" value="#{d.DemoEnabled.value}" />
<t:radiobutton id="g_66" enabled="#{d.DemoEnabled.enabled}" flush="true" group="RB" refvalue="NOT OK" text="NOT OK" value="#{d.DemoEnabled.value}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_67" >
<t:label id="g_68" text="CheckBox" width="150" />
<t:checkbox id="g_69" enabled="#{d.DemoEnabled.enabled}" selected="false" text="false" />
<t:checkbox id="g_77" enabled="#{d.DemoEnabled.enabled}" selected="true" text="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_71" >
<t:label id="g_72" text="Toggle" width="150" />
<t:toggle id="g_75" enabled="#{d.DemoEnabled.enabled}" selected="false" text="false" />
<t:toggle id="g_73" enabled="#{d.DemoEnabled.enabled}" selected="true" text="true" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:rowflexlinecontainer>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ISetId;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdTextSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoEnabled}")

public class DemoEnabled
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoEnabled(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
    
    public void onAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Action was invoked");
    }

    protected boolean m_enabled;
    public boolean getEnabled() { return m_enabled; }
    public void setEnabled(boolean value) { m_enabled = value; }

    protected String m_value = "1000";
    public String getValue() { return m_value; }
    public void setValue(String value) { m_value = value; }

    public void onChange(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_enabled = !m_enabled;
    }
    
    public void onComboFieldAction(ActionEvent event)
    {
        IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createInstance();
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
            idts.addLine("ID_"+i,"VALUE_"+i);
        idts.setCallBack(new ISetId() { public void setId(String id) { m_value = id; }});
    }

}

Menus

Menubars

Menus are easily defined: they are an arrangement of MENUBAR, MENU and MENUITEM components.

The top menu bar of this page (the one which is direclty below the titlebar) is statically defined. Please have a look into the XML layout. Each item is associated with an action listener - just like with normal button or icon controls.

The second menu bar is dynamically built. Via the attribute COMPONENTBINDING it points into a server side implementation of the menu bar. Check the Java code and you will see that the components are assembled by the server side program.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:row id="g_1" >
<t:menubar id="g_2" width="100%" >
<t:menu id="g_3" text="File" >
<t:menuitem id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoMenu.onSave}" image="../images/icons/disk.png" text="Save" />
<t:menu id="g_5" text="Recently opened" >
<t:menuitem id="g_6" text="abcd.txt" />
<t:menuitem id="g_7" text="efgh.txt" />
<t:menuitem id="g_8" text="ijklmnop.txt" />
<t:menu id="g_9" background="#FF8080" text="Last item" >
<t:menuitem id="g_10" text="AAA" />
<t:menuitem id="g_11" text="BBB" />
</t:menu>
</t:menu>
<t:menuseparator id="g_12" />
<t:menuitem id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoMenu.onClose}" text="Close" />
</t:menu>
</t:menubar>
</t:row>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_14" objectbinding="#{d.demoMenu}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_16" text="First Menu, statically built" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:menubar id="g_18" >
<t:menu id="g_19" text="File" >
<t:menuitem id="g_20" enabled="false" text="Open" />
<t:menuitem id="g_21" actionListener="#{d.DemoMenu.onSave}" image="../images/icons/disk.png" text="Save" />
<t:menuseparator id="g_22" />
<t:menuitem id="g_23" actionListener="#{d.DemoMenu.onClose}" background="#00000010" text="Close" />
</t:menu>
<t:menuitem id="g_24" actionListener="#{d.DemoMenu.onHelp}" foreground="#80A0A0" text="Help" />
</t:menubar>
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_25" height="50" />
<t:row id="g_26" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_27" text="Second Menu, dynamically built" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:menubar id="g_29" width="100%" >
<t:dynamiccontent id="g_30" contentbinding="#{d.DemoMenu.menuContent}" />
</t:menubar>
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_31" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_32" text="Same menu, different style" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_33" >
<t:menubar id="g_34" background="#00000020" foreground="#FF0000" width="100%" popupborder="left:5;right:1;top:1;bottom:1;color:#FF0000;" >
<t:dynamiccontent id="g_35" contentbinding="#{d.DemoMenu.menuContent}" />
</t:menubar>
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.BaseComponent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.MENUITEMNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.MENUNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.DYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.MENUBARComponent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.MENUComponentTag;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.MENUITEMComponentTag;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding.ComponentNode;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoMenu extends PageBean
{    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class Invoker
    {
        String i_text;
        public Invoker(String text)
        {
            i_text = text;
        }
        public void onInvoke(ActionEvent event) 
        {
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Menu item was pressed: " + i_text);
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    DYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_menuContent = new DYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    List<Invoker> m_invokers = new ArrayList<Invoker>();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoMenu(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("menubar");
        renderDynamicMenuContent();
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DYNAMICCONTENTBinding getMenuContent() { return m_menuContent; }
    public List<Invoker> getInvokers() { return m_invokers; }

    public void onClose(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("Close was pressed");
    }
    
    public void onSave(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("Save was pressed");
    }

    public void onHelp(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("Help was pressed");
    }

    private void renderDynamicMenuContent()
    {
        m_invokers.clear();
        List<ComponentNode> contentNodes = new ArrayList<ComponentNode>();
        for (int i=0; i<5; i++)
        {
            MENUNode menuNode = new MENUNode();
            contentNodes.add(menuNode);
            menuNode.setText("Menu " + i);
            menuNode.setFont("weight:bold");
            for (int j=0; j<5; j++)
            {
                String itemText = "Item "+j+"/"+i;
                Invoker invoker = new Invoker(itemText);
                m_invokers.add(invoker);
                MENUITEMNode menuItemNode = new MENUITEMNode();
                menuNode.addSubNode(menuItemNode);
                menuItemNode.setForeground("#800000");
                menuItemNode.setFont("size:"+(12+(j*2)));
                menuItemNode.addAttribute("text",itemText);
                menuItemNode.addAttribute("actionListener","#{d.DemoMenu.invokers["+(m_invokers.size()-1)+"].onInvoke}");
            }
        }
        m_menuContent.setContentNodes(contentNodes);
//        StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
//        for (int i=0; i<5; i++)
//        {
//            sb.append("<t:menu text='Menu "+i+"'>");
//            for (int j=0; j<5; j++)
//            {
//                String itemText = "Item "+j+"/"+i;
//                Invoker invoker = new Invoker(itemText);
//                m_invokers.add(invoker);
//                sb.append("<t:menuitem text='"+itemText+"' actionListener='#{d.DemoMenu.invokers["+(m_invokers.size()-1)+"].onInvoke}'/>");
//            }
//            sb.append("</t:menu>");
//        }
//        m_menuContent.setContentXml(sb.toString());
    }

}

Popup Menu

Click with the right mouse button onto the labels, fields, the foldable pane and the body of the page. You will see different popup menus showing up, dependent from the component that you clicked on.

Popup menus are defined on top level of a page. In the example there are three popup menus defined, each getting an explicit id: "POPUPMENU1", "POPUPMENU2" and "POPUPMENU3".

For a component a popup menu is referenced by the POPUPMENU attribute. Have a look into the field, label or page body definition. Components can share the same popup menu. - The user interface will always show the popup menu which is reachable "from bottom up": this means that it will start to check the availability of a popup menu with the control the user clicks on, then will continue with the next control layer (e.g. the container around) etc.

The reaction of a popup menu is done within the component's ACTIONLISTENER implementation. But pay attention: it is the action listener of the component that uses the popup menu - it's not the action listener of the popup menu item itself. Each popup menu item is associated with a command. This command is passed as command into the action listener processing of the receiving component. By this mechanism each component can react in a different way.

The command either is a simple string (as shown in the example) or can be a "method call string", e.g. "onXYZ(param1,param2)". When using the method call string format you can get the parameters passed by calling the BaseActionEvent.getParams() method.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowheader id="g_1" actionListener="#{d.demoPopupMenu.onHeaderAction}" popupmenu="POPUPMENU3" >
<t:button id="g_2" text="Some button (no function behind)" />
</t:rowheader>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.demoPopupMenu.onBodyAction}" objectbinding="#{d.demoPopupMenu}" popupmenu="POPUPMENU3" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.demoPopupMenu.onFoldablePaneAction}" popupmenu="POPUPMENU4" text="Foldable Pane" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.demoPopupMenu.onLabel1Action}" popupmenu="POPUPMENU1" text="Label 1" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.demoPopupMenu.onField1Action}" popupmenu="POPUPMENU1" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_9" />
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.demoPopupMenu.onLabel2Action}" popupmenu="POPUPMENU2" text="Label 2" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.demoPopupMenu.onField2Action}" popupmenu="POPUPMENU2" width="200" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_13" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.demoPopupMenu.onRowAction}" popupmenu="POPUPMENU3" >
<t:textpane id="g_15" text="Some content in this row. The popup menu is defined on row level." width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:popupmenu id="POPUPMENU1" >
<t:menuitem id="g_16" command="OPTION1" text="Option 1" />
<t:menu id="g_17" text="Option 2 &amp; 3" >
<t:menuitem id="g_18" command="OPTION2" text="Option 2" />
<t:menuitem id="g_19" command="OPTION3" text="Option 3" />
</t:menu>
</t:popupmenu>
<t:popupmenu id="POPUPMENU2" >
<t:menuitem id="g_20" command="OPTION4" text="Option 4" />
<t:menuitem id="g_21" command="OPTION5" text="Option 5" />
<t:menuitem id="g_22" command="OPTION6" text="Option 6" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:popupmenu id="POPUPMENU3" popupborder="top:3;left:3;right:3;bottom:3;color:#808080" >
<t:menuitem id="g_23" command="OPTION7" text="Option 7" />
<t:menuitem id="g_24" command="OPTION8" text="Option 8" />
<t:menuitem id="g_25" command="OPTION9" text="Option 9" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:popupmenu id="POPUPMENU4" >
<t:menuitem id="g_26" command="OPTION10" text="Option 10" />
<t:menuitem id="g_27" command="OPTION11" text="Option 11" />
<t:menuitem id="g_28" command="OPTION12" text="Option 12" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.BaseActionEvent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoPopupMenu extends PageBean
{
    public void onLabel1Action(ActionEvent ae) { process("label1",ae); }
    public void onLabel2Action(ActionEvent ae) { process("label2",ae); }
    public void onField1Action(ActionEvent ae) { process("field1",ae); }
    public void onField2Action(ActionEvent ae) { process("field2",ae); }
    public void onBodyAction(ActionEvent ae) { process("body",ae); }
    public void onFoldablePaneAction(ActionEvent ae) { process("foldablepane",ae); }
    public void onHeaderAction(ActionEvent ae) { process("header",ae); }
    public void onTitlebarAction(ActionEvent ae) { process("titlebar",ae); }
    public void onRowAction(ActionEvent ae) { process("row",ae); }
    
    public DemoPopupMenu(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("popupmenu");
    }
    
    private void process(String component, ActionEvent ae)
    {
        if (ae instanceof BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem)
        {
            BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem bae = (BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem)ae;
            Statusbar.outputMessage
                ("Received popup menu command: " + component + " / " + bae.getCommand() + "/" + bae.getPercentageHorizontal() + "/" + bae.getPercentageVertical());
        }
    }
}

Popup Menu in Grid

On FIXGRID level there are two popup menu definitions that you can use:

(1) the POPUPMENU attribute is the one that is the reference to the POPUPMENU definition for the whole grid.
(2) the ROWPOPUPMENU attribute is the one that is the reference to the POPUPMENU definition for the grid items.

On FIXGRID level the popup events are automatically delegated to the item's or the grid's "onPopupMenuItem()" method. You need to override these methods in order to add your event processing.

In the example the menu for the whole grid only contains the "New Item" command, whereas the menu on item level allows to either call "New Item" or "Remove Item".

The event information that is available in the action listener method allows to check, where the user pressed the right mouse button in order to open the popup menu. Dependent from this information in the example the new item is either created in front or behind the corresponding item.

Of course you still can in addition define individual popup menus for each component that you place into the grid columns.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" actionListener="#{d.DemoGridPopupMenu.onWholePageAction}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridPopupMenu}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#00000020" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridPopupMenu.rows}" popupmenu="GRIDPOPUPMENU" rowpopupmenu="GRIDROWPOPUPMENU" rowpopupmenuloadroundtrip="true" sbvisibleamount="25" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="First Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_5" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Last Name" width="50%" >
<t:field id="g_7" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:popupmenu id="GRIDROWPOPUPMENU" >
<t:menuitem id="g_8" command="REMOVE" text="Remove Item" />
<t:menuitem id="g_9" command="NEW" text="New Item" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:popupmenu id="GRIDPOPUPMENU" >
<t:menuitem id="g_10" command="NEW" text="New Item" />
<t:menuitem id="g_11" command="SELECTALL" hotkey="ctrl-65" text="Select all Items" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.BaseActionEvent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridPopupMenu}")

public class DemoGridPopupMenu
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class MyRow extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {    
        protected String m_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }

        protected String m_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
        
        @Override
        public void onRowPopupMenuItem(BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem event)
        {
            if ("REMOVE".equals(event.getCommand()))
            {
                m_rows.getItems().remove(this);
            }
            else if ("NEW".equals(event.getCommand()))
            {
                boolean inFront = (event.getPercentageVertical() < 50);
                MyRow r = new MyRow();
                int insertIndex = m_rows.getItems().indexOf(this);
                if (inFront == false)
                    insertIndex++;
                m_rows.getItems().add(insertIndex,r);
                m_rows.ensureItemToBeDisplayed(r);
            }
        }
    }
    
    public class MyGridListBinding extends FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow>
    {
        @Override
        protected void onPopupMenuItem(BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem event)
        {
            if ("NEW".equals(event.getCommand()))
            {
                MyRow r = new MyRow();
                m_rows.getItems().add(r);
                m_rows.ensureItemToBeDisplayed(r);
            }
            else if ("SELECTALL".equals(event.getCommand()))
            {
                m_rows.deselectCurrentSelection();
                for (MyRow row: getItems())
                    m_rows.selectItem(row);
            }
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    protected MyGridListBinding m_rows = new MyGridListBinding();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoGridPopupMenu(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("fixgrid");
        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
        {
            MyRow r = new MyRow();
            r.setFirstName("FN " + i);
            r.setLastName("LN " + i);
            m_rows.getItems().add(r);
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<MyRow> getRows() { return m_rows; }
    
    public void onWholePageAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem)
        {
            BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem e = (BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem)event;
            if ("COPY".equals(e.getCommand()))
            {
                Statusbar.outputAlert("Number of items: " + m_rows.getSelectedItems().size());
            }
        }
    }

}

Load popup menu dynamically

By right clicking on the labels you see that each label has its own set of menu items.

In this case this is NOT implemented by providing different popup menu definitions, one per label.

In this case the attribute POPUPMENULOADROUNDTRIP is used:
(.) When the user right-clicks onto the label then a roundtrip is triggered to the label's actionListener
(.) The actionListener code builds up the popup menu items by feeding a corresponding DYNAMICCONTENT component

Advantage of this implementation: there is only one popup menu definition which is very flexibly control-able from server side.

Disadvantage: a roundtrip is triggered on right mouse click.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPopupMenuLoadRoundtrip}" rowdistance="20" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupMenuLoadRoundtrip.onLabelTopAction}" stylevariant="ccbig" popupmenu="CENTRALPOPUP" popupmenuloadroundtrip="true" text="Right Click onto this top label" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="or" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupMenuLoadRoundtrip.onLabelBottomAction}" stylevariant="ccbig" popupmenu="CENTRALPOPUP" popupmenuloadroundtrip="true" text="Right Click onto this bottom label" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:popupmenu id="CENTRALPOPUP" >
<t:dynamiccontent id="g_8" contentbinding="#{d.DemoPopupMenuLoadRoundtrip.dynMenuContent}" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.MENUITEMNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPopupMenuLoad;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.DYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding.ComponentNode;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPopupMenuLoadRoundtrip}")

public class DemoPopupMenuLoadRoundtrip
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
     protected DYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_dynMenuContent = new DYNAMICCONTENTBinding();

    public DemoPopupMenuLoadRoundtrip(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        initRefComponent("popupmenu");
    }

    public DYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDynMenuContent() { return m_dynMenuContent; }
    
    public void onLabelTopAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventPopupMenuLoad)
        {
            List<ComponentNode> nodes = new ArrayList<ComponentNode>();
            {
                MENUITEMNode node = new MENUITEMNode();
                node.setText("First of top");
                node.setCommand("TOP1");
                nodes.add(node);
            }
            {
                MENUITEMNode node = new MENUITEMNode();
                node.setText("Second of top");
                node.setCommand("TOP1");
                nodes.add(node);
            }
            m_dynMenuContent.setContentNodes(nodes);
        }
        else if (event instanceof BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem)
        {
            BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem e = (BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem)event;
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Command of popup menu item: " + e.getCommand());
        }
    }
    
    public void onLabelBottomAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventPopupMenuLoad)
        {
            List<ComponentNode> nodes = new ArrayList<ComponentNode>();
            {
                MENUITEMNode node = new MENUITEMNode();
                node.setText("First of bottom");
                node.setCommand("BOT1");
                nodes.add(node);
            }
            {
                MENUITEMNode node = new MENUITEMNode();
                node.setText("Second of bottom");
                node.setCommand("BOT2");
                nodes.add(node);
            }
            {
                MENUITEMNode node = new MENUITEMNode();
                node.setText("Third of bottom");
                node.setCommand("BOT3");
                nodes.add(node);
            }
            m_dynMenuContent.setContentNodes(nodes);
        }
        else if (event instanceof BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem)
        {
            BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem e = (BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem)event;
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Command of popup menu item: " + e.getCommand());
        }
    }

}

Dynamic Popup Menu in Grid

Click with the right mouse button into different cells of the grid: for each cell there is an own popup menu.

The way, this is done, is:

(.) there is a POPUPMENU definition with id "GRIDPOPUP"
(.) the grid references the "GRIDPOPUP" menu in its FIXGRID-ROWPOPUPMENU definition
(.) in the POPUPMENU there is a DYNAMICCONTENT component
(.) in the onRowPopupMenuLoad()-method of the grid processing the dynamic content of the grid is built

And, to be explicitly pointed out:
(.) the FIXGRID-ROWPOPUPMENULOADROUNDTRIP is switched to "true". This forces the client to trigger a roundtrip to the server side when the user clicks the right mouse button.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoDynamicMenu}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoDynamicMenu.grid}" rowpopupmenu="GRIDPOPUP" rowpopupmenuloadroundtrip="true" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="First Name" width="50%" >
<t:label id="g_5" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Last Name" width="50%" >
<t:label id="g_7" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:popupmenu id="GRIDPOPUP" >
<t:dynamiccontent id="g_8" contentbinding="#{d.DemoDynamicMenu.popupContent}" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.MENUITEMNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPopupMenuLoad;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.DYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding.ComponentNode;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoDynamicMenu}")

public class DemoDynamicMenu
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected String m_lastName;
        public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }

        protected String m_firstName;
        public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }

        @Override
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        
        @Override
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
            updatePopupMenu(this);
        }
        
        @Override
        public void onRowPopupMenuItem(BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem event)
        {
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Popup menu item invoked. Command = " + event.getCommand() + ", Item = " + m_lastName);
        }
        @Override
