<t:field id="g_135" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_136" >
<t:label id="g_137" text="A field" width="60" />
<t:field id="g_138" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:menuitemcontainer>
<t:menuitem id="g_139" enabled="#{d.DemoMenuItemContainer.itemsEnabled}" text="Normal Item 3" />
<t:menuitem id="g_140" enabled="#{d.DemoMenuItemContainer.itemsEnabled}" text="Normal Item 4" />
</t:menu>
</t:menu>
</t:menu>
</t:menu>
</t:menubar>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_141" height="100" />
<t:row id="g_142" >
<t:label id="g_143" text="Please also press the right mouse button...!" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:popupmenu id="ALLPOPUP" >
<t:menuitem id="g_144" enabled="#{d.DemoMenuItemContainer.itemsEnabled}" text="Normal Item 1" />
<t:menuitem id="g_145" enabled="#{d.DemoMenuItemContainer.itemsEnabled}" text="Normal Item 2" />
<t:menuitemcontainer id="g_146" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,100%,#00000020,#00000008,vertical)" padding="10" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_147" >
<t:label id="g_148" text="A field" width="60" />
<t:field id="g_149" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_150" >
<t:label id="g_151" text="A field" width="60" />
<t:field id="g_152" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:menuitemcontainer>
<t:menuitem id="g_153" enabled="#{d.DemoMenuItemContainer.itemsEnabled}" text="Normal Item 3" />
<t:menuitem id="g_154" enabled="#{d.DemoMenuItemContainer.itemsEnabled}" text="Normal Item 4" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoMenuItemContainer}")

public class DemoMenuItemContainer
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    boolean m_itemsEnabled = true;
    public DemoMenuItemContainer(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        initRefComponent("menuitemcontainer");
    }

    public boolean getItemsEnabled() { return m_itemsEnabled; }
    public void setItemsEnabled(boolean value) { this.m_itemsEnabled = value; }
}

Dynamic loading in Button Menu

Press the "Show Menu" button: the menu below is different every time you press the button.

There is an attribute BUTONMENU-MENULOADROUNDTRIP. If set to "true" then an action listener will be called prior to building the menu on client side. Within the action listener you may dynamically create the menu.

Please pay attention: you must define at least one menu item in order to be able to press the menu-button! The menu-button is disabled if there are no items defined.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoButtonMenuLoad}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:buttonmenu id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoButtonMenuLoad.onButtonMenuAction}" menuloadroundtrip="true" text="Show Menu" >
<t:dynamiccontent id="g_4" contentbinding="#{d.DemoButtonMenuLoad.dynContent}" />
</t:buttonmenu>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.BaseActionEvent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.MENUITEMNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventMenuLoad;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.DYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.MENUITEMComponent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding.ComponentNode;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoButtonMenuLoad}")

public class DemoButtonMenuLoad
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public void onButtonMenuAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventMenuLoad)
        {
            render();
        }
    }

    DYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_dynContent = new DYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    public DYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDynContent() { return m_dynContent; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoButtonMenuLoad(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        initRefComponent("buttonmenu");
        render();
    }

    public void onMenuItemAction(ActionEvent event)
    {
        BaseActionEvent e = (BaseActionEvent)event;
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Menu Item was pressed: " + e.getSourceReference());
    }
    
    private void render()
    {
        List<ComponentNode> nodes = new ArrayList<ComponentNode>();
        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
        {
            MENUITEMNode mi = new MENUITEMNode();
            mi.setText("Hello " + System.currentTimeMillis() + " " + i);
            mi.setActionListener(getRootExpressionUsedInPage().replace("}",".onMenuItemAction}"));
            mi.setReference(""+i);
            nodes.add(mi);
        }
        m_dynContent.setContentNodes(nodes);
    }
}

Show default browser menu

Right click into each of the following text areas and you will see:

1. in the first text area the default browser menu pops up - this is due to the usage of the reserved word "CCBROWSER" as popup menu

2. in the second text area a normal RISC menu shows up - which has the id "NORMAL" and which is defined in the POPUPMENU definition

3. in the third text are no RISC menu shows up - because there is no popup definition at all.

The usage of the default browser popup menu is not activated by default - because it typically confuses the user - and it provides functions (like viewing the source of the page) which are not relevant fofr application users.

For the TEXTAREA, if switched to "check spelling" the default menu popup is very useful, because it shows proposals to replace words which are not spelled in a correct way.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPopupMenuBrowser}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Popup menu &#34;CCBROWSER&#34;" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:textarea id="g_5" height="80" popupmenu="CCBROWSER" text="#{d.DemoPopupMenuBrowser.text1}" width="100%" withspellcheck="true" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_6" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Normal Popup Menu &#34;NORMAL&#34;" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:textarea id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupMenuBrowser.onText3Action}" height="80" popupmenu="NORMAL" text="#{d.DemoPopupMenuBrowser.text3}" width="100%" withspellcheck="true" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_11" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" stylevariant="ccbig" text="No popup menu" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:textarea id="g_15" height="80" text="#{d.DemoPopupMenuBrowser.text2}" width="100%" withspellcheck="true" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:popupmenu id="NORMAL" >
<t:menuitem id="g_16" command="CLEAR" text="Clear text" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventDrop;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPopupMenuBrowser}")

public class DemoPopupMenuBrowser
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    String m_text1 = "Some text to be editet.";
    String m_text2 = "Some text to be editet.";
    String m_text3 = "Some text to be editet.";

    public DemoPopupMenuBrowser(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopopupmenubrowser.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPopupMenuBrowser}"; }


    public String getText1() { return m_text1; }
    public void setText1(String value) { this.m_text1 = value; }
    public String getText2() { return m_text2; }
    public void setText2(String value) { this.m_text2 = value; }
    public String getText3() { return m_text3; }
    public void setText3(String value) { this.m_text3 = value; }
    
    public void onText3Action(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem)
        {
            BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem e = (BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem)event;
            if ("CLEAR".equals(e.getCommand()))
            {
                m_text3 = null;
            }
        }
    }
}

Combining popup menus
Example

Press the right mouse button inside the fields.

It is possible two combine several popup menus by referencing them via a semicolon separated list of POPUPMENU-ids.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPopupMenuSequence}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPopupMenuSequence}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:field id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupMenuSequence.onLabel1Action}" labeltext="Menu 1 (MENU1)" popupmenu="MENU1" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:field id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupMenuSequence.onLabel2Action}" labeltext="Menu 2 (MENU2)" popupmenu="MENU2" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:field id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupMenuSequence.onLabel3Action}" labeltext="Menu 3 (MENU3, dynamically built)" popupmenu="MENU3" popupmenuloadroundtrip="true" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:field id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupMenuSequence.onLabel12Action}" labeltext="Menu 1+2 (MENU1;MENU2)" popupmenu="MENU1;MENU2" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:field id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupMenuSequence.onLabel123Action}" labeltext="Menu 1+2 +3(MENU1;MENU2;MENU3, dynamically built)" popupmenu="MENU1;MENU2;MENU3" popupmenuloadroundtrip="true" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:popupmenu id="MENU1" >
<t:menuitem id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupMenuSequence.onMenuItemAction}" command="AAA" hotkey="alt-112" reference="AAA" text="AAA" />
<t:menuitem id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupMenuSequence.onMenuItemAction}" command="BBB" hotkey="alt-113" reference="BBB" text="BBB" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:popupmenu id="MENU2" >
<t:menuitem id="g_15" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupMenuSequence.onMenuItemAction}" command="CCC" hotkey="alt-114" reference="CCC" text="CCC" />
<t:menuitem id="g_16" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupMenuSequence.onMenuItemAction}" command="DDD" hotkey="alt-115" reference="DDD" text="DDD" />
<t:menu id="g_17" text="Sub items" >
<t:menuitem id="g_18" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupMenuSequence.onMenuItemAction}" command="EEE" hotkey="alt-116" reference="EEE" text="EEE" />
<t:menuitem id="g_19" actionListener="#{d.DemoPopupMenuSequence.onMenuItemAction}" command="FFF" hotkey="alt-117" reference="FFF" text="FFF" />
</t:menu>
</t:popupmenu>
<t:popupmenu id="MENU3" >
<t:dynamiccontent id="g_20" contentbinding="#{d.DemoPopupMenuSequence.dynMenuContent}" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.BaseActionEvent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.MENUITEMNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPopupMenuLoad;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.DYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding.ComponentNode;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPopupMenuSequence}")

public class DemoPopupMenuSequence
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    DYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_dynMenuContent = new DYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    int m_counter = 0;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPopupMenuSequence(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopopupmenusequence.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPopupMenuSequence}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDynMenuContent() { return m_dynMenuContent; }
    
    public void onLabel1Action(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) { processAction(event); }
    public void onLabel2Action(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) { processAction(event); }
    public void onLabel12Action(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) { processAction(event); }

    public void onLabel3Action(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) { processAction(event); }
    public void onLabel123Action(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) { processAction(event); }

    public void onMenuItemAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        String ref = ((BaseActionEvent)event).getSourceReference();
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Menu item action: " + ref);
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void processAction(ActionEvent event)
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem)
        {
            BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem e = (BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem)event;
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Component action: " + e.getCommand());
        }
        else if (event instanceof BaseActionEventPopupMenuLoad)
        {
            renderDynMenu();
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Menu load action");
        }
    }
    
    private void renderDynMenu()
    {
        m_counter++;
        List<ComponentNode> nodes = new ArrayList<ComponentNode>();
        for (int i=0; i<3; i++)
        {
            MENUITEMNode m = new MENUITEMNode()
                    .setCommand("DYN"+i)
                    .setText("Dynamic text "  + m_counter);
            nodes.add(m);
        }
        m_dynMenuContent.setContentNodes(nodes);
    }

}

Grid item and grid

This example shows how to combine a popup menu on grid level (id "GRID") with a popup menu on item level (id "GRIDITEM").

Please pay attention: the item has to explicitly delegate the popup menu processing to its grid within you program!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPopupMenuCombinedForGrid}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPopupMenuCombinedForGrid}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:textpane id="g_10" text="Press the right mouse button inside the grid." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_7" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPopupMenuCombinedForGrid.grid}" popupmenu="GRID" rowpopupmenu="GRIDITEM;GRID" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_8" text="First name" width="100%" >
<t:field id="g_17" text=".{firstName}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_11" text="Last name" width="100%" >
<t:field id="g_12" text=".{lastName}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:popupmenu id="GRIDITEM" >
<t:menuitem id="g_14" command="DELETEITEM" text="Delete item" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:popupmenu id="GRID" >
<t:menuitem id="g_15" command="CREATEITEM" text="Create item" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPopupMenuCombinedForGrid}")

public class DemoPopupMenuCombinedForGrid
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_lastName;
        String i_firstName;
        public String getLastName() { return i_lastName; }
        public void setLastName(String value) { this.i_lastName = value; }
        public String getFirstName() { return i_firstName; }
        public void setFirstName(String value) { this.i_firstName = value; }
        public void onRowSelect() { }
        public void onRowExecute() { }
        @Override
        public void onRowPopupMenuItem(BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem event)
        {
            if ("DELETEITEM".equals(event.getCommand()))
                m_grid.getItems().remove(this);
            else
                // delegate to grid parent processing
                procesGridMenuItem(event.getCommand());
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>()
    {
        @Override
        protected void onPopupMenuItem(BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem popupMenuItemEvent)
        {
            procesGridMenuItem(popupMenuItemEvent.getCommand());
        }
    };

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPopupMenuCombinedForGrid(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopopupmenucombinedforgrid.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPopupMenuCombinedForGrid}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void procesGridMenuItem(String command)
    {
        if ("CREATEITEM".equals(command))
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setFirstName("new");
            gi.setLastName("new");
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }
}

Hot Keys

Associated with invokers

Invoker components (buttons, icons, menus) allow to directly bind to a key by defining their HOTKEY attribute. The attribute's value contains the string "ctrl-", "alt-", "shift-" and the keycode definition of the corresponding key.

The hot key is available "globally" within the page - i.e. the corresponding actionListener will be executed whenever the user will press the corresponding key within the window showing the page.

Pay attention: there is no conflict resolution when you define multiple components using the same hotkey definition!

Components that are associated with a hotkey automatically append this information to their tooltip, so that the user can see what key to press.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:row id="g_1" popupmenu="HOTKEYS" >
<t:menubar id="g_2" width="100%" >
<t:menu id="g_3" text="Edit" >
<t:menuitem id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoHotkeys.onFind}" hotkey="ctrl-70" text="Find..." />
<t:menuitem id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoHotkeys.onReplace}" hotkey="ctrl-82" text="Replace..." />
</t:menu>
</t:menubar>
</t:row>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoHotkeys.onPageAction}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoHotkeys}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="Ctrl-o" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoHotkeys.onOK}" hotkey="ctrl-79" text="OK" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="Ctrl-i" width="100" />
<t:icon id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoHotkeys.onIcon}" hotkey="ctrl-73" image="/images/icons/computer.png" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:label id="g_14" text="Ctrl-u" width="100" />
<t:fileuploadlink id="g_15" hotkey="ctrl-85" text="Upload File..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:coldistance id="g_17" width="80" />
<t:textarea id="g_18" height="100%" requestfocus="creation" text="#{d.DemoHotkeys.protocol}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_23" height="20" />
<t:rowline id="g_24" />
<t:rowdistance id="g_26" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:label id="g_28" text="In popup" width="100" />
<t:combofield id="g_21" actionListener="#{d.demoHotkeys.onDepartmentAction}" labeltext="Hotkey also available in popup" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdTextSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;


@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.demoHotkeys}")

public class DemoHotkeys extends PageBean
{
    String m_protocol = "";
    public String getProtocol() { return m_protocol; }
    public void setProtocol(String protocol) { m_protocol = protocol; }

    public DemoHotkeys(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("popupmenu");
    }

    public void onOK(ActionEvent event)
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("OK was executed.");
        m_protocol += "OK was executed.\n";
    }

    public void onEnter(ActionEvent event)
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("Enter was executed.");
        m_protocol += "Enter was executed.\n";
    }

    public void onIcon(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("Icon was pressed.");
        m_protocol += "Icon was pressed.\n";
    }

    public void onFind(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("Find was called.");
        m_protocol += "Find was called.\n";
    }

    public void onReplace(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("Replace was called.");
        m_protocol += "Replace was called.\n";
    }
    
    public void onDepartmentAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createInstance();
        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
            idts.addLine(""+i,"Value " + i);
        idts.getPopup().setParentHotkeysActive(true);
    }

}

Associated with popup menus

Use the POPUPMENU definition in order to very flexibly assign hot keys to page areas or individual component instances.

In the first example a popup menu "HOTKEYS" is defined on SHADOWEDPANE level, that provides three menu items. Each menu item is associated with a hotkey definition using its HOTKEY attribute. On server side the menu item is bound to an actionListener that reacts correspondingly.

In the second example the popup menu "VALIDATE" is defined with each individual field. The binding to the server side processing is not done by implementing an actionListener for the MENUITEM, but by using the actionListener definitions for each field.

You see: there are two types of binding the server side processing, that can be used in parallel:

(1) by implementing the MENUITEM actionListener
(2) by implementing the actionListener of this component on which the hotkey was executed and on which the popup menu was bound

When using the 2nd way then it is important to define the COMMAND attribute with the MENUITEM: it allows to differenciate between different hotkeys/ menu items that are executed on one component.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoHotkeysPopupMenu}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:pane id="g_3" background="#00000008" padding="10" popupmenu="HOTKEYS" rowdistance="4" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Hotkeys associated with a popup menu:" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" text="ctrl-s, ctrl-F4, Enter" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="Name" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_11" text="#{d.DemoHotkeysPopupMenu.name}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="Company" width="100" />
<t:combobox id="g_14" editable="true" value="#{d.DemoHotkeysPopupMenu.company}" width="100" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_15" text="CaptainCasa" value="CaptainCasa" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_16" text="IBM" value="IBM" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_17" text="SAP" value="SAP" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_18" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:pane id="g_20" background="#00000008" padding="10" rowdistance="4" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:label id="g_22" text="Hotkeys associated with a popup menu on fields:" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_23" >
<t:label id="g_24" text="Enter" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_25" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_26" >
<t:label id="g_27" text="Street" width="100" />
<t:textarea id="g_28" actionListener="#{d.DemoHotkeysPopupMenu.onStreetAction}" height="100" popupmenu="VALIDATEPOPUP" text="#{d.DemoHotkeysPopupMenu.street}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_29" >
<t:label id="g_30" text="City" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_31" actionListener="#{d.DemoHotkeysPopupMenu.onCityAction}" popupmenu="VALIDATEPOPUP" text="#{d.DemoHotkeysPopupMenu.city}" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_32" height="20" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:popupmenu id="HOTKEYS" >
<t:menuitem id="g_33" actionListener="#{d.DemoHotkeysPopupMenu.onFunctionSave}" hotkey="ctrl-83" text="Save" />
<t:menuitem id="g_34" actionListener="#{d.DemoHotkeysPopupMenu.onFunctionClose}" hotkey="ctrl-115" text="Close" />
<t:menuitem id="g_35" actionListener="#{d.DemoHotkeysPopupMenu.onFunctionEnter}" hotkey="10" text="Enter" />
<t:menuitem id="g_36" actionListener="#{d.DemoHotkeysPopupMenu.onFunctionAbout}" hotkey="ctrl-112" hotkeyonly="true" text="About" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:popupmenu id="VALIDATEPOPUP" >
<t:menuitem id="g_37" command="VALIDATE" hotkey="10" text="Validate" />
</t:popupmenu>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.OKPopup;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;


@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.demoHotkeysPopupMenu}")

public class DemoHotkeysPopupMenu extends PageBean
{
    String m_name;
    public void setName(String value) { m_name = value; }
    public String getName() { return m_name; }
    
    String m_company;
    public void setCompany(String value) { m_company = value; }
    public String getCompany() { return m_company; }
    
    public DemoHotkeysPopupMenu(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
    
    public void onFunctionClose(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Close was excecuted" + buildValueString());
    }

    public void onFunctionSave(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Save was excecuted" + buildValueString());
    }
    
    public void onFunctionReturn(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Return was excecuted" + buildValueString());
    }
    
    public void onFunctionEnter(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Enter was excecuted" + buildValueString());
    }
    
    public static void onFunctionAbout(ActionEvent event)
    {
        OKPopup.createInstance("About","CaptainCasa Enteprise Client\n\nhttp://www.captaincasa.com");
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    String m_street;
    public void setStreet(String value) { m_street = value; }
    public String getStreet() { return m_street; }
    
    String m_city;
    public void setCity(String value) { m_city = value; }
    public String getCity() { return m_city; }
    
    public void onStreetAction(ActionEvent event)
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem)
        {
            BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem e = (BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem)event;
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Street was validated! ("+m_street+","+e.getCommand()+")");
        }
    }
    
    public void onCityAction(ActionEvent event)
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem)
        {
            BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem e = (BaseActionEventPopupMenuItem)event;
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("City was validated! ("+m_city+","+e.getCommand()+")");
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private String buildValueString()
    {
        return " (" + m_name + ", " + m_company + ")";
    }
    
}

Test if hot key is available

With this page you can test the availability of hot key combinations within your browser environment.

Within the page buttons are generated for the followin hot keys:

(.) "ctrl-" a-z,0-9,F1-F12
(.) "ctrl-shift" a-z,0-9,F1-F12
(.) "ctrl" a-z,0-9,F1-F12
(.) "ctrl-alt" a-z,0-9,F1-F12

The button's HOTKEY attribute is set correspondingly.

Whenever the button reacts on the hotkey combination then a corresponding message is output in the status bar. If there is no output and/or some behavior that comes from the browser processing then the hot key is not usable.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoAllHotkeys}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoAllHotkeys}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:field id="g_9" requestfocus="creation" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowflexlinecontainer id="g_6" >
<t:dynamiccontent id="g_7" contentbinding="#{d.DemoAllHotkeys.dynContent}" />
</t:rowflexlinecontainer>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Calendar;
import java.util.List;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.BUTTONNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.DYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding.ComponentNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.valuemgmt.IActionListenerDelegation;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager.HotKeyInfo;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoAllHotkeys}")

public class DemoAllHotkeys
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    DYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_dynContent = new DYNAMICCONTENTBinding();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoAllHotkeys(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        createDynContent();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoallhotkeys.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoAllHotkeys}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDynContent() { return m_dynContent; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void createDynContent()
    {
        List<int[]> ranges = new ArrayList<int[]>();
        ranges.add(new int[] {65,90});
        ranges.add(new int[] {48,57});
        ranges.add(new int[] {112,123});
        List<ComponentNode> l = new ArrayList<ComponentNode>();
        for (int[] range: ranges)
        {
            for (int i=range[0]; i<=range[1]; i++)
            {
                {
                    HotKeyInfo hki = new HotKeyInfo();
                    hki.m_keyCode = i;
                    hki.m_isControlDown = true;
                    BUTTONNode b = createButton(hki);
                    l.add(b);
                }
                {
                    HotKeyInfo hki = new HotKeyInfo();
                    hki.m_keyCode = i;
                    hki.m_isAltDown = true;
                    BUTTONNode b = createButton(hki);
                    l.add(b);
                }
                {
                    HotKeyInfo hki = new HotKeyInfo();
                    hki.m_keyCode = i;
                    hki.m_isControlDown = true;
                    hki.m_isAltDown = true;
                    BUTTONNode b = createButton(hki);
                    l.add(b);
                }
                {
                    HotKeyInfo hki = new HotKeyInfo();
                    hki.m_keyCode = i;
                    hki.m_isControlDown = true;
                    hki.m_isShiftDown = true;
                    BUTTONNode b = createButton(hki);
                    l.add(b);
                }
            }
        }
        m_dynContent.setContentNodes(l);
    }

    private BUTTONNode createButton(HotKeyInfo hki)
    {
        String hotkey = ""+hki.m_keyCode;
        if (hki.m_isAltDown == true) hotkey = "alt-" + hotkey;
        if (hki.m_isShiftDown == true) hotkey = "shift-" + hotkey;
        if (hki.m_isControlDown == true) hotkey = "ctrl-" + hotkey;
        final String text = ValueManager.createHotKeyString(hki);
        BUTTONNode b = new BUTTONNode()
                .setText(text)
                .setWidth("150+")
                .setHotkey(hotkey)
                .bindActionListener(new IActionListenerDelegation()
                {
                    @Override
                    public void onAction(ActionEvent event)
                    {
                        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Hotkey pressed: " + text + ", Stamp: " + System.currentTimeMillis());
                    }
                });
        return b;
    }
}

Hotkey visibility in popup dialogs

By default hotkey definitions within the parent of a popup dialog are not visible inside the dialog itself. The dialog forms a "hotkey sandbox".

You can override by calling Modal/ModelessPopup.setParentHotkeysActive(true) - in this case the hotkey definitions of the parent are processed in the dialog as well.

In the example the first dialog is following the default hotkey processing - i.e. there is no visibility of parent hotkeys in the valid-values-dialog.

In the second example the parent hotkeys are visible.
Please note: due to the fact that the popup internally is defined with "closeonclickoutside", the dialog immediately closes after invoking one of the hotkeys.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoHotkeyAndPopup}" />
<t:rowheader id="g_3" >
<t:button id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoHotkeyAndPopup.onHotkey1Action}" hotkey="ctrl-shift-49" text="Invoke action 1" />
</t:rowheader>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_11" objectbinding="#{d.DemoHotkeyAndPopup}" popupmenu="POPUPMENU" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:textpane id="g_8" text="There are two &#34;hotkey&#34; definitions in this dialog, both triggering some output within the status bar:1. ctrl-shift-1 invokes action 1 - the hotkey is defined as global hotkey2. ctrl-shift-2 invokes action 2 - the hotkey is defined as popup menu item hotkey" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_9" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:combofield id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoHotkeyAndPopup.onDepartmentAction1}" labeltext="Department" text="#{d.DemoHotkeyAndPopup.department}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:textpane id="g_18" text="Open the popup behind the combo-field and press the ctrl-shift-1/-2: the hotkeys are not processed. - By default hotkeys are only activated inside a dialog." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_24" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:combofield id="g_20" actionListener="#{d.DemoHotkeyAndPopup.onDepartmentAction2}" labeltext="Department" text="#{d.DemoHotkeyAndPopup.department}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:textpane id="g_22" text="Open the popup behind the combo-field and press the ctrl-shift-1/-2: the hotkeys are processed. So the hotkey definitions are &#34;visible&#34; also in the popup dialog. - Please check the Java code: a function setParentHotkeysActive(true) is valled with the dialog popup that is opened." width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:popupmenu id="POPUPMENU" >
<t:menuitem id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoHotkeyAndPopup.onHotkey2Action}" command="IA2" hotkey="ctrl-shift-50" text="Invoke action 2" />
</t:popupmenu>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.ISetId;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.IdTextSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoHotkeyAndPopup}")

public class DemoHotkeyAndPopup
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    String m_department;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoHotkeyAndPopup(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
    
    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demohotkeyandpopup.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoHotkeyAndPopup}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onDepartmentAction1(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        IdTextSelection idts = createValidValuesPopup();
    }

    public void onDepartmentAction2(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        IdTextSelection idts = createValidValuesPopup();
        idts.getPopup().setParentHotkeysActive(true);
    }

    public String getDepartment() { return m_department; }
    public void setDepartment(String value) { this.m_department = value; }

    public void onHotkey1Action(ActionEvent event)
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("Action 1 triggered: " + System.currentTimeMillis());
    }
    
    public void onHotkey2Action(ActionEvent event)
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("Action 2 triggered: " + System.currentTimeMillis());
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private IdTextSelection createValidValuesPopup()
    {
        IdTextSelection idts = IdTextSelection.createInstance();
        idts.addLine("SALES","Sales");
        idts.addLine("PRODUCTION","Production");
        idts.addLine("QA","Quality Assurance");
        idts.addLine("FINANCE","Finance & Controlling");
        idts.setCallBack(new ISetId()
        {
            @Override
            public void setId(String id)
            {
                m_department = id;
            }
        });
        return idts;
    }

}

Structure Components

Tabbed Line

The tabbed line is a horizontal arrangement of tabs. Each tab can have a text (mandatory) and an image (optional).

Unlike the TABBEDPANE the TABLINE component does not provide an own pane/ container component for each tab - but can be used for any purpose as consequence.

In the example the tabbed line is associated with a pane that is located directly below the tabbed line. When clicking onto a tab the corresponding page is shown within the pane.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoTabbedline}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_58" >
<t:label id="g_2" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Simple Example:" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_59" >
<t:tabbedline id="g_5" width="100%" >
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.demoTabbedline.onLeft}" text="Left" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.demoTabbedline.onCenter}" text="Center" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.demoTabbedline.onRight}" text="Right" />
</t:tabbedline>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_61" height="25" />
<t:row id="g_62" >
<t:label id="g_63" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Serve side &#34;tab&#34; selection" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_33" >
<t:tabbedline id="g_34" value="#{d.demoTabbedline.selectedIndex}" width="100%" >
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_35" actionListener="#{d.demoTabbedline.onLeft}" text="Left" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_36" actionListener="#{d.demoTabbedline.onCenter}" text="Center" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_37" actionListener="#{d.demoTabbedline.onRight}" text="Right" tooltip="This is the most right tab component." />
</t:tabbedline>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_40" >
<t:label id="g_41" text="Index" width="120" />
<t:combobox id="g_42" flush="true" value="#{d.demoTabbedline.selectedIndex}" width="80" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_43" text="Left" value="0" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_44" text="Center" value="1" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_45" text="Right" value="2" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_67" height="25" />
<t:row id="g_47" >
<t:label id="g_48" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Tabbed Line controlling the content of a container" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:pane id="g_65" height="200" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_50" >
<t:tabbedline id="g_51" border="bottom:1;color:#00000030" width="100%" >
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_52" actionListener="#{d.demoTabbedline.onGreen}" text="Green" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_53" actionListener="#{d.demoTabbedline.onRed}" text="Red" />
</t:tabbedline>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_54" >
<t:pane id="g_55" background="#{d.demoTabbedline.background}" border="left:1;top:0;right:1;bottom:1;color:#C0C0C0" height="100%" padding="top:0;bottom:1;left:1;right:1" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.demoTabbedline}")

public class DemoTabbedline extends PageBean
{
    protected int m_selectedIndex;
    public int getSelectedIndex() { return m_selectedIndex; }
    public void setSelectedIndex(int value) { m_selectedIndex = value; }

    String m_background = "#C0FFC0";
    
    public DemoTabbedline(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("tabbedline");
    }
    
    public String getBackground() { return m_background; }
    
    public void onLeft(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("Left tab was invoked.");
    }
    
    public void onRight(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("Right tab was invoked.");
    }
    
    public void onCenter(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("Center tab was invoked.");
    }
    
    public void onGreen(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        m_background = "#C0FFC0";
    }
    
    public void onRed(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        m_background = "#FFC0C0";
    }
    
}

Tabbed Line Style Variants

There are some pre-configured style variants that are part of the default style.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTabbedLineStyleVariants}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Default" width="80" />
<t:tabbedline id="g_4" >
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_5" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_6" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_7" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_8" text="tab" />
</t:tabbedline>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="cctl05" width="80" />
<t:tabbedline id="g_11" stylevariant="cctl05" width="100%" >
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_12" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_13" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_14" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_15" text="tab" />
</t:tabbedline>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="cctl01" width="80" />
<t:tabbedline id="g_18" stylevariant="cctl01" >
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_19" text="tab" width="70" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_20" text="tab" width="70" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_21" text="tab" width="70" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_22" text="tab" width="70" />
</t:tabbedline>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_23" >
<t:label id="g_24" text="cctl02" width="80" />
<t:tabbedline id="g_25" stylevariant="cctl02" >
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_26" text="tab" width="70" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_27" text="tab" width="70" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_28" text="tab" width="70" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_29" text="tab" width="70" />
</t:tabbedline>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_30" >
<t:label id="g_31" text="cctl03" width="80" />
<t:tabbedline id="g_32" stylevariant="cctl03" >
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_33" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_34" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_35" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_36" text="tab" />
</t:tabbedline>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_37" >
<t:label id="g_38" text="cctl04" width="80" />
<t:tabbedline id="g_39" stylevariant="cctl04" >
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_40" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_41" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_42" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_43" text="tab" />
</t:tabbedline>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_44" >
<t:label id="g_45" text="cctlbreadcrumb01" width="100" />
<t:tabbedline id="g_46" stylevariant="cctlbreadcrumb01" >
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_47" stylevariant="cctlbreadcrumb01" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_48" stylevariant="cctlbreadcrumb01" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_49" stylevariant="cctlbreadcrumb01" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_50" stylevariant="cctlbreadcrumb01" text="tab" />
</t:tabbedline>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_52" >
<t:label id="g_53" text="cctlbreadcrumb01" width="100" />
<t:tabbedline id="g_54" menuiconvisible="false" stylevariant="cctlbutton" width="100" withscrollicons="false" >
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_55" stylevariant="cctlbreadcrumb01" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_56" stylevariant="cctlbreadcrumb01" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_57" stylevariant="cctlbreadcrumb01" text="tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_58" stylevariant="cctlbreadcrumb01" text="tab" />
</t:tabbedline>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoTabbedLineStyleVariants extends PageBean
{

    public DemoTabbedLineStyleVariants(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("tabbedline");
    }

}

Tabbed Line Selection Id

by default the VALUE of the TABBEDLINE (or TABBEDLINTECONTAINER) reflects the index of the currently selected item.

But: you can also define a SELECTIONID on item level. In this case the VALUE reflects the currently selected selecition id value.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTabbedLineTabSelectionId}" rowdistance="20" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:tabbedline id="g_3" value="#{d.DemoTabbedLineTabSelectionId.tlvalue}" >
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_4" selectionid="LEFT" text="Left" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_5" selectionid="MIDDLE" text="Middle" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_6" selectionid="RIGHT" text="Right" />
</t:tabbedline>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:tabbedlinecontainer id="g_8" value="#{d.DemoTabbedLineTabSelectionId.tlvalue}" width="300" >
<t:tabbedlinecontainertab id="g_9" selectionid="LEFT" text="Left" >
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="Left" />
</t:row>
</t:tabbedlinecontainertab>
<t:tabbedlinecontainertab id="g_12" selectionid="MIDDLE" text="Middle" >
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:label id="g_14" text="Middle" />
</t:row>
</t:tabbedlinecontainertab>
<t:tabbedlinecontainertab id="g_15" selectionid="RIGHT" text="Right" >
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="Right" />
</t:row>
</t:tabbedlinecontainertab>
</t:tabbedlinecontainer>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" text="Selected Tab" width="100" />
<t:combobox id="g_20" flush="true" value="#{d.DemoTabbedLineTabSelectionId.tlvalue}" width="100" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_21" text="Left" value="LEFT" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_22" text="Middle" value="MIDDLE" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_23" text="Right" value="RIGHT" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTabbedLineTabSelectionId}")

public class DemoTabbedLineTabSelectionId
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    String m_tlvalue = "MIDDLE";
    public String getTlvalue() { return m_tlvalue; }
    public void setTlvalue(String value) { this.m_tlvalue = value; }

    public DemoTabbedLineTabSelectionId(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotabbedlinetabselectionid.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoTabbedLineTabSelectionId}"; }

}

Tabbed Line - Vertical

The vertical tabbed line is a vertical arrangement of click-able areas. Its definition is very similar to the normal (horizontal) tabbed line.

The tabbed line maintains a VALUE, which is "0" when the first item is selected, "1" when the next one is selected, etc. In addition each tab item has an own action listener, so that you can directly react on user selections.

By using the different bgpaint-attributes of the component, you can achieve nice graphical effects with low effort.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTabbedlineVertical}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Default Styling" width="110" />
<t:tabbedlinevertical id="g_4" value="#{d.DemoTabbedlineVertical.indexTL1}" width="100" >
<t:tabbedlineverticaltab id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoTabbedlineVertical.onTL1Action}" text="First" />
<t:tabbedlineverticaltab id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoTabbedlineVertical.onTL1Action}" text="Second" />
<t:tabbedlineverticaltab id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoTabbedlineVertical.onTL1Action}" text="Third" />
<t:tabbedlineverticaltab id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.DemoTabbedlineVertical.onTL1Action}" text="Fourth" />
</t:tabbedlinevertical>
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_9" background="#00000030" height="1" />
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="Individual Styling" width="110" />
<t:pane id="g_12" background="#FFFFFF80" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:pane id="g_14" height="100%" >
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:pane id="g_16" bgpaint="line(80%,0,80%,100%,1,#800000)" height="50" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:tabbedlinevertical id="g_18" bgpaintdefault="line(80%,0,80%,100%,1,#800000);line(0,100%,80%,100%,1,#00000010)" bgpaintdefaultfirst="line(80%,0,80%,100%,1,#800000);line(0,100%,80%,100%,1,#00000010);line(0,0,80%,0,1,#00000010)" bgpaintrollover="rectangle(0,0,100%,100%,#80000080);line(80%,0,80%,100%,1,#800000)" bgpaintselected="background(#800000)" fontselected="weight:bold" foregrounddefault="#80800" foregroundselected="#F0F0F0" fxstyleseqtabs="cc_buttontabbedline_transparent" value="#{d.DemoTabbedlineVertical.indexTL2}" width="100" >
<t:tabbedlineverticaltab id="g_19" actionListener="#{d.DemoTabbedlineVertical.onTL2Action}" align="left" text="First" />
<t:tabbedlineverticaltab id="g_20" actionListener="#{d.DemoTabbedlineVertical.onTL2Action}" align="left" text="Second" />
<t:tabbedlineverticaltab id="g_21" actionListener="#{d.DemoTabbedlineVertical.onTL2Action}" align="left" text="Third" />
<t:tabbedlineverticaltab id="g_22" actionListener="#{d.DemoTabbedlineVertical.onTL2Action}" align="left" height="100" text="Fourth" />
<t:tabbedlineverticaltab id="g_23" actionListener="#{d.DemoTabbedlineVertical.onTL2Action}" align="left" text="Fifth" />
<t:tabbedlineverticaltab id="g_24" actionListener="#{d.DemoTabbedlineVertical.onTL2Action}" align="left" text="Sixth" />
</t:tabbedlinevertical>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_25" >
<t:pane id="g_26" bgpaint="line(80%,0,80%,100%,1,#800000)" height="100%" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
<t:pane id="g_27" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_28" />
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoTabbedlineVertical extends PageBean
{
    int m_indexTL1 = 0;
    int m_indexTL2 = 2;
    
    public DemoTabbedlineVertical(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("tabbedlinevertical");
    }

    public int getIndexTL1() { return m_indexTL1; }
    public void setIndexTL1(int indexTL1) { m_indexTL1 = indexTL1; }
    public void onTL1Action(ActionEvent event) { updateStatusbar(); }

    public int getIndexTL2() { return m_indexTL2; }
    public void setIndexTL2(int indexTL2) { m_indexTL2 = indexTL2; }
    public void onTL2Action(ActionEvent event) { updateStatusbar(); }
    
    public void updateStatusbar()
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Selected index 1: " + m_indexTL1 + "; selected index 2: " + m_indexTL2);
    }
}

Tabbed Line - Image Definition

This demo shows the usage of the attributes...

(.) IMAGE
(.) IMAGEWIDTH/HEIGHT
(.) IMAGEBACKGROUND
(.) IMAGEROUNDING
(.) IMAGEBORDERWIDTH/COLOR

...within the TABBEDLINETAB and TABBEDPANE component.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTabbedLineImage}" rowdistance="20" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="TABBEDLINE(TAB)" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:tabbedline id="g_5" >
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_6" image="/images/pictures/photo0.gif" imagebordercolor="#c0c0c0" imageborderwidth="1" imageheight="40" imagerounding="50%" imagewidth="40" text="First tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_7" image="/images/pictures/photo1.gif" imagebordercolor="#c0c0c0" imageborderwidth="1" imageheight="40" imagerounding="50%" imagewidth="40" text="Second tab" />
<t:tabbedlinetab id="g_8" image="/images/pictures/photo2.gif" imagebordercolor="#c0c0c0" imageborderwidth="1" imageheight="40" imagerounding="50%" imagewidth="40" text="Third tab" />
</t:tabbedline>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_9" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" stylevariant="ccbig" text="TABBEDPANE(TAB)" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:tabbedpane id="g_13" height="200" width="100%" >
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_14" image="/images/pictures/photo3.gif" imagebordercolor="#c0c0c0" imageborderwidth="1" imageheight="40" imagerounding="50%" imagewidth="40" text="First tab" >
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_16" text="Some content 1" />
</t:row>
</t:tabbedpanetab>
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_17" image="/images/pictures/photo4.gif" imagebordercolor="#c0c0c0" imageborderwidth="1" imageheight="40" imagerounding="50%" imagewidth="40" text="Second tab" >
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" text="Some content 2" />
</t:row>
</t:tabbedpanetab>
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_20" image="/images/pictures/photo5.gif" imagebordercolor="#c0c0c0" imageborderwidth="1" imageheight="40" imagerounding="50%" imagewidth="40" text="Third tab" >
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:label id="g_22" text="Some content 3" />
</t:row>
</t:tabbedpanetab>
</t:tabbedpane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTabbedLineImage}")

public class DemoTabbedLineImage
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoTabbedLineImage(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotabbedlineimage.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoTabbedLineImage}"; }
}

Outlook Bar

The Outlook bar consists out of a number of items, each rendered as some kind of button. When pressing the button then the items are arranged around the content, so that the button, that was selected, is directly located above the content area.

The server gets notified by the button click and can now itself arrange the content area in any way. In the example the content area is dynamically built using component binding. It is also possible to define different pages to be shown, using the ROWINCLUDE component.

Please note: the outlook bar does not open up one content pane per item, but it has one content pane, that is used by all items.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoOutlookbar}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:outlookbar id="g_3" height="100%" value="#{d.demoOutlookbar.contentpageIndex}" width="150" >
<t:outlookbaritem id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.demoOutlookbar.onMails}" align="left" image="/images/icons/table.png" text="Mails" />
<t:outlookbaritem id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.demoOutlookbar.onFolders}" align="left" image="/images/icons/style.png" text="Folders" />
<t:outlookbaritem id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.demoOutlookbar.onAddresses}" align="left" image="/images/icons/telephone.png" text="Addresses" />
<t:outlookbaritem id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.demoOutlookbar.onFavourites}" align="left" height="40" image="/images/icons/disk.png" text="Favourites" />
<t:outlookbarcontent id="g_8" background="#FFFFFF40" curtaincolor="#F0F0F0" >
<t:rowdynamiccontent id="g_9" contentbinding="#{d.DemoOutlookbar.dynamicContent}" />
</t:outlookbarcontent>
</t:outlookbar>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.BUTTONNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.LABELNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.PANENode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.ROWNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding.ComponentNode;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoOutlookbar extends PageBean
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    int m_contentPageIndex = 0;
    int m_renderedContentPageIndex = -1;
    ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_dynamicContent = new ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoOutlookbar(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("outlookbar");
        buildContentMails();
    }
    
    public ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDynamicContent() { return m_dynamicContent; }

    public void setContentpageIndex(int value) { m_contentPageIndex = value; }
    public int getContentpageIndex() { return m_contentPageIndex; }
    
    public void onMails(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("onMails " + m_contentPageIndex);
        if (m_renderedContentPageIndex == 0) return;
        buildContentMails();
    }
    
    public void onFolders(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("onFolders " + m_contentPageIndex);
        if (m_renderedContentPageIndex == 1) return;
        buildContentFolders();
    }
    
    public void onAddresses(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("onAddresses " + m_contentPageIndex);
        if (m_renderedContentPageIndex == 2) return;
        buildContentAddresses();
    }
    
    public void onFavourites(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("onFavourites " + m_contentPageIndex);
        if (m_renderedContentPageIndex == 3) return;
        buildContentFavourites();
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void buildContentMails()
    {
        m_renderedContentPageIndex = 0;
        PANENode p = new PANENode();
        p.setHeight("100%");
        p.setWidth("100%");
        {
            ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
            p.addSubNode(r);
            BUTTONNode b = new BUTTONNode();
            r.addSubNode(b);
            b.setText("Mails");
            b.setContentareafilled("false");
            b.setImage("/images/icons/bigmails.png");
            b.setImagepressed("/images/icons/bigmailspressed.png");
            b.setImagerollover("/images/icons/bigmailsrollover.png");
            b.setWidth("100%");
            b.setHorizontaltextposition("center");
            b.setVerticaltextposition("bottom");
        }
        {
            ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
            p.addSubNode(r);
            BUTTONNode b = new BUTTONNode();
            r.addSubNode(b);
            b.setText("Voice Mails");
            b.setContentareafilled("false");
            b.setImage("/images/icons/bigspeaker.png");
            b.setImagepressed("/images/icons/bigspeakerpressed.png");
            b.setImagerollover("/images/icons/bigspeakerrollover.png");
            b.setWidth("100%");
            b.setHorizontaltextposition("center");
            b.setVerticaltextposition("bottom");
        }
        {
            ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
            p.addSubNode(r);
            BUTTONNode b = new BUTTONNode();
            r.addSubNode(b);
            b.setText("Calendar");
            b.setContentareafilled("false");
            b.setImage("/images/icons/bigcalendar.png");
            b.setImagepressed("/images/icons/bigcalendarpressed.png");
            b.setImagerollover("/images/icons/bigcalendarrollover.png");
            b.setWidth("100%");
            b.setHorizontaltextposition("center");
            b.setVerticaltextposition("bottom");
        }
        m_dynamicContent.setContentNode(p);
    }
    
    private void buildContentFolders()
    {
        m_renderedContentPageIndex = 1;
        PANENode p = new PANENode();
        p.setHeight("100%");
        p.setWidth("100%");
        {
            ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
            p.addSubNode(r);
            LABELNode b = new LABELNode();
            r.addSubNode(b);
            b.setText("Folders - any content");
        }
        m_dynamicContent.setContentNode(p);
    }
    
    private void buildContentAddresses()
    {
        m_renderedContentPageIndex = 2;
        PANENode p = new PANENode();
        p.setHeight("100%");
        p.setWidth("100%");
        {
            ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
            p.addSubNode(r);
            LABELNode b = new LABELNode();
            r.addSubNode(b);
            b.setText("Addresses - any content");
        }
        m_dynamicContent.setContentNode(p);
    }
    
    private void buildContentFavourites()
    {
        m_renderedContentPageIndex = 3;
        PANENode p = new PANENode();
        p.setHeight("100%");
        p.setWidth("100%");
        {
            ROWNode r = new ROWNode();
            p.addSubNode(r);
            LABELNode b = new LABELNode();
            r.addSubNode(b);
            b.setText("Favourites - any content");
        }
        m_dynamicContent.setContentNode(p);
    }
}

Ribbon Menu Areas

The areas on top of the page are not a specific component but just an arrangement of existing ones. Have a look into the XML for more details.

(This demo just shows a certain arrangement of components - there is no function implemented behind the icons/fields.)

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTitledArea}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:pane id="g_3" background="#FFFFFFA0" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:tabbedpane id="g_5" onlydrawselectedtab="true" stylevariant="topmenu" tabindent="30" width="100%" borderdarkshadowcolor="#00000010" borderlightcolor="#00000010" bordershadowcolor="#00000000" tabstyle="classic" transparent="true" >
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_6" text="File" >
<t:row id="g_7" coldistance="5" >
<t:pane id="g_8" height="100%" >
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:pane id="g_10" background="#ffffff40" height="100%" padding="5" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:button id="g_12" contentareafilled="false" height="22" image="/images/icons/disk.png" text="Save" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:button id="g_14" contentareafilled="false" height="22" image="/images/icons/disk.png" text="Save as..." />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_16" align="center" background="#00000010" text="Basic" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
<t:pane id="g_17" height="100%" >
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:pane id="g_19" background="#ffffff40" height="100%" padding="5" >
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:button id="g_21" contentareafilled="false" height="22" image="/images/icons/delete.png" text="Remove file" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:button id="g_23" contentareafilled="false" height="22" image="/images/icons/package.png" text="Build Package ou of selected items" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:button id="g_25" contentareafilled="false" height="22" image="/images/icons/add.png" text="Add Package Item" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_26" >
<t:label id="g_27" align="center" background="#00000010" text="Extended" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:tabbedpanetab>
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_28" text="Edit" >
<t:row id="g_29" coldistance="5" >
<t:pane id="g_30" height="100%" >
<t:row id="g_31" >
<t:pane id="g_32" background="#ffffff40" height="100%" padding="5" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_33" coldistance="10" >
<t:label id="g_34" text="Text" width="70" />
<t:colorfield id="g_35" value="#000000" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_36" coldistance="10" >
<t:label id="g_37" text="Background" width="70" />
<t:colorfield id="g_38" value="#FFFFFF" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_39" >
<t:label id="g_40" align="center" background="#00000010" text="Colors" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
<t:pane id="g_41" height="100%" >
<t:row id="g_42" >
<t:pane id="g_43" background="#ffffff40" height="100%" padding="5" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_44" coldistance="10" >
<t:link id="g_45" font="size:10" text="Abcdef" />

</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_52" >
<t:label id="g_53" align="center" background="#00000010" text="Font Size" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:tabbedpanetab>
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_54" text="Search" >
<t:row id="g_55" >
<t:label id="g_56" text="No content placed yet..." />
</t:row>
</t:tabbedpanetab>
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_57" text="Project" >
<t:row id="g_58" >
<t:label id="g_59" text="No content placed yet..." />
</t:row>
</t:tabbedpanetab>
</t:tabbedpane>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_60" >
<t:scrollpane id="g_61" background="#FFFFFF" border="left:1;right:1;top:0;bottom:1;color:#00000010" height="100%" padding="10" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_62" >
<t:label id="g_63" text="Some label" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_64" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_65" >
<t:label id="g_66" text="Some label" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_67" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_68" >
<t:label id="g_69" text="Some label" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_70" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_71" >
<t:label id="g_72" text="Some label" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_73" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_74" >
<t:label id="g_75" text="Some label" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_76" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_77" >
<t:label id="g_78" text="Some label" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_79" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_80" >
<t:label id="g_81" text="Some label" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_82" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_83" >
<t:label id="g_84" text="Some label" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_85" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:scrollpane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoTitledArea extends PageBean
{

    public DemoTitledArea(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("tabbedpane");
    }

}

Lines

This examples shows how to use the components COLLINE (vertical) and ROWLINE (horizontal).

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoLines}">
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:foldableverticalpane id="g_3" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="Vertical" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Label 1" width="100" />
<t:colline id="g_6" height="50" />
<t:coldistance id="g_7" width="10" />
<t:label id="g_8" text="Label 2" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="Label 1" width="100" />
<t:colline id="g_11" background="#800000" height="50" width="3" />
<t:coldistance id="g_12" width="10" />
<t:label id="g_13" text="Label 2" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:foldableverticalpane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:foldableverticalpane id="g_15" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="Vertical" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="Label 1" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_18" />
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:label id="g_20" text="Label 2" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_21" background="#800000" height="3" />
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:label id="g_23" text="Label 3" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:foldableverticalpane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:foldableverticalpane id="g_25" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="Examples" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_26" >
<t:label id="g_27" text="This is a text" />
<t:coldistance id="g_28" width="10" />
<t:pane id="g_29" width="100%" >
<t:rowline id="g_30" background="#000000" height="3" />
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_31" >
<t:pane id="g_32" width="50%" >
<t:rowline id="g_33" background="#FF0000" height="3" />
</t:pane>
<t:coldistance id="g_34" width="10" />
<t:label id="g_35" text="This is a text" />
<t:coldistance id="g_36" width="10" />
<t:pane id="g_37" width="50%" >
<t:rowline id="g_38" background="#FF0000" height="3" />
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_39" >
<t:pane id="g_40" width="100%" >
<t:rowline id="g_41" background="#FFFF00" height="3" />
</t:pane>
<t:coldistance id="g_42" width="10" />
<t:label id="g_43" text="This is a text" />
</t:row>
</t:foldableverticalpane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoLines extends PageBean
{
    public DemoLines(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("colline");
    }
}

Title Bar

This demo shows various configuration options that are provided by the ROWTITLEBAR component.

You may place additional components on the right of the text into the title bar.
By default the width of the title bar's label is set to 100%, so additional components are "pressed" to the very right of the title bar's internal row, in which the component are arranged. But you may override by using attribute TEXTWIDTH.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTitlebar}" >
<t:rowtitlebar id="g_4" text="Default Usage" />
<t:rowtitlebar id="g_5" text="Default Usage, with image" textimage="/images/icons/car.png" />
<t:rowtitlebar id="g_6" align="center" text="Text aligned" />
<t:rowtitlebar id="g_7" text="With some components on the right" >
<t:icon id="g_8" image="/images/icons/add.png" />
<t:icon id="g_9" image="/images/icons/clear.png" />
</t:rowtitlebar>
<t:rowtitlebar id="g_10" text="Text width 120" textwidth="120" >
<t:icon id="g_11" image="/images/icons/add.png" />
<t:icon id="g_12" image="/images/icons/clear.png" />
</t:rowtitlebar>
<t:rowtitlebar id="g_13" text="Text width 50%" textwidth="50%" >
<t:pane id="g_14" width="50%" >
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:icon id="g_16" image="/images/icons/add.png" />
<t:icon id="g_17" image="/images/icons/clear.png" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:rowtitlebar>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:rowstatusbar id="g_18" />
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTitlebar}")

public class DemoTitlebar
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoTitlebar(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        initRefComponent("rowtitlebar");
    }
}

Key Selector

The KEYSELECTOR shows a list of characters, each one can be pressed and triggers a corresponding event on server side.

The configuration of the component includes:
