(.) the definition of the keys that are shown - both as part of the page definition and by using a runtime API
(.) the ability to decide at runtime which key is active and which not

The server side representation of the KEYSELECTOR component is an instance of class KEYSELECTORBinding.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoKeySelector}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:keyselector id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoKeySelector.onKeySelectorAction}" keys="ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ" objectbinding="#{d.DemoKeySelector.selector}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_4" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_6" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoKeySelector.grid}" sbvisibleamount="10" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_7" text="Name" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_8" text=".{name}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:rowstatusbar id="g_9" />
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventKeySelected;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.KEYSELECTORBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.PageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoKeySelector}")

public class DemoKeySelector
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String m_name;
        public String getName() { return m_name; }
        public void setName(String value) { this.m_name = value; }

    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    KEYSELECTORBinding m_selector = new KEYSELECTORBinding();
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();

    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoKeySelector(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        super.initRefComponent("keyselector");
        m_selector.addKeyInfosAZ();
        for (int i=0; i<26; i++)
        {
            String s = (char)((int)'A'+i) + "_xxxxxx";
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setName(s);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demokeyselector.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoKeySelector}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    public KEYSELECTORBinding getSelector() { return m_selector; }

    public void onKeySelectorAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventKeySelected)
        {
            BaseActionEventKeySelected e = (BaseActionEventKeySelected)event;
            positionGrid(e.getSelectedKey());
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Key was pressed: " + e.getSelectedKey());
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void positionGrid(String key)
    {
        m_grid.deselectCurrentSelection();
        for (GridItem gi: m_grid.getItems())
        {
            if (gi.getName().startsWith(key))
            {
                m_grid.selectAndFocusItem(gi);
                break;
            }
        }
    }
}

File Up/Download

Triggered by User

The FILEUPLOAD and FILEUPLOADLINK components start an upload of a client side file. They are the most simple to use implementation because the file content is passed as server side event parameter.

For downloading file there are components as well: FILEDOWNLOADLINK and FILEDOWNLOADBUTTON. You pass a URL and a file name (without directory) - a popup will show up letting the user select where to download the URL content to.

Please note: FILEUPLOAD and FILEUPLOADLINK directly embed the file content into the request that is just normally sent to the server side. This means: in case of big files, the request will take some duration as consequence. For uploading bigger files there is an asynchronous upload as well, which also allows the user to observe the upload status.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFile}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="File download link" width="150" />
<t:filedownloadlink id="g_4" fileextensions="png" text="Download File..." url="/images/icons/car.png" filename="car.png" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="File download button" width="150" />
<t:filedownloadbutton id="g_7" contentareafilled="false" image="/images/icons/car.png" text="Download File..." url="/images/icons/car.png" filename="car.png" iconrollover="true" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="20" />
<t:rowline id="g_9" />
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="File upload link" width="150" />
<t:fileuploadlink id="g_17" actionListener="#{d.DemoFile.onFileNameAction}" maxfilesize="100000" text="Upload File..." tooltip="Here you can upload files." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_29" text="File upload button" width="150" />
<t:fileuploadbutton id="g_20" actionListener="#{d.DemoFile.onFileNameAction}" fileextensions="png;gif;jpg;bmp" maxfilesize="50000000000" text="Upload File..." iconrollover="true" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_21" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:coldistance id="g_23" width="150" />
<t:textarea id="g_24" background="#F0F0F0" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoFile.fileHexContent}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.BaseActionComponent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.BaseActionEvent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventUpload;
import org.eclnt.util.log.CLog;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoFile extends PageBean
{
    String m_fileName;
    String m_fileHexContent;
    
    public DemoFile(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
    
    public void setFileName(String value) { m_fileName = value; }
    public String getFileName() { return m_fileName; }
    
    public void setFileHexContent(String value) { m_fileHexContent = value; }
    public String getFileHexContent() { return m_fileHexContent; }
    
    public void onFileNameAction(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        if (ae instanceof BaseActionEventUpload)
        {
//            try { Thread.currentThread().sleep(5000); } catch (Throwable t) {}
            BaseActionEventUpload bae = (BaseActionEventUpload)ae;
            m_fileHexContent = bae.getHexByteString();
            Statusbar.outputMessage("File " + bae.getClientFileName() + " (length="+m_fileHexContent.length()/2+") was uploaded.");
        }
    }
}

Triggered by Server

There is a special file download component FILEDOWNLOAD. This component is not optically visible. You can trigger from the server side processing that this component should start the download of a certain URL into a certain file.

Result: when the server response is processed in the client, then a popup opens up asking the user to download a certain file.

An analogue component exists for the upload direction: FILEUPLOADASYNCHRONOUS - allowing to upload certain file content, triggered by the server side processing.

The triggering is done by using the TRIGGER attribute - pointing to a server side Trigger-instance.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:filedownload id="g_2" filename="#{d.DemoFileDownloadAuto.downloadFileName}" opensupported="true" trigger="#{d.DemoFileDownloadAuto.downloadTrigger}" url="#{d.DemoFileDownloadAuto.downloadUrl}" />
<t:fileuploadasynchronous id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoFileDownloadAuto.onUploadFinished}" asynchronousuploadurl="#{d.DemoFileDownloadAuto.uploadUrl}" filename="c:&#92;temp&#92;test.png" infopopuptype="modal" trigger="#{d.DemoFileDownloadAuto.uploadTrigger}" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFileDownloadAuto}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="File Name" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_7" text="#{d.DemoFileDownloadAuto.downloadUrl}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Download URL" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_10" text="#{d.DemoFileDownloadAuto.downloadFileName}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_11" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:button id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoFileDownloadAuto.onCallAppUseTrigger}" text="Download using trigger!" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_14" height="20" />
<t:rowline id="g_15" />
<t:rowdistance id="g_16" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:label id="g_18" text="Upload URL" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_19" text="#{d.DemoFileDownloadAuto.uploadUrl}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:button id="g_21" actionListener="#{d.DemoFileDownloadAuto.onCallUploadTrigger}" text="Upload using trigger!" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:textarea id="g_23" height="100" text="#{d.DemoFileDownloadAuto.uploadInfo}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.bufferedcontent.BufferedContentMgr;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.bufferedcontent.DefaultBufferedContent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.bufferedcontent.DefaultUploadContent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.bufferedcontent.UploadContentMgr;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.WebResourceReader;
import org.eclnt.util.log.CLog;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFileDownloadAuto}")

public class DemoFileDownloadAuto 
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public class MyBufferedContent extends DefaultBufferedContent
    {
        public byte[] getContent()
        {
            byte[] pdfBytes = (new WebResourceReader()).readFileIntoByteArray("pdf/pdftest1.pdf");
            return pdfBytes;
        }
        public String getContentType()
        {
            return "application/pdf";
        }
    }
    
    public class MyUploadContent extends DefaultUploadContent
    {
        public void beginPassing()
        {
        }
        public void passClientFile(String fileName, byte[] content)
        {
            CLog.L.log(CLog.LL_INF,"Upload of content: is processed.");
            CLog.L.log(CLog.LL_INF,"Upload of content: ");
            m_uploadInfo = "Upload was executed:\n" +
                           "File name: " + fileName + "\n" +
                           "Content length: " + content.length;
        }
        public void endPassing()
        {
        }
    }
    
    Trigger m_downloadTrigger = new Trigger();
    Trigger m_uploadTrigger = new Trigger();
    String m_uploadInfo = "(No upload info yet.)";
    MyUploadContent m_uploadContent;
    MyBufferedContent m_bufferedContent;
    
    public DemoFileDownloadAuto(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        m_uploadContent = new MyUploadContent();
        m_bufferedContent = new MyBufferedContent();
        UploadContentMgr.add(m_uploadContent);
        BufferedContentMgr.add(m_bufferedContent);
        getWorkpage().addLifecycleListener(new WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnDestroyed()
            {
                UploadContentMgr.remove(m_uploadContent);
                m_uploadContent = null;
                m_bufferedContent = null;
            }
        });
    }
    
    public String getDownloadUrl() { return m_bufferedContent.getURL(); }
    public String getDownloadFileName() { return "some test document.pdf"; }
    public Trigger getDownloadTrigger() { return m_downloadTrigger; }
    
    public String getUploadUrl() { return m_uploadContent.getURL(); }
    public Trigger getUploadTrigger() { return m_uploadTrigger; }
    public String getUploadInfo() { return m_uploadInfo; }

    public void onCallAppUseTrigger(ActionEvent event)
    {
        // do application processing
        // ...
        // ...
        // ...
        m_downloadTrigger.trigger();
        // ...
        // ...
        // ...
    }
    
    public void onCallUploadTrigger(ActionEvent event)
    {
        // do application processing
        // ...
        // ...
        // ...
        m_uploadTrigger.trigger();
        // ...
        // ...
        // ...
    }
    
    public void onUploadFinished(ActionEvent event)
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Upload finished!");
    }
}

Single / multiple files

By using the attribute MULTISELECT you can decide if the user can upload one or multiple files. The client file names and the client file data are passed at server side via corresponding methods of BaseActionEventUpload, in which you pass the number of the file that is uploaded as parameter.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFileSingleMulti}" >
  <t:row id="g_2" >
    <t:label id="g_3" text="Sinlge File" width="120" />
    <t:fileuploadlink id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoFileSingleMulti.onUpload}" maxfilesize="3000000" multiselect="false" text="Upload..." />
  </t:row>
  <t:row id="g_5" >
    <t:coldistance id="g_6" width="120" />
    <t:fileuploadbutton id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoFileSingleMulti.onUpload}" maxfilesize="3000000" text="Upload..." />
  </t:row>
  <t:rowdistance id="g_11" height="10" />
  <t:row id="g_12" >
    <t:label id="g_13" text="Multiple Files" width="120" />
    <t:fileuploadlink id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoFileSingleMulti.onUpload}" maxfilesize="3000000" multiselect="true" text="Upload..." />
  </t:row>
  <t:row id="g_15" >
    <t:coldistance id="g_16" width="120" />
    <t:fileuploadbutton id="g_17" actionListener="#{d.DemoFileSingleMulti.onUpload}" maxfilesize="3000000" multiselect="true" text="Upload..." />
  </t:row>
  <t:rowdistance id="g_21" height="20" />
  <t:row id="g_22" >
    <t:textarea id="g_23" height="100" text="#{d.DemoFileSingleMulti.protocol}" width="100%" />
  </t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventUpload;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFileMultiSingle}")

public class DemoFileSingleMulti
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    String m_protocol;
    public void setProtocol(String value) { m_protocol = value; }
    public String getProtocol() { return m_protocol; }
    
    public DemoFileSingleMulti(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
    
    public void onUpload(ActionEvent event)
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventUpload)
        {
            BaseActionEventUpload baeu = (BaseActionEventUpload)event;
            StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
            sb.append("Number of uploaded files: " + baeu.getNumberOfUploadedFiles() + "\n\n");
            for (int i=0; i<baeu.getNumberOfUploadedFiles(); i++)
            {
                sb.append(i + ".) " + baeu.getClientFileName(i) + "\n");
            }
            m_protocol = sb.toString();
        }
    }
}

Dynamic Download Content - Buffered Content

The content that is provided on server side is dynamic content.

There is a nice function to access dynamic content: create a class that extends interface IBufferedContent by extending class DefaultBufferedContent. In the class you need to implement the method getContent() and the method getContentType().

The methods are called at this point of time, when the user activates the download. In other words: you do not need to build up the download-content in advance (maybe the user does not want to download at all!).

By definint WITHCALLBACK as "true" the server gets notified when the client started the download of the content.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFileBufferedContent}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Server side - content as byte[] array" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_27" >
<t:label id="g_23" text="As link" width="100" />
<t:filedownloadlink id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoFileBufferedContent.onCallServer}" text="Click to download File" url="#{d.DemoFileBufferedContent.downloadURL}" withcallback="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_25" text="As button" width="100" />
<t:filedownloadbutton id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoFileBufferedContent.onCallServer}" text="Click to download File" url="#{d.DemoFileBufferedContent.downloadURL}" withcallback="true" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_14" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_29" >
<t:label id="g_30" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Server side - content as stream" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_31" >
<t:label id="g_32" text="As link" width="100" />
<t:filedownloadlink id="g_33" actionListener="#{d.DemoFileBufferedContent.onCallServer}" text="Click to download File" url="#{d.DemoFileBufferedContent.streamDownloadURL}" withcallback="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_34" >
<t:label id="g_35" text="As button" width="100" />
<t:filedownloadbutton id="g_36" actionListener="#{d.DemoFileBufferedContent.onCallServer}" text="Click to download File" url="#{d.DemoFileBufferedContent.streamDownloadURL}" withcallback="true" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_15" height="100%" />
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="Download URL" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_18" enabled="false" text="#{d.DemoFileBufferedContent.downloadURL}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:label id="g_20" text="File Name" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_21" text="#{d.DemoFileBufferedContent.downloadFileName}" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.OutputStream;
import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Date;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.bufferedcontent.BufferedContentMgr;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.bufferedcontent.DefaultBufferedContent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.bufferedcontent.DefaultBufferedStreamContent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFileBufferedContent}")

public class DemoFileBufferedContent
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /**
     * The getContent() method of this class will be called when the
     * download servlet is accessed.
     */
    class MyBufferedContent extends DefaultBufferedContent
    {
        public byte[] getContent()
        {
            try
            {
                // return result as byte[]
                StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
                for (int i=0; i<1000000; i++)
                    sb.append("1234567890");
                return (sb.toString().getBytes("UTF-8"));
            }
            catch (Throwable t)
            {
                throw new Error("Should never happen!");
            }
        }
        public String getContentType()
        {
            return "application/octet-stream"; // always download, do not show in browser
        }
    }
    
    /**
     * Same implementation as MyBufferedContent, but not using the stream-based
     * implementation. Advantage: the content is not kept in memory as whole.
     */
    class MyBufferedStreamContent extends DefaultBufferedStreamContent
    {
        @Override
        public void writeStream(OutputStream stream)
        {
            try
            {
                // directly write content to stream
                for (int i=0; i<1000000; i++)
                {
                    byte[] bs = "1234567890".getBytes("UTF-8");
                    stream.write(bs);
                }
            }
            catch (Throwable t)
            {
                throw new Error("Should never happen!");
            }
        }
        @Override
        public String getContentType()
        {
             return "application/octet-stream"; // always download, do not show in browser
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    MyBufferedContent m_bufferedContent;
    MyBufferedStreamContent m_bufferedStreamContent;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoFileBufferedContent(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        // create buffered content
        m_bufferedContent = new MyBufferedContent();
        m_bufferedContent.setFileName("testBufferedContent.txt"); // optional: explicitly assign download file name
        BufferedContentMgr.add(m_bufferedContent);
        // create buffered stream content
        m_bufferedStreamContent = new MyBufferedStreamContent();
        BufferedContentMgr.add(m_bufferedStreamContent);
        // the buffered content is registered in the dialog session; it is automatically released
        // when the session ends. But you can (and should) release it as early as possible in order 
        // to release the associated memory. The point of time to release is, is up to you: here
        // we used the end ot the life cycle of a workpage within the workplace.
        getWorkpage().addLifecycleListener(new WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener() 
        {
            public void reactOnDestroyed()
            {
                super.reactOnDestroyed();
                BufferedContentMgr.remove(m_bufferedContent);
                BufferedContentMgr.remove(m_bufferedStreamContent);
            }
        });
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public String getDownloadURL() { return m_bufferedContent.getURL(); }
    public String getStreamDownloadURL() { return m_bufferedStreamContent.getURL(); }

    public void onCallServer(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Download was triggered, timestamp = " + new Date().getTime());
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    
}

Dynamic Download Content - TempFileManager

The *DOWNLOAD components require some URL to download content from the server to the client.

In case of dynamic content you may provide this URL by using the TempFileManager: you just pass some content to the TempFileManager via a simple API - and received back a URL that you can then use for downloading.

Please note:

1. The TempFileManager uses the servlet engine's temp directory (which is part of the J2EE API definition) for storing the data. In case of Tomcat this is the tomcat/work directory.

2. The files are automatically removed when a session is removed.

3. Each file that you pass receives some unique id. The file name that is part of the API is only the last part of the file name - its main purpose is to define the name of the file that is proposed when downloading on client side.

As result loading data into the TempFileManager will not occupy any memory on server side.

In the demo the download were done by using a FILEDOWNLOADBUTTON component. Note, that there is an invisible FILEDOWNLOAD component as well (in layout definition: below BEANPROCESSING), which you can trigger from server side.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTempFileManager}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:filedownloadbutton id="g_3" text="Download some TXT" url="#{d.DemoTempFileManager.txtUrl}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:textpane id="g_5" cutwidth="true" font="size:10" text="#{d.DemoTempFileManager.txtUrl}" width="100%" wordwrap="true" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_6" height="30" />
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:filedownloadbutton id="g_8" text="Download some PNG" url="#{d.DemoTempFileManager.pngUrl}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:textpane id="g_10" cutwidth="true" font="size:10" text="#{d.DemoTempFileManager.pngUrl}" width="100%" wordwrap="true" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_12" height="30" />
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:filedownloadbutton id="g_14" text="Again PNG - Cross session" url="#{d.DemoTempFileManager.pngCrossSessionUrl}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:textpane id="g_16" cutwidth="true" font="size:10" text="#{d.DemoTempFileManager.pngCrossSessionUrl}" width="100%" wordwrap="true" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.awt.Color;
import java.awt.Font;
import java.awt.image.BufferedImage;
import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.imageio.ImageIO;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.tempfile.TempFileManager;
import org.eclnt.util.image.FontImageCreator;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTempFileManager}")

public class DemoTempFileManager
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_pngUrl;
    String m_txtUrl;
    String m_pngCrossSessionUrl;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoTempFileManager(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        buildDownloadContentTXT();
        buildDownloadContentPNG();
        buildDownloadContentPNGCrossSession();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotempfilemanager.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoTempFileManager}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getPngUrl() { return m_pngUrl; }
    public String getTxtUrl() { return m_txtUrl; }
    public String getPngCrossSessionUrl() { return m_pngCrossSessionUrl; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void buildDownloadContentTXT()
    {
        try
        {
            StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
            for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
            {
                sb.append(i + ". This is some dynamically produced content.\n");
            }
            String s = sb.toString();
            byte[] bytes = s.getBytes("UTF-8");
            // application/octet => browser directly downloads the file when accessed
            m_txtUrl = TempFileManager.saveTempFile("dynamicallyCreatedText.txt","application/octet",bytes);
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputAlert("Problem during content generation: " + t.getMessage());
        }
    }
    
    private void buildDownloadContentPNG()
    {
        try
        {
            String s = "This is some text.";
            Font f = new Font("Arial",Font.BOLD,25);
            BufferedImage bim = FontImageCreator.createImageFromText(s, f, Color.RED);
            ByteArrayOutputStream bos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
            ImageIO.write(bim,"png",bos);
            byte[] bytes = bos.toByteArray();
            // no specific setting of content type => defaults will be used
            m_pngUrl = TempFileManager.saveTempFile("dynamicImage.png",bytes);
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputAlert("Problem during content generation: " + t.getMessage());
        }
    }
    
    private void buildDownloadContentPNGCrossSession()
    {
        try
        {
            String s = "This is some text for the CROSS SESSION example.";
            Font f = new Font("Arial",Font.BOLD,25);
            BufferedImage bim = FontImageCreator.createImageFromText(s, f, Color.RED);
            ByteArrayOutputStream bos = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
            ImageIO.write(bim,"png",bos);
            byte[] bytes = bos.toByteArray();
            // no specific setting of content type => defaults will be used
            m_pngCrossSessionUrl = TempFileManager.saveTempFileCrossSession("dynamicImageCrossSession.png","image/png",bytes);
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputAlert("Problem during content generation: " + t.getMessage());
        }
    }
}

Asynchronous Upload

The normal upload components (FILEUPLOADLINK, FILEUPLOADBUTTON) directly embed the uploaded content into the normal client-server-communication. The file content is part of the event that is processed on server side.

When uploading big file sizes this may cause problems:

(1) The memory required on client and server side is quite high, because the file is kept as a whole both within the client and in the server memory. Only for short time, of course, but this may be enough to cause memory exceptions.
(2) The user needs to wait with continuing input until the upload has finished.

As consequence there are two components providing the possibility to upload file content in an asynchronous way: FILEUPLOADLINKASYNCHRONOUS and FILEUPLOADBUTTONASYNCHRONOUS. For both components you need to define a URL that is the target of the file upload: the content of the file(s) that are uploaded are sent to this URL, as part of the post string of the request. The format of the post string is:

FILENAME0=...&CONTENT0=...FILENAME1=...&CONTENT1=....

The file name is transferred in escaped characters, the content as hexadecimal string ("FF203040...").

On server side there is a default, servlet based management for receiving the files - please take a look into the code. You have two options how you want to receive the upload content:

(1) as byte[] array - this is easier from programming point of view, but means that the whole file is kept on server side for a short time in memory.
(2) as character stream - this is more complex to program, because you need to parse the string on your own. But, of course, the memory consumption is much less - the file's content is "floating" through your program only.
(3) as sequence of byte streams, one per file - this is a much more comfortable way of parsing the content of the character stream: for each file that is passed you pass back one output stream into which the content of the upload file is passed

After having successfully uploaded the file, the client will invoke the corresponding action listener on server side and send the event "BaseActionEventUploadAsynchronousFinished".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:jshowurl id="g_2" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFileUploadAsynchronous}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_5" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" text="Server Side byte[] Processing" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" text="Link" width="100" />
<t:fileuploadlinkasynchronous id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.DemoFileUploadAsynchronous.onRefresh}" asynchronousuploadurl="#{d.DemoFileUploadAsynchronous.uploadURL}" fileextensions="jpg;jpeg;tif;tiff;pdf;png" imagereduction="600;400;85" multiselect="true" text="Upload File..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="Button" width="100" />
<t:fileuploadbuttonasynchronous id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoFileUploadAsynchronous.onRefresh}" asynchronousuploadurl="#{d.DemoFileUploadAsynchronous.uploadURL}" fileextensions="txt;jpg;png" maxfilesize="100000000" maxnumberoffiles="4" multiselect="true" text="Upload File..." width="100+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:coldistance id="g_13" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_14" cutwidth="true" font="size:8" text="#{d.DemoFileUploadAsynchronous.uploadURL}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_16" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" text="Server Side Stream Processing" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_33" >
<t:label id="g_34" font="weight:bold" text="Direct processing of client stream" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:label id="g_18" text="Link" width="100" />
<t:fileuploadlinkasynchronous id="g_19" actionListener="#{d.DemoFileUploadAsynchronous.onRefresh}" asynchronousuploadurl="#{d.DemoFileUploadAsynchronous.uploadStreamURL}" fileextensions="jpg;jpeg;tif;tiff;pdf;png" maxfilesize="100000000" multiselect="true" text="Upload File..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:label id="g_21" text="Button" width="100" />
<t:fileuploadbuttonasynchronous id="g_22" actionListener="#{d.DemoFileUploadAsynchronous.onRefresh}" asynchronousuploadurl="#{d.DemoFileUploadAsynchronous.uploadStreamURL}" fileextensions="txt;jpg;png" maxfilesize="100000000" multiselect="true" text="Upload File..." width="100+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_23" >
<t:coldistance id="g_24" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_25" cutwidth="true" font="size:8" text="#{d.DemoFileUploadAsynchronous.uploadStreamURL}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_36" >
<t:label id="g_37" font="weight:bold" text="Comfortable processing of client stream" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_38" >
<t:label id="g_39" text="Link" width="100" />
<t:fileuploadlinkasynchronous id="g_40" actionListener="#{d.DemoFileUploadAsynchronous.onRefresh}" asynchronousuploadurl="#{d.DemoFileUploadAsynchronous.uploadStreamURLComfortable}" fileextensions="jpg;jpeg;tif;tiff;pdf;png" maxfilesize="100000000" multiselect="true" text="Upload File..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_41" >
<t:label id="g_42" text="Button" width="100" />
<t:fileuploadbuttonasynchronous id="g_43" actionListener="#{d.DemoFileUploadAsynchronous.onRefresh}" asynchronousuploadurl="#{d.DemoFileUploadAsynchronous.uploadStreamURLComfortable}" fileextensions="txt;jpg;png" maxfilesize="100000000" multiselect="true" text="Upload File..." width="100+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_44" >
<t:coldistance id="g_45" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_46" cutwidth="true" font="size:8" text="#{d.DemoFileUploadAsynchronous.uploadStreamURLComfortable}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_26" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_27" height="100%" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" text="Content, that was uploaded" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_28" coldistance="5" >
<t:button id="g_29" actionListener="#{d.DemoFileUploadAsynchronous.onClear}" text="Clear" width="100+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_30" >
<t:textarea id="g_31" height="100%;100" text="#{d.DemoFileUploadAsynchronous.content}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.FileOutputStream;
import java.io.InputStream;
import java.io.OutputStream;
import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.bufferedcontent.DefaultUploadContent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.bufferedcontent.DefaultUploadStreamContent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.bufferedcontent.DefaultUploadStreamContentBySeparateOutputStreams;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.bufferedcontent.UploadContentMgr;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.HttpSessionAccess;
import org.eclnt.util.file.FileManager;
import org.eclnt.util.log.CLog;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.UniqueIdCreator;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFileUploadAsynchronous}")

public class DemoFileUploadAsynchronous 
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    /*
     * In this implementation each file that is uploaded is passed as byte[] array.
     * Disadvantag: memory consumption! The file is kept in memory at least for some
     * short duration of time. - Not use-able for big files e.g. > 10MB!
     */
    public class MyUploadContent extends DefaultUploadContent
    {
        public void beginPassing()
        {
            m_content = "Upload started.\n";
        }
        public void passClientFile(String fileName, byte[] bytes)
        {
            m_content += "File was passed: client name " + fileName + ", length " + bytes.length +"\n";
        }
        public void endPassing()
        {
            m_content += "Upload ended.";
        }
    }

    /*
     * In this example the stream content that is passed from the client side is directly
     * processed. You can see the text of the upload in the m_content.
     */
    public class MyUploadStreamContent extends DefaultUploadStreamContent
    {
        public void beginPassing()
        {
            m_content = "Stream upload started.\n";
        }
        public void passClientFilesAsStream(InputStream stream)
        {
            try
            {
                StringBuffer sb = new StringBuffer();
                while (true)
                {
                    int b1 = stream.read();
                    if (b1 < 0) break;
                    char c = (char)b1;
                    sb.append(c);
                }
                m_content += sb.toString()+ "\n";
            }
            catch (Throwable t)
            {
                CLog.L.log(CLog.LL_ERR,"error when receivng file from client",t);
            }
        }
        public void endPassing()
        {
            if (m_content.length() > 20000)
                m_content = m_content.substring(0,20000) + "...";
            m_content += "\nStream upload ended.";
        }
    }
    
    /*
     * In this example the files are sent one by one. For each file one output stream
     * is requested into which the content is written. In the example a file is generated
     * in the servlet-temp-directory for each file that is passed.
     */
    public class MyUploadStreamContentComfortable extends DefaultUploadStreamContentBySeparateOutputStreams
    {
        @Override
        public void beginPassing() 
        { 
        } 
        @Override
        public OutputStream passingFileStarted(String fileName)
        {
            try
            {
                String serverFileName = HttpSessionAccess.getServletTempDirectory()+"/tempfiles/"+UniqueIdCreator.createUUID();
                serverFileName = ValueManager.encodeIntoValidFileName(serverFileName,false);
                FileManager.ensureDirectoryForFileExists(serverFileName);
                m_content += "\nStarting upload of client file: " + fileName;
                m_content += "\nStoring it in: " + serverFileName;
                FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream(serverFileName);
                return fos;
            }
            catch (Throwable t)
            {
                throw new Error("Problem processing upload file: " + fileName);
            }
        }
        @Override
        public void passingFileFinished(String fileName)
        {
            m_content += "\nFinished uploading of client file: " + fileName;
        }
        @Override
        public void endPassing() { } 
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    MyUploadContent m_uploadContent;
    MyUploadStreamContent m_uploadStreamContent;
    MyUploadStreamContentComfortable m_uploadStreamContentComfortable;
    
    protected String m_content = "Nothing uploaded yet.";
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoFileUploadAsynchronous(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        m_uploadContent = new MyUploadContent();
        UploadContentMgr.add(m_uploadContent);
        m_uploadStreamContent = new MyUploadStreamContent();
        UploadContentMgr.add(m_uploadStreamContent);
        m_uploadStreamContentComfortable = new MyUploadStreamContentComfortable();
        UploadContentMgr.add(m_uploadStreamContentComfortable);
        getWorkpage().addLifecycleListener(new WorkpageDefaultLifecycleListener() 
        {
            public void reactOnDestroyed()
            {
                super.reactOnDestroyed();
                UploadContentMgr.remove(m_uploadContent);
                UploadContentMgr.remove(m_uploadStreamContent);
                UploadContentMgr.remove(m_uploadStreamContentComfortable);
            }
        });
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public String getUploadURL() { return m_uploadContent.getURL(); }
    public String getUploadStreamURL() { return m_uploadStreamContent.getURL(); }
    public String getUploadStreamURLComfortable() { return m_uploadStreamContentComfortable.getURL(); }

    public String getContent() { return m_content; }
    
    public void onRefresh(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_content += "\nActionListener onRefresh: File upload processing finished.";
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("File was uploaded!");
    }

    public void onClear(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_content = "";
    }

}

Drag/drop files

This example demonstrates that the user can also drag/drop files directly from the file explorer onto the file upload button.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFileUploadDrop}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:textpane id="g_3" text="Click onto the &#34;Upload files...&#34; area or directly drag/drop files from file explorer:" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_4" height="50%" />
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_6" width="50%" />
<t:fileuploadbuttonasynchronous id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoFileUploadDrop.onUploadAction}" asynchronousuploadurl="#{d.DemoFileUploadDrop.uploadURL}" height="200" maxfilesize="5000000" multiselect="true" text="Upload  files..." width="300" />
<t:coldistance id="g_8" width="50%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_9" height="50%" />
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="Protocol" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:textarea id="g_13" height="150" text="#{d.DemoFileUploadDrop.protocol}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.bufferedcontent.DefaultUploadContent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.bufferedcontent.UploadContentMgr;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFileUploadDrop}")

public class DemoFileUploadDrop
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class MyUploadContent extends DefaultUploadContent
    {
        public void beginPassing()
        {
            m_protocol += "---------------------- begin\n";
        }
        public void passClientFile(String fileName, byte[] content)
        {
            m_protocol += "File upload: " + fileName + ", " + content.length + " bytes\n";
        }
        public void endPassing()
        {
            m_protocol += "---------------------- end\n";
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_protocol = "";
    MyUploadContent m_uploadContent;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoFileUploadDrop(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        m_uploadContent = new MyUploadContent();
        UploadContentMgr.add(m_uploadContent);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demofileuploaddrop.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoFileUploadDrop}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getUploadURL() { return m_uploadContent.getURL(); }
    
    public String getProtocol() { return m_protocol; }
    public void setProtocol(String value) { this.m_protocol = value; }

    public void onUploadAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("File upload was executed.");
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Download multiple files

This demo shows how 5 dynamically created files are downloaded from the server side to the client side.

The browser only allows to download one file. As consequence you need to chain the downloads, so that the actual download of one file directly triggers the download of the next file.

The FILEDOWNLOAD component provides an attribute WITHCALLBACK which is set to "true". As consequence the client notifies the server when a download of content happens.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoFileDownloadMultiple}" >
<t:filedownload id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoFileDownloadMultiple.onNextDownload}" trigger="#{d.DemoFileDownloadMultiple.downloadTrigger}" url="#{d.DemoFileDownloadMultiple.downloadUrl}" withcallback="true" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFileDownloadMultiple}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:button id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoFileDownloadMultiple.onDownloadAction}" text="Download 5 files" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_6" height="30" />
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="Protocol" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:textarea id="g_10" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoFileDownloadMultiple.protocol}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:textpane id="g_13" text="Not seeing 5 files to be downloaded within your browser? - Check the popup settings! Browsers may block the opening of multiple dialogs by one application - you can override by allowing the openeing of popup dialogs for dedicated URLs." width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.tempfile.TempFileManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFileDownloadMultiple}")

public class DemoFileDownloadMultiple
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    int m_downloadCounter;
    String m_downloadUrl;
    Trigger m_downloadTrigger = new Trigger();
    String m_protocol = "";

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoFileDownloadMultiple(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demofiledownloadmultiple.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoFileDownloadMultiple}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getProtocol() { return m_protocol; }
    public void setProtocol(String value) { this.m_protocol = value; }

    public void onDownloadAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_protocol = "Download started.";
        m_downloadCounter = 5;
        onNextDownload(null);
    }

    public void onNextDownload(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        try
        {
            m_downloadCounter--;
            if (m_downloadCounter >= 0)
            {
                String fileContent = "This is the new file number " + m_downloadCounter;
                // content-type "application/octet" ==> browser always downloads; otherwise "txt" are shown in own browser window
                m_downloadUrl = TempFileManager.saveTempFile("file"+m_downloadCounter+".txt","application/octet",fileContent.getBytes("UTF-8"));
                m_protocol += "\nDownload URL: " + m_downloadUrl;
                m_downloadTrigger.trigger();
            }
            else
            {
                m_protocol += "\nDownload ended.";
            }
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            m_protocol += "\n" + t;
        }
    }

    public String getDownloadUrl() { return m_downloadUrl; }
    public void setDownloadUrl(String value) { this.m_downloadUrl = value; }

    public Trigger getDownloadTrigger() { return m_downloadTrigger; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Drag & Drop

Drag & Drop

This is a simple demo of drag & drop between components. But, the good news, it covers all you need to know about drag & drop!

The components, that you can drag from, need to specify what they send by using their DRAGSEND attribute. The attribute contains a string that follows the format "type:value", e.g. "article:apple".
The components, that you can drop to, need to specify what information they accept by specifying all the valid types in the DROPRECEIVE attribute, e.g. "article". This can also be a comma separated list of values.

Both DRAGSEND and DROPRECEIVE are defined in a static way within this example, of course you an use any kind of expression as well, in order to bind them to your managed beans.

On server side the component that you drop information onto, triggers a request to the server. The corresponding action listener is called, the event type "BaseActionEventDrop" or "BaseActionEventDropCopy" is used. The event provides information about the drag information that was defined by the component you dragged from - so that you can react correspondingly on server side.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoDragDropSimple}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Drag these articles..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:icon id="g_5" dragsend="article:apple" image="/images/touch/apple.png" />
<t:icon id="g_6" dragsend="article:kiwi" image="/images/touch/kiwi.png" />
<t:icon id="g_7" dragsend="article:salad" image="/images/touch/salad.png" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="50" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="...onto this cashier!" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:icon id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoDragDropSimple.onCashierActions}" dropreceive="article" image="/images/touch/cashier.gif" />
<t:coldistance id="g_13" width="50" />
<t:fixgrid id="g_14" background="#00000010" border="top:0;left:0;right:0;bottom:0" objectbinding="#{d.DemoDragDropSimple.articleRows}" rowheight="16" sbvisibleamount="5" suppressheadline="true" >
<t:gridcol id="g_15" text="Image" width="20" >
<t:image id="g_16" height="16" image=".{image}" width="16" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_17" text="Distance" width="10" >
<t:label id="g_18" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_19" text="Article" width="100" >
<t:label id="g_20" text=".{article}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_21" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_22" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventDrop;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventInvoke;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoDragDropSimple}")

public class DemoDragDropSimple
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public class ArticleRow extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected String m_article;
        public String getArticle() { return m_article; }
        public void setArticle(String value) { m_article = value; }
        
        public String getImage()
        {
            return "/images/touch/"+m_article+".png";
        }

    }

    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<ArticleRow> m_articleRows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<ArticleRow>();
    
    public DemoDragDropSimple(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<ArticleRow> getArticleRows() { return m_articleRows; }

    public void onCashierActions(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventDrop)
        {
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Drop-Event was processed: " + event.getClass().getName());
            BaseActionEventDrop baed = (BaseActionEventDrop)event;
            String dragInfo = baed.getDragInfo();
            if (dragInfo.startsWith("article:"))
            {
                String article = dragInfo.substring("article:".length());
                ArticleRow ar = new ArticleRow();
                ar.setArticle(article);
                m_articleRows.getItems().add(ar);
            }
        }
        else if (event instanceof BaseActionEventInvoke)
        {
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Cashier Icon was pressed!");
        }
    }

}

Usage with Input Components

This demo demonstrates how to use drag & drop with input elements like fields and combo boxes. You need to pay attention to that the value within the DRAGSEND attribute might not be the one that you want to be transferred because the user might change the component's content on the screen side.

There are two possibilities to manage this situation:

(1) You specify the FLUSH attribute within the component to be set to true. In this case the flush to the server is executed first, then the drag/drop operation starts. In other words: the DRAGSEND property is refreshed when starting a drag & drop operation.

(2) You do not pass the value of what is dragged into the DRAGSEND attribute, but you pass the information about "who is the sending component". The drop receiver receives an event on server side (just the usual thing...) and then does not take the dropped value out of the drag-String, but it directly takes the value from the property that is represented by the dragging component.

In the titles of the demo, we differenciate between "id based" drag & drop, and "component based" drag & drop.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" objectbinding="#{d.DemoDragDropField}">
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_3" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" text="The &quot;by value&quot; way" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:field id="g_5" dragsend="#{d.DemoDragDropField.fromFieldDragSend}" flush="true" text="#{d.DemoDragDropField.fromField}" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_6" width="20" />
<t:label id="g_7" text="&gt;&gt;&gt; drop to &gt;&gt;&gt;" />
<t:coldistance id="g_8" width="20" />
<t:field id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoDragDropField.onToFieldAction}" dropreceive="field" text="#{d.DemoDragDropField.toField}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:combobox id="g_11" dragsend="#{d.DemoDragDropField.fromDragSend}" flush="true" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoDragDropField.comboVVs}" value="#{d.DemoDragDropField.fromCombo}" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_12" width="20" />
<t:label id="g_13" text="&gt;&gt;&gt; drop to &gt;&gt;&gt;" />
<t:coldistance id="g_14" width="20" />
<t:combobox id="g_15" actionListener="#{d.DemoDragDropField.onToAction}" dropreceive="combo" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoDragDropField.comboVVs}" value="#{d.DemoDragDropField.toCombo}" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_17" text="The &quot;by component&quot; way" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:combobox id="g_19" dragsend="comboleft:dummy" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoDragDropField.comboVVs}" value="#{d.DemoDragDropField.fromCombo2}" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_20" width="20" />
<t:label id="g_21" text="&gt;&gt;&gt; drop to &gt;&gt;&gt;" />
<t:coldistance id="g_22" width="20" />
<t:combobox id="g_23" actionListener="#{d.DemoDragDropField.onTo2Action}" dropreceive="comboleft" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoDragDropField.comboVVs}" value="#{d.DemoDragDropField.toCombo2}" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventDrop;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoDragDropField}")

public class DemoDragDropField
    extends PageBean
{
    public String getFromFieldDragSend() 
    { 
        return "field:"+m_fromField; 
    }

    protected String m_toField;
    public String getToField() { return m_toField; }
    public void setToField(String value) { m_toField = value; }

    protected String m_fromField = "abc";
    public String getFromField() { return m_fromField; }
    public void setFromField(String value) { m_fromField = value; }

    protected String m_toCombo2;
    public String getToCombo2() { return m_toCombo2; }
    public void setToCombo2(String value) { m_toCombo2 = value; }

    protected String m_fromCombo2 = "1";
    public String getFromCombo2() { return m_fromCombo2; }
    public void setFromCombo2(String value) { m_fromCombo2 = value; }

    public DemoDragDropField(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        m_comboVVs.addValidValue("1","First item");
        m_comboVVs.addValidValue("2","Second item");
        m_comboVVs.addValidValue("3","Third item");
        m_comboVVs.addValidValue("4","Fourth item");
    }

    public String getFromDragSend() 
    { 
        return "combo:"+m_fromCombo; 
    }

    protected ValidValuesBinding m_comboVVs = new ValidValuesBinding();
    public ValidValuesBinding getComboVVs() { return m_comboVVs; }
    public void setComboVVs(ValidValuesBinding value) { m_comboVVs = value; }

    protected String m_toCombo;
    public String getToCombo() { return m_toCombo; }
    public void setToCombo(String value) { m_toCombo = value; }

    protected String m_fromCombo = "1";
    public String getFromCombo() { return m_fromCombo; }
    public void setFromCombo(String value) { m_fromCombo = value; }

    public void onToAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventDrop)
        {
            String di = ((BaseActionEventDrop)event).getDragInfo();
            if (di.startsWith("combo:"))
            {
                m_toCombo = di.substring("combo:".length());
            }
        }
    }

    public void onToFieldAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventDrop)
        {
            String di = ((BaseActionEventDrop)event).getDragInfo();
            if (di.startsWith("field:"))
            {
                m_toField = di.substring("field:".length());
            }
        }
    }

    public void onTo2Action(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventDrop)
        {
            String di = ((BaseActionEventDrop)event).getDragInfo();
            if (di.startsWith("comboleft:"))
            {
                m_toCombo2 = m_fromCombo2;
            }
        }
    }

}

Drop Zones

When dragging the label over the various drop zones you will recognize that there is a certain "zone painting" within the drop zones.

The information about the type of drop zones is passed as aprt of the DROPRECEIVE attribute: per drop-receive-type you can add the drop zone information ("dropReceiveType:dropZoneInfo"). In case of multiple drop-receive-types you just concatenate the information ("dropReceiveType:dropZoneInfo;dropReceiveType:dropZoneInfo").

The "drop zones" are just a certain painting that is done on client side. It is your task to interpret the drop position on server side when a drop is done by the user. To do so you receive the exact drop position as part of the event information on server side.

On server side there are helper functions within the BaseActionEventDrop event (methods "checkIfDroppedInZone...") thay you may use for transferringt a concrete drop position into a drop zone.

The drop zones are defined in the following way (left,top,width,height):

(.) "horizontalsplit": left (0,0,50%,100%)/ right (50%,0,50%,100%)
(.) "verticalsplit": top (0,0,100%,50%)/ bottom (0,50%,100%,50%)
(.) "edges": left-top (0,0,50%,50%)/ left-bottom (0,50%,50%,50%)/ right-top (50%,0,50%,50%)/ right-bottom (50%,50%,50%,50%)
(.) "sides": top (0,0,100%,25%)/ bottom (0,75%,100%,25%) /left (0,25%,25%,50%) /right (50%,25%,50%,50%)
(.) "sidesandcenter": top (0,0,100%,25%)/ bottom (0,75%,100%,25%) /left (0,25%,25%,50%) /right (75%,25%,25%,50%) /center (25%,25%,50%,50%)

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoDropZones}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Drag this label...:" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_4" align="center" border="#00000020" dragsend="test:4711" font="weight:bold" foreground="#400000" text=" LABEL TO DRAG " />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="&#34;horizontalsplit&#34;" width="100" />
<t:pane id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoDropZones.onProcessDrop}" border="#00000030" dropreceive="test:horizontalsplit" height="80" width="80" />
<t:coldistance id="g_8" width="20" />
<t:label id="g_9" text="&#34;edges&#34;" width="70" />
<t:pane id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoDropZones.onProcessDrop}" background="#FFFFFF80" border="#00000030" dropreceive="test:edges" height="80" width="80" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="&#34;verticalsplit&#34;" width="100" />
<t:pane id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoDropZones.onProcessDrop}" background="#FFFFFF80" border="#00000030" dropreceive="test:verticalsplit" height="80" width="80" />
<t:coldistance id="g_14" width="20" />
<t:label id="g_15" text="&#34;sides&#34;" width="70" />
<t:pane id="g_16" actionListener="#{d.DemoDropZones.onProcessDrop}" background="#FFFFFF80" border="#00000030" dropreceive="test:sides" height="80" width="80" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:label id="g_18" text="&#34;sidesandcenter&#34;" width="100" />
<t:pane id="g_19" actionListener="#{d.DemoDropZones.onProcessDrop}" background="#FFFFFF80" border="#00000030" dropreceive="test:sidesandcenter" height="80" width="80" />
<t:coldistance id="g_20" width="20" />
<t:label id="g_21" text="&#34;grid(10)&#34;" width="70" />
<t:pane id="g_22" actionListener="#{d.DemoDropZones.onProcessDrop}" background="#FFFFFF80" border="#00000030" dropreceive="test:grid(20)" height="80" width="80" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_23" >
<t:label id="g_24" text="...and drop it into one of the areas...!" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventDrop;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoDropZones extends PageBean
{
    public DemoDropZones(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    public void onProcessDrop(ActionEvent event)
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventDrop)
        {
            BaseActionEventDrop baed = (BaseActionEventDrop)event;
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Drop processed: " + 
                                    baed.getDragInfo() + " // " + 
                                    baed.getPercentageHorizontaAsFloat() + " // " +
                                    baed.getPercentageVerticalAsFloat());
        }
    }
}

Grid example

Drag & drop items from the left to the right, and vice versa. When dropping onto an item you will see that the dropped item is either positioned in front of or behind - dependent from the vertical position where you dropped.

This example shows the simplest way to implement Drag & Drop for grids. The FIXGRID component provides DRAGSEND and DROPRECEIVE attributes - these are the ones which are valid for the whole grid, e.g. when the user drags/drops from/to an empty area of the grid which is not covered by a row.

And the grid provides for a ROWDRAGSEND and ROWDROPRECEIVE attribute, these are the ones that are located on item level - so that you can drop information onto individual items.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDragDrop}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" font="size:17" text="Stock Items 1" width="50%" />
<t:coldistance id="g_4" width="20" />
<t:label id="g_5" font="size:17" text="Stock Items 2" width="50%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_7" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" dragsend="grid1:grid1" dropreceive="grid2" enabled="#{d.DemoGridDragDrop.grid1Enabled}" height="100%" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDragDrop.stockItems1}" rowdragsend="grid1:grid1" rowdropreceive="grid2:verticalsplit" sbvisibleamount="20" width="50%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_8" text="ArticleId" width="60" >
<t:label id="g_9" text=".{articleId}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_10" text="Article Text" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_11" text=".{articleText}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
<t:coldistance id="g_12" width="20" />
<t:fixgrid id="g_13" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" dragsend="grid2:grid2" dropreceive="grid1" enabled="#{d.DemoGridDragDrop.grid2Enabled}" height="100%" multiselect="true" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDragDrop.stockItems2}" rowdragsend="grid2:grid2" rowdropreceive="grid1:verticalsplit" sbvisibleamount="20" width="50%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_14" text="ArticleId" width="60" >
<t:label id="g_15" text=".{articleId}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_16" text="Article Text" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_17" text=".{articleText}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:checkbox id="g_19" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoGridDragDrop.grid1Enabled}" text="Enabled" width="50%" />
<t:coldistance id="g_20" width="20" />
<t:checkbox id="g_21" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoGridDragDrop.grid2Enabled}" text="Enabled" width="50%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Collection;
import java.util.Set;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventDrop;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridDragDrop}")

public class DemoGridDragDrop
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    protected boolean m_grid2Enabled = true;
    public boolean getGrid2Enabled() { return m_grid2Enabled; }
    public void setGrid2Enabled(boolean value) { m_grid2Enabled = value; }

    protected boolean m_grid1Enabled = true;
    public boolean getGrid1Enabled() { return m_grid1Enabled; }
    public void setGrid1Enabled(boolean value) { m_grid1Enabled = value; }

    public class StockItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected String m_articleText;
        public String getArticleText() { return m_articleText; }
        public void setArticleText(String value) { m_articleText = value; }

        protected String m_articleId;
        public String getArticleId() { return m_articleId; }
        public void setArticleId(String value) { m_articleId = value; }

        @Override
        public void onRowDrop(BaseActionEventDrop event)
        {
            String dragSend = event.getDragInfo(); 
            // drag & drop on item level ==> move dropped item at right position!
            boolean inFront = true;
            if (event.getPercentageVertical() >= 50)
                inFront = false;
            if (dragSend.startsWith("grid1:"))
                moveItemsBetweenGrids(m_stockItems1,m_stockItems2,m_stockItems2.getItems().indexOf(this),inFront);
            else if (dragSend.startsWith("grid2:"))
                moveItemsBetweenGrids(m_stockItems2,m_stockItems1,m_stockItems1.getItems().indexOf(this),inFront);
        }
    }
    
    public class StockItemGrid extends FIXGRIDListBinding<StockItem>
    {
        @Override
        protected void onDrop(BaseActionEventDrop dropEvent)
        {
            String dragsend = dropEvent.getDragInfo();
            if (dragsend.startsWith("grid1:"))
                moveItemsBetweenGrids(m_stockItems1,m_stockItems2,-1,true);
            else if (dragsend.startsWith("grid2:"))
                moveItemsBetweenGrids(m_stockItems2,m_stockItems1,-1,true);
        }
    }
    
    
    
    public DemoGridDragDrop(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("fixgrid");
        for (int i=0; i<5; i++)
        {
            StockItem si = new StockItem();
            si.setArticleId("4711"+i);
            si.setArticleText("Text for " + i);
            m_stockItems1.getItems().add(si);
            si = new StockItem();
            si.setArticleId("0815"+i);
            si.setArticleText("Text for " + i);
            m_stockItems2.getItems().add(si);
        }
    }

    protected StockItemGrid m_stockItems2 = new StockItemGrid();
    public StockItemGrid getStockItems2() { return m_stockItems2; }
    
    protected StockItemGrid m_stockItems1 = new StockItemGrid();
    public StockItemGrid getStockItems1() { return m_stockItems1; }

    private void moveItemsBetweenGrids(StockItemGrid gridFrom, 
                                       StockItemGrid gridTo, 
                                       int toIndex,
                                       boolean inFront)
    {
        if (inFront == false)
            toIndex++;
        Collection<StockItem> sis = gridFrom.getSelectedItemsAsSequence();
        for (StockItem si: sis)
        {
            if (toIndex >= 0)
            {
                gridTo.getItems().add(toIndex,si);
                toIndex++;
            }
            else
            {
                gridTo.getItems().add(si);
            }
            gridFrom.getItems().remove(si);
        }
    }
    
}

Update row sequence in grid

You may drag items from the grid and re-position them in the grid.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDragDropSequence}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoGridDragDropSequence.grid}" rowdragsend="#{d.DemoGridDragDropSequence.rowDragSend}" rowdropreceive="#{d.DemoGridDragDropSequence.rowDropReceive}" sbvisibleamount="40" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="Some column title" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_5" text=".{text}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventDrop;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.UniqueIdCreator;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoGridDragDropSequence}")

public class DemoGridDragDropSequence
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
