        String i_text;
        public String getText() { return i_text; }
        public void setText(String value) { this.i_text = value; }
        @Override
        public void onRowDrop(BaseActionEventDrop event)
        {
            super.onRowDrop(event);
            if (event.getDragInfo().startsWith(m_dragDropType))
            {
                GridItem selectedItem = m_grid.getSelectedItem();
                if (selectedItem == this) return; // drag on same node as drop
                m_grid.getItems().remove(selectedItem);
                int newIndex = m_grid.getItems().indexOf(this);
                if (event.getPercentageVertical() >= 50)
                    newIndex++;
                m_grid.getItems().add(newIndex,selectedItem);
                m_grid.selectAndFocusItem(selectedItem);
            }
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    String m_dragDropType;
    String m_rowDropReceive;
    String m_rowDragSend;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoGridDragDropSequence(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        // create unique drag-drop-type - so that there is no drag drop between identical
        // pages. Each instance of the grid has its own, isolated drag-drop-type.
        // Otherwise: potencial problems if the page bean is e.g. created twice.
        m_dragDropType = "TYPE_" + UniqueIdCreator.createId();
        m_rowDragSend = m_dragDropType+":this";
        m_rowDropReceive = m_dragDropType +":verticalsplit";
        for (int i=0; i<50; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setText("Text " + i);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demogriddragdropsequence.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoGridDragDropSequence}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getRowDropReceive() { return m_rowDropReceive; }
    public void setRowDropReceive(String value) { this.m_rowDropReceive = value; }

    public String getRowDragSend() { return m_rowDragSend; }
    public void setRowDragSend(String value) { this.m_rowDragSend = value; }

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Drop Files (Java Client only)

Pick one ore more files from the file explorer and drop the information into the correpsonding area. You will see that the name(s) of the file(s) are transferred.

Apart from defining information types within DRAGSEND and DROPRECEIVE in any "free" way, there are some predefined types:

(.) "ccfilename" is the type definition that corresponds to exactly one file
(.) "ccfilenames" is the type definition that corresponds to one or more file names

In the example the DROPRECEIVE definition is applied on PANE level.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoDragFiles}" rowdistance="20" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="100" />
<t:pane id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.DemoDragFiles.onFileDrop}" background="#FF800050" dropreceive="ccfilename" height="50" width="100%" >
<t:rowdistance id="g_5" height="50%" />
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:coldistance id="g_7" width="50%" />
<t:label id="g_8" text="Drop here one file from your file explorer." />
<t:coldistance id="g_9" width="50%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" height="50%" />
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:coldistance id="g_12" width="100" />
<t:pane id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoDragFiles.onFileDrop}" background="#FF800050" dropreceive="ccfilenames" height="100" width="100%" >
<t:rowdistance id="g_14" height="50%" />
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:coldistance id="g_16" width="50%" />
<t:label id="g_17" text="Drop here one or more files from your file explorer." />
<t:coldistance id="g_18" width="50%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_19" height="50%" />
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_20" />
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:label id="g_22" text="Dropped Info" width="100" />
<t:textarea id="g_23" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoDragFiles.droppedInfo}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventDrop;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoDragFiles}")

public class DemoDragFiles
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    protected String m_droppedInfo;
    
    public DemoDragFiles(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    public String getDroppedInfo() { return m_droppedInfo; }
    
    public void onFileDrop(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        StringBuffer info = new StringBuffer();
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventDrop)
        {
            BaseActionEventDrop baed = (BaseActionEventDrop)event;
            String s = baed.getDragInfo();
            info.append(s);
            if (s.startsWith("ccfilename:"))
            {
                info.append("\n\nFilename:");
                info.append("\n--------------------------");
                info.append("\n"+s.substring("ccfilename:".length()));
            }
            else if (s.startsWith("ccfilenames:"))
            {
                info.append("\n\nFilename(s):");
                info.append("\n--------------------------");
                String csv = s.substring("ccfilenames:".length());
                String[] fns = ValueManager.decodeCSV(csv);
                for (String fn: fns)
                {
                    info.append("\n" + fn);
                }
            }
        }
        m_droppedInfo = info.toString();
    }


}

Drag over info text + cursor

By using attribute DROPRASTERTEXT you can output different type of information once some information is dragged over your component.

The current options are:

(.) output pixel/percentage position
(.) output explicit text that depends on position

In addition you may use attribute DROPSHAPE in order to influence the rendering of the drag over cursor. The current possibilities are:

(.) output crosshair
(.) output veritcal/horizontal line

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoDropRaster}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:pane id="g_3" border="#00000030" dragsend="LABEL:dragme" padding="5" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Drage me!" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" coldistance="5" >
<t:pane id="g_7" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_8" coldistance="5" >
<t:pane id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoDropRaster.onDropAction}" background="#FFFFFF" border="#00000030" droprastertext="pixel(10)" dropreceive="LABEL" height="100" padding="5" width="100%" >
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" height="100%" />
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="pixel(10)" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_13" height="100%" />
</t:pane>
<t:pane id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoDropRaster.onDropAction}" background="#FFFFFF" border="#00000030" droprastertext="pixelX(10)" dropreceive="LABEL" height="100" padding="5" width="100%" >
<t:rowdistance id="g_15" height="100%" />
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="pixelX(10)" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_18" height="100%" />
</t:pane>
<t:pane id="g_19" actionListener="#{d.DemoDropRaster.onDropAction}" background="#FFFFFF" border="#00000030" droprastertext="pixelY(10)" dropreceive="LABEL" height="100" padding="5" width="100%" >
<t:rowdistance id="g_20" height="100%" />
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:label id="g_22" text="pixelY(10)" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_23" height="100%" />
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" coldistance="5" >
<t:pane id="g_25" actionListener="#{d.DemoDropRaster.onDropAction}" background="#FFFFFF" border="#00000030" droprastertext="percentage(5)" dropreceive="LABEL" height="100" padding="5" width="100%" >
<t:rowdistance id="g_26" height="100%" />
<t:row id="g_27" >
<t:label id="g_28" text="percentage(5)" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_29" height="100%" />
</t:pane>
<t:pane id="g_30" actionListener="#{d.DemoDropRaster.onDropAction}" background="#FFFFFF" border="#00000030" droprastertext="percentageX(5)" dropreceive="LABEL" height="100" padding="5" width="100%" >
<t:rowdistance id="g_31" height="100%" />
<t:row id="g_32" >
<t:label id="g_33" text="percentageX(5)" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_34" height="100%" />
</t:pane>
<t:pane id="g_35" actionListener="#{d.DemoDropRaster.onDropAction}" background="#FFFFFF" border="#00000030" droprastertext="percentageY(5)" dropreceive="LABEL" height="100" padding="5" width="100%" >
<t:rowdistance id="g_36" height="100%" />
<t:row id="g_37" >
<t:label id="g_38" text="percentageY(5)" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_39" height="100%" />
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_40" coldistance="5" >
<t:pane id="g_41" actionListener="#{d.DemoDropRaster.onDropAction}" background="#FFFFFF" border="#00000030" droprastertext="textX(0,Morning shift,25,Day shift,75,Night shift)" dropreceive="LABEL" dropshape="crosshairX" height="100" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_42" >
<t:drawarea id="g_43" drawcommands="rectangle(0,0,25%,100%,#FF000020,#FF000020,vertical);rectangle(75%,0,25%,100%,#00FF0020,#00FF0020,vertical)" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_44" text="textX(0,Morning shift,25,Day shift,75,Night shift)" />
</t:drawarea>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_45" />
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_46" coldistance="5" >
<t:pane id="g_47" actionListener="#{d.DemoDropRaster.onDropAction}" background="#FFFFFF" border="#00000030" droprastertext="textY(0,Morning shift,25,Day shift,75,Night shift)" dropreceive="LABEL" dropshape="crosshairY" height="100" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_48" >
<t:drawarea id="g_49" drawcommands="rectangle(0,0,100%,25%,#FF000020,#FF000020,vertical);rectangle(0,75%,100%,25%,#00FF0020,#00FF0020,vertical)" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:label id="g_50" text="textY(0,Morning shift,25,Day shift,75,Night shift)" />
</t:drawarea>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_51" />
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_52" coldistance="5" >
<t:schedule id="g_53" actionListener="#{d.DemoDropRaster.onDropAction}" background="#FFFFFF" border="#00000030" droprastertext="#{d.DemoDropRaster.complexRaster}" dropreceive="LABEL" dropshape="crosshairX" height="80" numberofblocks="24" orientation="horizontal" schedulemax="96" width="100%" >
<t:scheduleitem id="g_54" background="#00FF0030" scheduleleft="16" schedulewidth="16" text="Some schedule" valign="middle" />
</t:schedule>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_55" >
<t:label id="g_56" align="center" text="...whole day, separated in quarter of hours..." width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
<t:pane id="g_57" height="500" rowalignmenty="top" width="100" >
<t:row id="g_58" coldistance="5" >
<t:schedule id="g_59" actionListener="#{d.DemoDropRaster.onDropAction}" background="#FFFFFF" border="#00000030" droprastertext="#{d.DemoDropRaster.complexRasterY}" dropreceive="LABEL" dropshape="crosshairY" height="100%" numberofblocks="24" orientation="vertical" schedulemax="96" width="100%" >
<t:scheduleitem id="g_60" background="#00FF0030" scheduleleft="16" schedulewidth="16" text="Some schedule" valign="middle" />
</t:schedule>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.time.LocalTime;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventDrop;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.DropRasterTextX;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.DropRasterTextY;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoDropRaster}")

public class DemoDropRaster
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    DropRasterTextX m_complexRaster = new DropRasterTextX();
    DropRasterTextY m_complexRasterY = new DropRasterTextY();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoDropRaster(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        // prepare "complex" raster for schedule with quarter of hours
        int counter = -1;
        for (int i=0; i<24; i++)
        {
            for (int j=0; j<4; j++)
            {
                counter++;
                double pos = counter * 100d / (4 * 24); 
                LocalTime lt = LocalTime.of(i,j*15);
                m_complexRaster.addText(pos,lt.toString());
                m_complexRasterY.addText(pos,lt.toString());
            }
        }
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demodropraster.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoDropRaster}"; }

    public DropRasterTextX getComplexRaster() { return m_complexRaster; }
    public DropRasterTextY getComplexRasterY() { return m_complexRasterY; }

    public void onDropAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventDrop)
        {
            BaseActionEventDrop e = (BaseActionEventDrop)event;
            float xPos = e.getPercentageHorizontaAsFloat() + e.getPercentageDeltaX();
            float yPos = e.getPercentageVerticalAsFloat() + e.getPercentageDeltaY();
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("DROP was registered at position: " + xPos + ", " + yPos);
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

}

Moving boxes

This example shows how to use...

1. drag & drop
2. dynamic content management
3. the component ROWFLEXLINECONTAINER

...in order to build a scenario in which the sequence of the boxes can be changed by the user.

For smart drag & drop the following features are used:

1. drop zone definition in DROPRECEIVE ("horizontalsplit")
2. interpretation of the drop position in the drop-event processing in order to position the dropped box either in front or behind.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoDragDropSequence}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoDragDropSequence}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:textpane id="g_9" text="Change the sequence of the boxes by dragging &amp; dropping them:" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowflexlinecontainer id="g_6" >
<t:dynamiccontent id="g_7" contentbinding="#{d.DemoDragDropSequence.dynContent}" />
</t:rowflexlinecontainer>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.BOXNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.LABELNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.componentnodes.ROWNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventDrop;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.DYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding.ComponentNode;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.StyleManager;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.valuemgmt.IActionListenerDelegation;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoDragDropSequence}")

public class DemoDragDropSequence
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class BoxInfo
    {
        String i_text;
        String i_color;
        public String getText() { return i_text; } 
        public void setText(String text) { i_text = text; }
        public String getColor() { return i_color; }
        public void setColor(String color) { i_color = color; } 
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private static final String[] COLORS = new String[] 
    {
        StyleManager.getStyleValue("@backgroundColorGreen@"),
        StyleManager.getStyleValue("@backgroundColorYellow@"),
        StyleManager.getStyleValue("@backgroundColorRed@"),
    };
    
    List<BoxInfo> m_boxes = new ArrayList<DemoDragDropSequence.BoxInfo>();
    DYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_dynContent = new DYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoDragDropSequence(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        createBoxes();
        renderBoxes();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demodragdropsequence.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoDragDropSequence}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DYNAMICCONTENTBinding getDynContent() { return m_dynContent; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void createBoxes()
    {
        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
        {
            BoxInfo bi = new BoxInfo();
            bi.setText("Box " + i);
            bi.setColor(COLORS[i%COLORS.length]);
            m_boxes.add(bi);
        }
    }

    private void renderBoxes()
    {
        List<ComponentNode> l = new ArrayList<ComponentNode>();
        int counter = 0;
        for (final BoxInfo bi: m_boxes)
        {
            BOXNode box = new BOXNode()
                    .setWidth("150")
                    .setHeight("150")
                    .setStylevariant("ccexposed")
                    .setDragsend("box:"+counter)
                    .setDropreceive("box:horizontalsplit")
                    .setBackground(bi.getColor())
                    .bindActionListener(new IActionListenerDelegation()
                    {
                        @Override
                        public void onAction(ActionEvent event)
                        {
                            processBoxEvent(bi,event);
                        }
                    });
            l.add(box);
            ROWNode row = new ROWNode();
            box.addSubNode(row);
            LABELNode lab = new LABELNode()
                    .setText(bi.getText())
                    .setWidth("100%")
                    .setHeight("100%")
                    .setAlign("center")
                    .setValign("middle")
                    .setStylevariant("ccbig");
            row.addSubNode(lab);
            counter++;
        }
        m_dynContent.setContentNodes(l);
    }

    private void processBoxEvent(BoxInfo bi, ActionEvent event)
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventDrop)
        {
            String di = ((BaseActionEventDrop)event).getDragInfo();
            if (di.startsWith("box:"))
            {
                String dragIndexString = di.substring("box:".length());
                int dragIndex = ValueManager.decodeInt(dragIndexString,-1);
                // horizontal drop position defines if to moved before or after
                boolean dropBefore = ((BaseActionEventDrop)event).getPercentageHorizontal() < 50;
                moveBox(m_boxes.get(dragIndex),bi,dropBefore);
            }
        }
    }

    private void moveBox(BoxInfo movedBox, BoxInfo refBox, boolean before)
    {
        if (movedBox == refBox)
            return;
        m_boxes.remove(movedBox);
        int index = m_boxes.indexOf(refBox);
        int movedBoxIndex = index;
        if (before == false)
            movedBoxIndex = index+1;
        m_boxes.add(movedBoxIndex,movedBox);
        renderBoxes();
    }

}

Fine control drag&drop by regular expressions

Check the demo: all the involved drag/drop components use the drag/drop type "DEMO", i.e. but there is a fine-granular, regular expression based selection, where a dragged information can be dropped.

In the DROPRECEIVE definition of a component you can add a regular expression as 3rd argument, each one separated by a colon (":"):

type:zone:regex(...)

The TYPE is the basic guidance if a drag operation (i.e. a DRAGSEND value) is applicable for the component - or not. If the TYPE does match, then the component will be open to accept a drop of the information.

The ZONE is "just" an indicator about the highlighting of the component during drag-over, there is no logic behind.

The REGEX now is the 3rd parameter - containing a regular expression: if the TYPE matches then the value part of the DRAGSEND definition (type:value) is in addition checked against this regular expression - and the component will only accept the drop if the values matches the regular expression.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.captaincasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoDragWithregex}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoDragWithregex}" rowdistance="20" >
<t:row id="g_35" >
<t:label id="g_36" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Matching drag&amp;drop by regular expressions" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" text="Drag one of the following..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" coldistance="20" >
<t:label id="g_2" align="center" border="#a0a0a0" dragsend="DEMO:1111" height="50" text="Dragsend 1111" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_8" align="center" border="#a0a0a0" dragsend="DEMO:2222" height="50" text="Dragsend 2222" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_10" align="center" border="#a0a0a0" dragsend="DEMO:ABC" height="50" text="Dragsend ABC" width="100" />
<t:label id="g_12" align="center" border="#a0a0a0" dragsend="DEMO:abc" height="50" text="Dragsend abc" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:label id="g_25" text="...and drop here:" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_3" coldistance="20" >
<t:textpane id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoDragWithregex.onDropAction}" align="center" border="#a0a0a0" dropreceive="DEMO:default:regex([1]+)" height="50" text="Drop 1 only" valign="middle" width="100" />
<t:textpane id="g_16" actionListener="#{d.DemoDragWithregex.onDropAction}" align="center" border="#a0a0a0" dropreceive="DEMO:default:regex([2]+)" height="50" text="Drop 2 only" valign="middle" width="100" />
<t:textpane id="g_18" actionListener="#{d.DemoDragWithregex.onDropAction}" align="center" border="#a0a0a0" dropreceive="DEMO:default:regex([A-Za-z]+)" height="50" text="Drop characters only" valign="middle" width="100" />
<t:textpane id="g_20" actionListener="#{d.DemoDragWithregex.onDropAction}" align="center" border="#a0a0a0" dropreceive="DEMO:default:regex([0-9]+)" height="50" text="Drop numbers only" valign="middle" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_42" />
<t:row id="g_50" >
<t:label id="g_51" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Also supported with HTML5 drag/drop:" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_44" >
<t:label id="g_45" text="Drag here..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_38" coldistance="20" >
<t:textpane id="g_39" align="center" border="#a0a0a0" dragsend="cchtml5_DEMO:1111" height="50" text="HTML5 Dragsend 1111" valign="middle" width="100" />
<t:textpane id="g_40" align="center" border="#a0a0a0" dragsend="cchtml5_DEMO:2222" height="50" text="HTML5 Dragsend 2222" valign="middle" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_47" >
<t:label id="g_48" text="...and drop here:" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_31" coldistance="20" >
<t:textpane id="g_32" actionListener="#{d.DemoDragWithregex.onDropAction}" align="center" border="#a0a0a0" dropreceive="cchtml5_DEMO:default:regex([1]+)" height="50" text="HTML5 Drop 1 only" valign="middle" width="100" />
<t:textpane id="g_33" actionListener="#{d.DemoDragWithregex.onDropAction}" align="center" border="#a0a0a0" dropreceive="cchtml5_DEMO:default:regex([2]+)" height="50" text="HTML5 Drop 2 only" valign="middle" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventDrop;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoDragWithregex}")

public class DemoDragWithregex
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoDragWithregex(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demodragwithregex.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoDragWithregex}"; }

    public void onDropAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventDrop)
        {
            BaseActionEventDrop e = (BaseActionEventDrop)event;
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Drop was processed: " + e.getDragInfo());
        }
    }
}

Caret / text-cursor position

In addition to the x,y position you also receive the caret position (text cursor position) as part of the event data.

You may react accordingly and e.g. place text exactly at the point where the user dropped the information.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.captaincasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoDragDropCaretPosition}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoDragDropCaretPosition}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistancebig@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Drag one of the following..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" coldistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultcoldistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:label id="g_12" dragsend="mytext:Abcdefg" text="Abcdefg" />
<t:label id="g_14" dragsend="mytext:Hijklmnop" text="Hijklmnop" />
<t:label id="g_16" dragsend="mytext:012345" text="012345" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:label id="g_21" stylevariant="ccbig" text="...and drop into this text:" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:textarea id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.DemoDragDropCaretPosition.onTextAreaAction}" dropreceive="mytext" height="100%" stylevariant="cc_code" text="#{d.DemoDragDropCaretPosition.text}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventDrop;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoDragDropCaretPosition}")

public class DemoDragDropCaretPosition
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public void onTextAreaAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventDrop)
        {
            BaseActionEventDrop e = (BaseActionEventDrop)event;
            String dragInfo = e.getDragInfo();
            if (dragInfo.startsWith("mytext:"))
            {
                String text = dragInfo.substring("mytext:".length());
                int caretPosition = e.getCaretPosition();
                if (caretPosition < 0)
                    caretPosition = text.length();
                m_text = m_text.substring(0,caretPosition) + text + m_text.substring(caretPosition);
            }
        }
    }

    String m_text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod "
        + "tempor invidunt ut labore et dolore magna aliquyam erat, sed diam voluptua. "
        + "At vero eos et accusam et justo duo dolores et ea rebum. Stet clita "
        + "kasd gubergren, no sea takimata sanctus est Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet.";
    public String getText() { return m_text; }
    public void setText(String value) { this.m_text = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /* Listener to the user of the page bean. */
    public interface IListener extends Serializable
    {
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private IListener m_listener;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoDragDropCaretPosition(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demodragdropcaretposition.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoDragDropCaretPosition}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /* Initialization of the bean. Add any parameter that is required within your scenario. */
    public void prepare(IListener listener)
    {
        m_listener = listener;
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Statusbar and Messages

Statusbar

The STATUSBAR component typically is placed ONE time into your pages. Typically it is placed in the page which is the "most outside" one.

From bean logic point of view it can be reached by calling static methods of the class Statusbar. Please have a look into the code view.

There are 4 levels of messages available:
(1) message (no hightlighting, just output)
(2) success (green highlighting)
(3) error (red highlighting)
(4) alert (red highlighting + confirmation dialog)

When placing a STATUSBAR two times into a page then the corresponding messages will show up in both status bar instances. This typically only makes sense when calling popups with own status bar.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.demoStatusbar}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:button id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.demoStatusbar.onOutputMessage}" text="Output Message" width="150" />
<t:link id="g_4" actionListener="#{d.demoStatusbar.onOutputMessageWithPopup}" font="size:10" rowalignmenty="bottom" text="...with Popup" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:button id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.demoStatusbar.onOutputSuccess}" text="Output Success" width="150" />
<t:link id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.demoStatusbar.onOutputSuccessWithPopup}" font="size:10" rowalignmenty="bottom" text="...with Popup" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoStatusbar.onOutputWarning}" text="Output Warning" width="150" />
<t:link id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.demoStatusbar.onOutputWarningWithPopup}" font="size:10" rowalignmenty="bottom" text="...with Popup" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_11" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:button id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.demoStatusbar.onOutputError}" text="Output Error" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:button id="g_15" actionListener="#{d.demoStatusbar.onOutputAlert}" text="Output Alert" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_16" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:button id="g_18" text="Synch (Clear)" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_19" height="100%" />
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:checkbox id="g_21" selected="#{d.DemoStatusbar.immediatelyShowAllMessages}" text="Open multiple messages area immediately" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

/*
 * When working with the workpalce framework there is an additional
 * statusbar management. Pleae check the corresponding examples.
 */
public class DemoStatusbar 
    extends PageBean
{
    public DemoStatusbar(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("rowstatusbar");
    }

    public void onOutputAlert(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputAlert("This message is output as ALERT message.");
    }
    
    public void onOutputError(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputError("This message is output as ERROR message..","You may pass a long text to the statusbar message as well. You may pass a long text to the statusbar message as well. You may pass a long text to the statusbar message as well. You may pass a long text to the statusbar message as well. You may pass a long text to the statusbar message as well. You may pass a long text to the statusbar message as well. You may pass a long text to the statusbar message as well. You may pass a long text to the statusbar message as well. You may pass a long text to the statusbar message as well. You may pass a long text to the statusbar message as well. ");
    }
    
    public void onOutputSuccess(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("This message is output as SUCCESS message.");
    }
    
    public void onOutputSuccessWithPopup(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccessWithPopup("This message is output as SUCCESS message.");
    }
    
    public void onOutputMessage(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        // several messages are output: as consequence a small icon is 
        // renedered inside the statusbar - when the user clicks on the
        // icon then all messages will be shown in a scrollable area.
        Statusbar.outputMessage("This message is output as normal message 1.");
        Statusbar.outputWarning("This message is output as warning message 2.");
        Statusbar.outputError("This message is output as error message 3.");
        Statusbar.outputMessage("This message is output as normal message 4.");
        Statusbar.outputMessage("This message is output as normal message 5.");
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("This message is output as success message 6.");
        Statusbar.outputMessage("This last message is output as normal message.");
    }
    
    public void onOutputMessageWithPopup(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessageWithPopup("This message is output as normal message.");
    }
    
    public void onOutputWarning(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputWarning("This message is output as WARNING message.");
    }
    
    public void onOutputWarningWithPopup(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        Statusbar.outputWarningWithPopup("This message is output as WARNING message.");
    }
    
    public boolean getImmediatelyShowAllMessages() { return Statusbar.getImmediatelyShowAllMessages(); }
    public void setImmediatelyShowAllMessages(boolean value) { Statusbar.setImmediatelyShowAllMessages(value); }
    
}

Auto Clearing

By calling method Statusbar.autoClearStatusbar(duration), the status bar message will be cleared after the duration that is passed as argument.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoStatusbarAutoClear}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Message" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_4" text="#{d.DemoStatusbarAutoClear.message}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_5" />
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:coldistance id="g_7" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.DemoStatusbarAutoClear.onError}" text="Output Error" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:coldistance id="g_10" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoStatusbarAutoClear.onAlert}" text="Output Alert" width="150" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoStatusbarAutoClear}")

public class DemoStatusbarAutoClear
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    String m_message = "This is the message to be displayed.";
    public String getMessage() { return m_message; }
    public void setMessage(String value) { this.m_message = value; }

    public void onAlert(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Statusbar.outputAlert(m_message);
        Statusbar.autoClearStatusbar(2000);
    }

    public void onError(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Statusbar.outputError(m_message);
        Statusbar.autoClearStatusbar(2000);
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoStatusbarAutoClear(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Message toasts

So called "message toasts" are a common way to notify the user about certain information. The information is shown as popup dialog together with some title and some image. The dialog will close automatically after some duration of time.

You may pass a type (see constant definitions in MessageToast class). This type is associated with a style class modifier, so that each type may have its own color style.

Message toasts can be directly used, using class MessageToast. You do not have to embed some explicit component inside your layout definition.

The duration of time that each message waits for being closed is centrally configure-able by calling MessageToast.initDuration(..).

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.captaincasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoMessageToast}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoMessageToast}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:combobox id="g_8" labeltext="Message title" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoMessageToast.messageTypeVVS}" value="#{d.DemoMessageToast.messageType}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:combobox id="g_18" labeltext="Message position" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoMessageToast.messagePositionVVS}" value="#{d.DemoMessageToast.messagePosition}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:field id="g_14" labeltext="Message title" text="#{d.DemoMessageToast.messageTitle}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:textarea id="g_11" height="100" labeltext="Message text" text="#{d.DemoMessageToast.messageText}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_2" format="int" labeltext="Duration" value="#{d.DemoMessageToast.messageDuration}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:button id="g_15" actionListener="#{d.DemoMessageToast.onCreateMessageAction}" doubleclickenabled="true" text="Show message" width="150+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.MessageToast;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoMessageToast}")

public class DemoMessageToast
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_messageType = MessageToast.TYPE_INFO;
    String m_messageTitle = "This is the title";
    String m_messageText = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consetetur sadipscing elitr, sed diam nonumy eirmod tempor.";
    ValidValuesBinding m_messagePositionVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();
    String m_messagePosition = MessageToast.POSITION_rightbottom;
    int m_messageDuration = MessageToast.s_duration;

    ValidValuesBinding m_messageTypeVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoMessageToast(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        m_messageTypeVVS.addValidValue(MessageToast.TYPE_INFO,MessageToast.TYPE_INFO);
        m_messageTypeVVS.addValidValue(MessageToast.TYPE_SUCCESS,MessageToast.TYPE_SUCCESS);
        m_messageTypeVVS.addValidValue(MessageToast.TYPE_WARNING,MessageToast.TYPE_WARNING);
        m_messageTypeVVS.addValidValue(MessageToast.TYPE_ERROR,MessageToast.TYPE_ERROR);
        for (String position: MessageToast.POSITIONS_all)
            m_messagePositionVVS.addValidValue(position,position);
        // optional: you may explicitly set the duration that messages show up on client side
        // pay attention: this setting is done globally for all users!
        // MessageToast.initDuration(5000);
        // MessageToast.initPosition(MessageToast.POSITION_leftmiddle);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demomessagetoast.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoMessageToast}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getMessageTitle() { return m_messageTitle; }
    public void setMessageTitle(String value) { this.m_messageTitle = value; }

    public String getMessageText() { return m_messageText; }
    public void setMessageText(String value) { this.m_messageText = value; }
    
    public String getMessageType() { return m_messageType; } 
    public void setMessageType(String messageType) { m_messageType = messageType; }

    public ValidValuesBinding getMessageTypeVVS() { return m_messageTypeVVS; }

    public ValidValuesBinding getMessagePositionVVS() { return m_messagePositionVVS; }

    public String getMessagePosition() { return m_messagePosition; }
    public void setMessagePosition(String value) { this.m_messagePosition = value; }

    public int getMessageDuration() { return m_messageDuration; }
    public void setMessageDuration(int value) { this.m_messageDuration = value; }

    public void onCreateMessageAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        MessageToast.showMessage(m_messageType,"/images.iconssvg.save._606060.16x16.ccsvg",m_messageTitle,m_messageText,m_messagePosition,m_messageDuration);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Progress messages for long operations

The new server side API "BlockerInfo.sendProgressToClient(...)" allows to send progress messages to the client directly during application processing.

Internally the client opens up a websocket connection to the server that is responsible for transferring progress messages back to the client - without using the "big communication round trip".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoBlockerInfo}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoBlockerInfo}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:label id="g_4" stylevariant="ccbig" text="How to make users angry" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:textpane id="g_6" text="During the application processing on server side the client is blocked for interaction. If this takes more than some seconds then the user sees some &#34;wait icon&#34; - and gest angry because there is no information about what&#39;s going on..." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:button id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.DemoBlockerInfo.onLongAngryAction}" text="Start long lasting operation (10 secs)" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_9" height="50" />
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" stylevariant="ccbig" text="It&#39;s so simple to inform your users - ...now!" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:textpane id="g_13" text="Up to now (20201221) you had to outsource your application processing in some own processing thread and then had to use e.g. some websocket long polling to decouple the application processing from the UI processing. Now it is much (muchchchchch!) easier! From the original processing thread you simple can send signals to the client about the progress of the processing." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:button id="g_15" actionListener="#{d.DemoBlockerInfo.onLongAction}" text="Start long lasting operation (10 secs)" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.BlockerInfo;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoBlockerInfo}")

public class DemoBlockerInfo
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoBlockerInfo(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoblockerinfo.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoBlockerInfo}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onLongAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        try
        {
            for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
            {
                Thread.sleep(100);
                BlockerInfo.sendProgressToClient("Processing step " + (i+1),i+1);
            }
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputError(t.toString());
        }
    }

    public void onLongAngryAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        try
        {
            Thread.sleep(10000);
        }
        catch (Throwable t)
        {
            Statusbar.outputError(t.toString());
        }
    }

    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Notification messages

Notifications are messages that are output by the operating system - independent from the browser. The browser itself may be invisible - e.g. minimized or your dialog might be positioned on a hidden brwoser tab.

Notifications require some permission that needs to be granted by the user. This permission only can be obtained in the context of a user interaction.

PLEASE NOTE: there are a couple of security restrictions that might be active in concrete scenarios that depend on the environment (browser type) and/or the browser configuration. It is important to check your usage scenarios prior to using notifications!

There are diverse attributes that are part of the NOTIFICATION component. By setting attribute ONLYSENDIFHIDDEN to "true" you ensure that notifications will only be sent if the current dialog is not visible to the user - e.g. if it is minimized.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoNotification}" >
<t:callserverontrigger id="g_24" actionListener="#{d.DemoNotification.onCreateNotificationAction}" duration="5000" trigger="#{d.DemoNotification.delayTrigger}" />
<t:notification id="g_3" image="/images/iconssvg/arrowright_green_16x16.svg" onlysendifhidden="#{d.DemoNotification.onlySendIfHidden}" requireinteraction="#{d.DemoNotification.requireInteraction}" text="#{d.DemoNotification.bodyText}" title="#{d.DemoNotification.titleText}" trigger="#{d.DemoNotification.notificationTrigger}" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoNotification}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_16" stylevariant="ccbig" text="(1. Requesting permission for notifications)" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_35" >
<t:textpane id="g_2" text="For security reasons requests for gaining the permission to send notifications can only be executed in the context  of some  user interaction." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_44" >
<t:textpane id="g_45" text="When adding a NOTIFICATION  component to your dialog, then  the next user event (e.g. mouse click, ...) will automatically request the permission to send notifcations into the user&#39;s  browser. - You can enforce this by adding a SYSTEMICON component with command &#34;requestNotifcation&#34; onto your page, which  explicitly calls the browser  functions to gain persmission." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:systemicon id="g_11" styleseq="riscbutton" systemfunction="requestNotification" text="Request notification permission" width="300+" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" stylevariant="ccbig" text="2. Sending notifications" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_47" >
<t:textpane id="g_48" text="Nof you can send notification messages by triggering the NOTIFCATION component." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_31" text="Options" width="100" />
<t:checkbox id="g_27" selected="#{d.DemoNotification.onlySendIfHidden}" text="Only send notification if browser is hidden" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:coldistance id="g_7" width="100" />
<t:checkbox id="g_29" selected="#{d.DemoNotification.requireInteraction}" text="Notification requires user interaction to be closed" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_37" >
<t:coldistance id="g_38" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_39" labeltext="Title  text" text="#{d.DemoNotification.titleText}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_40" >
<t:coldistance id="g_41" width="100" />
<t:textarea id="g_42" height="100" labeltext="Body text" text="#{d.DemoNotification.bodyText}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_33" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:button id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoNotification.onCreateNotificationAction}" text="Create notification - now" width="300+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:button id="g_22" actionListener="#{d.DemoNotification.onCreateNotificationActionDelayed}" text="Create notification - in 5 seconds" width="300+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_50" >
<t:textpane id="g_51" text="...so that you can quickly minimize your dialog in order to test the feature &#34;only send if browser is hidden&#34;" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoNotification}")

public class DemoNotification
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    boolean m_onlySendIfHidden = false;;
    boolean m_requireInteraction = false;
    Trigger m_delayTrigger = new Trigger();
    Trigger m_notificationTrigger = new Trigger();
    String m_bodyText = "This notification was sent by the NOTIFICATION component. If it appears, then the permission for receiving notifications was granted by the user.";
    String m_titleText = "Hello User!";
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoNotification(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demonotification.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoNotification}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getBodyText() { return m_bodyText; }
    public void setBodyText(String value) { this.m_bodyText = value; }

    public String getTitleText() { return m_titleText; }
    public void setTitleText(String value) { this.m_titleText = value; }

    public boolean getOnlySendIfHidden() { return m_onlySendIfHidden; }
    public void setOnlySendIfHidden(boolean value) { this.m_onlySendIfHidden = value; }

    public boolean getRequireInteraction() { return m_requireInteraction; }
    public void setRequireInteraction(boolean value) { this.m_requireInteraction = value; }

    public Trigger getDelayTrigger() { return m_delayTrigger; }

    public Trigger getNotificationTrigger() { return m_notificationTrigger; }

    public void onCreateNotificationAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_notificationTrigger.trigger();
    }

    public void onCreateNotificationActionDelayed(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_delayTrigger.trigger();
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Open Street Map

Simple Scenario

The Open Street Map (OSM) Viewer renders the maps that are available within the OSM project.

Definitions are quite simple:

(.) Within the OSMVIEWER component you define the center point of the map (latitude/longitude) and the scroll level.
(.) Below the OSMVIEWER you can place OSMVIEWERWAYPOINT components, each one holding a coordinate, a width/height (pixels) and a BGPAINT command for rendering the content.

There are some events that you can register to:
(.) OSMVIEWER sends a BaseActionEventOsmviewerSelection event when the user clicks into the map - but only if the mouse-down and mouse-up position are exactly the same. The selected latitude/longitude values can be accessed from the corresponding event information.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoOsmViewer}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Latitude" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_4" format="double" formatmask="decmax20" value="#{d.DemoOsmViewer.latitudeToSet}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Longitude" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_7" format="double" formatmask="decmax20" value="#{d.DemoOsmViewer.longitudeToSet}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Zoom" width="100" />
<t:spinner id="g_10" maxvalue="19" minvalue="0" value="#{d.DemoOsmViewer.zoom}" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:coldistance id="g_12" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoOsmViewer.onSetPosition}" text="Take over" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_14" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:osmviewer id="g_16" actionListener="#{d.DemoOsmViewer.onSelection}" height="100%" latitude="#{d.DemoOsmViewer.latitude}" longitude="#{d.DemoOsmViewer.longitude}" osmzoom="#{d.DemoOsmViewer.zoom}" width="100%" >
<t:osmviewerwaypoint id="g_17" actionListener="#{d.DemoOsmViewer.onPoint1Action}" hideinfopopup="true" latitude="49.411112809289975" longitude="8.715183734893799" markerimage="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyBpZD0iZTMwNmJkMmQtY2UxMy00ZmEzLTg2MjctOGVkMzE4OGNkNzBhIiBkYXRhLW5hbWU9IkViZW5lIDEyIEtvcGllIEtvcGllIEtvcGllIiB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZpZXdCb3g9IjAgMCAxNiAxNiI+PGRlZnM+PHN0eWxlPi5cMzQgMGRmNmEzZS1kYzViLTQ3MGMtYjg3NS0yMjNjY2E0ZTZmN2V7ZmlsbDpub25lO3N0cm9rZTojMDAwO3N0cm9rZS1taXRlcmxpbWl0OjEwO30uXDM2IDM2MTM3ZDctYTFiOS00YjU2LTliODItMDU5ZjA1OGNmOWNie2ZpbGw6I2ZmZjt9PC9zdHlsZT48L2RlZnM+PHRpdGxlPmFjbV9lYzA3X2RldmljZS1tYW5hZ2VtZW50PC90aXRsZT48cG9seWxpbmUgY2xhc3M9IjQwZGY2YTNlLWRjNWItNDcwYy1iODc1LTIyM2NjYTRlNmY3ZSIgcG9pbnRzPSIxMC4wMTMgMTIuOTUyIDEyLjE0NCAxNS4xOTcgMTUuNTgyIDEwLjQ1MiIvPjxwYXRoIGQ9Ik04Ljk4MywwYS41ODMuNTgzLDAsMCwxLC42MDYuNjA2VjkuMDg0YS41ODMuNTgzLDAsMCwxLS42MDYuNjA2SDQuMTRhLjU4My41ODMsMCwwLDEtLjYwNi0uNjA2Vi42MDlBLjU4My41ODMsMCwwLDEsNC4xNCwwWm0wLC42MDVINC4xNFY5LjA4NEg4Ljk4M1pNNS4wNDgsOC40NzhhLjMuMywwLDAsMSwwLS42MDVIOC4wNzVhLjMuMywwLDAsMSwwLC42MDVaTTcuNDcsMy4wM2EuOS45LDAsMCwxLS45MDgtLjkwOC45MDguOTA4LDAsMSwxLDEuODE2LDAsLjkuOSwwLDAsMS0uOTA4LjkwOFpNNS4wNDYsNy4zNTVhLjI2OC4yNjgsMCwwLDEtLjMtLjMuMjY4LjI2OCwwLDAsMSwuMy0uM0g4LjA3M2EuMjY4LjI2OCwwLDAsMSwuMy4zLjI2OC4yNjgsMCwwLDEtLjMuM1oiLz48cmVjdCBjbGFzcz0iNjM2MTM3ZDctYTFiOS00YjU2LTliODItMDU5ZjA1OGNmOWNiIiB4PSItMC42NzgiIHk9IjEuOTA3IiB3aWR0aD0iNy4xOTkiIGhlaWdodD0iOC45MjciIHJ4PSIxIiByeT0iMSIvPjxwYXRoIGQ9Ik01LjQ1NywyLjI2NmEuNTgzLjU4MywwLDAsMSwuNjA2LjYwNnY4LjQ3NmEuNTgzLjU4MywwLDAsMS0uNjA2LjYwNkguNjE0YS41ODMuNTgzLDAsMCwxLS42MDYtLjYwNlYyLjg3MmEuNTgzLjU4MywwLDAsMSwuNjA2LS42MDZabTAsLjYwNUguNjE0djguNDc2SDUuNDU3Wm0tMy45MzUsNy44N2EuMy4zLDAsMCwxLDAtLjYwNUg0LjU0OWEuMy4zLDAsMCwxLDAsLjYwNVpNMy45NDQsNS4yOTNhLjkuOSwwLDAsMS0uOTA4LS45MDguOS45LDAsMCwxLC45MDgtLjkwOC45LjksMCwwLDEsLjkwOC45MDguOS45LDAsMCwxLS45MDguOTA4WiIvPjwvc3ZnPg==" markerimageheight="30" markerimagewidth="30" text="Point 1" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,100%,#00000080);write(100%-5,50%-2,Point 1,16,#ffffff,bold,rightmiddle,0,1,1);image(5,50%,/images/icons/accept.png,leftmiddle)" height="25" tooltip="&lt;html&gt;&lt;h2&gt;Point 1&lt;/h2&gt;This is a fabulous point.&lt;br&gt;You have to visit....!&lt;/html&gt;" width="100" />
<t:osmviewerwaypoint id="g_18" actionListener="#{d.DemoOsmViewer.onPoint2Action}" hideinfopopup="true" latitude="49.431112809289975" longitude="8.735183734893799" markerimage="/images/iconssvg/truck_red_20x20.svg" markerimageheight="30" markerimagewidth="30" text="Point 2" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,100%,#00000080);write(100%-5,50%-2,Point 2,16,#ffffff,bold,rightmiddle,0,1,1);image(5,50%,/images/icons/add.png,leftmiddle)" height="25" tooltip="&lt;html&gt;&lt;h2&gt;Point 2&lt;/h2&gt;Also very nice - why not visit?&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;/html&gt;" width="100" />
</t:osmviewer>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:rowstatusbar id="g_19" />
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventOsmviewerSelection;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoOsmViewer
    extends PageBean
{
    public DemoOsmViewer(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("osmviewer");
    }
    
    double m_latitude = 49.411112809289975;
    double m_longitude = 8.715183734893799;
    
    double m_latitudeToSet = m_latitude;
    double m_longitudeToSet = m_longitude;

    int m_zoom = 10;
    
    
    public void setLatitude(double latitude) { m_latitude = latitude; }
    public void setLongitude(double longitude) { m_longitude = longitude; }
    public double getLatitude() { return m_latitude; }
    public double getLongitude() { return m_longitude; }
    
    public double getLatitudeToSet() { return m_latitudeToSet; }
    public void setLatitudeToSet(double latitudeToSet) { m_latitudeToSet = latitudeToSet; }
    public double getLongitudeToSet() { return m_longitudeToSet; }
    public void setLongitudeToSet(double longitudeToSet) { m_longitudeToSet = longitudeToSet; }

    public int getZoom() { return m_zoom; }
    public void setZoom(int zoom) { m_zoom = zoom; }
    
    public void onSelection(ActionEvent event)
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventOsmviewerSelection)
        {
            BaseActionEventOsmviewerSelection e = (BaseActionEventOsmviewerSelection)event;
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Selection: " + e.getLatitude() + "/" + e.getLongitude());
            m_latitudeToSet = e.getLatitude();
            m_longitudeToSet = e.getLongitude();
        }
    }
    
    public void onSetPosition(ActionEvent event)
    {
        m_latitude = m_latitudeToSet;
        m_longitude = m_longitudeToSet;
    }
    
    public void onPoint1Action(ActionEvent event)
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Point 1 was selecetd.");
    }

    public void onPoint2Action(ActionEvent event)
    {
        Statusbar.outputSuccess("Point 2 was selecetd.");
    }

}

Dynamic Way Points

By clicking into the map you add new way points into the grid.

This example shows how to dynamically use the OSMVIEWER and OSMVIEWERWAYPOINT components, based on the usage of the DYNAMICCONTENT component.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoOsmViewerDynamic}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoOsmViewerDynamic.grid}" rowheight="18" sbvisibleamount="5" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="Name of Location" width="100%;100" >
<t:field id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoOsmViewerDynamic.onTakeOver}" flush="true" flushtimer="2000" text=".{name}" width="100" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Latitude" width="120" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_7" enabled="false" format="double" formatmask="decmax20" value=".{latitude}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_8" text="Longitude" width="120" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_9" enabled="false" format="double" formatmask="decmax20" value=".{longitude}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_10" width="80" >
<t:button id="g_11" actionListener=".{onRemove}" background="#00000020" contentareafilled="false" doubleclickenabled="true" text="Remove" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" />
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:osmviewer id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoOsmViewerDynamic.onMapSelection}" height="100%" latitude="#{d.DemoOsmViewerDynamic.latitude}" longitude="#{d.DemoOsmViewerDynamic.longitude}" osmzoom="7" width="100%" >
<t:dynamiccontent id="g_15" contentbinding="#{d.DemoOsmViewerDynamic.waypointContent}" />
</t:osmviewer>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventOsmviewerSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.DYNAMICCONTENTBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.ROWDYNAMICCONTENTBinding.ComponentNode;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoOsmViewerDynamic}")

public class DemoOsmViewerDynamic
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {    
        protected double m_latitude;
        public double getLatitude() { return m_latitude; }
        public void setLatitude(double value) { m_latitude = value; }

        protected double m_longitude;
        public double getLongitude() { return m_longitude; }
        public void setLongitude(double value) { m_longitude = value; }

        protected String m_name;
        public String getName() { return m_name; }
        public void setName(String value) { m_name = value; }

        public void onRemove(ActionEvent event) 
        {
            m_grid.getItems().remove(this);
            onTakeOver(null);
        }
        
        public void onSelectAction(ActionEvent event)
        {
            m_grid.deselectCurrentSelection();
            m_grid.selectAndFocusItem(this);
        }
    }

    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    DYNAMICCONTENTBinding m_waypointContent = new DYNAMICCONTENTBinding();
    double m_longitude = 8.715119361877441;
    double m_latitude = 49.411112809289975;

    public DemoOsmViewerDynamic(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        initRefComponent("osmviewer");
        GridItem gi = new GridItem();
        gi.setLatitude(49.411112809289975);
        gi.setLongitude(8.715119361877441);
        gi.setName("Heidelberg, Castle");
        m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        gi = new GridItem();
        gi.setLatitude(49.31717765464028);
        gi.setLongitude(8.442220687866211);
        gi.setName("Speyer, Dome");
        m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
//        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
//        {
//            gi = new GridItem();
//            gi.setLatitude(49.31717765464028 + i * 0.05);
//            gi.setLongitude(8.442220687866211 + i * 0.05);
//            gi.setName("Waypoint " + i);
//            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
//        }
        onTakeOver(null);
    }

    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
    public DYNAMICCONTENTBinding getWaypointContent() { return m_waypointContent; }
    
    public double getLongitude() { return m_longitude; }
    public void setLongitude(double longitude) { m_longitude = longitude; }

    public double getLatitude() { return m_latitude; }
    public void setLatitude(double latitude) { m_latitude = latitude; }

    public void onCreateNewLocation(ActionEvent event)
    {
        GridItem gi = new GridItem();
        m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        m_grid.deselectCurrentSelection();
        m_grid.selectAndFocusItem(gi);
    }
    
    public void onMapSelection(ActionEvent event)
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventOsmviewerSelection)
        {
            BaseActionEventOsmviewerSelection e = (BaseActionEventOsmviewerSelection)event;
            try
            {
                GridItem gi = new GridItem();
                gi.setLatitude(e.getLatitude());
                gi.setLongitude(e.getLongitude());
                m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
                m_grid.deselectCurrentSelection();
                m_grid.selectAndFocusItem(gi);
                onTakeOver(null);
            }
            catch (Throwable t)
            {
            }
        }
    }
    
    public void onTakeOver(ActionEvent event)
    {
        List<ComponentNode> nodes = new ArrayList<ComponentNode>();
        String[] bgpaints = new String[] 
        {
            "rectangle(7,7,100%-7,100%-7,#00000080)",
            "oval(0,0,15,15,#000000)",
            "oval(3,3,9,9,#FFFFFF)",
            null                
        };
        int counter = 0;
        for (GridItem gi: m_grid.getItems())
        {
            ComponentNode node = new ComponentNode("t:osmviewerwaypoint");
            node.addAttribute("latitude",""+gi.m_latitude);
            node.addAttribute("longitude",""+gi.m_longitude);
            bgpaints[3] = ValueManager.encodeMethod("write",new String[] {"15","10",gi.getName(),"14","#FFFFC0","bold","lefttop","0","1","1"});
            String bgpaint = ValueManager.encodeCSV(bgpaints);
            node.addAttribute("bgpaint",bgpaint);
            node.addAttribute("height","32");
            node.addAttribute("width","150");
            node.addAttribute("actionListener","#{d.DemoOsmViewerDynamic.grid.items["+counter+"].onSelectAction}");
            node.addAttribute("text",gi.getName());
            if (counter%2 == 0)
                node.addAttribute("markerimage","/images.iconssvg.factory.#FF0000.64x64.ccsvg");
            else
                node.addAttribute("markerimage","/images.iconssvg.factory.#00FF00.64x64.ccsvg");
            node.addAttribute("hideinfopopup","true");
            nodes.add(node);
            counter++;
        }
        m_waypointContent.setContentNodes(nodes);
    }

}

Client Clock

Client Clock

The CLOCK component is a pure output component - it presents the current time or date to the user.

By using attribute CLOCKFORMAT you can specify various output formats. Use the attribute TIMEZONE if you want to explicitly define the time zone to be used for displaying - if not defined then the client's default time zone will be used.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoClock}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Time formatting" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="timeShort" width="100" />
<t:clock id="g_6" align="center" clockformat="timeShort" font="family:Courier New;size:17;weight:bold" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="timeMedium" width="100" />
<t:clock id="g_9" align="center" clockformat="timeMedium" font="family:Courier New;size:17;weight:bold" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="timeLong" width="100" />
<t:clock id="g_12" align="center" clockformat="timeLong" font="family:Courier New;size:17;weight:bold" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:label id="g_14" text="&#34;mm:ss&#34;" width="100" />
<t:clock id="g_15" align="center" clockformat="time(mm:ss)" font="family:Courier New;size:17;weight:bold" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" text="&#34;HH&#34;" width="100" />
<t:clock id="g_18" align="center" clockformat="time(HH)" font="family:Courier New;size:17;weight:bold" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_19" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:label id="g_21" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Date formatting" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:label id="g_23" text="dateShort" width="100" />
<t:clock id="g_24" align="center" clockformat="dateShort" font="family:Courier New;size:17;weight:bold" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_25" >
<t:label id="g_26" text="dateMedium" width="100" />
<t:clock id="g_27" align="center" clockformat="dateMedium" font="family:Courier New;size:17;weight:bold" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_28" >
<t:label id="g_29" text="dateLong" width="100" />
<t:clock id="g_30" align="center" clockformat="dateLong" font="family:Courier New;size:17;weight:bold" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_31" >
<t:label id="g_32" text="&#34;yyyy-MM-dd&#34;" width="100" />
<t:clock id="g_33" align="center" clockformat="date(yyyy-MM-dd)" font="family:Courier New;size:17;weight:bold" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_34" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_35" >
<t:label id="g_36" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Date-time formatting" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_37" >
<t:label id="g_38" text="Medium" width="100" />
<t:clock id="g_39" align="center" clockformat="datetimeMedium" font="family:Courier New;size:17;weight:bold" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_40" >
<t:label id="g_41" text="&#34;MM-dd HH-mm&#34;" width="100" />
<t:clock id="g_42" align="center" clockformat="datetime(MM-dd HH-mm)" font="family:Courier New;size:17;weight:bold" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_43" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_44" >
<t:label id="g_45" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Stopwatch" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_46" >
<t:label id="g_47" text="timeLong" width="100" />
<t:clock id="g_48" align="center" clockformat="timeLong" font="family:Courier New;size:17;weight:bold" startat="0" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_49" >
<t:label id="g_50" text="stopwatch" width="100" />
<t:clock id="g_51" align="center" clockformat="stopwatch" font="family:Courier New;size:17;weight:bold" startat="0" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_52" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_53" >
<t:label id="g_54" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Countdown" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_55" >
<t:label id="g_56" text="timeLong" width="100" />
<t:clock id="g_57" align="center" clockformat="timeLong" font="family:Courier New;size:17;weight:bold" startat="10000" startatcountdown="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_58" >
<t:label id="g_59" text="countdown" width="100" />
<t:clock id="g_60" align="center" clockformat="countdown" font="family:Courier New;size:17;weight:bold" startat="10000" startatcountdown="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_61" >
<t:label id="g_62" text="Embedded" width="100" />
<t:clock id="g_63" align="center" clockformat="countdown" embeddingtext="This is the time ${value} which is currently remaining." startat="10000" startatcountdown="true" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoClock}")

public class DemoClock
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoClock(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("clock");
    }
}

Count down / up

You may set attribute STARTAT to a certain value (in milliseconds). The clock will then count relative to this value.

By setting STARTATCOUNTDOWN to "true" the clock will count downwards from the value of STARTAT on.

By triggering a reset via attribute RESETTRIGGER the clock will switch back to the value of STARTAT.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoClockStartAt}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Start at 0" width="150+" />
<t:clock id="g_4" clockformat="timeMedium" resettrigger="#{d.DemoClockStartAt.resetTrigger}" startat="0" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Start at 10" width="150+" />
<t:clock id="g_7" clockformat="timeMedium" resettrigger="#{d.DemoClockStartAt.resetTrigger}" startat="10000" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Start at 10, count down" width="150+" />
<t:clock id="g_10" clockformat="timeMedium" resettrigger="#{d.DemoClockStartAt.resetTrigger}" startat="10000" startatcountdown="true" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_11" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:button id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoClockStartAt.onResetAction}" text="Reset" width="100+" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoClockStartAt}")

public class DemoClockStartAt
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoClockStartAt(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democlockstartat.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoClockStartAt}"; }

    Trigger m_resetTrigger = new Trigger();
    public Trigger getResetTrigger() { return m_resetTrigger; }

    public void onResetAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_resetTrigger.trigger();
    }

}

Scheduling

Schedule Component
