    int m_status = STATUS_FILTER;
    Trigger m_rotationTrigger = new Trigger();
    String m_rotationDirection;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoCubeRotatorForLists(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democuberotatorforlists.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoCubeRotatorForLists}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getCubeImage() 
    { 
        switch (m_status)
        {
            case STATUS_FILTER:
                return IMAGE_TOP;
            case STATUS_LIST:
                return IMAGE_LEFT;
            case STATUS_DETAIL:
                return IMAGE_RIGHT;
            default:
                return null;
        } 
    }

    public boolean getRenderedRight() { return m_status == STATUS_DETAIL; }
    public boolean getRenderedLeft() { return m_status == STATUS_LIST; }
    public boolean getRenderedTop() { return m_status == STATUS_FILTER; }

    public String getRotationDirection() { return m_rotationDirection; }
    public void setRotationDirection(String value) { this.m_rotationDirection = value; }

    public Trigger getRotationTrigger() { return m_rotationTrigger; }

    public CCDataGridView2<Person> getGrdiView() { return m_grdiView; }
    public Person getSelectedPerson() { return m_selectedPerson; }

    public void onRightAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (m_status == STATUS_FILTER)
            rotate("up");
        if (m_status == STATUS_LIST)
            rotate("left");
        m_status = STATUS_DETAIL;
    }

    public void onLeftAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (m_status == STATUS_FILTER)
            rotate("up");
        if (m_status == STATUS_DETAIL)
            rotate("right");
        m_status = STATUS_LIST;
    }

    public void onTopAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        rotate("down");
        m_status = STATUS_FILTER;
    }

    public void onShowListAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        rotate("up");
        fillGridView();
        m_status = STATUS_LIST;
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void fillGridView()
    {
        int size = new Random().nextInt(300);
        List<Person> ps = new ArrayList<Person>();
        for (int i=0; i<size; i++)
        {
            Person p = RandomLogic.createPerson();
            ps.add(p);
        }
        m_grdiView.prepare(ps,new CCDataGridView2.DefaultListener<Person>()
        {
            @Override
            public void reactOnGridExecute(Person object)
            {
                showDetailOfPerson(object);
            }
        });
    }

    protected void showDetailOfPerson(Person object)
    {
        rotate("left");
        m_status = STATUS_DETAIL;
        m_selectedPerson = object;
    }

    private void rotate(String direction)
    {
        m_rotationTrigger.trigger();
        m_rotationDirection = direction;
    }
    
}

Cube rotation - Turning pages

This demo shows how to use the CUBEROTATOR component for turning pages.

Use the "Next" and "Previous" button to navigate through the pages.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoCubeRotatorPageTurning}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoCubeRotatorPageTurning}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:overlayarea id="g_7" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:overlayareabaseitem id="g_8" >
<t:cuberotator id="g_2" height="100%" rotationdirection="#{d.DemoCubeRotatorPageTurning.direction}" rotationtrigger="#{d.DemoCubeRotatorPageTurning.trigger}" width="100%" >
<t:box id="g_5" height="100%" padding="0" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" stylevariant="ccexposed" width="100%" >
<t:rowpagebeaninclude id="g_13" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoCubeRotatorPageTurning.contentBean}" shownullcontent="true" />
</t:box>
</t:cuberotator>
</t:overlayareabaseitem>
<t:overlayareaitem id="g_9" boundsanchor="rightbottom" x="100%-20" y="100%-20" zindex="2" >
<t:box id="g_10" border="#00000010" padding="10" stylevariant="ccexposed" >
<t:row id="g_11" coldistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultcoldistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:button id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoCubeRotatorPageTurning.onPrevAction}" hotkey="alt-80" image="/images/iconssvg/navigatePrevious_16x16.svg" imageheight="32" imagewidth="32" width="60" />
<t:button id="g_18" actionListener="#{d.DemoCubeRotatorPageTurning.onNextAction}" hotkey="alt-78" image="/images/iconssvg/navigateNext_16x16.svg" imageheight="32" imagewidth="32" width="60" />
</t:row>
</t:box>
</t:overlayareaitem>
</t:overlayarea>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.List;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.IPageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoCubeRotatorPageTurning}")

public class DemoCubeRotatorPageTurning
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    List<IPageBean> m_pageBeans = new ArrayList<IPageBean>();
    int m_index = 0;
    String m_direction;
    Trigger m_trigger = new Trigger();
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoCubeRotatorPageTurning(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        m_pageBeans.add(new DemoHelloWorld(workpageDispatcher));
        m_pageBeans.add(new DemoMinispread(workpageDispatcher));
        m_pageBeans.add(new DemoBudget(workpageDispatcher));
        m_pageBeans.add(new DemoPojoPersonList(workpageDispatcher));
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democuberotatorpageturning.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoCubeRotatorPageTurning}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public IPageBean getContentBean() 
    { 
        return m_pageBeans.get(m_index % m_pageBeans.size()); 
    }

    public void onPrevAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_direction = "right";
        m_trigger.trigger();
        m_index--;
        if (m_index < 0)
            m_index = m_pageBeans.size()-1;
    }

    public void onNextAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_direction = "left";
        m_trigger.trigger();
        m_index++;
        if (m_index >= m_pageBeans.size())
            m_index = 0;
    }

    public String getDirection() { return m_direction; }
    public void setDirection(String value) { this.m_direction = value; }

    public Trigger getTrigger() { return m_trigger; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

"Flying in" updated content

Press the buttons one the left one after the other and view the animation.

Whenever you update the content of the FLYINCONTENTAREA then you may invoke a trigger.

As consequence the updated content of the area "flies" into its position by some animation.

The point to start the animation from can be defined by the definition in attribute STARTPOINT. There are two notations supported currently:

1. component(...id...) - from the center of the component
2. point(x,y) - from an absolute coordinate

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoFlyInContentArea1}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoFlyInContentArea1}" >
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:overlayarea id="g_37" background="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@backgroundColorBlue@&#39;]}" border="left:1;right:0;top:1;bottom:1;color:#C0C0C0" height="100%" >
<t:overlayareaitem id="g_38" height="100%" x="0" y="0" >
<t:paintarea id="g_39" height="100%" width="210" >
<t:paintarealineitem id="g_40" arrowto="1" bounds="50%;10%;0;80%" linecolor="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@baseColor@&#39;]}" linesize="4" />
</t:paintarea>
</t:overlayareaitem>
<t:overlayareaitem id="g_41" height="100%" x="0" y="0" zindex="2" >
<t:pane id="g_42" height="100%" padding="left:30;right:30" rowdistance="40" >
<t:rowdistance id="g_43" height="100%" />
<t:row id="g_44" >
<t:button id="HELLOWORLD" actionListener="#{d.DemoFlyInContentArea1.onHelloWorld}" height="80" shadow="hoffset:3;voffset:3;blur:3;color:#C0C0C0" text="1. Hello World!" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_45" >
<t:button id="MINISPREAD" actionListener="#{d.DemoFlyInContentArea1.onMiniSpread}" height="80" reference="MINISPREAD" shadow="hoffset:3;voffset:3;blur:3;color:#C0C0C0" text="2. Mini Spreadsheet" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_46" >
<t:button id="BUDGET" actionListener="#{d.DemoFlyInContentArea1.onBudget}" height="80" reference="BUDGET" shadow="hoffset:3;voffset:3;blur:3;color:#C0C0C0" text="3. Budget" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_47" height="100%" />
</t:pane>
</t:overlayareaitem>
</t:overlayarea>
<t:flyincontentarea id="g_35" height="100%" startpoint="#{d.DemoFlyInContentArea1.startPoint}" trigger="#{d.DemoFlyInContentArea1.trigger}" width="100%" >
<t:pane id="g_18" background="#FFC0C0" border="#C0C0C0" >
<t:rowpagebeaninclude id="g_11" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoFlyInContentArea1.contentBean}" shownullcontent="true" />
</t:pane>
</t:flyincontentarea>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.Map;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.IPageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoFlyInContentArea1}")

public class DemoFlyInContentArea1
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_startPoint;
    IPageBean m_contentBean;
    Trigger m_trigger = new Trigger();
    
    Map<Class,IPageBean> m_beans = new HashMap<Class,IPageBean>(); 
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoFlyInContentArea1(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        {
            DemoHelloWorld bean = new DemoHelloWorld(workpageDispatcher);
            bean.setDocuRendered(false);
            m_beans.put(bean.getClass(),bean);
        }
        {
            DemoBudget bean = new DemoBudget(workpageDispatcher);
            bean.setDocuRendered(false);
            m_beans.put(bean.getClass(),bean);
        }
        {
            DemoMinispread bean = new DemoMinispread(workpageDispatcher);
            bean.setDocuRendered(false);
            m_beans.put(bean.getClass(),bean);
        }
        onHelloWorld(null);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoflyincontentarea1.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoFlyInContentArea1}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getStartPoint() { return m_startPoint; }
    public IPageBean getContentBean() { return m_contentBean; }

    public void onBudget(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_trigger.trigger();
        m_contentBean = m_beans.get(DemoBudget.class);
        m_startPoint = "component(BUDGET)"; // Id of button
    }

    public void onMiniSpread(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_trigger.trigger();
        m_contentBean = m_beans.get(DemoMinispread.class);
        m_startPoint = "component(MINISPREAD)"; // Id of button
    }

    public void onHelloWorld(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_trigger.trigger();
        m_contentBean = m_beans.get(DemoHelloWorld.class);
        m_startPoint = "component(HELLOWORLD)"; // Id of button
    }

    public Trigger getTrigger() { return m_trigger; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

2D transformations (rotating, skewing)

There is a new attribute TRANSFORM which is available for many controls and which allows to apply 2D transformations.

The transformations are directly passed into the CSS-transform-style-attribute. Typical values are "rotate(...deg)", "skewX(...deg)", "skewY(...deg)", skew(...deg,...deg)".

The control itself is positioned at its "normal" position and then is transformed accordingly. Sometimes you have to make sure that the physical screen space around the transformed control is sufficient. In this case you may position a PANE with some PADDING around.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoTransform}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTransform}" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:pane id="g_8" height="100%" padding="50" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_2" height="100%" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" stylevariant="ccexposed" text="Transform Demo" transform="rotate(-5deg)" width="100%;300" >
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:field id="g_7" labeltext="Some field" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:field id="g_13" labeltext="Some field" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:field id="g_15" labeltext="Some field" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:checkbox id="g_22" labeltext="Some checkbox" text="Some checkbox" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_16" height="100%" />
<t:row id="g_9" coldistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultcoldistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:button id="g_18" text="Some button" width="150+" />
<t:button id="g_20" text="Some button" width="150+" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTransform}")

public class DemoTransform
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoTransform(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotransform.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoTransform}"; }
}

Camera / take photo

The CAMERA component shows what is currently is recorded by the web camera. By pressing the "snap"-button, the current image is sent to the server side in its original camera resolution.

The CAMERA component requires some explicit activation by the user for security reasons. It is NOT available on Internet Explorer 10/11.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoCamera}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:camera id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoCamera.onCameraAction}" devicesorting="environment" height="100%" width="100%" trigger="#{d.DemoCamera.trigger}" withsnapicon="#{d.DemoCamera.withSnapIcon}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_5" text="Capturing" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:checkbox id="g_7" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoCamera.withSnapIcon}" text="With snap icon" />
<t:coldistance id="g_8" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoCamera.onTriggerSnapAction}" text="Take photo via button" width="100+" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:coldistance id="g_11" width="50%" />
<t:label id="g_12" text="Captured image" />
<t:coldistance id="g_13" width="50%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:coldistance id="g_15" width="50%" />
<t:image id="g_16" height="100" image="#{d.DemoCamera.capturedImageURL}" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_17" width="50%" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventCameraSnap;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.tempfile.TempFileManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoCamera}")

public class DemoCamera
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    boolean m_withSnapIcon = true;
    public boolean getWithSnapIcon() { return m_withSnapIcon; }
    public void setWithSnapIcon(boolean value) { this.m_withSnapIcon = value; }

    public void onTriggerSnapAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_trigger.trigger();
    }

    Trigger m_trigger = new Trigger();
    public Trigger getTrigger() { return m_trigger; }

    String m_capturedImageURL = null;
    
    public DemoCamera(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democamera.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoCamera}"; }

    public String getCapturedImageURL() { return m_capturedImageURL; }

    public void onCameraAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventCameraSnap)
        {
            BaseActionEventCameraSnap e = (BaseActionEventCameraSnap)event;
            byte[] bytes = e.getPNGImageBytes();
            m_capturedImageURL = TempFileManager.saveTempFile("capturedImage.png",bytes);
        }
    }
}

Camera / record videos

The CAMERARECORDER component allows to record content of the user's camera.

Pay attention: it is only usable in https-scenarios for security reasons! (For development reasons it is also supported for localhost-scenarios.)

The video recording produces a ".webm" file containing both the video and the audio stream. The file is sent to the server by the same upload mechanism that is used for transferring big files in the area of managing client file uploads: the big file is divided into parts, so that network upload limits ("max post size") are avoided.

After successful upload an action "AsynchronousUploadFinished" is triggered on server side.

The photo function ("snap") is the same as with the normal CAMERA component.

We have to add: the component was born out of business requirements! So the primary reason was not to add a "vlog component"... The concrete use case is: in some industries (e.g. insurances) the user can sign a contract by recording his "yes!" as video.

There are many other cases as well: recording a video of a technical problem to send it to maintenance. Record some behavior in medical applications. Etc. Etc.!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoCameraVideoRecording}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoCameraVideoRecording}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:coldistance id="g_22" width="150" />
<t:textpane id="g_12" text="Before starting this demo: in this demo a video of your web camera content will be recorded and uploaded to our demo server. - The video will be removed immediately when you end the session, e.g. by closing the browser or by moving on to another web page. During your session the video is stored in a directory which can only be accessed by your session - and no one&#39;s parallel session. - Nevertheless we recommend to never show private content!" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_15" text="Camera recorder" width="150" />
<t:camerarecorder id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoCameraVideoRecording.onCameraRecorderAction}" asynchronousuploadurl="#{d.DemoCameraVideoRecording.uploadURL}" height="400" maxfilesize="4000000" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_35" >
<t:coldistance id="g_36" width="150" />
<t:textpane id="g_37" text="Press the photo button in order to take snap shots. Or press the camera button to start recording a video - and then use the red &#34;stop&#34; button to end recording." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_18" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_30" text="Uploaded video" width="150" />
<t:coldistance id="g_10" width="100%" />
<t:video id="g_20" height="200" videosrc="#{d.DemoCameraVideoRecording.videoLink}" width="200" />
<t:coldistance id="g_24" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_31" >
<t:coldistance id="g_32" width="150" />
<t:coldistance id="g_25" width="100%" />
<t:filedownloadbutton id="g_5" enabled="#{d.DemoCameraVideoRecording.videoLinkEnabled}" text="Download video" url="#{d.DemoCameraVideoRecording.videoLink}" width="150+" />
<t:coldistance id="g_26" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_33" text="Uploaded photo" width="150" />
<t:coldistance id="g_27" width="100%" />
<t:image id="g_16" height="200" image="#{d.DemoCameraVideoRecording.imageLink}" width="200" />
<t:coldistance id="g_28" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.bufferedcontent.DefaultUploadContent;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.bufferedcontent.UploadContentMgr;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventCameraSnap;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventUploadAsynchronousFinished;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.HttpSessionAccess;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.tempfile.TempFileManager;
import org.eclnt.util.file.FileManager;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.UniqueIdCreator;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoCameraVideoRecording}")
public class DemoCameraVideoRecording
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /*
     * Pay attention: all methods are processed in some own upload thread which is
     * NOT the main request/response thread!
     */
    public class MyUploadContent extends DefaultUploadContent
    {
        @Override
        public void beginPassing()
        {
        }
        @Override
        public void passClientFile(String clientFileName, byte[] content)
        {
            // the file is written to a temporary file - it is NOT kept in memory in order
            // to prevent memory overload
            m_currentClientFileName = clientFileName;
            m_currentFileName = s_directory + UniqueIdCreator.createUUID() + "_" + clientFileName;
            FileManager.ensureDirectoryForFileExists(m_currentFileName);
            FileManager.writeFile(m_currentFileName,content,true);
        }
        @Override
        public void endPassing()
        {
        }
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public static String s_directory;
    String m_currentClientFileName;
    String m_currentFileName;
    MyUploadContent m_uploadContent;
    String m_imageLink;
    String m_videoLink;
    boolean m_videoLinkEnabled = false;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    static
    {
        s_directory = HttpSessionAccess.getServletTempDirectory() + "/videorecordings/";
        s_directory = ValueManager.encodeIntoValidFileName(s_directory,true);
    }
    
    public DemoCameraVideoRecording(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        m_uploadContent = new MyUploadContent();
        UploadContentMgr.add(m_uploadContent);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/democameravideorecording.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoCameraVideoRecording}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getUploadURL() { return m_uploadContent.getURL(); }

    public void onCameraRecorderAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventUploadAsynchronousFinished)
        {
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Upload of video is finished. File stored as: " + this.m_currentFileName);
            byte[] videoBytes = FileManager.readFile(m_currentFileName,true);
            // @data protection: the TempFileManager creates one directory per content, the name of the 
            // directory is created using secure random id algorithms. Only the current user session
            // knows about this directory - it is not visible to other sessions. The content is removed
            // automatically when the dialog session ends.
            m_videoLink = TempFileManager.saveTempFile(this.m_currentClientFileName,videoBytes);
            // @data protection: explicitly delete video after it is moved to file manager
            FileManager.deleteFile(m_currentFileName);
            m_videoLinkEnabled = true;
        }
        else if (event instanceof BaseActionEventCameraSnap)
        {
            BaseActionEventCameraSnap e =(BaseActionEventCameraSnap)event;
            byte[] image = e.getPNGImageBytes();
            m_imageLink = TempFileManager.saveTempFile("uploadedImage.png",image);
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Upload of image is finished.");
        }
    }

    public String getImageLink() { return m_imageLink; }
    public String getVideoLink() { return m_videoLink; }
    public boolean getVideoLinkEnabled() { return m_videoLinkEnabled; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Video

Playing videos

The VIDEO component is a representation of the HTML "video" element - and plays videos.

Please pay attention: check the documentation of the HTML "video" element in order to find the exact video formats that are supported on various platforms!

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoVideo}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Some video examples" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_5" flush="true" group="MOVIES" refvalue="/videos/sample.webm" text="/videos/sample.webm" value="#{d.DemoVideo.videoSrc}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_7" flush="true" group="MOVIES" refvalue="http://www.html5videoplayer.net/videos/toystory.mp4" text="http://www.html5videoplayer.net/videos/toystory.mp4" value="#{d.DemoVideo.videoSrc}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_9" flush="true" group="MOVIES" refvalue="http://mirrors.standaloneinstaller.com/video-sample/jellyfish-25-mbps-hd-hevc.mp4" text="http://mirrors.standaloneinstaller.com/video-sample/jellyfish-25-mbps-hd-hevc.mp4" value="#{d.DemoVideo.videoSrc}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:pane id="g_12" border="#808080" height="300" width="400" >
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:video id="g_14" height="100%" videosrc="#{d.DemoVideo.videoSrc}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_15" />
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:label id="g_17" align="center" cutwidth="true" font="size:10" text="#{d.DemoVideo.videoSrc}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoVideo}")

public class DemoVideo
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_videoSrc ="/videos/sample.webm";

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoVideo(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demovideo.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoVideo}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getVideoSrc() { return m_videoSrc; }
    public void setVideoSrc(String value) { this.m_videoSrc = value; }


    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Videos with subtitles ("tracks")

Below the VIDEO component you may place one or several TRACK elements - e.g. for adding sub-titles to the video.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoVideoWithTrack}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoVideoWithTrack}">
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:video id="g_4" height="100%" videosrc="/videos/sample.webm" width="100%" >
<t:track id="g_5" default="true" kind="subtitles" label="Subtitles for video" src="/videos/sample.vtt" srclang="en" />
</t:video>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoVideoWithTrack}")

public class DemoVideoWithTrack
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoVideoWithTrack(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demovideowithtrack.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoVideoWithTrack}"; }

}

Explicit control

There are certain attributes which enable you to directly take over control over the VIDEO component:

(.) WITHCONTROLS - if set to "false" then the component will not show any inner controls, which are normally shown to play/pause a video
(.) PLAYTRIGGER/PAUSETRIGGER - if triggered then the component will react correspondingly. As result you can completely control the component by your application logic.

You may get event-notifications about the component's inner activities by defining attribute MEDIAEVENTFILTER. Here you define these event names you are interested in as semicolon separated list. The events are "ended", "play" and "pause".

If an event occurs then the ACTIONLISTENER of the component is called - passing the event via method "getMessage()".

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoVideoDetails}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoVideoDetails}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_3" coldistance="10" >
<t:coldistance id="g_4" width="100%" />
<t:pane id="g_5" background="#00000010" border="#00000030" padding="5" rowalignmenty="top" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Without controls" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:video id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoVideoDetails.onVideoAction}" height="240" mediaeventfilter="ended;play;pause" pausetrigger="#{d.DemoVideoDetails.pauseTrigger}" playtrigger="#{d.DemoVideoDetails.playTrigger}" videosrc="/videos/sample.webm" width="320" withcontrols="false" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" coldistance="5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_11" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoVideoDetails.onPlayAction}" text="Play" width="100+" />
<t:button id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoVideoDetails.onPauseAction}" text="Pause" width="100+" />
<t:coldistance id="g_14" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
<t:coldistance id="g_15" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_16" height="50" />
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:textarea id="g_18" enabled="false" height="100%;150" labeltext="Event log (newst event at top)" text="#{d.DemoVideoDetails.eventProtocol}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_19" height="20" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventMediaPlayer;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoVideoDetails}")

public class DemoVideoDetails
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_eventProtocol = "";
    boolean m_withPlayerControls = true;
    Trigger m_pauseTrigger = new Trigger();
    Trigger m_playTrigger = new Trigger();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoVideoDetails(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demovideodetails.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoVideoDetails}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onVideoAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventMediaPlayer)
        {
            BaseActionEventMediaPlayer e = (BaseActionEventMediaPlayer)event;
            m_eventProtocol = e.getMessage() + "\n" + m_eventProtocol;
        }
    }

    public String getEventProtocol() { return m_eventProtocol; }

    public boolean getWithPlayerControls() { return m_withPlayerControls; }
    public void setWithPlayerControls(boolean value) { this.m_withPlayerControls = value; }

    public void onPauseAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) { m_pauseTrigger.trigger(); }
    public void onPlayAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) { m_playTrigger.trigger(); }

    public Trigger getPauseTrigger() { return m_pauseTrigger; }

    public Trigger getPlayTrigger() { return m_playTrigger; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Playing Youtube movies

This demo just shows how to use the BROWSER component to render Youtube-videos.

Each Youtube-video can be embedde via a URL. The BROWSER component internally opens up an HTML "iframe" instance, in which the URL is opened.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoYoutube}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_3" flush="true" group="LINK" refvalue="https://www.youtube.com/embed/N_rOS7a7JO0" text="Hot Deployment" value="#{d.DemoYoutube.youtubeLink}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_5" flush="true" group="LINK" refvalue="https://www.youtube.com/embed/D27cv5GPASs" text="Creating a Gradle project" value="#{d.DemoYoutube.youtubeLink}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" rendered="false" >
<t:radiobutton id="g_7" flush="true" group="LINK" refvalue="https://www.youtube.com/embed/8Q0WwIWOri8" text="Web UI for Business Applications" value="#{d.DemoYoutube.youtubeLink}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:browser id="g_10" allowfullscreen="true" height="350" url="#{d.DemoYoutube.youtubeLink}" width="500" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" align="center" font="size:10" text="#{d.DemoYoutube.youtubeLink}" width="500" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoYoutube}")

public class DemoYoutube
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    String m_youtubeLink = "https://www.youtube.com/embed/N_rOS7a7JO0";
    
    public DemoYoutube(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoyoutube.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoYoutube}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getYoutubeLink() { return m_youtubeLink; }
    public void setYoutubeLink(String value) { this.m_youtubeLink = value; }

}

Touch Screen

Touch field

The TOUCHFIELD component allows to input a string value by using a touch field.

There is an attribute TOUCHLAYOUT by which you can reference to client side touch-keyboard layout definitions.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTouchField}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Input value by TOUCHFIELD:" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_4" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:touchfield id="g_6" height="220" value="#{d.DemoTouchField.value}" width="500" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_7" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="...or via field:" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_10" flush="true" text="#{d.DemoTouchField.value}" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTouchField}")

public class DemoTouchField 
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public DemoTouchField(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("touchfield");
    }
    
    protected String m_value = "ABCD";
    public String getValue() { return m_value; }
    public void setValue(String value) { m_value = value; }
}

Numeric field

The component TOUCHFIELDNUMERIC allows to input a number by touch keyboard.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTouch}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Value via Touch Field" width="150" />
<t:touchfieldnumeric id="g_4" flush="true" height="200" value="#{d.DemoTouch.numericValue}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_5" />
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:label id="g_7" text="Value via Text Field" width="150" />
<t:field id="g_8" flush="true" rowalignmenty="top" text="#{d.DemoTouch.numericValue}" width="100%" />
<t:coldistance id="g_9" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.math.BigDecimal;

import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoTouch extends PageBean
{
    BigDecimal m_numericValue = new BigDecimal("100");
    
    public DemoTouch(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("touchfieldnumeric");
    }
    
    public void setNumericValue(BigDecimal value) { m_numericValue = value; }
    public BigDecimal getNumericValue() { return m_numericValue; }
}

Field with touch popup

The normal FIELD and FORMATTEDFIELD component provides touch support as well. When defining attribute TOUCHSUPPORT as true, then a corresponding touch pad is opended when the user clicks onto the field component.

The window that is popped up can either be closed by explicitly pressing the OK button, or by clicking anywhere else onto the screen.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTouchOnField}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="First Name" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_4" text="#{d.DemoTouchOnField.firstName}" touchsupport="true" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Last Name" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_7" text="#{d.DemoTouchOnField.lastName}" touchopenonfocus="true" touchsupport="true" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="Shoe Size" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_11" format="int" touchsupport="true" value="#{d.DemoTouchOnField.shoeSize}" width="50" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="Weight" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_14" format="bigdecimal" formatmask="dec2" touchsupport="true" value="#{d.DemoTouchOnField.weight}" width="50" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_16" text="Password" width="100" />
<t:password id="g_17" text="#{d.DemoTouchOnField.password}" touchlayout="qwert" touchsupport="true" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" text="Text Area" width="100" />
<t:textarea id="g_20" height="60" text="#{d.DemoTouchOnField.comment}" touchsupport="true" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_21" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:coldistance id="g_23" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_24" actionListener="#{d.DemoTouchOnField.onOK}" text="OK" width="80" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.ClientTestLog;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.IClientLogAware;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTouchOnField}")

public class DemoTouchOnField 
    extends PageBean
    implements IClientLogAware
{
    protected String m_comment = "Some comment...";
    public String getComment() { return m_comment; }
    public void setComment(String value) { m_comment = value; }

    protected String m_password;
    public String getPassword() { return m_password; }
    public void setPassword(String value) { m_password = value; }

    public DemoTouchOnField(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("field");
    }

    protected float m_weight = 80.5f;
    public float getWeight() { return m_weight; }
    public void setWeight(float value) { m_weight = value; }

    protected int m_shoeSize = 40;
    public int getShoeSize() { return m_shoeSize; }
    public void setShoeSize(int value) { m_shoeSize = value; }

    protected String m_firstName  = "Captain";
    public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
    public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
    
    protected String m_lastName  = "Casa";
    public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }
    public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
    
    public void onOK(ActionEvent event)
    {
        String result = m_firstName + "/" +
                        m_lastName + "/" +
                        m_shoeSize + "/" +
                        m_password;
        Statusbar.outputSuccess(result);
    }
    
    public boolean onCreateClientTestLogMessage()
    {
        String result = m_firstName + "/" +
                        m_lastName + "/" +
                        m_shoeSize + "/" +
                        m_password;
        ClientTestLog.addClientTestLogMessage(result);
        return true;
    }
}

Point of Sales

This example shows some point of sales functions that take use of touchscreen components.

Click on one of the article images on the left. A corresponding item will be generated. You may update the quantity by again clicking onto the article or by using the numeric touch keyboard.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPos}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:coldistance id="g_3" width="50%" />
<t:colline id="g_4" background="#00000080" height="100%" width="2" />
<t:pane id="g_5" height="100%" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:pane id="g_7" padding="top:0;left:10;right:10;bottom:10" >
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:icon id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoPos.articles[0].onAction}" image="#{d.DemoPos.articles[0].image}" />
<t:icon id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoPos.articles[1].onAction}" image="#{d.DemoPos.articles[1].image}" />
<t:icon id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoPos.articles[2].onAction}" image="#{d.DemoPos.articles[2].image}" />
<t:icon id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoPos.articles[3].onAction}" image="#{d.DemoPos.articles[3].image}" />
<t:icon id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoPos.articles[4].onAction}" image="#{d.DemoPos.articles[4].image}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:icon id="g_15" actionListener="#{d.DemoPos.articles[5].onAction}" image="#{d.DemoPos.articles[5].image}" />
<t:icon id="g_16" actionListener="#{d.DemoPos.articles[6].onAction}" image="#{d.DemoPos.articles[6].image}" />
<t:icon id="g_17" actionListener="#{d.DemoPos.articles[7].onAction}" image="#{d.DemoPos.articles[7].image}" />
<t:icon id="g_18" actionListener="#{d.DemoPos.articles[8].onAction}" image="#{d.DemoPos.articles[8].image}" />
<t:icon id="g_19" actionListener="#{d.DemoPos.articles[9].onAction}" image="#{d.DemoPos.articles[9].image}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:icon id="g_21" actionListener="#{d.DemoPos.articles[10].onAction}" image="#{d.DemoPos.articles[10].image}" />
<t:icon id="g_22" actionListener="#{d.DemoPos.articles[11].onAction}" image="#{d.DemoPos.articles[11].image}" />
<t:icon id="g_23" actionListener="#{d.DemoPos.articles[12].onAction}" image="#{d.DemoPos.articles[12].image}" />
<t:icon id="g_24" actionListener="#{d.DemoPos.articles[13].onAction}" image="#{d.DemoPos.articles[13].image}" />
<t:icon id="g_25" actionListener="#{d.DemoPos.articles[14].onAction}" image="#{d.DemoPos.articles[14].image}" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_26" background="#00000080" height="2" />
<t:row id="g_27" >
<t:pane id="g_28" height="100%" padding="top:10;left:10;right:10" rendered="#{d.DemoPos.itemAvailable}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_29" >
<t:label id="g_30" text="Article" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_31" text="#{d.DemoPos.selRow.article.name}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_32" >
<t:coldistance id="g_33" width="120" />
<t:image id="g_34" image="#{d.DemoPos.selRow.article.image}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_35" >
<t:label id="g_36" text="Quantity" width="120" />
<t:field id="g_37" flush="true" text="#{d.DemoPos.selRow.quantity}" width="50" />
<t:coldistance id="g_38" />
<t:label id="g_39" text="#{d.DemoPos.selRow.article.uom}" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_40" >
<t:label id="g_41" text="Price (each)" width="120" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_42" format="bigdecimal" value="#{d.DemoPos.selRow.article.price}" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_43" />
<t:label id="g_44" text="" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_45" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_46" >
<t:label id="g_47" text="Price" width="120" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_48" font="size:14;weight:bold" format="bigdecimal" value="#{d.DemoPos.selRow.price}" width="100" />
<t:coldistance id="g_49" />
<t:label id="g_50" text="" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_51" height="100%" />
<t:row id="g_52" >
<t:coldistance id="g_53" width="120" />
<t:button id="g_54" actionListener="#{d.DemoPos.onRemove}" text="Remove" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
<t:colline id="g_55" background="#00000080" height="100%" width="2" />
<t:pane id="g_56" height="100%" width="250" >
<t:row id="g_57" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_58" border="top:0;left:0;right:0;bottom:0" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPos.rows}" sbvisibleamount="20" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_59" text="Name" width="100%" >
<t:field id="g_60" border="top:0" enabled="false" text=".{article.name}" height="100%" width="100%" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_61" width="25" >
<t:image id="g_62" image=".{article.image}" keepratio="false" height="100%" width="25" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_63" text="Price" width="45" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_64" align="right" format="bigdecimal" value=".{price}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_65" text="Qty" width="30" >
<t:field id="g_66" align="right" text=".{quantity}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_67" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_68" align="right" font="size:20;weight:bold" format="bigdecimal" value="#{d.DemoPos.total}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_69" background="#00000080" height="2" />
<t:row id="g_70" >
<t:pane id="g_71" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_72" >
<t:touchfieldnumeric id="g_73" flush="true" height="200" value="#{d.DemoPos.selRow.quantity}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:pane>
<t:colline id="g_74" background="#00000080" height="100%" width="2" />
<t:coldistance id="g_75" width="50%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.math.BigDecimal;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPos}")

public class DemoPos
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public class Article implements Serializable
    {
        String i_image;
        BigDecimal i_price;
        String i_name;
        String i_uom;
        public Article(String name, BigDecimal price, String uom, String image)
        {
            super();
            i_name = name;
            i_price = price;
            i_uom = uom;
            i_image = image;
        }
        public String getImage() { return "/images/touch/" + i_image; }
        public BigDecimal getPrice() { return i_price; }
        public String getName() { return i_name; }
        public String getUom() { return i_uom; }
        public void onAction(ActionEvent ae)
        {
            createNewOrderItem(this);
        }
    }
    
    public class OrderItem extends FIXGRIDItem
    {
        Article i_article;
        int i_quantity = 1;
        public OrderItem(Article article)
        {
            i_article = article;
        }
        public Article getArticle() { return i_article; }
        public int getQuantity() { return i_quantity; }
        public void setQuantity(int value) { i_quantity = value; }
        public BigDecimal getPrice()
        {
            return i_article.getPrice().multiply(new BigDecimal(""+i_quantity));
        }
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
            m_selRow = this;
        }
        
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    Article[] m_articles = new Article[15];
    FIXGRIDListBinding<OrderItem> m_rows = new FIXGRIDListBinding<OrderItem>();
    OrderItem m_selRow = null;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoPos(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        m_articles[0] = new Article("Apple",new BigDecimal("0.49"),"Pc","apple.png");
        m_articles[1] = new Article("Orange",new BigDecimal("0.49"),"Pc","orange.png");
        m_articles[2] = new Article("Lemmon",new BigDecimal("0.49"),"Pc","citron.png");
        m_articles[3] = new Article("Kiwi",new BigDecimal("0.49"),"Pc","kiwi.png");
        m_articles[4] = new Article("Strawberry",new BigDecimal("0.49"),"Kg","strawberry.png");
        m_articles[5] = new Article("Raspberry",new BigDecimal("0.49"),"Kg","raspberry.png");
        m_articles[6] = new Article("Melon (water)",new BigDecimal("0.49"),"Pc","watermelon.png");
        m_articles[7] = new Article("Melon (honey)",new BigDecimal("0.49"),"Pc","honeymelon.png");
        m_articles[8] = new Article("Potatoe",new BigDecimal("0.49"),"Pc","potatoe.png");
        m_articles[9] = new Article("Onion",new BigDecimal("0.49"),"Pc","onion.png");
        m_articles[10] = new Article("Salad",new BigDecimal("0.49"),"Pc","salad.png");
        m_articles[11] = new Article("Carrot",new BigDecimal("0.49"),"Pc","carrot.png");
        m_articles[12] = new Article("Tomatoe",new BigDecimal("0.49"),"Pc","tomatoe.png");
        m_articles[13] = new Article("Asparagus (white)",new BigDecimal("0.49"),"Pc","asparaguswhite.png");
        m_articles[14] = new Article("Asparagus (green)",new BigDecimal("0.49"),"Pc","asparagusgreen.png");
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public Article[] getArticles() { return m_articles; }
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<OrderItem> getRows() { return m_rows; }
    public OrderItem getSelRow() { return m_selRow; }
    
    public BigDecimal getTotal()
    {
        BigDecimal result = new BigDecimal("0");
        for (int i=0; i<m_rows.getItems().size(); i++)
        {
            OrderItem oi = m_rows.getItems().get(i);
            result = result.add(oi.getPrice());
        }
        return result;
    }
    
    public void onRemove(ActionEvent ae)
    {
        if (m_selRow != null)
        {
            m_rows.deselectCurrentSelection();
            m_rows.getItems().remove(m_selRow);
            m_selRow = null;
        }
    }
    
    public boolean isItemAvailable()
    {
        if (m_selRow == null)
            return false;
        else
            return true;
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void createNewOrderItem(Article article)
    {
        if (m_selRow != null && m_selRow.getArticle() == article)
        {
            m_selRow.i_quantity++;
        }
        else
        {
            OrderItem oi = new OrderItem(article);
            m_rows.getItems().add(oi);
            m_rows.deselectCurrentSelection();
            m_rows.selectItem(oi);
            m_rows.ensureItemToBeDisplayed(oi);
            m_selRow = oi;
        }
    }
    
    
}

Touch Keyboard Layouts

There are pre-configured layouts for the keyboard user interface that is opened when clicking into a touch-sensitive field: "qwert" and "abc".

You can add own layouts by editing the default file /eclntjsfserver/config/touchlayouts.xml on server side. Please have a look into the template within the same directory for more details.

The client dynamically requests the server layout definition, first trying to access the file "touchlayouts_de.xml" if the client's language setting is "de". If not finding a corresponding file then the file "touchlayouts.xml" is accessed. As consequence you can build up layouts that depend from the language.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTouchLayout}" rowdistance="4" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Default QWERT" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_4" touchlayout="qwert" touchsupport="true" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Default ABC" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_7" touchlayout="abc" touchsupport="true" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="CHN / Cangjie" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_10" touchlayout="cangjie" touchsupport="true" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_11" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:label id="g_13" text="Own layout 1" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_14" touchlayout="owndef" touchsupport="true" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_16" text="Own layout 2" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_17" touchlayout="helloworld" touchsupport="true" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" text="Own layout 3" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_20" touchlayout="datetime" touchsupport="true" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:label id="g_22" text="Own layout 4" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_23" touchlayout="chinese" touchsupport="true" width="100" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

public class DemoTouchLayout extends PageBean
{
    public DemoTouchLayout(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }
}

Touch Grid Navigation

This demo shows how to use buttons for scrolling wihtin a grid. There are two ways to go:

1. use normal buttons and link them to the server side processing
2. use special touch buttons

1. Usage of normal buttons:

On server side there are a couple of default functions available with each FIXGRIDBinding implementation. Within the property "scrollHelper" you find functions that you can simply bind to buttons/icons or other components.

There are two categories of scroll functions:
(1) the "onScroll*"-functions just scroll the list - without any consequence on selected items
(2) the "onSelect*"-functions both scroll the list and select one item

2. Usage of touch buttons

There is a special component type FIXGRIDTOUCHBUTTON. With each definition you define the id of the grid that you refer to and you assign a command associated with the button. So, this is one of the rare cases in which you really have to assign an explicit id to a component (the FIXGRID), because you reference it from other components (the FIXGRIDTOUCHBUTTONs).


In addition you see that there is a special selection mode available for the selection of multiple items: by default you need to press the ctrl- or shift-key and click with the mouse on the items that you want to select. When changing the attribute MULTISELECTMODE then items are selected/deselected by simple clicking (there is no keyboard with touch screens...)

Please also be aware that there is a client start attribute "touch" (not part of this demo). If setting "touch=true" then all scrollbars are magnified by a certain factor so that they are much simpler to use via a touch screen device.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTouchGrid}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Multi Selection" width="100" />
<t:toggle id="g_4" flush="true" selected="#{d.DemoTouchGrid.mutliSelection}" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_5" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:coldistance id="g_7" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.DemoTouchGrid.grid.scrollHelper.onScrollToTop}" contentareafilled="false" doubleclickenabled="true" image="/mirrored(50):/eclntjsfserver/images/scroll_tobegin.png" />
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoTouchGrid.grid.scrollHelper.onScrollPageUp}" contentareafilled="false" doubleclickenabled="true" image="/mirrored(50):/eclntjsfserver/images/scroll_pageup.png" />
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoTouchGrid.grid.scrollHelper.onScrollLineUp}" contentareafilled="false" doubleclickenabled="true" image="/mirrored(50):/eclntjsfserver/images/scroll_lineup.png" />
<t:button id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoTouchGrid.grid.scrollHelper.onScrollLineDown}" contentareafilled="false" doubleclickenabled="true" image="/mirrored(50):/eclntjsfserver/images/scroll_linedown.png" />
<t:button id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoTouchGrid.grid.scrollHelper.onScrollPageDown}" contentareafilled="false" doubleclickenabled="true" image="/mirrored(50):/eclntjsfserver/images/scroll_pagedown.png" />
<t:button id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoTouchGrid.grid.scrollHelper.onScrollToBottom}" contentareafilled="false" doubleclickenabled="true" image="/mirrored(50):/eclntjsfserver/images/scroll_toend.png" />
<t:coldistance id="g_14" width="55" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:fixgrid id="TOUCHGRID" bordercolor="#{ccstylevalue.ccLightBorderColor}" borderheight="1" borderwidth="1" height="100%" horizontalscrollmode="" multiselect="#{d.DemoTouchGrid.mutliSelection}" multiselectmode="1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTouchGrid.grid}" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_16" text="Article Id" width="120" >
<t:label id="g_17" text=".{articleId}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_18" text="Article Id" width="600" >
<t:label id="g_19" text=".{articleText}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
<t:pane id="g_20" background="#00000020" border="#00000030" height="-1000" >
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:fixgridtouchbutton id="g_22" actionListener="#{d.DemoTouchGrid.grid.scrollHelper.onSelectToTop}" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,100%,#FFFFFF00,#FFFFFF50,vertical)" contentareafilled="false" fixgridcommand="scrollToBegin" fixgridid="TOUCHGRID" height="20" image="/eclntjsfserver/images/scroll_tobegin.png" width="50" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_23" background="#00000040" />
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:fixgridtouchbutton id="g_25" actionListener="#{d.DemoTouchGrid.grid.scrollHelper.onSelectPageUp}" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,100%,#FFFFFF00,#FFFFFF50,vertical)" contentareafilled="false" fixgridcommand="scrollPageUp" fixgridid="TOUCHGRID" height="50%" image="/eclntjsfserver/images/scroll_pageup.png" width="50" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_26" background="#00000040" />
<t:row id="g_27" >
<t:fixgridtouchbutton id="g_28" actionListener="#{d.DemoTouchGrid.grid.scrollHelper.onSelectLineDown}" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,100%,#FFFFFF00,#FFFFFF50,vertical)" contentareafilled="false" fixgridcommand="scrollLineUp" fixgridid="TOUCHGRID" height="30" image="/eclntjsfserver/images/scroll_lineup.png" width="50" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_29" background="#00000040" />
<t:row id="g_30" >
<t:pane id="g_31" height="75" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_32" >
<t:fixgridtouchbutton id="g_33" actionListener="#{d.DemoTouchGrid.grid.scrollHelper.onSelectPageUp}" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,100%,#FFFFFF50,#FFFFFF00,horizontal)" contentareafilled="false" fixgridcommand="scrollPageLeft" fixgridid="TOUCHGRID" height="100%" image="/eclntjsfserver/images/control_rewind.png" width="50%" />
<t:colline id="g_34" background="#00000040" height="100%" />
<t:fixgridtouchbutton id="g_35" actionListener="#{d.DemoTouchGrid.grid.scrollHelper.onSelectPageDown}" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,100%,#FFFFFF00,#FFFFFF50,horizontal)" contentareafilled="false" fixgridcommand="scrollPageRight" fixgridid="TOUCHGRID" height="100%" image="/eclntjsfserver/images/control_fastforward.png" width="50%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_36" background="#00000040" />
<t:row id="g_37" >
<t:fixgridtouchbutton id="g_38" actionListener="#{d.DemoTouchGrid.grid.scrollHelper.onSelectLineDown}" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,100%,#FFFFFF00,#FFFFFF50,vertical)" contentareafilled="false" fixgridcommand="scrollLineDown" fixgridid="TOUCHGRID" height="30" image="/eclntjsfserver/images/scroll_linedown.png" width="50" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_39" background="#00000040" />
<t:row id="g_40" >
<t:fixgridtouchbutton id="g_41" actionListener="#{d.DemoTouchGrid.grid.scrollHelper.onSelectPageDown}" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,100%,#FFFFFF00,#FFFFFF50,vertical)" contentareafilled="false" fixgridcommand="scrollPageDown" fixgridid="TOUCHGRID" height="50%" image="/eclntjsfserver/images/scroll_pagedown.png" width="50" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_42" background="#00000040" />
<t:row id="g_43" >
<t:fixgridtouchbutton id="g_44" actionListener="#{d.DemoTouchGrid.grid.scrollHelper.onSelectToBottom}" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,100%,#FFFFFF00,#FFFFFF50,vertical)" contentareafilled="false" fixgridcommand="scrollToEnd" fixgridid="TOUCHGRID" height="20" image="/eclntjsfserver/images/scroll_toend.png" width="50" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTouchGrid}")

public class DemoTouchGrid
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        protected String m_articleText;
        public String getArticleText() { return m_articleText; }
        public void setArticleText(String value) { m_articleText = value; }
        
        protected String m_articleId;
        public String getArticleId() { return m_articleId; }
        public void setArticleId(String value) { m_articleId = value; }
    }
    
    protected boolean m_mutliSelection;
    protected FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    
    public DemoTouchGrid(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        for (int i=0; i<100; i++)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setArticleId("471"+i);
            gi.setArticleText("Text for " + gi.getArticleId());
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
        }
    }

    public boolean getMutliSelection() { return m_mutliSelection; }
    public void setMutliSelection(boolean value) { m_mutliSelection = value; }
    
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }
}

Signature

Sign within the yellow area and then press OK. (If you do not have a touch screen monitor, you have to use your mouse for signing...)

The TOUCHSIGNATURE components allows to directly "draw" lines with the finger or a pen into its sensitive area. The lines are transferred to server side as pixel values - a semicolon separated sequence of coordinates.

The intention of the component is to be used as control for capturing human signatures.

You want to convert the singature-"vector" into an image? Then use class SignatureImageCreator, which directly consukmes the input fomr the TOUCHSIGNATURE component and converts into an image.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTouchSignature}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="Default Resolution (5), enabled - sign here:" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:touchsignature id="g_5" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,100%,#FFFFC0)" flush="true" flushtimer="2000" height="150" pixelresolution="5" pixelvalues="#{d.DemoTouchSignature.pixelValues}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoTouchSignature.onOK}" text="OK" width="80" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_8" height="20" />
<t:rowdistance id="g_9" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:label id="g_11" text="Default Resolution (1), display only" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:touchsignature id="g_13" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,100%,#E0FFE0)" enabled="false" height="30" pixelresolution="1" pixelvalues="#{d.DemoTouchSignature.pixelValues}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" text="Pixel Values" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:textarea id="g_17" enabled="false" height="100" text="#{d.DemoTouchSignature.pixelValues}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTouchSignature}")

public class DemoTouchSignature
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    String m_pixelValues;
    public String getPixelValues() { return m_pixelValues; }
    public void setPixelValues(String value) { this.m_pixelValues = value; }

    public DemoTouchSignature(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        initRefComponent("touchsignature");
    }

    public void onOK(ActionEvent event) {}

}

Keyboard scanner - without field

Either connect a barcode reader (or other device) and scan a value - or type come characters in quick order. When interrupting the keyboard input the key sequence will be sent to the server side.

The KEYBOARDSCANNER is a visible component that receives keyboard input and passes it to the server side if the keyboard input is interrupted for 400ms.

The component is useful for scnearios in which barcodes or other ids are scanned via a technical device that is internally transferring its data into keyboard events.

In order to receive keyboard events the component must be focused. As consequence it provides an attribute REQUSTFOCUSTIMER by which you can define a duration in ms, after which the component tries to request the focus in case of user inactivity.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoKeyboardScanner}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:keyboardscanner id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoKeyboardScanner.onScanAction}" requestfocus="creation" requestfocustimer="5000" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_4" />
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Scanned Value" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_7" enabled="false" text="#{d.DemoKeyboardScanner.scannedValue}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventScan;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoKeyboardScanner}")

public class DemoKeyboardScanner
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_scannedValue;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoKeyboardScanner(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demokeyboardscanner.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoKeyboardScanner}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onScanAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventScan)
        {
            BaseActionEventScan e = (BaseActionEventScan)event;
            m_scannedValue = e.getScannedValue();
        }
    }

    public String getScannedValue() { return m_scannedValue; }
    public void setScannedValue(String value) { this.m_scannedValue = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Keyboard scanner - without field - multiple scans

The KEYBOARDSCANNERMULTISCAN component is able to register several scans on client side - which it collects and then sends to the client in one round-trip.

This component requires some sophisticated definition of time intervals!

(.) the attribute EVENTDELAY is the duration that the client waits after some keyboard input to recognize that a scan is ended.
(.) the attribute MULTISCANDELAY is the duration that the client then waits to check if there is no further, continuous scan.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoKeyboardScannerMultiScan}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoKeyboardScannerMultiScan}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:keyboardscannermultiscan id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoKeyboardScannerMultiScan.onScanAction}" eventdelay="200" multiscandelay="1000" requestfocus="creation" requestfocustimer="5000" />
</t:row>
<t:rowline id="g_9" />
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Scanned Value" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_7" enabled="false" text="#{d.DemoKeyboardScannerMultiScan.scannedValue}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventMultiScan;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoKeyboardScannerMultiScan}")
