public class DemoKeyboardScannerMultiScan
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_scannedValue;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoKeyboardScannerMultiScan(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demokeyboardscanner.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoKeyboardScanner}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public void onScanAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventMultiScan)
        {
            BaseActionEventMultiScan e = (BaseActionEventMultiScan)event;
            m_scannedValue = e.getScannedValuesAsCSV();
            // or use: e.getScannedValues(), that returns String[]
        }
    }

    public String getScannedValue() { return m_scannedValue; }
    public void setScannedValue(String value) { this.m_scannedValue = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Keyboard scanner - with field

The SCANFIELD is a special field variant that is specialized to receive values that are coming from a scan devices - and that in addition provide the direct input of the value for the user.

The additional functions are:

1. the focus is requested for this field after a certain duration of user-inactivity.
2. you can define a SCANHOTKEY which is the special key that may be sent by a scan device to indicate that the scan input is finished.
3. you can define a SCANPREFIX and a SCANPOSTFIX - special characters that may be prepended or appended by the scanner. The scanned value is cut correspondingly before being sent to the server-side.

Other typical functions are normal field functions:

1. by setting FLUSH to true, user-input is sent to the server after leaving the field
2. by settting FLUSHTIMER to a certain duration, user input is automatically sent to the server if the user finished his/her input.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoScanField}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoScanField}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:scanfield id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoScanField.onScannedValueAction}" bgpaint="bgbackground_focus(#c5e0b3);bgbackground_nofocus(#f7cbac)" flush="true" labeltext="Scanned value" requestfocustimer="5000" scanhotkey="10" scanpostfix="B" scanprefix="A" text="#{d.DemoScanField.scannedValue}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:label id="g_25" labeltext="Scanned value received on server side" text="#{d.DemoScanField.scannedValue}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:textpane id="g_3" text="The SCANFIELD is defined with prefix &#34;A&#34;, postfix &#34;B&#34; - and the hotkey &#34;return&#34;." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:textpane id="g_19" text="Input &#34;A4711B&#34; - after finishing the input the value will be sent to the server-side immediately because prefix and postfix match." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:textpane id="g_22" text="Input &#34;6666666&#34; and hit the return key - the value will be sent to the serve side." width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_27" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:field id="g_8" labeltext="Normal value 1" text="#{d.DemoScanField.normal1}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" >
<t:field id="g_13" labeltext="Normal value 2" text="#{d.DemoScanField.normal2}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventFlush;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventScan;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.PageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoScanField}")

public class DemoScanField
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    String m_scannedValue;
    String m_normal1;
    String m_normal2;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoScanField(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoscanfield.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoScanField}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getNormal2() { return m_normal2; }
    public void setNormal2(String value) { this.m_normal2 = value; }

    public String getNormal1() { return m_normal1; }
    public void setNormal1(String value) { this.m_normal1 = value; }

    public String getScannedValue() { return m_scannedValue; }
    public void setScannedValue(String value) { this.m_scannedValue = value; }

    public void onScannedValueAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventScan)
        {
            BaseActionEventScan e = (BaseActionEventScan)event;
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Value was scanned: " + m_scannedValue + "/" + e.getScannedValue());
        }
        else if (event instanceof BaseActionEventFlush)
        {
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Value was flushed: " + m_scannedValue);
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Chinese keyboard

The configuration of touch keyboards now provides the possibility to also define layouts in which you have to key in some characters in order to find the character to insert.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoChineseTouchField}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:tabbedpane id="g_3" width="100%" >
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_4" text="pinyin" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:touchfield id="g_6" flush="true" height="250" touchlayout="pinyin" value="#{d.DemoChineseTouchField.value}" width="100%;500" />
</t:row>
</t:tabbedpanetab>
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_7" text="cangjie" >
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:touchfield id="g_9" flush="true" height="250" touchlayout="cangjie" value="#{d.DemoChineseTouchField.value}" width="100%;500" />
</t:row>
</t:tabbedpanetab>
</t:tabbedpane>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" height="20" />
<t:rowline id="g_11" />
<t:rowdistance id="g_12" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:label id="g_14" text="Input" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_15" enabled="false" text="#{d.DemoChineseTouchField.value}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoChineseTouchField}")

public class DemoChineseTouchField
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_value = "";

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoChineseTouchField(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demochinesetouchfield.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoChineseTouchField}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getValue() { return m_value; }
    public void setValue(String value) { this.m_value = value; }

}

QR Code Scanner (JSQR)

The component QRCODESCANNERJSQR uses the JSQR library for scanning barcodes.

Please find details and terms of usage on page https://github.com/cozmo/jsQR

The component is integrated as independent IFRAME so that the JSQR framework is running in some own, independent environment.

Please pay attention: the component requires access to your client's camera. The browser can only access the camera when starting the page with "https://"! (Exception: working in localhost-environment.)

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoQRCodeScannerJQRS}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" stylevariant="ccbig" text="Place a QR Code in front of your camera..." />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:qrcodescannerjsqr id="g_5" actionListener="#{d.DemoQRCodeScannerJQRS.onQRCodeAction}" height="300" scandelay="1000" width="400" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:textarea id="g_7" enabled="false" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoQRCodeScannerJQRS.protocol}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Date;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventQRCodeScan;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoQRCodeScannerJQRS}")

public class DemoQRCodeScannerJQRS
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    /* Listener to the user of the page bean. */
    public interface IListener
    {
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    private IListener m_listener;
    String m_protocol = "Protocol:\n";
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoQRCodeScannerJQRS(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoqrcodescannerjqrs.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoQRCodeScannerJQRS}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getProtocol() { return m_protocol; }
    public void setProtocol(String value) { this.m_protocol = value; }

    public void onQRCodeAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventQRCodeScan)
        {
            BaseActionEventQRCodeScan e = (BaseActionEventQRCodeScan)event;
            m_protocol += "QRCode was scanned: " + e.getQRCodeAsUTF8String() + ", " + new Date().toString() + "\n";
        }
    }

}

Stable virtual keyboard

The TOUCHVIRUTALKEYBOARD is a software keyboard component that is not bound to a specific field/component but that operates indenpently as a vitrual keyboard.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTouchKeyboard}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_3" text="First Name" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_4" requestfocus="creation" text="#{d.DemoTouchKeyboard.firstName}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Last Name" width="100" />
<t:field id="g_7" text="#{d.DemoTouchKeyboard.lastName}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Shoe Size" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_10" format="int" value="#{d.DemoTouchKeyboard.shoeSize}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="Married" width="100" />
<t:checkbox id="g_13" selected="#{d.DemoTouchKeyboard.married}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:label id="g_15" text="Height" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_16" format="bigdecimal" value="#{d.DemoTouchKeyboard.height}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:label id="g_18" text="Department" width="100" />
<t:combobox id="g_19" value="#{d.DemoTouchKeyboard.department}" width="100" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_20" text="Sales" value="Sales" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_21" text="Production" value="Production" />
</t:combobox>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_22" height="10" />
<t:row id="g_23" >
<t:coldistance id="g_24" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_25" actionListener="#{d.DemoTouchKeyboard.onAction}" text="OK" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_26" height="100%" />
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:row id="g_27" >
<t:pane id="g_28" background="#FFFFFF20" padding="2" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_29" >
<t:touchvirtualkeyboard id="g_30" height="200" touchlayoutmin="min" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:pane>
</t:row>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.math.BigDecimal;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTouchKeyboard}")

public class DemoTouchKeyboard
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    protected String m_lastName;
    protected String m_firstName;
    protected int m_shoeSize;
    protected BigDecimal m_height;
    protected boolean m_married;
    String m_department;
    
    public DemoTouchKeyboard(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("touchvirtualkeyboard");
    }

    public String getLastName() { return m_lastName; }
    public void setLastName(String value) { m_lastName = value; }

    public String getFirstName() { return m_firstName; }
    public void setFirstName(String value) { m_firstName = value; }
    
    public void setShoeSize(int value) { m_shoeSize = value; }
    public int getShoeSize() { return m_shoeSize; }
    
    public void setHeight(BigDecimal value) { m_height = value; }
    public BigDecimal getHeight() { return m_height; }

    public void setMarried(boolean value) { m_married = value; }
    public boolean getMarried() { return m_married; }
    
    public String getDepartment() { return m_department; }
    public void setDepartment(String value) { this.m_department = value; }

    public void onAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        getOwningDispatcher().getStatusbar().outputSuccess("Input: " + m_firstName + "/" + m_lastName + "/" + m_shoeSize + "/" + m_height);
    }

}

Touch / Tile tree (PBC)

The page bean component "CCTreeByTiles" renders a normal FIXGRIDTreeBinding-instance as tree that is made out of tiles.

The first line of the component shows the tree node hierarchy that is currently opened, the line(s) below shows the node of the currently selected level.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCTreeByTiles}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCTreeByTiles}" >
<t:row id="g_6" >
<t:pagebeancomponent id="g_8" pagebeanbinding="#{d.DemoPBCCCTreeByTiles.treeUI}" pagebeanclass="org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCTreeByTiles" pagebeaninitdata="tileBorder:0;lineColor:#00000030;tileBackgroundFolderNode:#00000018" shownullcontent="true" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.util.Random;

import org.eclnt.ccaddons.pbc.CCTreeByTiles;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDTreeItem;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPBCCCTreeByTiles}")

public class DemoPBCCCTreeByTiles
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class TreeNode extends FIXGRIDTreeItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        boolean i_childrenRead = false;
        public TreeNode(FIXGRIDTreeItem parentNode)
        {
            super(parentNode);
        }
        /*
         * This method is NOT called as part of the tile tree processing. 
         */
        public void onRowSelect()
        {
        }
        /*
         * This method is called when clicking onto an end node of the tile tree. 
         */
        public void onRowExecute()
        {
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Row execute called with item: " + getText());
        }
        public void onToggle()
        {
            // In this example: dynamic loading of child nodes according to user
            // navigation within the tree
            if (i_childrenRead == false)
            {
                i_childrenRead = true;
                String textPrefix = "";
                for (int j=0; j<(getLevelInt()+1); j++)
                    textPrefix += "Sub ";
                int maxi = new Random().nextInt(10) + 1;
                for (int i=0; i<maxi; i++)
                {
                    TreeNode tn = new TreeNode(this);
                    tn.setText(textPrefix + "folder " + i);
                    tn.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_CLOSED);
                    tn.setImage("/images.iconssvg.folder_16x16._ffc000.16x16.ccsvg");
                }
                maxi = new Random().nextInt(15) + 1;
                for (int i=0; i<maxi; i++)
                {
                    TreeNode tn = new TreeNode(this);
                    tn.setText(textPrefix + "node " + i);
                    tn.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_ENDNODE);
                    tn.setImage("/images.iconssvg.endnode_16x16._808080.16x16.ccsvg");
                }
            }
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    CCTreeByTiles m_treeUI = new CCTreeByTiles();
    FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode> m_tree = new FIXGRIDTreeBinding<TreeNode>();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoPBCCCTreeByTiles(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        buildTree();
        m_treeUI.prepare(m_tree,new CCTreeByTiles.DefaultListener()
        {
        });
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demopbccctreebytiles.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoPBCCCTreeByTiles}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public CCTreeByTiles getTreeUI() { return m_treeUI; }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void buildTree()
    {
        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
        {
            TreeNode tn = new TreeNode(m_tree.getRootNode());
            tn.setText("Top folder " + i);
            tn.setStatus(TreeNode.STATUS_CLOSED);
            tn.setImage("/images.iconssvg.folder_16x16._ffc000.16x16.ccsvg");
        }
    }

}

Touch Selector

The TOUCHSELECTOR is a control that allows to select one value out of a defined set of values. The user sees the currently selected value and can navigate through the available values by using the up down keys.

From programming point of view the touch selector is "the same" as programming a combo box: you need to bind the value that receives the selected id and you need to bind an instance of ValidValuesBinding that provides the set of select-ale values.

When the control is used on a desktop browser then the user can also use the mouse wheel for navigating through the valid values.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTouchSelector}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Number from (0..9)" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_10" >
<t:touchselector id="g_11" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoTouchSelector.valueVVS}" value="#{d.DemoTouchSelector.value}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_12" height="50" />
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="Department" width="150" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:touchselector id="g_14" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoTouchSelector.departmentVVS}" value="#{d.DemoTouchSelector.department}" width="200" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.pagebean.PageBean;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTouchSelector}")

public class DemoTouchSelector
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    ValidValuesBinding m_departmentVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();
    String m_department = "0001";
    int m_value = 0;
    ValidValuesBinding m_valueVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoTouchSelector(IWorkpageDispatcher dispatcher)
    { 
        super(dispatcher);
        // valid values for "value"
        for (int i=0; i<10; i++)
            m_valueVVS.addValidValue(""+i,""+i);
        // valid values for department
        m_departmentVVS.addValidValue("0001","Sales");
        m_departmentVVS.addValidValue("0002","Production");
        m_departmentVVS.addValidValue("0003","Management");
        m_departmentVVS.addValidValue("0004","Human Resources");
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotouchselector.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoTouchSelector}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getDepartment() { return m_department; }
    public void setDepartment(String value) { this.m_department = value; }
    
    public ValidValuesBinding getDepartmentVVS() { return m_departmentVVS; }
    
    public int getValue() { return m_value; }
    public void setValue(int value) { this.m_value = value; }

    public ValidValuesBinding getValueVVS() { return m_valueVVS; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Date and time input

The controls TOUCHDATE and TOUCHTIME are page bean component controls that are part of the eclnt_pbc package.

They are used to input a date or a time in a touch screen environment. The little green arrow icons are used for quicker navigation.

The server side binding can be a LocalDate, a Date, a Long or a String (containing a long value).

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoTouchDateTimeControl}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_4" objectbinding="#{d.DemoTouchDateTimeControl}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_8" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" text="Date input" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Default input of date" width="150" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_2" flush="true" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoTouchDateTimeControl.myDate}" width="120" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:label id="g_10" text="Touch input of date" width="150" />
<tpbc:touchdate id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoTouchDateTimeControl.onTouchDateAction}" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoTouchDateTimeControl.myDate}" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_17" >
<t:foldablepane id="g_18" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" text="Time input" width="100%" >
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:label id="g_20" text="Default input of time" width="150" />
<t:calendarfield id="g_21" flush="true" format="time" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoTouchDateTimeControl.myTime}" width="120" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:label id="g_23" text="Touch input of time" width="150" />
<tpbc:touchtime id="g_24" actionListener="#{d.DemoTouchDateTimeControl.onTouchTimeAction}" timezone="LOCAL" value="#{d.DemoTouchDateTimeControl.myTime}" withseconds="true" />
</t:row>
</t:foldablepane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.time.LocalDate;
import java.time.LocalTime;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoTouchDateTimeControl}")

public class DemoTouchDateTimeControl
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    LocalDate m_myDate = LocalDate.now();
    LocalTime m_myTime = LocalTime.now();

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoTouchDateTimeControl(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demotouchdatetimecontrol.xml"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoTouchDateTimeControl}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public LocalDate getMyDate() { return m_myDate; }
    public void setMyDate(LocalDate value) { this.m_myDate = value; }

    public LocalTime getMyTime() { return m_myTime; }
    public void setMyTime(LocalTime value) { this.m_myTime = value; }

    public void onTouchTimeAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("Time was changed by touch input: " + m_myTime.toString());
    }

    public void onTouchDateAction(javax.faces.event.ActionEvent event) 
    {
        Statusbar.outputMessage("Date was changed by touch input: " + m_myDate.toString());
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
}

Reporting, PDF, SVG

Show PDF

The PDFRENDERER component is able to render a PDF bytestream directly into the user interface. There is no necessity for having some Adobe Reader installed in the frontend - the rendering is done through pure Java.

The PDF format must adhere to documents display-able in Adobe Acrobat Reader 5.0.

...of course: you can also use the BROWSER component and pass a URL ending with ".pdf". But: the PDFRENDERER component gives you a tighter level of intergration. As you see in the server side Java program the PDF is rendered directly into a property string which is references by the component ...that's it.

When using the component as part of your screen definition make sure that the PDFRenderer.jar library is referenced within your applet of webstart definition.

The PDFRENDER component supports clients printing as well. Printing is started by using the TRIGGERPRINT attribute. You can pre-select if the user should see a print dialog and/or you can pre-select the client side printer by defining its name. If on client side no printer definition can be found, then the print dialog is opened automatically.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPdfRenderer}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:pdfrenderer id="g_3" bgpaint="rectangle(0,0,100%,100%,#000000A0,#00000040,vertical)" filename="{temp}/mypdf.pdf" height="100%" padding="top:10;bottom:5;left:10;right:10" pdf="#{d.DemoPdfRenderer.pdf}" triggerprint="#{d.DemoPdfRenderer.trigger}" width="100%" withprintdialog="true" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_4" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:label id="g_6" text="Trigger Printing" width="120" />
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoPdfRenderer.onTriggerPrint}" text="Print (triggered by Server)" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Client side PDF" width="120" />
<t:fileuploadbutton id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoPdfRenderer.onLoadPdfAction}" fileextensions="pdf" maxfilesize="5000000" text="Load PDF" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:label id="g_12" text="Clear PDF" width="120" />
<t:button id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoPdfRenderer.onClear}" text="Clear" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventUpload;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.WebResourceReader;
import org.eclnt.util.file.FileManager;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPdfRenderer}")

public class DemoPdfRenderer
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    protected Trigger m_trigger = new Trigger();
    protected String m_pdf;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoPdfRenderer(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("pdfrenderer");
        byte[] initialPdf = WebResourceReader.readFileIntoByteArray("/pdf/pdftest1.pdf");
        m_pdf = ValueManager.encodeHexString(initialPdf);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public Trigger getTrigger() { return m_trigger; }
    public void setTrigger(Trigger value) { m_trigger = value; }

    public String getPdf() { return m_pdf; }
    public void setPdf(String value) { m_pdf = value; }

    public void onLoadPdfAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventUpload)
        {
            BaseActionEventUpload baeu = (BaseActionEventUpload)event;
            byte[] bytes = baeu.getHexBytes();
            m_pdf = ValueManager.encodeHexString(bytes);
        }
    }

    public void onTriggerPrint(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_trigger.trigger();
    }
    
    public void onClear(ActionEvent event)
    {
        m_pdf = null;
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

}

Print PDF

The PDFPRINTER component is an invisible component that allows to send PDF documents to the printer. The PDF is passed as hex-string - in the same way as it is passed with the PDFRENDERER component.

On client side there are only limited possibilities for controlling the printing - because by nature of the browser, automated printing is not suitable...! So printing is always showing up some print dialog, there is no possibility to e.g. pre-select a local printer.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" >
<t:pdfprinter id="g_2" actionListener="#{d.DemoPdfPrinter.onPrintNotification}" paperheight="#{d.DemoPdfPrinter.paperHeight}" paperwidth="#{d.DemoPdfPrinter.paperWidth}" pdf="#{d.DemoPdfPrinter.pdf}" triggerprint="#{d.DemoPdfPrinter.trigger}" withprintdialog="true" withserverprintnotification="true" />
</t:beanprocessing>
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.DemoPdfPrinter}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_4" >
<t:label id="g_5" text="Paper width" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_6" format="double" value="#{d.DemoPdfPrinter.paperWidth}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="Paper height" width="100" />
<t:formattedfield id="g_9" format="double" value="#{d.DemoPdfPrinter.paperHeight}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:coldistance id="g_12" width="100" />
<t:button id="g_13" actionListener="#{d.DemoPdfPrinter.onTriggerPrint}" text="Print!" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventPdfprinterNotification;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.Trigger;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.managedbean.IDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.util.WebResourceReader;
import org.eclnt.util.file.FileManager;
import org.eclnt.util.valuemgmt.ValueManager;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoPdfPrinter}")

public class DemoPdfPrinter
    extends PageBean
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    protected Trigger m_trigger = new Trigger();
    protected String m_pdf;
    double m_paperHeight = 11.69d;
    double m_paperWidth = 8.26;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public DemoPdfPrinter(IDispatcher dispatcher)
    {
        super(dispatcher);
        initRefComponent("pdfprinter");
        // first pdf file that is shown
        byte[] initialPdf = WebResourceReader.readFileIntoByteArray("/pdf/pdftest1.pdf");
        m_pdf = ValueManager.encodeHexString(initialPdf);
    }
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public double getPaperHeight() { return m_paperHeight; }
    public void setPaperHeight(double value) { this.m_paperHeight = value; }

    public double getPaperWidth() { return m_paperWidth; }
    public void setPaperWidth(double value) { this.m_paperWidth = value; }

    public Trigger getTrigger() { return m_trigger; }
    public void setTrigger(Trigger value) { m_trigger = value; }

    public String getPdf() { return m_pdf; }
    public void setPdf(String value) { m_pdf = value; }

    public void onTriggerPrint(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        m_trigger.trigger();
    }

    public void onPrintNotification(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventPdfprinterNotification)
        {
            BaseActionEventPdfprinterNotification ne = (BaseActionEventPdfprinterNotification)event;
            Statusbar.outputMessage("Notification of client-printing: " + ne.getPrintResult() + "/" + ne.getDetail());
        }
    }

}

Chart.js - Graphics

The CHARTJS component is a wrapper around the client side chart.js library (http://www.chartjs.org).

The usage is quite simple: the configuration of the graphics is passed as JSON object to the client side chart processing. The JSON object has to correspond to the format expected by chart.js.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoChartJs}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:splitpane id="g_3" border="#00000030" dividerlocation="300" height="100%" orientation="vertical" width="100%" >
<t:splitpanesplit id="g_4" background="#FFFFFF" padding="10" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:chartjs id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoChartJs.onChartJsAction}" chartjsconfig="#{d.DemoChartJs.config}" height="100%" width="100%" withcallback="true" />
</t:row>
</t:splitpanesplit>
<t:splitpanesplit id="g_7" padding="10" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Select JSON string" width="120" />
<t:combobox id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoChartJs.onResourceAction}" flush="true" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoChartJs.resourceVVS}" value="#{d.DemoChartJs.resource}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:textarea id="g_12" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoChartJs.config}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:button id="g_14" text="Update" />
</t:row>
</t:splitpanesplit>
</t:splitpane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventChartJsPointSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.util.file.ClassloaderReader;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoChartJs}")

public class DemoChartJs
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_config;
    ValidValuesBinding m_resourceVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();
    String m_resource;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoChartJs(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        m_resource = "workplace/DemoChartJsLineChart.json";
        m_resourceVVS.addValidValue("workplace/DemoChartJsLineChart.json","Line Chart");
        m_resourceVVS.addValidValue("workplace/DemoChartJsStackedLineChart.json","Stacked Line Chart");
        m_resourceVVS.addValidValue("workplace/DemoChartJsBar.json","Bar Chart");
        m_resourceVVS.addValidValue("workplace/DemoChartJsBarStacked.json","Stacked Bar Chart");
        m_resourceVVS.addValidValue("workplace/DemoChartJsPieChart.json","Pie Chart");
        m_resourceVVS.addValidValue("workplace/DemoChartJsPieChart2.json","Double Pie Chart");
        updateConfigFromResource();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demochartjs.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoChartJs}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getConfig() { return m_config; }
    public void setConfig(String value) { this.m_config = value; }

    public ValidValuesBinding getResourceVVS() { return m_resourceVVS; }
    public void setResourceVVS(ValidValuesBinding value) { this.m_resourceVVS = value; }

    public String getResource() { return m_resource; }
    public void setResource(String value) { this.m_resource = value; }

    public void onResourceAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        updateConfigFromResource();
    }

    public void onChartJsAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventChartJsPointSelection)
        {
            BaseActionEventChartJsPointSelection e = (BaseActionEventChartJsPointSelection)event;
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Point selection: dataset " + e.getDatasetIndex() + ", point " + e.getPointIndex());
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void updateConfigFromResource()
    {
        m_config = (new ClassloaderReader(getClass().getClassLoader()).readUTF8File(m_resource,true));
    }
}

Chart.js - Dynamic creation

This demo shows how the JSON configuration for the chart is created dynamically.

The code takes use of Google's GSON library for creating JSON out of objects.

Please check the documentation at http://www.chartjs.org/ in order to find details about how to construct the different objects in order to create diverse types of charts.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoChartJSDynamic}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" objectbinding="#{d.DemoChartJSDynamic.grid}" sbvisibleamount="4" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="Area" width="100" >
<t:label id="g_5" text=".{region}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" align="right" text="Hardware" width="100%;60" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_7" align="right" format="bigdecimal" formatmask="dec2" value=".{sales[0]}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_8" align="right" text="Software" width="100%;60" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_9" align="right" format="bigdecimal" formatmask="dec2" value=".{sales[1]}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_10" align="right" text="Other" width="100%;60" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_11" align="right" format="bigdecimal" formatmask="dec2" value=".{sales[2]}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_12" coldistance="5" >
<t:combobox id="g_13" value="#{d.DemoChartJSDynamic.chartType}" width="100" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_14" text="Bar" value="bar" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_15" text="Line" value="line" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_16" text="Radar" value="radar" />
</t:combobox>
<t:button id="g_17" actionListener="#{d.DemoChartJSDynamic.onUpdateChartAction}" text="Update Chart" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:tabbedpane id="g_19" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_20" text="Graphics" >
<t:row id="g_21" >
<t:chartjs id="g_22" chartjsconfig="#{d.DemoChartJSDynamic.json}" height="100%" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:tabbedpanetab>
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_23" actionListener="#{d.DemoChartJSDynamic.onUpdateChartAction}" text="JSON" >
<t:row id="g_24" >
<t:textarea id="g_25" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoChartJSDynamic.json}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:tabbedpanetab>
</t:tabbedpane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.math.BigDecimal;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.List;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDItem;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.impl.FIXGRIDListBinding;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedPageBean;

import com.google.gson.Gson;
import com.google.gson.GsonBuilder;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoChartJSDynamic}")

/*
 * Details on setting up JSON objects: http://www.chartjs.org/.
 * This program takes use of Google'S GSON-library for creating JSON Strings. 
 */
public class DemoChartJSDynamic
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public class GridItem extends FIXGRIDItem implements java.io.Serializable
    {
        String i_region;
        public String getRegion() { return i_region; }
        public void setRegion(String value) { this.i_region = value; }

        BigDecimal[] i_sales = new BigDecimal[4];
        public BigDecimal[] getSales() { return i_sales; }
    }

    // JSON Objects - just for writing shorter code...
    static class JO extends HashMap<String,Object> {}
    static class JOs extends ArrayList<JO> {}
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    static final String[] REGIONS = new String[] {"North","West","South","East"}; 
    static final String[] COLORS = new String[] {"#FFC0C0","#C0FFC0","#C0C0FF","#C0C0C0"};
    
    static final String[] CATEGORIES = new String[] {"Hardware","Software","Other"}; 
    
    FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> m_grid = new FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem>();
    public FIXGRIDListBinding<GridItem> getGrid() { return m_grid; }

    String m_json;

    String m_chartType = "bar";
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoChartJSDynamic(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        int counter = 1;
        for (String region: REGIONS)
        {
            GridItem gi = new GridItem();
            gi.setRegion(region);
            gi.getSales()[0] = new BigDecimal(1*counter);
            gi.getSales()[1] = new BigDecimal(2*counter);
            gi.getSales()[2] = new BigDecimal(3*counter);
            gi.getSales()[3] = new BigDecimal(4*counter);
            m_grid.getItems().add(gi);
            counter++;
        }
        createChart(m_chartType);
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demochartjsdynamic.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoChartJSDynamic}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getJson() { return m_json; }

    public void onUpdateChartAction(ActionEvent event) { createChart(m_chartType); }
    
    public String getChartType() { return m_chartType; }
    public void setChartType(String value) { this.m_chartType = value; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void createChart(String type)
    {
        JO chart = new JO();
        chart.put("type",type);
        JO data = new JO();
        chart.put("data",data);
        {
            List<String> labels = new ArrayList<String>();
            for (String category: CATEGORIES) labels.add(category);
            data.put("labels",labels);
            JOs datasets = new JOs();
            data.put("datasets",datasets);
            for (int i=0; i<REGIONS.length; i++)
            {
                JO dataset = new JO();
                datasets.add(dataset);
                List<BigDecimal> datasetData = new ArrayList<BigDecimal>();
                for (int j=0; j<CATEGORIES.length; j++)
                    datasetData.add(m_grid.getItems().get(i).getSales()[j]);
                dataset.put("label",REGIONS[i]);
                dataset.put("data",datasetData);
                dataset.put("fill",true);
                dataset.put("backgroundColor",COLORS[i]);
            }
        }
        Gson gson = new GsonBuilder().setPrettyPrinting().create();
        m_json = gson.toJson(chart);
    }
    
}

Chart.js - With labels

By using BRIDGEPAGE "eclnt/risc/ext_chartjs/ext_chartjs_280_datalabels_060.html" you use chartjs together with its label-extension (see https://chartjs-plugin-datalabels.netlify.com).

Result: numeric values behind the charts are directly output as part of the chart - and not only available as tooltip on user request.

By default you do not have to add additional configuration data, but you may: please take a look at the JSON example "Stacked Bar Chart, explicit labels": the positioning and rendering of the label is directly controlled in this example.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoChartJsWithLabels}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:splitpane id="g_3" border="#00000030" dividerlocation="300" height="100%" orientation="vertical" width="100%" >
<t:splitpanesplit id="g_4" background="#FFFFFF" padding="10" >
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:chartjs id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoChartJsWithLabels.onChartJsAction}" bridgepage="eclnt/risc/ext_chartjs/ext_chartjs_datalabels.html" chartjsconfig="#{d.DemoChartJsWithLabels.config}" height="100%" width="100%" withcallback="true" />
</t:row>
</t:splitpanesplit>
<t:splitpanesplit id="g_7" padding="10" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue[&#39;@defaultrowdistance@&#39;]}" >
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:label id="g_9" text="Select JSON string" width="120" />
<t:combobox id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoChartJsWithLabels.onResourceAction}" flush="true" validvaluesbinding="#{d.DemoChartJsWithLabels.resourceVVS}" value="#{d.DemoChartJsWithLabels.resource}" width="200" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:textarea id="g_12" height="100%" text="#{d.DemoChartJsWithLabels.config}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:button id="g_14" text="Update" />
</t:row>
</t:splitpanesplit>
</t:splitpane>
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventChartJsPointSelection;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.util.ValidValuesBinding;
import org.eclnt.util.file.ClassloaderReader;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoChartJsWithLabels}")

public class DemoChartJsWithLabels
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_config;
    ValidValuesBinding m_resourceVVS = new ValidValuesBinding();
    String m_resource;
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoChartJsWithLabels(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        m_resource = "workplace/DemoChartJsLineChart.json";
        m_resourceVVS.addValidValue("workplace/DemoChartJsLineChart.json","Line Chart");
        m_resourceVVS.addValidValue("workplace/DemoChartJsPieChart.json","Pie Chart");
        m_resourceVVS.addValidValue("workplace/DemoChartJsPieChart2.json","Double Pie Chart");
        m_resourceVVS.addValidValue("workplace/DemoChartJsBarStacked.json","Stacked Bar Chart");
        m_resourceVVS.addValidValue("workplace/DemoChartJsBarStackedWithLabels.json","Stacked Bar Chart, explicit labels");
        updateConfigFromResource();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demochartjswithlabels.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoChartJsWithLabels}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public String getConfig() { return m_config; }
    public void setConfig(String value) { this.m_config = value; }

    public ValidValuesBinding getResourceVVS() { return m_resourceVVS; }
    public void setResourceVVS(ValidValuesBinding value) { this.m_resourceVVS = value; }

    public String getResource() { return m_resource; }
    public void setResource(String value) { this.m_resource = value; }

    public void onResourceAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        updateConfigFromResource();
    }

    public void onChartJsAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventChartJsPointSelection)
        {
            BaseActionEventChartJsPointSelection e = (BaseActionEventChartJsPointSelection)event;
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Point selection: dataset " + e.getDatasetIndex() + ", point " + e.getPointIndex());
        }
    }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    private void updateConfigFromResource()
    {
        m_config = (new ClassloaderReader(getClass().getClassLoader()).readUTF8File(m_resource,true));
    }
}

RGraph - Dynamic creation

The RGRAPH component includes the charting library "rchart". The library provides a rich set of charts. Please check for details via http://www.rgraph.net.

The configuration is done by passing a server side JSON string into the client side chart configuration. For further detail on the exact configuration object format, take a look into the documentation at http://www.rgraph.net.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoRGraph}" rowdistance="#{ccstylevalue['@defaultrowdistance@']}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:rgraph id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoRGraph.onRGraphAction}" height="100%" rgraphconfig="#{d.DemoRGraph.config}" width="100%" withcallback="true" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_4" coldistance="5" >
<t:coldistance id="g_5" width="50%" />
<t:button id="g_6" actionListener="#{d.DemoRGraph.onCreateChartFuel}" text="Fuel" />
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoRGraph.onCreateChartGauge}" text="Gauge" />
<t:button id="g_8" actionListener="#{d.DemoRGraph.onCreateChartMeter}" text="Meter" />
<t:button id="g_9" actionListener="#{d.DemoRGraph.onCreateChartOdometer}" text="Odometer" />
<t:button id="g_10" actionListener="#{d.DemoRGraph.onCreateChartBar}" text="Bar" />
<t:button id="g_11" actionListener="#{d.DemoRGraph.onCreateChartBars}" text="Bars" />
<t:button id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoRGraph.onCreateChartDonut}" text="Donut" />
<t:coldistance id="g_13" width="50%" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_14" >
<t:textarea id="g_15" height="150" text="#{d.DemoRGraph.config}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import java.math.BigDecimal;
import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Random;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.defaultscreens.Statusbar;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventFinishedRendering;
import org.eclnt.jsfserver.elements.events.BaseActionEventRGraphPointSelection;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

import com.google.gson.Gson;
import com.google.gson.GsonBuilder;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoRGraph}")

/**
 * Please check the documentation of http://www.rgraph.net <br>
 * In the server side processing you create the chat configuration by creating
 * a corresponding JSON-String.<br>
 * The only extra attribute that you have to set (compared to the JavaScript
 * interface) is to in addition pass the info, what type of chart you want to
 * create (rgraphType).
 */
public class DemoRGraph
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // inner classes
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    static class JO extends HashMap<String,Object> {}
    static class JOs extends ArrayList<JO> {}
    
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    String m_config;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoRGraph(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        createGaugeChart();
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demorgraph.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoRGraph}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public void onCreateChartGauge(ActionEvent event) { createGaugeChart(); }
    public void onCreateChartFuel(ActionEvent event) { createChartFuel(); }
    public void onCreateChartMeter(ActionEvent event) { createChartMeter(); }
    public void onCreateChartOdometer(ActionEvent event) { createChartOdometer(); }
    public void onCreateChartBar(ActionEvent event) { createChartBar(); }
    public void onCreateChartBars(ActionEvent event) { createChartBars(); }
    public void onCreateChartDonut(ActionEvent event) { createChartDonut(); }
    
    public String getConfig() { return m_config; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // private usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    
    public void onRGraphAction(ActionEvent event) 
    {
        if (event instanceof BaseActionEventRGraphPointSelection)
        {
            BaseActionEventRGraphPointSelection e = (BaseActionEventRGraphPointSelection)event;
            Statusbar.outputSuccess("Selection in RGraph, Dataset: " + e.getDatasetIndex() + ", Point: " + e.getPointIndex());
        }
    }

    private void createChartDonut()
    {
        JO chart = new JO();
        chart.put("rgraphType","Pie");
        List<BigDecimal> data = new ArrayList<BigDecimal>();
        chart.put("data",data);
        data.add(new BigDecimal(41));
        data.add(new BigDecimal(37));
        data.add(new BigDecimal(16));
        data.add(new BigDecimal(3));
        data.add(new BigDecimal(3));
        JO options = new JO();
        chart.put("options",options);
        options.put("variant","donut");
        options.put("linewidth",5);
        options.put("exploded",5);
        options.put("strokestyle","rgba(0,0,0,0)");
        options.put("title","Browser share");
        List<String> tooltips = new ArrayList<String>();
        options.put("tooltips",tooltips);
        tooltips.add("MSIE 7");
        tooltips.add("MSIE 6");
        tooltips.add("Firefox");
        tooltips.add("Safari");
        tooltips.add("Other");
        List<String> key = new ArrayList<String>();
        options.put("key",key);
        key.add("MSIE 7");
        key.add("MSIE 6");
        key.add("Firefox");
        key.add("Safari");
        key.add("Other");
        options.put("keyShadow",true);
        options.put("keyShadowOffsetx",1);
        options.put("keyShadowOffsety",1);
        options.put("keyShadowBlur",3);
        options.put("keyShadowColor","#ccc");
        options.put("keyAlign","right");
        options.put("align","left");
        options.put("shadowOffsetx",2);
        options.put("shadowOffsety",2);
        options.put("shadowBlur",3);
        // options.put("centerx",185);
        Gson gson = new GsonBuilder().setPrettyPrinting().create();
        m_config = gson.toJson(chart);
    }

    
    
    private void createChartBar()
    {
        JO chart = new JO();
        chart.put("rgraphType","Bar");
        List<BigDecimal> data = new ArrayList<BigDecimal>();
        chart.put("data",data);
        data.add(new BigDecimal(1.2));
        data.add(new BigDecimal(1.5));
        data.add(new BigDecimal(3.1));
        data.add(new BigDecimal(2.2));
        data.add(new BigDecimal(4.0));
        JO options = new JO();
        chart.put("options",options);
        List<String> labels = new ArrayList<String>();
        labels.add("John");
        labels.add("Barry");
        labels.add("Rich");
        labels.add("Tom");
        labels.add("Frank");
        Gson gson = new GsonBuilder().setPrettyPrinting().create();
        m_config = gson.toJson(chart);
    }
    
    private void createChartBars()
    {
        Random r = new Random();
        JO chart = new JO();
        chart.put("rgraphType","Bar");
        List<List<BigDecimal>> data = new ArrayList<List<BigDecimal>>();
        chart.put("data",data);
        for (int i=0; i<4; i++)
        {
            List<BigDecimal> col = new ArrayList<BigDecimal>();
            data.add(col);
            for (int j=0; j<4; j++)
            {
                col.add(new BigDecimal(r.nextInt(1000)));
            }
        }
        JO options = new JO();
        chart.put("options",options);
        List<String> labels = new ArrayList<String>();
        options.put("labels",labels);
        labels.add("2008");
        labels.add("2009");
        labels.add("2010");
        labels.add("2011");
        List<String> colors = new ArrayList<String>();
        options.put("colors",colors);
        colors.add("#C7CFC7");
        colors.add("#B2C8B2");
        colors.add("#D9E0DE");
        colors.add("#CDDED1");
        options.put("hmargin",15);
        options.put("hmarginGrouped",3);
        options.put("gutterLeft",45);
        options.put("gutterBottom",45);
        options.put("backgroundGridVlines",false);
        options.put("backgroundGridBorder",false);
        options.put("textSize",12);
        options.put("strokestyle","rgba(0,0,0,0)");
        options.put("shadow",false);
        options.put("textAccessible",true);
        Gson gson = new GsonBuilder().setPrettyPrinting().create();
        m_config = gson.toJson(chart);
    }

    private void createChartOdometer()
    {
        JO chart = new JO();
        chart.put("rgraphType","Odometer");
        chart.put("min",0);
        chart.put("max",360);
        chart.put("value",256);
        JO options = new JO();
        chart.put("options",options);
        options.put("needleColor","black");
        options.put("needleTail",false);
        options.put("labelArea",30);
        options.put("tickmarks",false);
        options.put("greenColor","Gradient(white:green)");
        options.put("yellowColor","Gradient(white:yellow)");
        options.put("redColor","Gradient(white:red)");
        options.put("shadowOuter",true);
        options.put("shadowOuterColor","#aaa");
        options.put("shadowOuterOffsetx",2);
        options.put("shadowOuterOffsety",2);
        Gson gson = new GsonBuilder().setPrettyPrinting().create();
        m_config = gson.toJson(chart);
    }
    
    private void createChartMeter()
    {
        JO chart = new JO();
        chart.put("rgraphType","Meter");
        chart.put("min",0);
        chart.put("max",100);
        chart.put("value",75);
        JO options = new JO();
        chart.put("options",options);
        options.put("anglesStart",Math.PI + 0.5);
        options.put("anglesEnd",Math.PI*2 - 0.5);
        options.put("linewidthSegments",15);
        options.put("textSize",16);
        options.put("strokestyle","white");
        options.put("segmentRadiusStart",155);
        options.put("border",0);
        options.put("tickmarksSmallNum",0);
        options.put("tickmarksBigNum",0);
        Gson gson = new GsonBuilder().setPrettyPrinting().create();
        m_config = gson.toJson(chart);
    }
    
    private void createChartFuel()
    {
        JO chart = new JO();
        chart.put("rgraphType","Fuel");
        chart.put("min",0);
        chart.put("max",65);
        chart.put("value",47);
        Gson gson = new GsonBuilder().setPrettyPrinting().create();
        m_config = gson.toJson(chart);
    }
    
    private void createGaugeChart()
    {
        JO chart = new JO();
        chart.put("rgraphType","Gauge");
        chart.put("min",0);
        chart.put("max",100);
        chart.put("value",86);
        JO options = new JO();
        chart.put("options",options);
        options.put("scaleDecimals",0);
        options.put("tickmarksSmall",50);
        options.put("tickmarksBig",5);
        options.put("titleTop","Speed");
        options.put("titleTopSize",24);
        options.put("titleBottom","mph");
        options.put("titleBottomColor","#aaa");
        options.put("borderOuter","Gradient(white:white:white:white:white:white:white:white:white:white:#aaa)");
        Gson gson = new GsonBuilder().setPrettyPrinting().create();
        m_config = gson.toJson(chart);
    }
}

Radial

The component RADIAL renders a percentage value as circle (or ellipse).

You can define the line color and line size - and many other parameters...

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:beanprocessing id="g_1" beanbinding="#{d.DemoRadial}" />
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_2" objectbinding="#{d.DemoRadial}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_3" >
<t:label id="g_4" text="Only setting value" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_5" >
<t:radial id="g_6" dragsend="TEST" value="66" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_7" >
<t:label id="g_8" text="Same width and height ==&gt; circle" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_9" >
<t:radial id="g_10" dragsend="TEST" font="weight:bold;size:15" height="70" linecolor="#008000" linesize="10" value="66" width="70" />
<t:radial id="g_11" dragsend="TEST" font="weight:bold;size:15" height="70" linecolor="#FFFF20" linesize="7" value="50" width="70" />
<t:radial id="g_12" dragsend="TEST" font="weight:bold;size:15" height="70" linecolor="#800000" linesize="3" value="25" width="70" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_13" >
<t:label id="g_14" text="Different width and height ==&gt; ellipse" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_15" >
<t:radial id="g_16" dragsend="TEST" font="weight:bold;size:15" height="70" linecolor="#008000" linesize="10" value="66" width="130" />
<t:radial id="g_17" dragsend="TEST" font="weight:bold;size:15" height="130" linecolor="#008000" linesize="10" value="66" width="70" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_18" >
<t:label id="g_19" text="Value by expression, move the slider" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_20" >
<t:coldistance id="g_21" width="50" />
<t:radial id="g_22" dragsend="TEST" font="weight:bold;size:15" height="100" linecolor="#{d.DemoRadial.lineColor}" linesize="10" value="#{d.DemoRadial.value}" width="100" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_23" >
<t:slider id="g_24" flush="true" flushtimer="500" majortickspacing="10" maxvalue="100" minvalue="0" value="#{d.DemoRadial.value}" width="200" />
<t:label id="g_25" text="#{d.DemoRadial.value}" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;

import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoRadial}")

public class DemoRadial
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // members
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    int m_value = 50;

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // constructors & initialization
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public DemoRadial(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);        
        initRefComponent("radial"); 
    }

    public String getPageName() { return "/workplace/demoradial.jsp"; }
    public String getRootExpressionUsedInPage() { return "#{d.DemoRadial}"; }

    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    // public usage
    // ------------------------------------------------------------------------

    public int getValue() { return m_value; }
    public void setValue(int value) { this.m_value = value; }

    public String getLineColor() 
    { 
        if (m_value <= 25) return "#800000";
        if (m_value <= 60) return "#FFFF40";
        return "#008000";
    }

}

Traffic Light Cockpit

Show SVG

The SVGVIEWER component renders SVG documents.
You can zoom in / out using the mouse wheel. When double clicking into the viewer then the graphics is right-sized as if it was newly loaded.

The document is passed via the attribute SVGVIEWER-SVG.

The user can use the mouse wheel for scrolling into the graphics and can move the graphics by clicking into it and moving the mouse.

Please pay attention: only plain SVG (without e.g. scripting) can be displayed.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSvg}" rowdistance="10" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:button id="g_3" actionListener="#{d.DemoSvg.onLoadDemo1}" text="Load Demo 1" />
<t:coldistance id="g_4" />
<t:button id="g_7" actionListener="#{d.DemoSvg.onClear}" text="Clear" />
</t:row>
<t:row id="g_8" >
<t:svgviewer id="g_9" border="#00000010" height="100%" svg="#{d.DemoSvg.svg}" width="100%" />
</t:row>
</t:rowdemobodypane>
<t:pageaddons id="g_pa"/>
</t:layoutdefinition>

This is the Java code:

package workplace;

import java.io.Serializable;
import org.eclnt.editor.annotations.CCGenClass;
import org.eclnt.util.file.ClassloaderReader;
import org.eclnt.workplace.IWorkpageDispatcher;
import org.eclnt.workplace.WorkpageDispatchedBean;

import javax.faces.event.ActionEvent;

@CCGenClass (expressionBase="#{d.DemoSvg}")

public class DemoSvg
    extends PageBean 
    implements Serializable
{
    String m_svg;
    
    public DemoSvg(IWorkpageDispatcher workpageDispatcher)
    {
        super(workpageDispatcher);
        initRefComponent("svgviewer");
        loadSVG("workplace/demo1.svg");
    }
    
    public void setSvg(String value) { m_svg = value; }
    public String getSvg() { return m_svg; }
    
    public void onLoadDemo1(ActionEvent event) { loadSVG("workplace/demo1.svg"); }
    public void onClear(ActionEvent event) { m_svg = null; }

    private void loadSVG(String resource)
    {
        m_svg = (new ClassloaderReader(getClass().getClassLoader())).readUTF8File(resource,true);
    }
}

SVG via JFreeChart

This demo shows how SVG graphics are generated on server side using JFreeChart and Batik.

For sizing the charts a PANE with contained SIZETRANSFER is placed into the component. As result the chart always is re-created when the available screen space on client side changes.

"Good old" JFreeChart is still an excellent library for creating charts! Yes, charts are not animated on client side - but flexibility and number of chart types are excellent. - And not to forget: the charts are created on server side and can be embedded into e.g. documents that are created on server side, too. This demo only shows examples that are based on the "Category data set" - there are many more possibilities and diagram types available.

This is the XML layout definition:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<t:layoutdefinition xmlns:t="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/t" xmlns:tpbc="http://www.CaptainCasa.com/controllibrary/tpbc" >
<t:rowdemobodypane id="g_1" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSvg2}" >
<t:row id="g_2" >
<t:fixgrid id="g_3" bordercolor="#e0e0e0" objectbinding="#{d.DemoSvg2.rows}" sbvisibleamount="5" width="100%" >
<t:gridcol id="g_4" text="Product" width="100" >
<t:field id="g_5" text=".{product}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_6" text="Revenue North" width="50%" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_7" align="right" format="double" value=".{revenueNorth}" />
</t:gridcol>
<t:gridcol id="g_8" text="Revenue South" width="50%" >
<t:formattedfield id="g_9" align="right" format="double" value=".{revenueSouth}" />
</t:gridcol>
</t:fixgrid>
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_10" />
<t:row id="g_11" >
<t:button id="g_12" actionListener="#{d.DemoSvg2.onCreateNewRow}" contentareafilled="false" text="Add new Row" />
<t:coldistance id="g_13" width="100%" />
<t:button id="g_14" actionListener="#{d.DemoSvg2.onUpdateChart}" contentareafilled="false" font="weight:bold" foreground="#800000" text="Update Chart" />
</t:row>
<t:rowdistance id="g_15" height="20" />
<t:row id="g_16" >
<t:tabbedpane id="g_17" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:tabbedpanetab id="g_18" padding="10" text="SVG Charttab" >
<t:row id="g_19" >
<t:pane id="g_20" height="100%" width="100%" >
<t:rowdistance id="g_21" height="5" />
<t:row id="g_22" >
<t:coldistance id="g_23" width="50%" />
<t:combobox id="g_24" actionListener="#{d.DemoSvg2.onUpdateChart}" flush="true" value="#{d.DemoSvg2.chartType}" width="100" >
<t:comboboxitem id="g_25" value="H.Bar" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_26" value="V.Bar" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_56" value="H.StackedBar" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_57" value="V.StackedBar" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_27" value="H.3DBar" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_28" value="V.3DBar" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_29" value="H.Line" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_30" value="V.Line" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_46" value="H.3DLine" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_47" value="V.3DLine" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_31" value="H.Area" />
<t:comboboxitem id="g_32" value="V.Area" />
